reviewTitle: Jeff has a tour scheduled for Wednesd...
review_text: Jeff has a tour scheduled for Wednesday 6/22 at noon.  Level B care facility, semi private starts at $2500. Private starts at $3000

What our family likes the most about the Stellar Care community is the attentiveness of the staff members who are working there. Based on the experience we have had so far, we would recommend them to other families who are looking for a community for their loved ones.

My family and loved one have had a good experience with Adult Family Care Home.  The owner works with the residents, and will occasionally have their partner/owner there when he is not available to be at the community.  The staff are very friendly and accommodating.  We would recommend the community to others for their loved ones.

reviewTitle: Overall satisfied but a few improvements
review_text:
It is very clean and plenty of activities.

There is a disconnect between the staff and getting information to families.

The quality of care can be a concern. My loved one is supposed to get showers 2 times a week and that wasn't happening.

We have put in 2 messages asking for a call back and we haven't received one yet.
Property Name: All American Assisted Living at Londonderry

review_text: The friendliness of the staff members is mixed, very simply this community was very warm and inviting getting us there, everyone was very helpful. It turns out our loved one has a very progressive neurological disease, and unfortunately the care they advertised was not what they promised. Those staff members that were friendly, became rude towards us. The dining room is slow, it takes a long time being seating, a long time to order,and a long time to receive the food you ordered. For a resident with good health it is a good value, probably one of the better ones. If you are not healthy it is not a good value, With the care services and care givers there were some that could not of been better, and others who could of used some improvement.
Property Address: 9525 N. Fort Washington Rd., Fresno, CA 93730

reviewTitle: Miramont Pointe, still the right choice for our family after several months of residence
review_text: My Mom has lived at Miramont Pointe for about 4 months now as an independent resident. She is very happy, loves the food, loves the care, loves the services, loves the staff, loves the community.  We are very happy with her choice to move there.
There is good overall attention from the staff. My loved one likes the person that does her hair! The communication is very good but they could have been a little more proactive.
Women's assisted living facility.
It seems as if they keep the people very busy and active.
Property Address: 4175 West Sample Rd, Coconut Creek, FL 33073

review_text: My communication with the schedulers has been excellent, with a few glitches that were quickly corrected. When selecting a company, I would ask how caretakers are vetted and compensated to gain an idea of the kinds of candidates they attract. Although 1 or 2 of the caretakers, the younger ones, did not work out for us-too much time on their phones, not enough personal engagement with my husband who is the patient- most have been friendly, helpful and cooperative.  Several are excellent in every way, and have become regulars.  Home health care is very expensive, much more than assisted living, and is not covered by Medicare, except for actual medical services, but Right at Home assures me they will provide a statement outlining the tax deductions allowable. If you can afford it, home health care is far preferable to an assisted living facility.  These are understaffed and poorly regulated and patients' experiences in most of them, according to published reports, is not what anyone would want for a loved one. Overall, ROH has been a godsend for my husband and for me. They are a national franchise. I would recommend them in the Charleston, SC area and hopefully elsewhere.
Property Address: 884 JOHNNIE DODDS BLVD STE 202, Charleston, SC 29403

review_text:
The community was very good, but the staff could have been more compassionate.  the one issue we had is they would not send her meds through medicare they had their own pharmacy.  

I would recommend this facility to others.
Property Address: 30350 West 12 Mile Road, Farmington Hills, MI 48334

reviewTitle: Review of Pacifica Senior Living Calaroga Terrace
review_text: [Name removed] at the front desk is great. He always gets things done in a timely manner.

The people I talked to on the phone were lovely.  I liked that the tour coordinator followed up with me multiple times, even after we had already found a place, to make sure we were still doing okay and didn't need a place.  The money was good for the size of rooms.  Basically the location just didn’t work out for our family.

My mom was not interested in moving into any sort of assisted living UNTIL I took her to visit Abode Care of Allentown.  In the lobby there was a sign welcoming us to which mom said "they want you to feel at home here".  The head of marketing gave us the tour of the facility and by the end of the tour mom said "when can I move in"?  I was stunned and amazed because of the drive over, she wanted NOTHING to do with it.   Mom moved into to her new home 3 weeks later and has no regrets.   She feels safe and constantly tells us how happy she is there.   She has made friends, enjoys the courtyard, and participates in some of the activities.   Everyone has made her feel welcome.  I provide regular feedback to the staff and they are always receptive and looking for ways to improve.  Mom is happy and safe, I couldn't ask for more.  I am thankful for the team at Abode for making this transition smooth and taking care of my mom.  I no longer need to worry as I know she is in good hands.

My mother is currently in this community. She loves it! The staff are friendly and responsive to her needs. They are making positive changes, brought in a new director who is hands on with the residents and the staff, and are bringing in an RN to add more clinical experience to the nursing department. This has been a joy for mom, and for us!

reviewTitle: A great blend of independence and assistance. Amazing cooks.
review_text: The staff are patient and personable. Not as much active activity as my grandmother expected from the way management sold us on the facility, but the actual staff is kind, wonderful chef and housekeeping

"Top!" senior living because of people here. Following based on score of 1-10 (10 being best):
Staff: 10 - love them
Residents: 10 - know names and greet daily with love
Helpers: 10 - very nice, smiling and always there
Waiters and kitchen staff: 10 - smart, there for you

We came for food - the dining room. If we are up 8hrs/day we easily could spend 3 hours in dining room. We are old, like the food we grew up with. 

Food: 8.5-9

I can't stress enough how pleased I am with the care that my mother receives here. My mother-in-law was also at this house a few years ago before passing away from Parkinson's related issues. I have never had a problem or concern that the staff hasn't addressed immediately. The food is wonderful, nutritious and well balanced. The house is always immaculately clean and there is a huge effort to make this a place where it is as much like a "family" as possible. It is such a painful decision to make when you feel that your loved one needs to be in an alternate care situation, but I think that the homeiness of Serenity is certainly 2nd best and often provides better care than you can yourself.

reviewTitle: Nice property.  Clean and very nice s...
review_text: Nice property.  Clean and very nice staff.
Property Address: 654  Lillian Way Ave, Los Angeles, CA 90004

review_text: Very spacious private rooms w/ high ceilings, huge great room, three care givers, great patio in back yard with many tall trees.  Pricing is comparable with others I visited, but much better venue. Owner is a nurse.

reviewTitle: Review of Northridge Gracious Retirement Living
review_text: I love it here. I have been very happy since moving back home. Starting with the staff whom go above and beyond what I believe would be working their job description. It's made evident that they love what they do. It's personal, the activities have a broad range of choices. They are limitless. Having staff whom live on site is absolutely a positive. It has a huge impact.

My mom lives here and it is terrible! They are having box food for Christmas with a choice of tuna salad or egg salad, can you believe that!  They never have special Holiday meals and the meals are always cold.   
They hardly have any fun activities to do.  They always make necklaces and bracelets to sell so that Brookdale can get money.  For Christmas, they haven't done anything.  You would think that they would make gingerbread houses at least.
They have Happy Hour and they will pass out a piece of candy or a sliver of cake.  They always play trivia games and never anything else.  My mom hates Trivia so it isn't fun for her. They are so cheap!
They never play fun music or have bands.  They will hire a violinist or solo musician and that is it.
Please don't put your loved one here!!!
Property Address: 145 North Milwaukee Avenue, Vernon Hills, IL 60061

review_text: Mom is still adjusting to living at this community. The staff have been very nice, encouraging and attentive.  Mom seems to like the food, however she has not yet started to participate in any of the activities offered. They keep the community well taken care of.
My father had excellent care at this facility!  Excellent food, caring staff would recommend this place!
not interested b/c of location
Property Address: 10001 South May Avenue, Oklahoma City, OK 73159

reviewTitle: The administration staff has been real nice
review_text: Overall, the administration staff has been real nice. I've had some trouble with the administration of medications, which is the handing out of the medications. The food i'm not impressed with at all. The other staff is friendly but I have seen friendlier. The facility is always very clean. They do a good job at cleaning it. They do offer activities, but I have seen better activities at other facilities.
Property Address: 3620 Happy Woods Ct, Myrtle Beach, SC 29588

reviewTitle: I like it, but there have been a few minor issues.
review_text: I like it, but there have been a few minor issues. It's been tough getting some medical testing done in a timely manor. Getting some of the basic care needs accomplished regularly, like bathing hasn't been entirely consistent. The billing has been a little bit off. The numbers I was given at the beginning are way off compared to what I saw on the bill. I have had a difficult time getting a response. In the beginning I got an email that if we enrolled by a certain date, we could qualify for a reduction in rent the following month, and I haven't heard anything back yet either way. Other than that she is very happy there, she has acclimated and made friends, and is definitely more active. Her health has improved a little. They are very friendly. I never get complaints about the food, she is always excited when it comes to meals, I think she likes to socialize. It's working out pretty well.
Property Address: 1919 West Carla Vista Drive, Chandler, AZ 85224

review_text: The staff has been very engaged and caring. We're just very pleased with Cornerstone. My mother goes to church service which is good and she's gone to some of the movies. She's gone to when there is music in the common area. I'm not sure if she went on one of the shopping junkets but I know that's an available activity. She makes use of the on site beautician, which she finds convenient, and goes to the doctor who comes on site. My mom is happy with everything. The only thing she says about the food is they give her too much and my advice to her is to eat all of it.

reviewTitle: Hilltop Delivers Excellent Care For Residents And  Peace Of Mind For Families
review_text: I have been well pleased with Hilltop Memory Care. My only concern has been difficulty in reaching staff. I received a voicemail expressing concern about my husband and was unable to reach anyone for over 12 hours. I hope this problem has been addressed. The director has assured me that my complaint about non availability of staff has brought about policy change and the problem has been resolved.

Fairmont Village seemed a little frenetic for my loved one.  It had a lot of people in a big place.  But the staff was very friendly.  I loved the concept of them having an extra room for those who really need it - an area to calm someone who was agitated.  But for our needs, it just seemed a little less cozy and more frenetic than other places we toured.

reviewTitle: A wonderful atmosphere for our family members to live and thrive
review_text:
Hello, my name is [name removed].

I currently perform for the Anthology residents once a month during a happy hour event.

I can say a few great things about Anthology based on my experience during these events.

First off, the campus always looks great!

The residents always seem to be in a great mood, ready to sing along, dance or just listen to the music.

The staff always seems attentive to the needs of the residents.

If you have not checked out Anthology yet for your family member(s), I highly recommend you scheduling a visit today!

Great transportation. Good location.  The building and grounds are well kept. The lobby and downstairs is pretty nice. However the rooms and the halls are dated and old with dirt colored colors. It makes for not a very peaceful environment. They are repainting and updating some of the rooms as the residents move out. Hopefully they will do the halls soon.  The food is not good. Service to get the food is very slow. They do not have high speed internet...if many people use it it is so slow you might as well give up. The activities are good and they have a variety. Really nice people live here. We have had a bedbug problem they are trying to fix and finally we smell gas a lot from the kitchen. When I ask about it they always tell me not to worry about it.
Property Address: 1617 W Temple Ln (10200 South), South Jordan, UT 84095

reviewTitle: be careful and really do your homework befire signing paperwork
review_text: Our dad is in longterm care. We have found him in the floor, fallen out of the bed and no one around to help us and no answers to why his safety is not a concern. Staff is uneducated, you can not tell who is the CNA is  verses who have a degree in administration / social work. I am a social worker myself, and I have been in many homes. This is by far the most frustrating place for your loved one to call "home". Collecting a pay check is the only concern!

reviewTitle: Very poor facility based on experience
review_text: Very disappointed in this ALF. Mom lived here for 2 years. It was good when there were few residents, however as management, chef & employees left and it became more populated, care was sacrificed to a great extent. The place began to smell as residents were left in soiled clothes, laundry was done on a “quick wash” leaving it smelly and still soiled. Food was the equivalent to a truck stop, with breakfast being the only satisfactory meal. Lunch & dinner were heavy, dry pasta, meat, potatoes & bread with a few soggy vegetables. Fruit, when available was canned peaches, pears or fruit cocktail. It was not a menu that the elderly would choose, had they the ability to do so. There are also functional obsolescences throughout the facility. The bathrooms are so small it is nearly impossible to accommodate a wheelchair. There is no protection from weather when taking a resident from the memory care facility and no automatic doors that stay open while maneuvering a wheelchair. The dining area is too small to accommodate full residency so some residents are put alone in common areas to eat. The staff quickly puts residents in their rooms to “nap” even if they don’t “nap” after lunch, I assume in an effort to keep the common area uncrowded. There are just too many negative issues to address. Management is confrontational and quick to threaten expulsion hen issues are raised. Do yourself and your elderly loved ones a favor and avoid Anthem Lakes.

We have been using the services from this company for my mom for a while now and we are very happy so far with everything they have done for her. The caregivers that come to the home are always on time and very friendly. They accommodate her needs and make sure they can do there best to make sure she stays as comfortable as possible. I would recommend this home health care company to anyone in need of there services
Property Name: Affordable Family Care Services, Inc - Raleigh, NC

reviewTitle: Security is excellent and great floor plan!
review_text: The security is good. The Fllorplan is setup really well for the needs of everyone there.

reviewTitle: Nice Tour, But to Far For Us To Travel
review_text: My tour of this community was good one. The community appeared to be well maintained. Everything was nice and clean. The staff I met was kind and very helpful to residents. It was nice to see them being attentive to the residents. The location of this community wasn't very convenient for our families to travel. I enjoyed my tour, this is a friendly community.

reviewTitle: Review of Horizon Health and Rehab Center
review_text: Sometimes, when he calls for a nurse, they don't come right away or the CNA will say they will go get a nurse, and the nurse never comes. The therapist explains thoroughly what to expect. They are very patient with him and they encourage him. My husband does get upset because the nurses don't respond quickly. He has enjoyed the food.
Property Address: 660 S Martin Luther King Blvd, Las Vegas, NV 89106

review_text: This looked like a nice community when we toured it a while back.  The people were nice and friendly.  They offer independent living, assisted living and respite stays. They seem to offer some nice amenities and activities.  We were not ready to move at the time we looked into this community.

His has been a great experience for my family and loved one.  All the staff and residents are kind, sweet, and welcoming!  They make you feel at ease when you walk in, almost like it is your own home you're waling into.  Overall, I would recommend the community to others.

I would recommend The lofts At Cogir they are a very caring and compassionate home feeling Facility and always there for their residence. They have a lot of fun activities for their residence to keep their minds sharp and bodies moving witch is very important.

The advisor helped me find suitable options and even followed up with my inquiry.  It was unfortunate that other communities they sent us too were very aggressive and pushing us to make a decision. Sunrise at Livingston listened and understood and provided resources that the advisor could not.
Property Address: 290 W S Orange Ave, Livingston, NJ 07039

review_text:
I could not be more pleased with my choice. The Sheridan looks more like a beautiful boutique hotel than an assisted living and memory care facility. The people who work there really care about the residents, the food is fabulous and the activities are amazing and really diverse and fun.  The apartments in assisted living are modern and spacious yet comfortable at the same time.

I would highly recommend The Sheridan as your loved one’s next home
Moved our Mom in!
When I had a tour of the community I thought that it looked an old and runned down community. I did not think it was nice. The person who gave me the tour was okay with the presentation.
Community was pretty competent, would recommend this to a family or friend. We ate there a couple times, the food was pretty adequate would give it a five.

It's a beautiful facility. Some of the workers are not too friendly. The dining room food is good for the residents. They have activites such as exercise, golfing and a Japenese singing class. It's very expensive, and the services could be better.

This wouldn't be the first choice for a parent, if the choice were to be made again. Each time I'd visit, there would be many new faces at any given time.  I talked to the coordinator about the constant turn over of staff. I was told the CNAs don't stay long, because hospitals pay better. Once they get  a hospital job they realize how much more work it is. Don't be surprised to see your loved one with food spilled on their clothes  when you visit. Also, the wheel chair would be filthy, having remnants of spilled food.  I asked about morning hygiene routine, which they were always short on staff. My mother's teeth were brushed only when we brushed them ourselves.  Dinner hour was hard to visit,  people were sitting there who needed to be fed, rarely enough help. I never left there with a dry eye... The Scottish Home is private pay only. I highly recommend to do some serious research before your loved one moves into The Scottish Home. Although, The Scottish Home is always clean.
Property Name: Caledonia Senior Living and Memory Care
Property Address: 2800 Des Plaines Ave, North Riverside, IL 60546

review_text: The staff is great. We have a great manager. He steps up and does anything, even cooking and waiting on tables. He even shoveled snow from my car when it wasn't done and I needed to get out. The food is not proper for elderly people, a lot of fried food not enough vegetables mostly asparagus carrots mixed summer squash and hardly any fresh fruit. They say they put it out 3 times a day, but not enough for so many people if you aren't there when they put it out you don't get any. We are spending almost as much for proper food as we did at home.

From what we have seen, and we've seen a number of assisted living facilities, it seems to be very clean, the staff that we've encountered appear to be very friendly. The care is very good, just because of my mother in law's condition or situation, we have hired supplementary care just because of her dementia and out wish to be able to maintain her independence for as long as we possibly can. I think they do very well in maintaining a comfortable environment for the individuals who are living there, it's an attractive place, I think it's well laid out. I do think however that their activities probably could be diversified a little. I would like to see more activities that engage in either recalling things from the past or historical facts or word games but kind of geared at a slightly less complex level than what they have now.

reviewTitle: Toured.  Very impressed, but plan on ...
review_text: Toured.  Very impressed, but plan on homecare as long as possible

reviewTitle: Met with Director. Received tour and ...
review_text: Met with Director. Received tour and was put on waiting list. Good facility and great location. Might be a little too crowded for my mother's liking.

Sunrise Richmond is a wonderful community. They are filled with caring, compassionate staff who always put their residents first! I have a special place for Sunrise in my heart! I have visited the community several times and they have always been consistent with the care they provide!
Activities staff does an outstanding job. Front desk staff are very good but strained (understaffed). Common areas could use some regular vacuuming.

reviewTitle: A wonderful place to call home
review_text:
My daughter found this place for me when I was living in OKC and wanted me closer to her in San Antonio. My home here is a blessing. I love it so much. Staff are wonderful and we are all greeted by our name when we see them. The activities director is wonderful. Goes far above the call of duty to provide fun activities for all of us. 

I feel blessed every day to be here in this loving place called home.

reviewTitle: Would not recommend.  Poorly managed.  Poorly trained and unreliable care staff.
review_text: We chose Brookdale Kettering in 2022, which we regret.  It is NOT a community we would ever recommend for assisted living.  There are consistent problems with keeping reliable, well-trained staff and responding in a timely fashion to calls from residents in assisted living.  I don't think it's managed well.  Sales director and assistant director are very good, however.

Their strength lies in their medical staff. RNs were amazing, they did not contract out for medical care. That was their big plus for me. I felt my mil was in great hands as she needed lots of medical care not just assisted living.

reviewTitle: Beautiful facility has potential, honest review of our experience with Memory Care
review_text: The food is always served to Memory Care cold, no seconds or options. They're short staffed, the coffee is cold, limited food options and tiny portions. They were short a cook and the food came from the Assisted Living side, which they belonged in, but due to short staff they made my loved ones go into Memory Care where they had no activities and no one to enjoy passing time with. It was very horrible for their spirits and down right harmful to their mental health. The activities were non existent, including getting them outside. I will say that the facility has a lot of potential. I really liked [name removed], the person who I worked with the most. Such a kind and gentle soul. The facility is gorgeous. My loved ones would have been so much happier on the Assisted Living side, especially at those rates. I had such excitement of them moving to this facility honestly and am sorry to have to share this also.

My mother was a resident for almost a year before she died. She was not an easy person to please and yet she loved the staff and made quite a few friends there. I cannot thank the nurses and rest of staff enough for the peace of mind I felt that she was in a safe place. I knew she was being closely watched for changes in her health and well being. She especially liked Izaac and I’m sure she got his whole life story out of him. Also a huge thank you to [name removed] and [name removed] for coming to our rescue when we needed help transporting mom for a blood transfusion.  I will forever sing your praises to anyone looking for  help caring for a loved one.
Property Name: The Hampton at Salmon Creek Memory Care

review_text: As a resident that is handy capped, they have been very helpful in making the accommodations for me acceptable. I highly recommend this facility to others. The activities are scheduled conveniently and displayed.
Property Address: 11352 S Redwood Rd, South Jordan, UT 84095

reviewTitle: Definitely recommend you visit Regency Palms
review_text: I would recommend other families put Regency Palms on their list to check them out.  The management staff is extremely attentive and follows up well.  I appreciate their Montessori approach and very attentive staff.  The ratio of residents to caregivers is about 6:1,  which is better than most places you'll visit.
Great place full of active folks who become your friends and family. My mom has flourished since moving this last summer.  Managed very good

reviewTitle: Had more of an apartment like living ...
review_text: Had more of an apartment like living feel vs. the Gables.  Linda thought Gables was a prettier facility.  Two bedroom very nice and roomy
Property Address: One Chatfield Drive, West Hartford, CT 06110

review_text: Our mom has been at Greenfield for six months. She enjoys the activities and socialization with staff and other residents. All staff treat mom and all residents with genuine kindness. Greenfield has been a wonderful experience for our mom.
On site tour in Dec. Nice facility; however, my parents would need to switch facilities on the complex as their needs change. Very close to my house but I don't think this is the one.
Property Name: Legacy House Assisted Living of South Jordan
Property Address: 1517 W. Temple Lane, South Jordan, UT 84095

review_text: I was pleasantly surprised that [Removed] opened the door for me as I brought in equipment.  Staff was friendly and helpful.  I've been coming here for 5 years.  Always a 5 Star place.
Property Name: Arden Courts A ProMedica Memory Care Community in Glen Ellyn
Property Address: 2 South 706 Park Blvd., Glen Ellyn, IL 60137

review_text: I am happy with my time here (1.5years). Everyone is courteous & helpful.
Property Address: 3113 Charles B. Root Wynd, Raleigh, NC 27612

review_text: The facility is absolutely beautiful. The staff is very hard working and always on top of it.

The check-in and sign-up went very, very well. Since that time, things are okay. Their medication is okay and their book keeping is okay. There is just no wow factor there that I can see. But I think my mother is safe and in reasonably in good hands.

reviewTitle: Sunrise Continues to Earn My Respect
review_text:
After a year at Sunrise, for both of our 91 and 92 year-old grandmothers, we still have great things to say about Sunrise and their staff. One grandmother is reasonably independent and can take care of her basic daily needs (with a lot of help from the Sunrise care team). While the other requires additional care because of her mobility and memory challenges. Both have been able to successfully integrate into the Sunrise community, make interesting friendships, participate in most of the activities, and enjoy the weekly outings (parks, museums, casino, restaurants, beach and mountains). They have come to realize that simple exercise, a great diet, and social interactions are key to creating a happier life-style. One noticeable change is their focus on what they are going to do today, as opposed to what they can no longer do, i.e. driving. 
We get a lot of questions about what it is like at Sunrise now that over a year has passed and we have had an opportunity to experience their services and community. Here are key examples of what we have experienced:
•	Their medical team quickly diagnosed an upper respiratory infection that was causing her blood pressure to drop to unsafe levels and rushed her to the ER. The were completely on top of the situation, monitoring her vitals every day and took decisive action. 
•	Every time we visit Sunrise we are greeted by name. Why is this important – the staff takes the time to get to know us and how they can better meet our needs and concerns. Sunrise has had very little staff turnover, so it is much easier to build a relationship with the staff that is used to communicate what is going on with the grandmothers each week.
•	We still receive the monthly status calls from the care director updating us on the care they are providing and how well the grandmothers are doing – socially, physically, mentally. At every opportunity they seek our input – how are we doing? How can we improve? 
•	Prior to coming to Sunrise one grandmother lived at another local assisted living facility for over a year. During that time, we had nothing but monthly issues with the billing. We were constantly over billed by $100-$1,000 each month. It took hours of my time each month to correct their mistakes. At Sunrise we have had no billing errors. They know what they are doing, and the support staff is competent.
•	So, what don’t we like? Honestly, I haven’t found any issue that impacts the care my mother is receiving. Sunrise has earned my respect.

The community smells fresh, no other odors. I didn't see people cleaning but the community was clean. The staff was friendly and greeted us at the door. They all asked if they could help us and were very accommodating where they could be. The care was good as well, no complaints from my husband. He didn't complain about the food either! The only downside was when I tried to take him back, they were not licensed to thicken food otherwise I would have chosen them again.
I visited Coventry Place today looking for a place for my mom. What a wonderful place. The staff was friendly, and the residents were very happy. Lots of activities.

The residence was very nice and the residents seemed to be very well taken care of.  I do not think this is the right place for my Mom however, because I think she would be better off in a community environment.

You can eat off the floors – it’s immaculate.  There aren’t as many activities as in a regular facility, but for their level, they still do things with them. It’s been miraculous. They really care about the people. They actually do what they say. It’s fabulous. The food is unbelievable, homemade and organic! It’s just really excellent.
Property Address: 7878 E Vista Bonita Drive, Scottsdale, AZ 85255

review_text: Nice place. Very much like a home. Couldn't be happier.

Home instead has cancelled with us.
The caregivers need more training.  Some of them didn't know what to do.
I just feel abandoned.

reviewTitle: 5 stars all the way for Oxmoor Lodge!!!
review_text: The staff at this community are extremely friendly.  I did try the food once and it was ok I have not heard any complaints from my mom.  She is still adjusting so she has not yet started participating in any of the activities offered.  I would recommend this clean and well taken care of community.

5 stars, excellent staff that worked hard to make a smooth transition for my mom and family. She loves it there - her room is comfortable, the food is good and she enjoys her new friends and activities.

reviewTitle: Review of Synergy Homecare of Minneapolis - Golden Valley, MN
review_text:
It is very easy for the caregivers to understand our issues. They are willing to help.
I would recommend Synergy because they have always been able to help me with anything that I’ve asked of them.

Wow!! was my first thought when I walked into this property!  It is so beautiful.
John, was the marketing specialist that I worked with in arranging for my parents to move from out of state to AZ and into La Siena. I can't say enough positive things about John, he was so helpful and is such a fun person to work with!

LaSiena provides so many services and special activities and events for their residents.  The staff and everyone genuinely care about each and every resident.  Mom and Dad adjusted well and really enjoy living at La Siena.

reviewTitle: I love living at Revel Scottsdale
review_text: I have lived at Revel for almost a year and I love the family-like atmosphere and all the great activities and amenities. We have so much fun here and it is a wonderful safe and secure place to live. I highly recommend it.
We have had a very positive experience thus far. Everyone who works there is friendly and helpful. Mom is settling in very well, is happy and well cared for.

The apartment that my parents recently moved into at this community has been a perfect fit for them. They really like all of the great amenities it has to offer and they have a wonderful view outside there window. I like that they have a common activity center where all of the residents can enjoy a nice social environment. I would defiantly recommend this place to anyone interested.
We have not been able to eat the meals ourselves, but just from speaking with our loved one he really seems to enjoys the meals and dining and the activities.
Amazing community!!
Property Address: 19638 Stone Oak Pkwy, San Antonio, TX 78258

reviewTitle: Overall experience at Cantata Adult Life
review_text:
They were very helpful in selecting what type of assistance is appropriate. [name removed], the head nurse goes above and beyond to assist with setting up doctors visits, communicating issues with my mother that have been addressed and follow up care administered.

[name removed]  was outstanding in assisting with selection of appropriate apartment and alternative options to meet the timeliness of the move.
Property Name: Cantata Adult Life Services a CCRC

review_text: Silvercrest Garner was a wonderful community. The apartment we viewed was much larger and nicer than we expected. The staff were very kind and addressed all of my concerns. They offered activities for the residents and they kept the community very clean. We didn't choose Silvercrest because it was a bit far for our family to visit.

reviewTitle: Review of Westchester Village Of Lenexa
review_text: This is a very nice place to live - the people (residents) are all very nice as well as the staff. I have enjoyed living here... Except for the food.

My dad is doing just fine and he tells me that he likes the community. He likes the food and the activities the most. 
The staff are making the residents comfortable and safe, so far they have been good. We picked them because he already knew some people living here and it was affordable.

reviewTitle: Safe in the Haven of Love
review_text: We toured many facilities when we decided to place my mother at Southern Haven Assisted Living facility. We chose Southern Haven because it is a smaller facility ( they only take 13 residents). The atmosphere is more cozy and home like. The place seems very new, and is nestled on a knoll overlooking fields and a small lake. The facility is kept very clean, and the caregivers are kind and loving to all the residents. Southern Haven also is a very safe place for your loved one, since it is a locked facility. I was reluctant to have my mother placed in an assisted care facility, but the caregivers have put my mind at rest, knowing that she is safe with people who love her like she is part of their family.
Property Address: 279 Haig Mill Rd NW, Dalton, GA 30721

review_text: I moved into this community and it was been good. My apartment is 700 sq feet, with a separate bedroom, living room and storage room. It is a nice size for me. The staff have been nice and helpful. Since the Christmas is close I have not been able to try the meals or try activities.

reviewTitle: independence with a piece of mind
review_text: If you can afford it, this is a great community.  they always have someone checking up on the residence and this would a great place for your loved one to meet others that have similar interests.  I would recommend this community to others and already have.
Property Address: 2331 Westside Boulevard Southeast, Rio Rancho, NM 87124

review_text: I would recommend it as an ideal place to retire, meet good friendly residents, and enjoy a plethora of activities.
I like that it is a part of a larger system so if he needed more care he could receive it and would be given priority.

My father was there for only a month before he passed. He was cared for very well, even though he was very contrary.
The caregivers treated him and us like family, we felt he was safe with them 24/7. Where my wife and I couldn't give him all the care he required as well as keep him safe. 
Our family has no reservations about having Dad at St. Andrews.

reviewTitle: The smell of urine was overwhelming t...
review_text: The smell of urine was overwhelming throughout the house.  Bathrooms were dirty and house was not tidy.

I would highly recommend Arden Courts of Bath. The people here have been outstanding and great to work with, they are very flexible with all of my moms medications. We are just really happy with this facility.
Property Name: Arden Courts A ProMedica Memory Care Community in Bath
Property Address: 171 N Cleveland Massillon Rd, Akron, OH 44333

reviewTitle: So much more than brick and mortar!
review_text:
Approximately six months ago, I was in a situation of having to find a memory care community for my wife.  My requirements were high. Three or four days into my search and after having visited way too many communities, my son and I were visiting Westbrook Senior Living in Streamwood.  During our visit, we were fortunate to have met the Director of the Memory Care Unit, whom we talked with at great length. And we met many members of the staff, and just happened to have an unexpected “interview” with the daughter of a resident of the community who was there to pick up her Mom for an outing. My question for the daughter was brief and to the point, “How would you describe your experience at Westbrook?” Her response was a short five word sentence which said it all, “The staff here is amazing!”

After experiencing Westbrook for six months, I fully agree with the daughter's five word review. An example of this is easily illustrated by the fact one of the caregivers who we interacted with as my daughter, son, and I were setting up my wife's room, asked what day my wife was coming into Westbrook?  When we told her, she said that was her day off, but she would come in that morning because she wanted to meet my wife, and she did. 

Over the past months, I have experienced and observed much within the memory care unit. I am impressed with the Caregivers philosophy of family. Several of the staff have said to me they consider  those in memory care as family, and it is evident. One day as I was leaving, a Caregiver was walking in with a huge birthday cake she had purchased for all to enjoy in celebration of a resident's birthday. I have received calls from the Director keeping me informed on the transition progress of my wife. I have witnessed many times, staff sitting with residents on the benches in the halls, just talking and keeping them company. I have witnessed  the Director playing cards in the early evening with a new resident helping in the transition process. I have seen and heard laughter many, many times among staff and residents. It is unusual to not see a smile on the faces of staff. It is evident the staff enjoys what they are doing, and the residents enjoy the staff.

The brick and mortar of this approximately three to four year old facility is outstanding.  It is extremely clean, attractive, well maintained, comfortable, has many amenities, etc. One would hope that is true of any place that someone calls home, and it certainly is here at Westbrook.  But in my opinion, the staff is what makes a community like this exceptional.  Echoing the response of the daughter I just happened to meet during our initial visit to Westbrook, “The staff here is amazing!'

When my mother decided it was time to sell her house we looked at many various options. When we visited Sr. Commons we both felt it would be a great place for her. She really loves it there. The staff are wonderful, courteous and extremely helpful. Mom has made many new friends. We both highly recommend Sr. Commons. It’s a great new home.

I do not have much experience, but this community I will say is very clean and the staff members are just excellent. It is very Christian forward when it comes to religious so the staff will always greet you nicely and say God Bless you, etc. There are so many activities here that look very exciting, I am still adjusting but I hope to get involved here soon. The value for the  money is very good and I would absolutely recommend this community to other families.
Property Name: Fellowship Square Historic Mesa at Brown and Center

reviewTitle: My mom moved in March 1,  2014.  We a...
review_text: My mom moved in March 1,  2014.  We are so happy with Belmont, and the wonderful staff.  The pals are so kind, and caring they have made her adjustment there go very smoothly.   I am very pleased with all the supportive staff who make my mom feel like Belmont is her new home.  Belmont offers all kinds of daily activities that the residents can be involved in. The dining hall is very welcoming and the menu has a large selection to choose from.  We are thankful we have my mom in a place where she is cared for treated with respect, and shown so much love and kindness by all the staff.  Thank you everyone at Belmont for making it a great place for our loved ones.

I have lived here for 2+ years and have occupied two different apartments, due to my husbands death went to a different apartment. Staff was extremely helpful in process with the move. Made new friends and new social connections.

reviewTitle: A Cozy, Welcoming Community for Loved Ones
review_text: Recently toured Elim while looking for a place for my father, and I was genuinely impressed. The security measures are thorough without feeling restrictive, and the atmosphere is wonderfully welcoming. What caught my attention was how staff members stopped to chat with residents by name as we walked through. The community spaces are bright and inviting, and I noticed several residents enjoying card games and puzzles together. The facility has a cozy, home-like feel rather than an institutional atmosphere. The sample meal we tried was tasty and well-prepared. Will definitely keep Elim at the top of our list.

One of the main things that my mother likes about this community is the activities. They offer a lot of activities for her to choose from. This has been the perfect fit for her. At the moment she is still enjoying the healthy meals that they offer she does have a kitchen but, she enjoys the meals that the community offers.

I have both my mother and my aunt here at this community. They are both doing great here. This is truly a wonderful community. They have gone above and beyond for us, I'am very pleased. The community looks great, everything is very nice and clean. My mother has adjusted well to it, they have even asked her to do the flower arrangements for the community. Everybody is very friendly and accommodating. They have a wonderful chef, she is pleased with the meals. Overall everything has worked out very well for us here.

We recommend to everyone Alpha Senior Care Home. Very nice home ,clean, very good service  nice people and friendly . We could not find any better place for my mother . He was a bleesing for as to have this family to take care of my mom. Thank God for everything .

reviewTitle: we found a great place for our Mother
review_text: The overall experience with Prestonwood Court has been great; it took a while for her to engage with others after the loss of her husband but now she's more involved in being out with others in the activity room.

reviewTitle: I love this place, and I think that whole experience was wonderful.
review_text: I love this place, and I think that whole experience was wonderful. I was very pleased. Even when there was an emergency they get in touch with me right away. I can call anytime I need to. The food is great, very tasty and always looks good, and I was buying her ice cream, and they told me I don't need to they can give it to her. The activities can be tough with the dementia patients, but they try, and they have outings and entertainment, I think they do a good job of it on the dementia floor. I don't feel like I need to have someone there everyday, if I can't get there to visit every day, I know she is okay.

reviewTitle: My Tour Experience at Waltonwood Lakeside
review_text: Good community.  They didn't have any availability for a one bedroom and that is what we needed.

Our Mother received top-notch care for 11 years at this wonderful senior home. We cannot say enough good things about the wonderful caregiving staff!

We are so grateful for the consistent high-quality care our Mother received at Sunrise of Naperville North over many years.

The community here was so warm in its welcome to our family from day one until our Mother passed. 

We highly recommend Sunrise at Naperville North.

From what I saw while touring this community, I thought is was a beautiful place. I liked what I saw and what was here. This would have been a suitable community for us. However, the location of the community was not convenient or close for the family.
Property Address: 3185 E. Flamingo Rd, Las Vegas, NV 89121

review_text: The Shores at Clearlake is an absolutely beautiful facility that has been newly renovated. This was our second choice. The staff were all so kind and welcoming. I really liked that the take their memory care residents on outings. I liked this facility so much and it made it very hard for us to make a decision.

The owner is very personable, and has been great getting back to me.  There is really good open communication between us, so I am always informed myself, and able to ask and get any questions I have answered.  

My mother in law is very happy there, and that is the most important thing.

reviewTitle: Facility was beautiful, lacking in gr...
review_text: Facility was beautiful, lacking in grounds for residents to walk through, construction on pool has started but that will be the only outside area for residents.  For a one bedroom 865 sq ft, it starts at 2900.00.  No lease requirement, month to month rental. Had lunch food was wonderful. he liked the facility but not the fact that there are very little grounds, pool in progress and that the facility is only one third full.

Every time I drop of my mother at Edgewood Vista Omaha it’s always good. It’s a very small place with I think maybe 11-12 residents and guests at any time. They’re definitely overwhelmed and not not paying attention over there which makes it better. They provide activities almost every day and they hand out calendar schedules to let you know what’s happening. Today they have exercise video, hydration daily chronical, bowling, Christmas sing along, let’s reminisce, and game of choice. They do a little in the morning, a little more in the afternoon, and I think the last activity ends around 6:30pm because some of them like to go to bed early. They had a professional singer last time I went to pick up my mother. They are definitely more engaged here which I like compared to another facility that I went and toured.

There are nice people here with staff that seemed to care and it is family owned. It is farther from me and I didn't like where some of the rooms were facing. It was by the biggest boulevard and faced the 134 freeway. A little noisy and in urban areas for my mom to get comfortable. The tour guide did a good job and she was a nice lady.
Maranatha is part of the Presbyterian organization. My mother-in-law used to live there. It was okay but it got real expensive and it was not very modern. The care was good.

We only used them for two weeks.I think my mother could have benefited from their services more but because it was so brief we didn't put much effort into it. The bonding ad reliability of the employees was very good.
Property Name: Right at Home - East Memphis, TN
Property Address: 7225 Riverdale Bend Road Suite #105, Memphis, TN 38125

reviewTitle: Review of Briarwood Rehabilitation and Healthcare Center
review_text: It has been very good. They have a lot of staff and they are on top of things. It is clean and well kept. Social services and admissions reached out to us. Rehab seems good but I would like to see it extended. It is very clean. The meals looked good but he does not like the meals much. The social worker has been good with communicating.

I toured the Taylor while looking at living options for myself. I liked it very much, but I did end up choosing to live  in Taylor’s sister community, The Jackson. The Taylor is a restored school that they have done a wonderful job on. I did find that at the Taylor, the staff were willing to be accommodating and were very reasonable. However, I did find that a lot of people there wished that they had a better loading area for move in and move outs.

This place looks good at first, but they really let us down!  I would recommend you speak directly with the director about the care that your loved one needs.  The sales director fed us a line of BS that turned out to not be enforceable by the staff.  And they had a big attitude about how little they were actually caring for my mother.  She does wander, and they could not keep her secure because the supposed "secure" entrances and exits were all open due to renovations.  I was promised in my preliminary meetings with the Sales Mgr. that this would not be a problem.  My mom was there less than a week when I got the call that I had to get there as soon as possible to move her out.  The temperature in the building is very inconsistent.  The food seems ok, the water fowl lake is very nice, but the communication between departments sucks.  They put my sister and I in a very difficult position, I will NOT recommend them to ANYONE.  Too bad, as it is probably going to be a very nice looking place after the renovations are done.
Property Name: Commonwealth Senior Living at Willow Grove

review_text: The staff was friendly and everything.  But walking through on our tour, it seemed more like a nursing home.  It felt kind of depressing, which was not the atmosphere I wanted for my loved one.
Property Address: 16911 San Pedro Avenue, San Antonio, TX 78232

review_text:
They are very knowledgeable and helpful and will do their best to get a room/ apartment ready for you.... the staff is very friendly and will do whatever it takes to make your days as comfortable as possible.  There is a bus for use to go to doctor appts,  food Lion and Walmart...   there is a very dependable, qualified driver to run you back and forth... meals are prepared  three times a day and served in the dining room along with coffee, juices,  tea , milk and lemonade at mealtime. There is always a main meal, an alternate, a heart-healthy, a sandwich and chef salads and fruit plates with cottage cheese.   Lunches come with your choice of the salad of the day, which is smaller , the side salad has lettuces , cherry tomato and cucumber plus additional toppings and dressings. There's usually a homemade yeast roll every day with lunch and a dessert. At dinner,  meals are usually
 lighter since the noon meal is huge!!! Usually soup and sandwich or salad . The dessert cart comes around at the end of dinner with a variety of ice creams, cakes, puddings, fresh fruit cups and other treats.  Lately our meals have not been that great.  We can't seem to keep a cook and have to keep re-hiring a night chef. Sometimes the meals run out before everyone is served or the servers don't all come in and then it takes forever to get your meal .  Lunch is an hour and a half long , usually.  Breakfast does have a variety of cold and hot cereals, fruits, eggs, toasts or English muffins, meats several times a week but breakfast meat is not served every day... there is an Activity room where residents go to play games, WII bowling, art class , bingo and a soft -serve ice cream machine. There is ice cream in it all day, every day, which many people love ... there is always
 entertainment for us, square-dancers, singers, children from the local  churches sing songs and provide entertainment .... other activities are planned during the week that include trips to museums, parks and lakes for picnic lunches, etc., concerts, dairy farms for fresh ice cream and others. It's mostly a lot of fun here and new friends galore!   The worst part of it is the weight  you can gain from all these wonderful meals. I have found you cannot eat the yeast roll every day and no dessert if you eat the yeast roll.... which brings me to the GYM. There's an exercise class every day at 9:00 and 3:000 plus fully loaded gym with different exercise equipment for your use. There's a fully stocked library plus lots of jig  saw puzzles to do. The grounds are beautifully kept with flowers and roses and trees! There is a housekeeping staff to change your sheets and clean your private
 bathroom every week. They vacuum the carpets and sweep floors. Overall, it's been a great experience living here! I have really enjoyed it and there are two medical offices in the building if you need therapy or special help getting ready for bed . Since this is an independent living facility here, you should be able to do things for  yourself. But if you need help, there is Com-for-care to help with bathing and dressing or getting medicines. Legacy helps provide therapy if need be.  You can have your own vehicle, too, with free parking .  This building is located near  shopping malls, stores, restraunts and a variety of other things like museums and other places of interest. It's close to RDU airport.
Fran and I met on 3/18 - decided to move Mom here.  Thanks for the suggestion - this is a wonderful facility.
Property Name: Ginter Hall Assisted Living and Memory Care

reviewTitle: Excellent choice in Senior care is at Brookdale
review_text: The staff at Brookdale is awesome. They are patient , kind and knowledgeable as well as caring.  The facility is clean .

when walking in you can feel the environment is just different. Every department has a loving and caring heart. The housekeeping dept. is on top of keeping the place clean and tidy. Spoke with a red head gal and her response to why she tries so hard just astounded me! she replied I try the best I can because having a clean and tidy property is key to keeping the residents I care for so deeply safe from illness. if I do my part that helps them not add to the issues they have already and plus I want the family to know their loved ones are safe and secure. it is scary for everyone and if I can bring some peace of mind to the whole situation I want to. i am protective with my father as i am sure you are with your family member and wherever i can help may that be cleaning, holding a conversation or just being a cheerleader i will do my best whole heartedly that is my goal. they deserve a place to not worry I think this whole company is special in that way. then told me i hope you have a great visit for they are important at this stage of life. she brought a tear to my eye for you can see the compassion in her soul.  what a great feeling to know my father is in such a special caring place.
Property Address: 3920 East San Miguel Street, Colorado Springs, CO 80909

review_text: We had a short time frame in finding a short term facility for my brother. They had what he needed, a fully furnished, and I mean a fully furnished (right down to spatulas in the drawer) apartment. The pub was also great to make it like a fun neighborhood.

Director very attentative. Large facility. Multiple 3 story buildings. More geared to independent living and newly taking on assisted/directed living.   pros: larger units, met w/very satisfied resident, ample visitor parking.   cons: must go outside to activites and dining area = exposed to summer heat, appears directed care to come from Phoenix facility until new assisted building completed and opened, ala carte pricing can equal more expensive, units dated, very small entry to bathroom.
Property Name: Fellowship Square Historic Mesa at Brown and Center

review_text:
They have been very accommodating to the specific & individual needs of each patient. They are very mom & pop shop-like vs a big organization with a factory-feel. They provide a very personalized experience and are very flexible. Branch Brook is not a great facility for someone who needs a lot of care. It's better for someone who needs a medium amount of care. The people that move there should have some level of mental soundness. Overall 
it's been a good experience.

reviewTitle: Review of Westchester Village Of Lenexa
review_text: You should be proud of your community, I was equally impressed with your mission, vision and dedication to enhance the lives of the seniors you serve and the professionalism of the employees, I observed.

As I enjoyed my first meal with two friends, I'm left feeling full and grateful that Glen Eagle is a place I can feel is my own. My thank-you goes to my first contact person, Susan, she assisted me the most.
Our family had an in person tour and it was a really nice tour but we wanted apartment that had kitchens in them for our loved one to cook and this did not.

reviewTitle: My mother is very happy at Timberwood
review_text: My mother has been a resident for a little over a month and we are both very pleased. There have been a few minor problems but once staff is notified they are extremely responsive and correct the problem quickly. I really believe they are good hearted employees that have the residents best interest in mind. Andrea the director is wonderful.

Northridge Village is a very efficiently run retirement community that strives to meet ones needs and requests which results in a friendly, positive atmosphere in which one lives. The staff is well trained!
Property Address: 3300 George W Carver Avenue, Ames, IA 50010

review_text: Visit went as well as could be expected.Mom not happy with moving,but like the staff.
Rooms nice but very tiny.

The staff is friendly, welcoming and accommodating.  Dad likes the food, however it does seem to take a long time to receive it. They do offer a lot of activities.  The community is clean and very pretty.  They do not have staff on site twenty four hours a day.  I would recommend this community.

Everything is working out pretty well for my father with this home care. It is a work in progress. My father is still getting use to the care givers. My contact has primary been through the phone, and I'am satisfied with the commutation between us. Overall everything is going well and I would recommend this home care.
My mom was there for 2 weeks. Sales lady lied about overall price. After she was done kissing kitchen staff person in her office. Very displeased. Got my mother out!
Property Address: 2105 University Park Boulevard, Colorado Springs, CO 80918

review_text: This is a fairly nice facility! The staff care seems to be very good, and the facility is very clean. The food is adequate. We found that this was a significant improvement from the previous facility, so we are pleased.
Our family has an in person tour with Van Dyk Park Place and based on everything we were shown on the tour, we would have to say the overall tour experience was excellent!

They are on time and courteous over the phone if I have to call or if someone is going to be late. The work is excellent.  They are such a blessing to me, the house, and my loved one. The house is clean, which gives me more time. They have patience and are good with me and make me feel important.

My mother needed increased assistance while staying socially and physically active. JSS has provided that while addressing mom's medical needs. Every time I visit (at least weekly), mom reminds me how much she like JSS. In her words, "I am so happy".
I toured several communities, including this one. This one was the worst as far as area and freedom.

I love living at this community because of the friendships I have made since moving in.  I feel like the residents and staff are like a family always looking out for one another to helping each other.  Management is very nice and helpful whenever I have a question,

reviewTitle: My Tour Experience at Hampton Manor of Clinton
review_text: This was not the right fit for my loved one.

I wish I could give a zero. But one star is for the kind senior people who are residents. This place is awful . May appear to look nice. What a nightmare . You will have no
Luck in any form of health care. Meds will be skipped . And no response with emergency button as your loved one falls. Or mistakes as blood thinners givin before a procedure . I will be moving my family out. Things of value missing when your love one goes to lunch or is sleeping. What a disgrace.no orders will be followed from your doctor. My family member had a back procedure and they forgot to stop the aspirin as doctor ordered . Her stamps sitting on her kitchen table and valuable rings passed on from family gone. There is no reinforcement there to get rid of people of bad character. I found people not looking so happy. They were moved thinking what they were told is true. And sold on a nice apartment. We will be looking around to move. Listen up and take advice.

reviewTitle: When I first toured Autumn Leaves at ...
review_text: When I first toured Autumn Leaves at Bolingbrook, I immediately felt comfortable and at home. The warm welcoming community was very evident. My first impression was very accurate. My mother has been receiving exceptional care. The entire staff maintains a close relationship with every resident. The atmosphere has an extended family feel, with concern not only for the residents, but for their family members also. Communication with family is wonderful.

My parent use do live in west building . Truthfully speaking since [name removed]took over as ED this place has gone down hill. The memory care unit is dirty. The carpet, the kitchen very filthy. They have bedbugs and they are eating the residents alive, you can visibly see them even during the day. Bedbugs have been seen in the memory care unit kitchen plates that the residents eat with. This place is TERRIBLE, I would NEVER recommend it to anyone.

reviewTitle: The comfortable and correct choice for your family member.
review_text:
The set up of the front desk made it easy to visit when I wanted.  Other facilities I visited it was hard to come and go.  Poets walk was secure.  
Room size was a very nice size.  Had room for bed, tv dresser and chair with room to move.  Light in room was very good also.  Bathroom was set up well and large.  The little hall in room gave privacy from open door

I felt that that the community needed some updating done to it. The facility seemed older and could use a couple of things fixed. The guide was informative and i thought it was up-kept. I was able to see the rooms and the guide did tell me about the community being pet friendly. My overall view about it was that everyone was nice and friendly.

reviewTitle: This is homecare, so the cleanliness ...
review_text: This is homecare, so the cleanliness and activities don't really apply. Everything was great though. The prices were very reasonable. I can't really think of any improvements they needed - everything was good! We mainly chose them because they were also recommended by the Mayo Clinic.

Property Address: 10 N Summit Ave, Park Ridge, IL 60068

reviewTitle: Very small, very bad musty, moldy sme...
review_text: Very small, very bad musty, moldy smell in common area and apartment. Staff representative was absolutely wonderful. She took a lot of time with me and she and my daughter hit it off also.  Sadly, she was the best part of the place.
The facility at Bear Canyon Estates was quite lovely.  My mother really enjoyed the food and all the staff was very kind, friendly, and helpful.

reviewTitle: A great fit for our family, 5 stars
review_text: We chose Hartland Hills because my mother in law was here also so we knew what it was like. They also had a room available when we needed it. They have various sizes of rooms but his is adequate for his needs. The food here is incredible, they have a very nice dining room and a menu that has good variety. I would absolutely recommend to others.
I think this place is great! The meals are delicious and nutritious. I enjoy all the activities offered. The residents and staff are wonderful.

The community is very warm and inviting.  The staff is always friendly, welcoming, and caring.  The community is always clean and bright and the food is spectacular!  We would highly recommend west bay to anyone.

Moved mom and dad to The Terrace at Glen Eddy after a less-than-optimal experience at another nearby long term care facility. The level of care and attention my parents are receiving at The Terrace is absolutely outstanding! Even in the midst of necessary COVID restrictions, I am very impressed at how life is SO much richer and more rewarding here. Every staff member goes above and beyond to make my parents feel loved and cared for. Highly recommend Glen Eddy!

reviewTitle: Very old and not at all modernized
review_text: We didn’t like this place at all. They weren’t modern at all and looked very old. The rooms were not that big and it looked more institutionalized. There was no carpet in the rooms either, only tile floors. However, everything was clean. They told us about the basic activities that they offer for everyone to participate in. The person that gave us the tour was nice, answered all our questions, and basically told us what the facility had to offer. It wasn’t the right place for us so we went with a different community.
Property Name: Ginter Hall Assisted Living and Memory Care

review_text: The staff at this community was nice when we visited.  The community seemed clean.  They offer some daily  activities. I would have chosen this community if it was closer to us.

The community is very homey and comfortable.  A home-like environment and the staff is very friendly and kind.  The food is not very appetizing and really needs to improve but I would recommend this community to others based on my experience.
Excellent facility.
The facility is clean. My loved one is loving the meals! The communication has been good. They are always prompt to contact me if anything happens
Property Address: 1101 Black Oak Drive, New Brighton, MN 55112

reviewTitle: Very nice property room and people. W...
review_text: Very nice property room and people. We liked it, though it's definitely on the high end of the price range.

This facility has too much behind the scenes chaos. Laundry service is an absolute nightmare. My daddy's closet was routinely replenished with other resident's clothing. What was put away in drawers was balled up & crammed in the drawers & socks lost & mismatched with other resident's socks. My daddy was routinely restrained in his wheel chair behind the table in the activity room and china cabinet. My daddy was not changed regularly & was NEVER turned him at night & NEVER repositioned in his wheelchair. Within 2 months  my father had a pressure wound that went septic. That wound (gaping, puss-filled, rotting sore took my father's life.
I wouldn't recommend The Pearl to ANYONE- EVER! It is beautiful facility, aestetically. The food was good.  The caretakers are severely underpaid. And I do not think they are trained to work on this level of care.

My aunt is a little confused so it is hard to get a straight answer about how things are going, but it seems like she is settling in and doing a lot better. She was really confused when she got there. As she got used to it, she seemed to be a lot happier.

The building is very nice. They take good care of it as far as cleanliness and decorations, and the decor is very nice. The food is excellent. We have eaten there quite a few times, and I have always been impressed. I work in the industry, and this is not the top of the line, but it is probably in the top 2% of places around town.

When I toured Brookdale, it felt like more of a hotel than an apartment complex. It was cold and not inviting. Everyone there was very friendly and informative, but it was not what I was looking for. It was quite expensive as well.
What we like about Seniors Helping Seniors is that the staff is friendly and patient and we would recommend their services to other families.
Property Name: Seniors Helping Seniors Northwest Atlanta, GA
Property Address: 6478 Putnam Ford Drive, Suite 223, Woodstock, GA 30189

review_text: The tour I had was fine. It was a good view of the community. Everything is saw was good. I was looking for a place that was more small with the homelike atmosphere. The person I met with was nice and professional.

Turnover seems very high.  When I notice an exceptional caregiver, I don't see them there very long.  The facility in general is kept pretty clean.  The care of the residents could stand some improvement, especially in the area of personal grooming assistance.

Care of the resident's clothing is lacking.  For the price they charge, better care should be taken when laundering clothes.  Clothing seems like it's all washed together in high temperature, so items are quickly worn and ruined.

The people who provide service and care to my mother are the kindest people I have seen.  Over the past year, through the process of searching, moving in, and settling in, I have not had one unpleasant interaction.  The level of care is wonderful and my mother feels safe, well taken care of, and special!

reviewTitle: Visited this location, visited 2 of E...
review_text: Visited this location, visited 2 of Evelyn's locations.  One was extremely clean and neat and organized. Both of the places in Serra Mesa were nice and run efficiently.

We chose Apple Blossom mainly because of the staff members, when we went to visit the staff were all just very friendly helpful. The dining area also stuck out to us, it was very beautiful and I thought my mom would be happy here. My mom had a studio apartment and it was a good size for her needs. I just cannot say enough good about the staff and would absolutely recommend this facility.

Horrible. Very neglectful place, also very sad place. When you tour you will see residents just sitting staring into space. Horrible feeling to be there. On two occasions we heard people yelling for help, staff just ignored it. I cried in my car after I toured there.

They have very good activities for the senior residents.  The ratio of workers to residents is very good, such that the residents can get the care and attention that they need.  The facility itself is very nice, clean, and well kept.  I wish I could have kept my mother there longer, but unfortunately finances would not allow it.
I toured this community and it was ok. It wasn't bad, it just didn't feel like the right place for my loved one. It was clean and they were friendly enough- but kind of more like a business friendly.

I liked the fact that the facility is smaller in size and how the rooms are all easy to get to.  Residents were all around, at the entrance in the main area, in the activity room playing cards, in the movie room.  It is a locked facility and they can keep people with memory problems as well.  Everyone seemed happy.
Good place, good food.

reviewTitle: Compassionate Care in a Loving Home
review_text: Birchwood House is truly a home, where owner [Removed] and caregivers [Removed] consider your loved one to be part of their family. As my dear friend [Removed] entered the late stages of cancer and could no longer live in her home, she was blessed to find her new home at Birchwood. She is in hospice now, but while she lived at Birchwood she was lovingly cared for, driven to her chemotherapy and other procedure appointments by [Removed], and treated with the utmost kindness and respect. We are so grateful to have found such compassionate care for our [Removed] at Birchwood House.

I am looking for a retirement place for my mom. I came across the continental community and made an appointment for a tour.  [name removed]  is extremely kind and responsive.  She addressed all my concerns and gave all possible options. The facility is clean and well organized. I am in the process to move my mom in.

My Mom is 94 and has been recently diagnosed with Dementia. She can still function well, but needs alot of Cueing. We chose Cedar Lake because of the Residence Club program that seems to be a combination of Assisted Living and Memory Care. Mom moved in 2 weeks ago and has adjusted very well. The Staff is exceptional. Each and everyone we have met that works there, is well trained and very Caring. They have 
a wonderful daily program of activities to keep Mom active and socializing. The facilities are immaculate and the food is quite good. There were no surprises as everything was clearly explained in advance. So far, I do not think that Mom could be in a better Place, and that is very comforting to me.
Property Name: Cedar Lake Assisted Living and Memory Care

reviewTitle: met with manager. Only drawback is no...
review_text: met with manager. Only drawback is no kitchenettes.

Pinnacle of Louisville is a wonderful facility.  We are so happy we moved our mother to this facility.  All the staff from head down are so caring & loving.  Price is reasonable compared to others & benefits given are well worth it.  I highly recommend you consider Pinnacle for your loved ones. You won't be disappointed

My loved one has only been here a short time, but so far our experience has been a good one overall! The staff here do a good job for the most part, and although we did have a few minor issues initially they responded to our complaints quickly and made changes. The facility itself is beautiful, clean, and well kept, and Mom says that the food is pretty good! Emeritus was recently bought out by Brookdale, and I have noticed a little shakiness during the transition. However Mom really seems to enjoy it here, and that is what really matters, I would definitely recommend them!

reviewTitle: Back at home where we belong.
review_text: The experience we had at Brookdale Fresno wasn't the greatest. Thankfully, our home was still available so we moved out. There was absolutely no privacy and the staff walked in without knocking every morning which i did not like at all. The food was awful! Good thing the community is pet friendly although the patio is not a decent size for our two little dogs. Our experience with the staff wasn't all bad but we are definitely glad to be home.

We moved our parents there after 6 weeks of very poor care at [facility name removed]. Kanawha Place was amazing from the first day. My in-laws were well cared for, clean, and well fed. The staff was always available to lend an extra hand. When our family had to spend the night to be with our dying loved one, the staff offered meals and support. We highly recommend Kanawha Place.

reviewTitle: Much better than a large facility
review_text: Desert Breeze is a small place, it is a house with bedrooms so it does not really have that social vibe, but the value is excellent. There was always a good care giver to residents ratio.
Property Name: Desert Breeze Assisted Living Home Inc

review_text: We were really disappointed because this one was one of the newest and they had lots of plumbing problems. We visited 2 or 3 times and they never got resolved. The food was really bad, like cafeteria food. I had a fish with a lemon sauce, the fish was definitely overcooked and it was very rubbery; they tried to hide it with a bunch of sauce and that didn't work because it was too lemony. My son had a hot dog and that was also overcooked- I don't understand how you do that- but when you grill hotdogs they have grill marks, these weren't grilled but they were burnt and rubbery... overall it was all burnt and it had no taste, except for my fish that was covered in sauce
Property Name: Lynridge Assisted Living and Memory Care

review_text: We have had a great experience so far at Brookdale Lafayette. The facility is very clean and the staff is very helpful. The staff has taken care of my dad’s needs and have been very helpful in helping him make the transition to his new home. The administrative staff also helped me navigate the paperwork and made sure I was aware and understood all of our options.

reviewTitle: A large facility housing circa 160 re...
review_text: A large facility housing circa 160 residents.  New and professional.  A library, work out room, more developed occupational therapy programs were some of the many amenities it offered.  The staff offered to explore combining a treatment plan with blended higher cognitive function with a need for memory care.
Property Address: 13075 Evening Creek Dr S, San Diego, CA 92128

review_text: It costs a lot, but it's the best place for my dad. Nothing further

I would tell others to go for it.  The community was affordable for our loved one.  Everyone was following guidelines during the pandemic.  The property manager was nice and friendly.  She helped the residents with everything to feel accepted and was patient.  The knowledge of forms was important to us.
