reviewTitle: The Gardens of Virginia Beach review
review_text: All categories rate a score of 5. It's been a great relationship for sure with my Mom ultimately being the greatest benefactor. We would recommend this community to other families based on the experience we have had so far.

reviewTitle: Review of The Landing At Stone Oak
review_text:
The staff at The Landing has been a blessing. Their patience and understanding and most of all care for all who reside there is outstanding.
There have been confusing times with dementia and the staff is always able to handle the situation with skill and understanding. 
My biggest air hug and thank to keeping The Landing safe from Covid Virus.
It was a really friendly place

My father has been a resident at Barrington for 5 months ad he's received excellent attention and care by the staff.  [Name removed] was over Sales contracts and went above and beyond to welcome him into Barrington.  [Name removed], LPN is always aware of his changing health needs and he developed a sense of faith in her skills and judgement.  The caregivers take care of him as he is their family.
Property Address: 9731 Commerce Center Court, Fort Myers, FL 33908

review_text: Every interaction we have had at Amberleigh was positive, supportive and made my loved one feel at home. From the maintenance guy, to the receptionist, to the sales director - all extended themselves to make my loved one feel at home.

The main negative at the Jefferson is there isn't anyone here my age. All the residents are all older than me. I have a dog that is allowed to be with me that is medium sized. Most places only allow small dogs so I really appreciate that.  I have an apartment with an outside entrance and that was a big factor in me choosing this facility.
Property Name: Middleton Crossing, A Sky Active Living Community

review_text: I would highly recommend! We feel like our dad is in the best place he could be. He loves the food and he is taken care of very well. I have recommended it to a few others, as the need arises, and one referral actually ended up choosing it. Also several of my friends parents or relatives have been or are there now.
Dad is content and well cared for ... whew!

reviewTitle: Review of Majestic Gardens at Memphis
review_text: It is clean and far as I can see the care is good. The staff are friendly. They do not tell me how long is has to be there, though.

reviewTitle: Just moved in & I love it.!
review_text: Just moved in & I love it.!
Excellent facility, caregivers, food, etc.
Property Name: A Place Called Home Residential Care

reviewTitle: Great Place For Your Family Membrr
review_text: Brentwood is a clean facility.  The employees look after the residents pretty well.  They clean their room weekly.  My uncle does say when he pushes the button he wears he doesn’t feel they come to check on him very quickly.  However, overall he is happy there.

Overall, Parc Place has generally been a good experience. I think the space they allot for in their cottages is good, if not a bit small. We have a two bedroom, but are getting ready to move into a three. They also have 3 car garages here, which is almost unheard of in other communities. The staff is very helpful, and they do try. I feel they are overwhelmed however with the workload. They have a lot of activities here, and they have a great communication system so that we can always  know what is going on in the community. Overall, it has a good experience.
We did a tour and had a very nice lunch. Wold not work for us. Very nice place

I was familiar with this facility because a friend's mother had been there for many years earlier. I was not expecting to like it too much, and that held true. It would have been very close to me. They had updated it, although it certainly shows its age in some ways. It simply had a less vibrant feel, and I saw very few residents out and about.  There was a small group of women meeting in the dining room.  The age and the lack of kitchen was a negative there.   As well as no washer/dryer etc. it's an option if you had to spend less money, but was not desirable to me.
Property Address: 3113 Charles B. Root Wynd, Raleigh, NC 27612

review_text: I toured Merril Gardens prior to making a decision, and it was a nice place. The facility was in good shape and the people there were very friendly. It all came down to location, and also the food was not that great there.

reviewTitle: Review of Blueberry Hill Nursing & Rehabilitation Center
review_text: They're doing good. They're friendly. The nurses are good. His bedroom and bathroom are very clean. In the activity area, there is a smell sometimes. The meals are fine. Communication is good.
Property Name: Blueberry Hill Rehabilitation and Healthcare Center

reviewTitle: second experience even better than the first
review_text: I have had both my mother in law and now my own mother residing at the Cumberland and have been very pleased with the professionalism, friendliness and the services both times.  My mother in law was a resident in 2012 and my mother moved in just this year, it seems like things are improving every year.  This is RESIDENT centered care, not STAFF centered care, and it makes all the difference for the dignity of elderly residents.  The apartments are customizable, the common areas are clean and cheerful, the food is great in the dining room and we love the accommodations made by staff, particularly with residents who have pets.  This is a delightful community to be a part of!

my Alzheimer's mom is 65 and very active and although this place is clean and [Removed] seems very dedicated, I don't think my mom would be a good fit here. The house is huge, but the property is very small. When I asked about physical activities for my mom (she still mows her own lawn!) the owner seemed a bit confuzzled as to what to do with her. A wonderful tour though
Property Address: 24803 Broad Oak Trail, San Antonio, TX 78255

reviewTitle: If you've got to have help, this is it
review_text: Some peopel are really happy to be working with elders and for some it's just a job. I would say the majority though are glad to be there. My parents think the activities are kind of cheesy. They might be in their 80's, but they think they're kind of childish and sometimes they talk to them in these high voices which is understandable because they don't really know who they're talking to, but they think it's a little childish. My dad ended up moving in with my mom, which is fantastic. They totally have their minds and it's good, but they're more into conversations, not parties, especially kind of weird parties. When she first got their I went to some loud music thing, it was way too loud and she got kind of rattled. She kind of likes it quiet and adult like so when they throw a party it's not her thing. 3/4 of that place is independent living and 1/4 is enhanced care so that's what makes it do able. They actually have people around there that can have conversations. I told them I wouldn't put them in a place I wouldn't live in myself so they trusted me. I must have looked at 50 different places and this was as clsoe to home as they could get. When I saw this I was like, this is it, it was like a huge weight lifted off my shoulders.

My mother and father moved into Summit Hills into an independent apartment June of 2018. We had visited other senior communities and found Summit Hills to offer the best housing, social, and value for our money. My father was starting to show heavy signs of Alzheimer’s and the fact that is was a gated community made my mother and I feel more secure if he wondered outside alone. The community has beautiful interior design, constant activities and delicious dining fare. My family came to eat in the dining room many times. In February of 2020 we moved my father into the Memory Care unit there. It was hard to turn over a parent to people I did not know but he was too much for my mother to handle at 82 years old. I visited my dad many times a week and had wonderful walks around the campus. I got to know the caregivers and they my dad. After only six weeks of him being there, Corona-19 virus locked the care services building down to stop the spread. I was unable to see him until [date removed] when we could start window visits. The caregivers who brought him to see me shared wonderful moments they had with him that mad me smile. During this horrible time of lockdown, the caregivers gave more of themselves than ever, filling in as true family when we could not be together to hug or walk together. Seven weeks ago, my mother had a stroke and was taken to the hospital, unable to use her right side. We were able to have her some back to Summit Hills and use their Rehab services and stay in the Skilled Nursing area. It was so much easier for me to be able to check on their apartment, get mail, and visit with both parents at the same location. My father succumbed to his disease two weeks ago. Everyone I passed as I walked through the halls with my mother had a kind word about my dad. The staff has been so accommodating and thoughtful on our families’ needs during this time or mourning. I highly recommend Summit Hills to anyone looking into a retirement community that will serve them in all capacities no matter what stage they are at in life.

reviewTitle: Two elementary schools and a library ...
review_text: Two elementary schools and a library close. SR center 4 mi away. Can be on dining plan. Nice dining room. Long term ee's. 112 rooms. Lots of meeting rooms. Free transportation to Dr's. Many activities available. Can move in for one month to see how he likes it. Can start a literacy program with Pam. Post office close.

reviewTitle: Would not recommend the facility at this time. There is still too much turmoil there.
review_text: It became apparent very early that there was a large change over in staffing. It seemed that my mother had an aide that was new every few days.  The director and business manager and sales reps have changed in July and then again in September and one of the positions in January.  I received a call from a nursing director that was less than professional and when I went to meet her about a week later, she no longer worked there.  Aides actually told my mother she was calling for help too often and she was going to be charged for each call.
Property Name: The Residence at South Windsor Farms

review_text: I am grateful my grandma has Rosewood to call home. Never thought Grandma would accept anywhere else to be home, but it's so much like her actual home that she fit right in. Dementia can be a ugly disease, robbing memories. Since Grandma has been at Rosewood we've been able to get back to quality family time. There's always, things to do, holiday parties, the smell of a home cooked meal and a smile on Grandma's face.  No longer being the caregivers put us back in good graces. The caregivers here love her like their own family. Also, the organization of Dr appointments, medicine, and communication behind the scenes from the staff makes us confident that no matter the challenges we face during the aging process, we are prepared. Thank you so much for all you do!

reviewTitle: A great new home for us.
review_text: We are both very happy that we have moved into this community. The care and staff are outstanding. The meals are excellent and a good variety to choose from. Alot of activities are offered for us to stay active. We would recommend this for other families.

We went on a tour at this community and it was nice and clean. The staff was friendly and answered all of my questions. It is fantastic here. We wanted to be a little closer to him but we may have to just drive a little further for good care. I like the fact that they are a non profit organization.

There is not enough staff to care for the residents at this community.  The community is beautiful and they keep it well taken care of.  They do offer a lockdown area for memory care.  They offer a lot of activities.  The care is not the best for the cost.  I would not recommend this community.

The rooms are very nice and large enough to have furniture that feels familiar to the patient.  The staff is great and the food is good. They have activities for them to do and church services for them. She still asks when she is going home but not like she did in the previous facility.

We chose Atria Maplewood Place because it was close to where his house is so he is familiar with the area and he would be more comfortable there. The apartment sizes are on the smaller side, he has a studio and we are looking to maybe upgrade. They do always have activities going on for the residents. The staff members here are all very nice. I would recommend to others looking.

Thank you for taking care of my husband and showing him so much! It always meant the world to  me when I visited and saw each of you talking to him and other residents, hugging them and joking with all of them. I love you all and I'm grateful he had such a special connection with all of you.

reviewTitle: Review of Franklin Park Tpc Parkway
review_text: Very nice, friendly independent community. Staff is great. Good leadership.

Victory Centre was clean and bright, which is a plus. Megan was very informative and gave us a detailed tour. They offer a lot of activities everyday.  The only downside is they only offer studio apts.
Property Address: 4150 W. Gatling Blvd., Country Club Hills, IL 60478

review_text: Heron House was very clean. They did a great job at keeping their residents safe during the pandemic. We chose this facility in the beginning based on the location and a recommendation from a friend who had a good experience here. One issue we had with Heron House was that they are limited with their care, they were only able to provide a fixed level of care. When he needed more, he would have to move out of the facility which caused issues.

We went with Brookdale Bath because when I interviewed them I liked the staff, they were willing to transfer her out of a memory care if she got better. They got to the hospital quickly to do her assessment which was very nice as well.  They do have some resident cats and my mother in law loves cats. The location is great for us. They lost their chef and they have just hired a new one. They admitted that the chef was not very good and we liked that they were transparent about it. I do think they could use some updates on the rooms, but the one she had was great. They have board meetings with the residents every month to discuss likes and dislikes of the facility. Every Friday they have a cocktail hour, their variety of activities are great. I would definitely recommend and already have.
Property Address: 101 North Cleveland Massillon Road, Akron, OH 44333

reviewTitle: Nice and new, but not enough help.
review_text: It was a newer place and it looks nice, but they don't have enough help. Especially in the memory care area. The person that shaved him, didn't shave him well. They were nice to talk to, but there just wasn't enough of them, and they aren't paid very well. I did like that they put some odor guard on the lights in the bathroom where the residents couldn't reach, but it really helped to combat the odors.

2 1/2 years ago after visiting many Assisted Living Facilities, I decided on choosing yours.  I am still happy with that decision.  I never have to worry about the level of care received & always appreciate the added attention.  My loved one is so happy living there in his beautiful apartment and always talks about the amazing meals!
Property Address: 51 Great Neck Road, Great Neck, NY 11021

review_text: My mother was only under their care for four days. She ended up bruised and received substandard care. They claimed that they didn't trim nails (demanded that I do it), her tooth brush wasn't unpacked, her laundry wasn't done, she was only given water to drink( no other options), the foods she was offered were not finger foods (even though I told them that was the only type she was capable of eating), the intake person told me they would have no problem with the type of dementia she had but the director told me she should never have been excepted. To say that I am not happy is an understatement.
Property Address: 12903 E Mission Ave, Spokane Valley, WA 99216

review_text: I like the way you take care of my husband.[Removed] ,our caregiver was so good to him at his birthday party.we really like [Removed].Everyone does!.He has a great personality and always smiles.
Property Address: 15333 N Pima Rd, STE 305, Scottsdale, AZ 85260

review_text:
Im a resident here at Hearthstone, I love the care I get from the caregivers they are very nice to everyone here, they cooked home made meals, are clean, the are wonderful people that CARE!
I really enjoy the music shows here!!! we do activities and have a therapy dog that visit

reviewTitle: My Loved One Is Doing Very Well At Serene Suites
review_text:
This is a clean, attractive community, and the staff are very personable.  They get to know the residents well.  The staff communication with the family is good, and the owner is very open to answer our questions directly.

There are three meals a day served to the residents.  My loved one enjoys the food offered.  Art therapy, trivia, music, and more are some of the activities available for the residents to participate in.
Property Name: Serene Suites Premier Memory Care and Assisted Living

reviewTitle: Just a smile or a good morning makes a difference on anybody's lives. Show them you really care!
review_text: This could be a nice facility to place your loved one or a place to work at, although lacks in prompt efficient care and employee appreciation. Most of the residents need medium to high level of care and there's too many other tasks assigned for completion to each of the two caregivers and the one med tech on each day shift, practically impossible to complete. Being understaffed is definitely not gonna make it happen besides staff don't get much support from immediate supervisors (nurses) and are overloaded with and held accountable for responsibilities nurses should be completing themselves along with A.L. director. Not to mention them, being part of the gossip as well as the Executive Director. They listen, believe and hold involved staff responsible, of not proven events or accusations, with either a write up or by letting them go without opening an investigation and actually obtain prove that such event really occur. Humiliate staff walking them out the door after fired as if they were a thief. Making the ones who have served and been part of their family feel worthless feeling no regret for it which is even worst. Management sucks, they need to prioritize in what is supposed to be most important their "RESIDENTS" not "GOSSIP"

reviewTitle: Overall above average facility. Improved training & staff retention would likely make this a great senior facility.
review_text: Above average facility overall.  Good to have memory care and assisted living under one roof.  Staff turnover is very high. Night shift staff in memory care is sub contract staff with little training.   Assisted living staff are employees and much better trained.  Very friendly staff.  Everyone makes a point of getting to know residents by name.
Property Address: 1190 Old McHenry Rd, Long Grove, IL 60047

reviewTitle: Choosing the right place for my loved one
review_text: My husband needed memory care placement from hospitalization.  I was referred to multiple facilities, when I visited Park Senior Villas, it was different experience, it felt like will give us and my husband  the  home feeling not a strange place. The managers assessed him for his needs; were involved,  spent the time with us as family as well  as with him.  The facility system was explained to me in details, all my questions and concerns were addressed. They worked so hard to accommodate his needs, they learned about his hobbies and even ordered table tennis for him to keep him active as part of his therapy! The staff is compassionate, pleasant and caring. As memory care resident who needs lots of care and attention to settle, the facility managers and staff made every effort to make sure to work with my husband to reach that point. I am blessed with this place.
Property Address: 6899 N La Canada DR, Tucson, AZ 85704

review_text: My loved one is currently a resident at The Lighthouse and everything has been great for her at this facility so far. We are very pleased with the establishment and all aspects of our experience with them. We would recommend The Lighthouse to others.

reviewTitle: Great place - full continuum of care....
review_text: Great place - full continuum of care.   The apartments were nice, assisted living very nice.  Memory care was good and the day programs were great.  This would be my choice if they moved.

We chose Kamlu Retirement because it is a very homey, smaller facility. The people are so friendly and everybody is really nice. It is very centrally located, not far from the hospital and it just close to everything you need. They have a bus that you can sign up for rides to stores or doctors appointments. The apartment sizes are reasonable for a studio, they do have other options as well on sizes. It is a lovely place and my mom is very happy here. I would recommend to others.

I found the staff unfriendly, the application process is slanted toward women only, discrimination is stated openly, I wouldn’t let my dog live there , Anyone not a single woman , they will find a way to deny your application
Property Address: 1609 Great Falls St, Mc Lean, VA 22101

reviewTitle: No interaction between independent and assisted floors
review_text: She just stayed in her room, we had a contract for one year so I had to wait it out before I could move her. They have an assisted living floor but we didn't feel that it was what we were looking for. We wanted her to be involved and to be a part of thing, here she would have been involved with just that floor but no one else. You have to make the choice to be with other people and she didn't want to be with other people unless she was with me and I had no way of making myself more available. The choice over here was to have an aid that would be the person to administer the drugs and I wasn't about to pay a big stipend to someone that was just going to have someone give her medicine.
Very polite really welcomed my mom then started getting calls about my mom and her needs I thought they were going to take of this I was wrong, disappointed.
Property Name: Paintbrush Assisted Living and Memory Support

reviewTitle: Past resident and glad I moved!
review_text: After living at Dunwoody Pines for two years, I would not recommend it to anyone. The turnover in dining room staff is terrible and under staffed.  They have a few good wait staff who have been there a long time, but most of them are new and not well trained. The food is cold, vegetables are undercooked, rolls can be used as hockey pucks and you are lucky to get a roll before your main meal is over. Desert is either served while you are eating your meal or you are sitting for 15 minutes waiting for it. The dining room manager has no idea on how to run a dining room. He should have never been placed in that position. He has no personality and barely grunts at you.  What a terrible place!!!

A very nice place to be.  Staff are friendly and courteous, nurses are always available.  There is always an activity happening and daily rosary is a plus!  Place is very clean and homey.  Would recommend.

We chose River Oaks because my brother is a Korean war vet and they had a lot of vets here, it seemed to be a smaller facility, and the people that we met with were very friendly and helpful. The staff members really seem to care about their residents and they seem to be very on top of things. It has been a good experience so far and I know that everyone here is trying their best in these hard times. I would recommend to others looking.
Beautiful facility. Tenants seemed happy and I like that they were called by name so it was personal interaction.  Very informative. Enjoyable visit!
Property Name: St Louis Hills Assisted Living and Memory Care

reviewTitle: Not an assisted living for Mom
review_text: This community presents very well when you first walk into the community.  My sister and I were looking for a community for our Mom.  We wanted to see both the assisted living and memory living.  We set an appointment ahead of time and when we got there on a weekday in the middle of the afternoon, no body was available to tour us.  Waited for 45 minutes until the Executive Director who didn't seem happy that she had to tour us, toured us.  She was in a rush during our tour, we asked about seeing the memory living and the Executive Director said that we need an advance appointment before they let us see that part of the community.  (Which we had, and express that to the Executive Director).  Which didn't make any sense, we also notice that a lot of nursing staff around the station on their cell phones and cursing during our tour.  Executive Director addressed this with the nursing staff, but when we left the nursing station and looked back at the station, 2 of the nurses were giving the Executive Director the middle finger.  If that is how they act towards their boss, I can't image what they would do with my Mom in this community.  Also, their prices were really high, the Executive Director asked if we had a long term care policy and that policy would cover the cost.  That didn't make sense of why the prices were so high, plus the attitude of the nursing staff, we are going to be looking for another community.

We had been looking for a place for our dad for close to a year as he wasn’t ready to leave his home. I had spoken with The Woods at Holly Tree and they invited us in to tour and have lunch with dad.... We had truly lost hope in dad moving because he didn’t want to leave his home but we knew it was the best thing.... My dad fell in love with the place and after hearing all positive things about this community we were able to confirm it firsthand.... My dad felt right at home and had it not been for this community our dad would still be at home and not living his full potential life around others. Thanks to everyone at the community

reviewTitle: Would recommend community for Independent living
review_text: RIght now because of COVID-19 there have not been any activities. The rooms at Nora Commons would be about a four out of five. I would recommend this community to a family or friend for independent living.

Mom loves living at Brookdale. The staff are attentive and she is getting as much assistance as she needs. The food is not bad, however they do overcook the vegetables. The community is clean and well taken care of.  I would recommend this community.

reviewTitle: Flexible and Adaptive, Works Well with the Residents, and Understanding of Residents
review_text:
It is a new community.  It is a great smaller community.  My loved ones have access to anything they want, and have independence if needed.  

Due to the pandemic the food has been delivered to the resident's rooms.  There can be a lack of variety.  A great assisted living community that is flexible with us allowing us to help the transition of our loved ones.

reviewTitle: My Tour Experience at Woodland Heights
review_text: This was a nice community, it was more expensive then we wanted.
My loved one used services through Trinity Care and it was a good experience. They took really good care of her.

We toured this location when we were looking into care options for a loved one. I really liked what I saw here, it was my favorite location that we toured. However, it was much more expensive than many of the places we looked at. It was a very nice looking place, and the staff were all very friendly and helpful.
I liked the restaurant style dining service, the food looked very good.
One concern was that since it was a mutliple story facility, and on the larger side, it may have been difficult for my loved one to navigate.

This is a return visit, and it's going quite well. I was very happy with it and I had good feeling from being there the first time and now we've come back. I think that's a testament to my faith and confidence in Buckingham.

reviewTitle: A place that feels like home
review_text: Traditions at Solana is a wonderful, family-oriented care facility. I love that the staff know their residents by name and always say hello. I've driven on Keystone so many times but never knew Traditions was back there because it's so private and serene. The water views are beautiful and the rooms are nice. This is a great facility and I would recommend it to families looking for a place for their loved one.
Mom moved here earlier this year & the place is great, close to family, lots of amenities to pick from.THANK You to [Removed] of APFM and the staff at Independence Hill. Marvelous

The overall appearance of the community is great, every time we come to visit the place is always nice, clean, tidy and the food is good. They could work better on their communication consistency and their correspondence with the families. During the tour the communication was great, but once our loved ones moved in it really seemed to decline.

reviewTitle: Review of Rehabilitation and Nursing Center of the Rockies
review_text: My father was getting some rehab therapy and it is excellent. The staff friendliness is awesome. Lately, they have had traveling nurses come in and I am not impressed. Overall, the place is very clean but there times it is not clean. There are times the floors have not been cleaned. They call me any time of day.
Property Name: Rehabilitation & Nursing Center of the Rockies

review_text: I was so nervous to move my Aunt into the community but I was relieved when the staff was so welcoming and excited to get to know her better. In the few weeks she has been there, it is the happiest I have seen her in years. She is absolutely thriving and has enjoyed being a part of the community. She is making new friends and trying new things all the time. We are so grateful for Sunrise!

My experience with Beavetdale Estates has was nice. The facility is nice, the managers are good, food is excellent. They have a really nice dining area that I was very impressed with. The staff was very caring. Overall I'm satisfied with their services.

It is a beautiful building and very clean. One of my loved one's main concerns has been the time it takes to receive care. It seems as though the facility is understaffed therefore it takes longer than it should. In the beginning, it was a little rough. However the facility seems to have addressed his concerns and the meals have smoothed out for him at the facility. Getting answers can be tough at times. When I speak with him he mentions feeling in the dark about his care and updates. The nurse has reached out to me with updates which is nice, however this also seems to be a big complaint from the patient's perspective.
Loved this place.  So warm and welcoming.  Anne Zbinden was so very helpful.  Unfortunately this was just not going to be a good fit for my Dad.  We were sad..Check this place out.
Property Address: 855 E Basse Rd, San Antonio, TX 78209

review_text: I have been here 10 months.  The residents are very friendly and so is the staff,  The activities are varied, such as Bingo, card games, Wii bowling, hangman, etc.  Outside trips are to Krogers and Meijers, doctor appointments, MGM Grand casino.  The food is fair and the waitstaff very helpful.

reviewTitle: My review of The Colonnade at Northdale
review_text: The place was good but it was overpriced, and the rooms were pretty small and they were shared rooms.

I like the therapists. They're all very good. Some of the staff are excellent. The day staff is very good. Night is not as good, but has gotten better. I have spoken to them about it. They are very receptive to it. I like the therapy. Some staff are not friendly and don't smile. They need to just smile a little bit! They need to at least pretend like they're happy. They could do better with cleanliness. There's things that I've seen where they miss the garbage and don't even pick it up. The meals look decent. They are presented nicely. My loved one has many options. I would recommend the facility if the nighttime got a little better. Also, the parking is terrible. I can't find a spot.

Our dad recently moved to Belmont Village and so far everything has been great! [name removed], [name removed], [name removed], and the entire staff were extremely helpful during what is inevitably a stressful transition process. The community of people is lovely, and they have a great sports lounge on the top floor where my brother and I watched the Bears game with our dad yesterday, along with a bunch of other residents. I feel very fortunate that my dad lives in a place like this.

My  dad was excited when moved into Oasis..since moving in.....he has been over-medicated....missing articles of clothing from laundry service. New management advised changing the medicine dstribution to only deliverying to resident with no change in the rental amount.

Overall a great  place..in spite of the shortcomings.
.
Property Address: 134 John Hope Dr SW, Atlanta, GA 30314

reviewTitle: Great experience at Broadway Mesa Village
review_text:
5 on all categories. We had a great experience there. Especially [name removed] (sales) and [name removed] (cna). They treated my mom like a friend and went above and beyond.

The facility was recently remodeled so had very updated styles. It was very clean. Everyone that worked there was very caring. The food was excellent and cafeteria staff was patient and attentive.

My mother-in-law has been at Middlewoods of Newington for 3 years.  She entered at age 95 and is still going strong at 98!  The care and quality of life at Middlewoods of Newington is second to none!   All her needs are met and exceeded at this facility.  Her studio apartment is cute and homey, the meals are excellent and there is something going on all the time!  The staff is high quality and cannot do enough for the residents and their families.  She is safe, mentally stimulated and very happy here.  My wife and I  have tremendous peace of mind and enjoy our visits with her and the other residents here.  We would highly recommend Middlewoods of Newington for your loved one's assisted care.
Nice place to live. A full service community for my mom.

reviewTitle: Good, friendly place where it does not feel like a "hotel type" situation.  I especially like the openness of the lobby area.
review_text: My friend, Garvin [removed], does not hear well and I wish there was a way to help him make friends with the group.  The staff is excellent!  The food is good and I am happy that I know the staff is "Looking after" him.

The staff is knowledgeable and friendly with a excellent staff to resident ratio. The facility is kept clean and the rooms are very nice. I had visited  several other facilities and colonial gardens was the best of them all.
Least attractive location on a busy street.  Fully vaccinated staff who were friendly and open. Best combination of price and room layout.

The community was nice to see. We had dinner with our friend and she loved the experience. They were very nice to us. My friend noticed many residents used walkers. She was not ready to move in but I would live here and it is a very nice community.

Overall our experience with Sunrise of Gahanna has been a good one. It's a nice looking, well kept, clean community, and the place has a very comfortable homey feel! The staff is friendly and caring, and they were a big help to us throughout the whole move-in process. Everyone here is very friendly, and they've even got a very sweet resident dog and cat. My only issue is that I feel they could have done a bit better job helping us through their medication program in the beginning. We eventually got it worked out, but it was a little confusing.
Very nice and cozy.  Great location with large park right across the street.

People in wheelchairs should not be on the 2nd floor.  Especially

when only 2 chairs will fit in elevator.  And flyer posted to stay in your room

in case theirs a fire and staff will get to you.  This place changes the rules consistently.  The conduct of the staff r not qualified nor professional.
The director has some drinking issues besides being on a power trip.  
i would not send my worse enemy to Sherwood village
check out fellowship square night and day difference.
Property Name: Sherwood Village Assisted Living and Memory Care
Property Address: 102 S Sherwood Village Dr, Tucson, AZ 85710

review_text: This community was very nice the only problem I had is that my loved one did not want to move here and wanted to stay in the state that she was in. Other than that I would for sure have considered this community for my loved one.
Property Address: 3501 Hancock Bridge Pkwy, Fort Myers, FL 33903

review_text: We had our loved one in the memory care section of the Sunrise of Richmond, and overall I think they did an excellent job with the care. The facility was ideally suited for taking care of a dementia patient. They had a good staff to resident ratio, so everyone got plenty of attention and was watched over carefully. They had a very secure and safe building, and wandering never became an issue.

Having had spent a lot of time with my parent at this facility in their memory care while locating a better facility for her, I saw a lot of neglect.  Residents are not looked after, cared for or treated with the kind of respect they inform you they will.   The small staff they have are clearly not trained to handle the special nature of an Alzheimer/Dementia patient.  Don't believe the sales tactics they use ... they are NOT an all level care facility for Alzheimer's.   Barely a level 1 facility.  There are better facilities that you can trust and have comfort that your loved one is being taken care of properly ... Atria is NOT IT!

It is going much better for my friend since moving into this home. We have to never worry about a caregiver being there. One is always available in the home. They are very professional and they do all that I request and call me back and keep me updated. The meals, activities, and cleanliness has been suitable for me.

Since July 2015 I have made my home with my husband at Sunrise of Rockville.  My husband is a wheelchair bound stroke victim, who requires assistance with toiletry and bathing.  The reason why I chose to live in this facility was because of the kindness of Clinton Thomas, the executive director, and his very friendly staff.  It has been nine months now since we moved here from another senior home and we have never regretted our decision.  This place is homelike with good healthy meals and caring staff who always try their very best to help me care for my husband.  I highly recommend Sunrise of Rockville for anyone who is seeking care for family members!

On [date removed]  My wife and I were given the seemingly impossible task of finding a place for dad. We were lost at sea!
[name removed] became our guiding light and heroically stepped up and showed us how well this wonderful place could help us and Dad. He explained everything and showed us around.
This great representative [name removed] made a hard decision easy for us and dad. Thank you.

[Name removed], the Family Ambassador, really made me feel like she was concerned about my mother's well-being as well as my father's. I like concept of roommate-pairing & meaningful activity. Nurses are on duty 24/7. The cost is higher than the other memory care community that we saw. They don't take "Family Care" when the money runs out. That would mean moving him again.

reviewTitle: Review of Synergy Homecare of Minneapolis - Golden Valley, MN
review_text: I would highly recommend Synergy Homecare. The caregivers are very professional.

I don't have anything to compare it to, but I think it's a five. My Mother-in-law is doing really well there. They do offer quite a bit of activities, she goes to the ones she wants to, like the wine and cheese party. She is loving the food and gaining weight.

reviewTitle: I was very impressed with this place...
review_text: I was very impressed with this place, especially with the fact they specialize in memory care. I like the fact that they are willing to have her come in for a few hours just to see if she gets adjusted and it would be complimentary. Also the fact they do day care and weekends and for respite care they can accommodate them anywhere from one week to a month. I wasn't able to watch any activities because they were having lunch at the time.

reviewTitle: Very good discussion and tour. Facili...
review_text: Very good discussion and tour. Facility appears very warnm and comfortable. Within the financial range. Requested a second tour. Only concern, not equipped to handle bed ridden patients.

So far our experience with Emeritus at Edgewood has been a great one. The staff are all very friendly and professional, and I've been very impressed by the degree of communication they keep with the families of the residents. I was impressed how the woman who gave us our tour stopped and greeted each of the residents by name. Our loved one had to go to the hospital at one point, and they handled everything exceedingly well, they kept us completely in the loop and everything went very smoothly. They also provide excellent physical therapy here, we've had quite a bit of experience with various physical therapy services, and they are near the top of the list.

Care from medical staff is excellent, as is their communication with family and doctors.   Staff is friendly, pricing structure is complex but in line with other local facilities.  I would have given them a 5, but they just announced a $250/day extra charge if resident must be quarantined or isolated for Covid.  That  is more than 100% of regular charges and in my opinion is not defensible

We chose Harmony because of the location of the facility and it was newer than some of the others that we narrowed it down to. She also was able to get an apartment on the first floor. The apartment sizes are perfect size for what she needs, she loves it. She is not thrilled about the food, she said it tastes like they use the similar seasoning in every meat so it tastes the same. The staff is very accommodating and they go out of their way to get to know her and make sure she is doing ok. They check in on her and call me which is very nice. I would recommend to others looking and already have.
The tour was great and the facility was beautiful.
Property Address: 3663 Park Center Blvd, Saint Louis Park, MN 55416

review_text: I was at this community for a respite stay, and it went very well. I really enjoyed my time here. if needed I would return. The community looks nice and clean. Everything was clean and well maintained. The staff was friendly and very helpful. They do have a nice selection of activities available for the residents. The meals were decent. It was a very nice experience, and I would recommend this community.

Since I live in Kansas I've only experienced this through my cousin except for annual trips to visit her.  She certified seems happy with the place and hasn't complained to me about anything except for one or two tenants who can be difficult at times, she just stays away from them,
Property Address: 13840 N Desert Harbor Dr, Peoria, AZ 85381

reviewTitle: Of the places I have visited, this wo...
review_text: Of the places I have visited, this would be my preferred. Dining arrangements great. Residences seemed happy. Well taken care of. Many activities available.
This is the best place to be if you need any  assistance to survive on your own. Best staff, food, and accommodation. I would highly recommended to everyone.

Royalton Place is the perfect location and level of care for my Mom. My only complaint is that they will not do their job if she refuses assistance. She often refuses to have her room cleaned forcing ME to clean it. Mom does not understand the process and they listen to her! I have asked them to wait until she goes to lunch and then just do it. I think this is more a function of the specific housekeeper than the Royalton's policy. 

The food is amazing. Mom is eating properly for the first time in years! I am quite happy, overall, with the care she receives.
The staff here are great. Very nice, and helpful. The therapists also work very hard to help you in rehab.

I has the experience of working with this company and it was a pleasant experience. The owner is very caring and compassion she will listen to any problems and address them as soon as they arrive. I would recommend this company to anyone. If you have a loved one that needs home care, Olivia's Angels Home Care is the right choice.
Property Address: 1329 E Kemper Road, Suite 4218B, Cincinnati, OH 45241

reviewTitle: me and my husband love it here
review_text:
I want to say a few words Spring Hills makes you feel very special, and they make you feel like "we are family". When someone makes you feel this way why would you be happy?
I believe I always need assistance, and every time I ask [name removed], he's there to assist and handle my concerns.

I cannot begin to tell you how wonderful Arden of Cherry Hill is.  I was in a really bad place with my husband. He was having behavior problems from his disease and was getting hard to manage.  I met with [name removed] and [name removed] and they helped me not just find a place that would care for my husband but they taught me to be his wife and not his caregiver.  We danced at activities went out to Olive Garden for lunch with others. They have a family support group that gets it. I have made friends. I miss my husband as he was but I have found that when(as I was taught by Linda)  “I meet him where he is at.  We can still have a wonderful time in spite of this horrid disease.  The staff and the place are wonderful. I don’t know where we would be without Arden Courts!!!
Property Name: Arden Courts A ProMedica Memory Care Community in Cherry Hill
Property Address: 2700 Chapel Ave W, Cherry Hill, NJ 08002

review_text: This place is absolutely fabulous. I'd rate them higher than 5 on every category if I could! I can't believe we didn't try moving someplace like this years ago, it's been wonderful so far! Everyone here is so nice, and they're always willing to help or answer any questions you might have. It's a brand new facility, but they are filling up fast!

We chose Brookdale Mandarin at the time because it was the only place that had a kitchen and I thought that would make the transition easier. Everyone has been very nice and their apartment is great. We have had some issues with communication from the nursing staff. I find I do not get responses very quickly which is hard because I live out of state . I know they are trying their hardest in this difficult situation.
Property Address: 10790 Old Saint Augustine Road, Jacksonville, FL 32257

review_text: Very nice residence.  Bright, nice gardens.  Met with Pia.  Informative, friendly  $4500 P, $3500 semi-private

FOOD IS TERRIBLE,TRY PUTTING SOME GRAVY ON THE MASHED POTATOES. NO CONDIMENTS, WATER IS THEIR DRINK. YOU DO NOT HAVE A CHOICE OF HAMBURGER OR HOT DOG, HAMBURGER IS TOO EXPENSIVE. HOW ABOUT SOME SOFT BUTTER. FOOD IS CORPORATE RUN SWILL. TODAY THEY SERVED, AT LEAST A WEEK OLD PULLED CHIKEN. DRY AND STRINGY, CHOAKABLE. THESE ARE HUMAN BEINGS, TRY MAKING THEIR MEALS EDIBLE.

reviewTitle: Review of Mission Palms Of Mesa
review_text: There are some really good nurses there, but they seem to be a little slow on passing the orders down from one nurse to another. The therapists don't have my loved one put any effort into her rehab. They do not spend time with her to get her to work harder.
The food is hit or miss.   My husband enjoys the activities.  He has blended well with the community members.
Property Address: 2700 Rice Creek Road, New Brighton, MN 55112

review_text: The staff is very helpful, friendly, and cooperative.  Also the fining room help is overly helpful.  there is also laughing and conversation-[name removed] is especially nice and friendly.  [Name removed] goes out of her to introduce prospective residents.  Game time is always happy and encouraging.
We really like the location of Northridge Gracious Retirement Living.

My mother is doing good in the community. They offer activities. The food is really fresh. When we aren't able to take my mom to appointments the community does afterwards they take her out to eat. It is a highly recommended community its clean and up-kept.

I toward many buildings, but when I met [name removed], I felt right at home. My father really enjoys Commonwealth the staff take great care of him. Really, that’s all anyone could ask for! The food is really good the activities that he participates and he seems to really enjoy the trips they take are his favorite
Property Name: Commonwealth Senior Living at Willow Grove

review_text: Very nice facility. Didn't have ability to care for dementia or alzheimer patients (except for additional cost).
around $5500 per month

reviewTitle: Review of Colonial Oaks Living Center
review_text: We came because we thought this was the best facility. The nurses are nice. The meals seem fine.

They do a pretty good job. There has been a few issues with follow up after two incidents my loved one had. She had trouble with one of the nurses, and it has been taken care of. She is a little stronger. She is looking healthier. The nurses are all great. The staff are all good. I am very impressed with the cleanliness. Every time we go there, they are always cleaning. She is eating better. They always call me with what ever happens.
Property Address: 1500 W Warm Springs Rd, Henderson, NV 89014

review_text: I think that I would recommend Bella Vista to others. My mom's biggest complaints are about the food and how long they have to sit for the meals, but she does like all of the activities that they have for the residents.

My mother is able to be more active at Mount Bachelor than at her previous facility.  The staff has learned several strategies for getting her to cooperate and choose to focus their efforts on keeping her safe and clean.

reviewTitle: Review of Pacifica Senior Living Victoria Court - Cranston, RI
review_text: This Facility tries Hard to please all residents. It does an admirable job in succeeding. They started an exercise/Brain project while it seems to be working, however they have to extend it to at least 4 days a week. The food is good most of the time. They switch dinner and lunch which I do not like at all!

The environment is lovey. They have a nice mix of residents, they have a good number of men. They do a good job. My mom likes it. Things have declined since COVID, The residents have been pretty isolated. The food is not the best.

Everyone at Aegis have been very caring and helpful in getting my mom into memory care assisted living. She has improved tremendously and our family is happy that she has activities and help that we couldn’t provide.
Property Address: 9100 W Desert Inn Rd, Las Vegas, NV 89117

review_text: We had a pleasant tour of this community. It was good experience. Everything looked great and very clean. Everybody was kind and helpful. My tour went very well.
Food is ok. Had fun at Viking's Party.
Property Name: The Harbors Senior Living of Fridley

review_text:
Nice facility (some updates in the dining room would be nice...tables linens pretty tattered, damage to walls visible). There was mentioned possibility of a possible refurbishment later this year...I hope so!

The wait staff in dining room don't seem happy about their jobs and often terse/borderline rude to residents/customers.  Food adequate but not stellar.  Rest of staff (receptionist, coordinators, all very pleasant).

Our tour contact (Removed) was wonderful and very nice and took her time with my mom and I.  Appreciate that they talked to my mom directly to get a handle on what was important to her in a facility.  Rest of facility/amenities and rooms seem nice.  Impressed that people seem social there (ice cream social very popular!).  Good turnout for one of the exercise classes.  Good systems in place for safety, etc.. Also appreciate that both IL and AL available there.

Our thanks to [Removed]...she was great and we will keep her posted on our decision.

Everyone at Harvard Square has gone out of their way to welcome my mother. She has been there for 2 months and has settled in very well. The kitchen staff does a great job with the menu. I’ve eaten with her several times and we have both enjoyed our meals. Mom is on the Assisted Living floor and is checked on a few times a day. I really appreciate the attention she receives!!

reviewTitle: A great place for your loved one.
review_text: Wexford Place is a wonderful and caring facility for seniors. It is attractive and clean. The staff cares about residents, and treats them with respect. We moved my Mother-In-Law there about two years ago, and are very satisfied and pleased with the decision. This is the right place for her. Her health and outlook have improved significantly!
Property Address: 6500 North Cosby Avenue, Kansas City, MO 64151

review_text: Things are going pretty well in the community. My mother  likes her meals they have great taste. The portions of the meals are good. The staff communicate very well with my mother and i. I feel that housekeeping does a great job maintaining everything clean and organized. Activities are offered are on site and off site.

[Removed] is an older community and could use some updates, but they do a very good job keeping it cleaned and well-maintained. The food always looks good, they definitely have a lot of activities there, the staff is always helpful, I think the prices are good, and I like that there is a lot of access to transportation so my loved one can get to appointments easily.
Run away from this place please.
I love Parkway Place and all of the things we get to do here.  The workers treat us like family.

I met Delilah and she showed me some rooms that were nice sized and bathrooms were nearby with showers ready with equipment and space for assisting the resident.  The common space was roomy and pleasant with room for wheelchairs and walkers to move easily about.  The home has a nice covered patio and grassy area out back for everyone's enjoyment.  Individual notebooks and medication bins are kept for each patient. Residents are welcome to help with some meal preparations if they want to and everyone eats together in a community setting.  The home felt homey and pleasant.

reviewTitle: Relieved knowing mom is happy and safe at CareOne Hamilton
review_text: We are so pleased with CareOne Hamilton and the difference it has made in our mom’s life. From the moment she moved in, the caring and experienced staff made her feel welcome and secure. Her happiness is evident, and it’s a huge relief for us to know she is in such good hands. The warm reception from the staff and fellow residents has been wonderful; they embraced her and helped her settle in right away. Mom has formed meaningful friendships and enjoys the sense of community that CareOne Hamilton fosters. The combination of attentive care and a supportive environment has made this transition smooth and reassuring for our family. We couldn’t be happier with her new home.
Property Address: 1660 Whitehorse - Hamilton Square Road, Hamilton, NJ 08690

review_text: I would like to take this opportunity to commend Fairmount ownership, management and personnel for the kind and loving care provided to a dear friend during his residency over the past 2+ years.  Each resident is treated with respect and dignity in this family-like environment.  I would heartily encourage those in need of this level of care to consider Fairmount Assisted Living.

Clean, homey, warm and friendly. Perfect choice for my mom. She will love the small home setting, the personal care, the gardens. You can see that [Removed] takes great care to see to the resident's needs.

reviewTitle: I was not able to have any ...
review_text: I was not able to have any appointments on Thurs the 10th.  I was told the appointment was for Wed at 3:30.  My sister and I made the Wed appointment and Bernie was very gracious and was able to meet with us even though the appointment date & time were altered.  We are very impressed with Anam and their approach in working with Alzheimer's residents.
Very friendly. Good staff. I like my spacious apartment.

The staff here did a very nice job showing us around, they took their time and they answered all our questions.  The community was very nice, clean and they realized that my mom was upset and they tried to make her feel comfortable, and I felt that this was just not going to be a good fit for my mom.

Life Plans provider Pathway gave us names of several agencies. When we called Options, the conversation  with the manager made us go with them. The caregiver was very polite, a good listener and patient.
Property Address: 2110 Powers Ferry Rd NE #306, Atlanta, GA 30339

review_text: This is a purpose built community that was built for assisted living. The community runs like clock work, they have a routine and you know what to expect. We wish money was not an issue because we would have loved to stay here, but it was just out of our budget. It is a very good community that we would recommend to anyone that could fit it into their budget.

reviewTitle: Review of Colonial Oaks Living Center
review_text: The staff has a nice attitude towards helping my wife. The physical therapy could be a bit more rigorous. She has dietary restriction and has been in an out of the hospital, and they have been very helpful and cater towards her dietary needs. I get calls and they are really good with keeping me informed.
Facility had everything I requested.

We chose Constant Care because the house itself was beautiful and small, there were only like 5 residents there. It is also by the VA so it is a good location for veterans. The minute our loved one got dropped off they bathed him, cleaned him up, shaved him and he was very comfortable. They take great care of their residents, I would rate the quality of care much higher if I could. I would highly recommend them to others looking.

reviewTitle: Atria Westchase is an excellent choice
review_text: Atria is an excellent place to entrust your loved one. Their staff are well trained and most have been there a very long time which attests to the quality of the management. They are diligent about every detail of care. They work hard to create a family atmosphere and get residents engaged in activities. We moved mom to Atria after a bad experience at another facility. Atria went out of their way to make moms transition as easy as possible and gave her extra attention the first few weeks to ensure she learned her way around. I highly recommend Atria Westchase and am thankful for the peace of mind their care has given us.

From the moment I walked into Revere Court I had a good feeling, I saw several residents in the lobby playing bingo and a memory game.  When [name removed] (who has been wonderful) gave us a tour she explained how every hall in the facility has been decorated with a different theme to make it easy to remember.   Most important my dad has is happy, I can FaceTime him though a "portal" they bring to his room so he lets me know that he is treated well and enjoys the food.

My mother needed extra care which we paid for. However, unless you are in Assisted Living and only need meds, your needs are not met. Mom had her meals in her room, and that were delivered with kindness. Her medications were given to her on time. But, she had special toileting needs that were not met. As her memory declined she was moved to memory care. She went t down hill quickly and couldn't take care of herself. Despite schedule changes, she would still be found on her floor or in filth at the toilet because those changes were not met. We tried desperately to get her to a more skilled nursing facility, but there were no openings. Needless to say, Mom ended up in the hospital after an injury where she spent her last days with bruises on her face and body causing the Sheriff's department to question us. It was a horrible way for her to die.

The administrative staff is extremely slow to process clients' paperwork and ignorant of the clients' needs and status/required support.    My mother was still not in the computer after 2 weeks.  The PT called about therapy for my mom 2 days after she died.  They didn't follow the DNR directive because it "wasn't in the computer" even though it was in the hard copy file.  Our family is facing huge hospital bills now.  We paid over $[removed]when my mother was admitted.  She died 5 days later.  We're still waiting for the refund so we can pay the unnecessary/unexpected/unauthorized hospital bills.  The director said she would "take care of the refund" when she called to tell me my mother died.  It's been 3 months.  The staff on the floor is good.
The staff and everyone at Harmony at Harts Run were very helpful and understanding. Everything is going well.

It is located in an urban area and close to mass transportation. The house is clean and inviting. If you are looking for a place that is full with residents for your loved one to be around then this is the place to keep them socially busy. The owner and operator offers private rooms and home cooked meals. Depending on what you are looking for this may be the place for you.

We visited a number of places in Northern NJ with my mom and found the Bristal to be the right size, with great staff, who all go out of their way to provide extra level of attention and care!  Lots of options on activities and you can get as involved as you individually want to.  Clean and perfectly appointed!
Property Address: 364 Chestnut Ridge Road, Woodcliff Lake, NJ 07677

reviewTitle: Not that impressed - nice place and p...
review_text: Not that impressed - nice place and people but just not what we are looking for at this time.

We chose Opus Memoria because it fit what we were wanting for our mom. The room sizes at the facility are nice, she has a very nice room with a private bathroom. My mom really enjoys the meals that are served and they seem to be healthy and good for you. The staff members here are friendly and I would recommend to others looking.

reviewTitle: Very nice place.  Beautiful outdoor landscaping.
review_text:
The food is awesome. Especially when they have special events to showcase the facilities.  The food management team know how to put on a great party with very delicious food and drink!
The wait staff was very quick and friendly.  Very helpful with an extra hand to carry food to your table.  I think I would enjoy this place.
Property Name: Pine Ridge of Plumbrook Senior Living

reviewTitle: The cream of the crop but t...
review_text: The cream of the crop but the parents can't outlive their money so after one year had to look elsewhere.
Property Address: 99 South Service Road, North Hills, NY 11040

review_text: Everyone has been so kind and sweet to me, the same ladies that toured me and my family at the beginning are still coming to check in on me. I feel very special and that I chose the right place to move in to. Everyone is so nice, and I tell that to everyone I see, it means the world to me to be treated so great.

My dad has been at Oakmont of the Lakes for 2.5 years. I can honestly say it has saved his life.  He was on a downward spiral prior to him going to live at Oakmont and the change has been tremendous. Not only do the staff take great care of him, the social network he has has been crucial to adding to his quality of life. The "head lady" (as my dad affectionately refers to her as) treats all the residents like they are members of her own family.  The driver has befriended my dad and always makes sure he has everything he needs whether it's a trip to the doctor, to Walmart or whenever he and his friends want to go out to a restaurant (as long as it's scheduled in advance if course). The med techs are consistent in delivering his medication per the doctors orders, there is a fitness facility where he can go exercise and where he can get physical therapy. This place is a great value especially considering the quality care he receives. so grateful to Oakmont of the Lakes!!
Property Address: 3250 S Fort Apache Rd, Las Vegas, NV 89117

review_text: I have no complaints of how things had went during my tour of this community for my self. The staff where on time to my appointment and made sure to answer any questions I had for them in detail. I liked that the residents seemed engaged in different activities and the spacious dinning room. Overall I am pleased with the experience it was just not the right fit for me in the end decision.
Property Address: 606 E. Best Ave, Coeur d'Alene, ID 83814

review_text: WARNING:  Do not attempt to go here unless you are 100% sure you make WELL UNDER the income limit of $37,900 for a single person, this includes all assets.  My mother has tried to get in twice, living well below her means for 3 months just to qualify, waiting for an approval.  She filled out the application, received a move in date and moved out of her current apartment (TWICE) to move into these apartments.  She put down a $300 holding fee (TWICE), intending to move in, with a move in date, which kept getting changed.  She has lost that holding fee both times, since it is non refundable.  That is $600 and for a senior looking to move into senior housing to save money, this is a huge burden on her.  She was under the impression that she was approved to move in both times, as both times she had a move in date.  Within days of supposedly moving into SHAG, she was notified that she did not meet the income limit, which they will not get back to her to tell her how they arrived at this conclusion.  She is now forced to look for another apartment, while living with a friend.  SHAG has made her practically homeless for 3 months...twice.  She now has storage fee costs, multiple moving fees and will have to go to small claims court to try to retrieve this money back.
Everyone,  from administration to residents made Mom feel welcomed.  It waa ao good to see her smiling!  I believe that God led us to the right place for her for sure.

reviewTitle: Very Positive Move from Independent into Assisted Living
review_text:
When it was time for our folks to move from Independent Living to Assisted Living, we found the fit was not good at their current facility.  Burr Ridge helped to outline the options for both assisted living, as well as the Memory Care options we may need to tap into going forward. We appreciated the transparency in both the base costs and costs at additional care levels. 

The move to Burr Ridge Senior Living was completed successfully in a matter of weeks. We have been happy with how friendly the staff has been and responsive to working with our folks to help them feel at home and answer any questions and implement desired changes.  Quite a bit is included in the base cost that was not at the other facility related to maintaining and improving their health. In the month that they've been there, our folks are both healthier and happier, with a care plan to keep them on this path, regardless of the health issues that may be coming in the future. It is a very vibrant community!

Our family had an in person tour and the tour was fine, the community was fairly comparable but we just did not get the best vibe from the people giving the tour. They kept talking about their own families experiences and issues and we just did not really care for that. Also we saw a lot of residents just sitting down and not being active.

I toured many places and was real happy to be greeted with such enthusiasm by the staff and sales person! Even during Covid-19 we were offered a Virtual Tour first then decided to come out to participate in an outside tour. We saw a first floor apartment from the window and walked the beautiful outside walk path with our tour guide. Said "hi" to many residents outside walking to "stay healthy" said one gentleman and the walk was beautiful.  We heard Elvis sing in the courtyard to balconies full of residents dancing which was a nice treat! My dad loves to dance! We were offered two meals "to go" and did take them up on that! My dad is still thinking about moving but was so impressed with everything he saw he is now more positive. Thank you to the Jefferson and staff for such a great tour.
Property Name: Middleton Crossing, A Sky Active Living Community

reviewTitle: staff do very well with the activities
review_text: My mother is not happy being at Villas At Union Park because she lived at her house for 59 years. It has nothing to do with the facility. She is just not willing to do much of the activities offered right now. While I was visiting we go see a movie they had playing but mom left early because she was not into it. The staff do very well with the activities. They even had a trip to Mount Rainier planned the day I arrived. I was unable to go but it seemed really neat. They have a beauty salon on site and that is really nice. They could improve with the location of the recycle bins. There aren't any close to moms room and she walks with a walker. The dining room with the nice white table cloth is a really nice touch. Overall I am really happy with everything here.

reviewTitle: Review of Independence Village Of Waukee
review_text:
I'm writing on behalf of resident [name removed]  and her family. We would like to express our deep appreciation and gratitude for the care [name removed]  receives and her living community at Legacy Pointe/ Independence Village. [name removed]  Was moved into long-term care shortly before the beginning of covid-19 pandemic. We cannot even begin to imagine the struggles this pandemic has presented to the staff and management of the care facility and empathize with the additional stress it must cause for employees and their care of the residents. As difficult as it is to not be able to see or touch a loved one in your care, we understand your need to keep the environment clean and safe for all. We feel [name removed]  and us, her family, have been treated with kindness and compassion through this difficult time. The staff has done a commendable job in dealing with the issues caused by isolation and helping to develop appropriate ways for us to communicate with our loved one through secure outside visits, through Windows, behind plexiglass walls, and through the use of Technology. By giving direct access to her advocate, [name removed], we are able to stay connected with the facility and feel involved in [name removed]’s daily care.  it has been a huge blessing and comfort for us! We have many friends and contacts in various care facilities around the area and feel blessed to have [name removed]  in Legacy Point / Independence Village.

We are appreciative of everyone at Legacy but would like to take this opportunity to personally thank a few staff members who take special care of [name removed] we specifically appreciate [names removed]. since we, her biological family, aren't able to care for [name removed]  directly, we want to thank them for their kindness and compassion towards her. They not only do their jobs well, but they have fun and treat [name removed]  with respect. Most importantly, I would like to give an incredibly special shout out to [name removed].  he has gone above and beyond to connect us through regular Communications, updates, sending pictures, and text messages, as well as answering our questions and dealing with any concerns or medical issues. His kindness and Care is second to none! He was wonderful to work with prior to the pandemic and he has been invaluable to us over the past few months. We hope you know and appreciate this gem on your stuff as much as we do!

Thank you for giving us this vehicle and opportunity to share our experience. We hope you will share our appreciation with staff members who work so hard to care for your residence, our family members. Keep up the good work and continue to provide a safe and caring environment.
Property Address: 1650 SE Holiday Crest Circle, Waukee, IA 50263

reviewTitle: A nice place for Memory Care
review_text: The staff is good, but there is a bit of a lack of communication. Security is good for keeping patients safe and not roaming around outside. The move in process was easy, and the facility was clean. I would recommend this facility to others.
Property Name: Desert Peaks Assisted Living and Memory Care
Property Address: 5525 Cotton Bloom Ct., Las Cruces, NM 88007

review_text: The facility is very welcoming, clean and friendly staff.   When entering the facility, always greeted staff and residents.  Outstanding offerings of activities, delicious food and wonderful care given to my family.

reviewTitle: Review of Pacifica Senior Living Portland
review_text: Fabulous from tour to move in on many occasions.

This facility only gets "4" ratings because I wish they were more consistent with their covid updates since they have a few outbreaks. But they have put appropriate measures in force. The other items regarding staffing is that they have had almost total turnover in the executive staff and chef.
Property Name: Prestige Assisted Living at Mira Loma

review_text: If you have a friend or family member that needs assisted living I for sure recommend this place for your loved one. They are very caring, and if you have someone that needs more care than normal they are not quite there yet and would have to supplement it. They have nurses on staff but it is not like a skilled nursing facility.

If you are looking for a place that will take care of your loved ones, I highly recommend considering Golden Oaks.  Golden Oaks has a very personal, family atmosphere, serve wonderful home-cooked meals, everyone is friendly, professional, and respectful and they always treat my father as one of their own -  I love that it has a “real home” feel to it!  

My father is well cared for and from day one, my father has flourished from the professional care-giving services he receives.  He has formed close relationships with his care-givers and the other residents, alleviating much of his loneliness and depression which provides me with a tremendous peace of mind.  

Everyone is always so helpful and willing to go above and beyond – what a great place!!

I am no longer living there. When I originally moved there, I had a great impression of the community.  However, I became displeased when I realized that I did not have an oven. I was not pleased with the fact that my 1 bedroom was outdated and did not have an oven, and they had no intentions of replacing the stove unit. (Other apartments had an oven.) The sliding glass door did not have a key and they had no intentions of making one. I was told not to worry about locking it when I go out because the community was safe. They indicated that the sliding glass door was going to be replaced, but they made no attempt to do so until I left. It's also important to know that if rent is missed, arrangements can be made but have to made by a certain date or there would be an automatic eviction. Many other residents have been evicted and have left on their own because of that issue or because of the fact that maintenance was slow and that the facility was outdated and did not warrant the amount of the rent. They made it very easy to move in, but after moving in, things changed over time, especially with new management.  I understand that other communities are more expensive, but they are updated and have better services. I would not recommend Revela to anyone, unless the "cheaper price", and outdated appearance doesn't matter.
Property Name: Revela at Mt. Pleasant Independent Living
Property Address: 1224 Village Creek Ln, Mount Pleasant, SC 29464

review_text: Sunrise at Mount Vernon has been the right place for my wife’s needs.  The Remembrance unit is caring and considerate.  They are attentive to her needs and provide round the clock assistance.  The meals are well prepared and tasty and the activities are very helpful to her memory care.  Highly recommended!!

We really liked Sunrise at Montgomery Village - the facility, the apartments, the food, and the staff. The staff is very engaged with the residents and family members. They have good employee retention, which is important for the residents and their families.

Ths staff at this community are fabulous. The food is good and they offer healthy options. The community is lovely and well taken care of. They do offer some daily activities.  This is a memory care lock down community and I would recommend it.

This facility was very accommodating to us. [Removed] enjoyed himself.  Large facility but still with a "homey" feel.  Many social activities, room options, could be a budget "fit", and staff was great.  Transportation for a field visit was being made available to the clients when we visited.

reviewTitle: I have a high regard for the staff
review_text: I have a high regard for the staff at Creekside Village The friendliness and cleanliness is really good. The room mom has is a little bit tired. They cleaned it up nicely but it's just a little tired. The cupboards don't all hang straight any more, the track in the closet is dented so it doesn't close right, things like that. The food is excellent and they are improving their activities. They are going to start doing some things that are a little more universal. They haven't done it yet but say they are.

reviewTitle: Review of Meadowstone Place - Dallas, TX
review_text: I like Meadowstone - the apt. is great & when I had a door problem, it was taken care of promptly!

Terrible facility.   Management did not train caretakers at all.  Supervisors were never available on weekends.  High turnover rate for all employees.  Many caretakers were mean and lazy.  Found my mother sleeping in urine soaked sheets too many times.  Facilities are old and in poor condition.   Toilets overflow, air conditioning goes out, heat goes out, fire alarms blast for hours, gutters are filled with weeds.  My mother was not supervised properly and often fell out of her wheelchair.  Caretakers dropped her several times sending her to the hospital.

reviewTitle: Very nice facility, very clean and fr...
review_text: Very nice facility, very clean and friendly staff.  The room available was a nice size and included a shower in the room.  However, there was very little visitation areas noted within the Memory Unit.  Loved the dog in the unit.  Nice touch!  I thought pricing as a little prohibitive at greater than 6,000 a month. Just doesn't seem like a nice fit for my Mom due the the exit and the cost as well as lack of visitation areas.  Loved the staff we met though.  A great place.
My mother-in-law has been there for about 6 weeks and we are so happy with the care she is receiving. The staff is phenomenal!

reviewTitle: Visited this site.  Very clean and im...
review_text: Visited this site.  Very clean and impressed by what I saw

I am so happy we moved my mom to Collinfield House.  The staff is fantastic!
