They are caring, attentive, adaptive to changing needs. Communication  is fine. Our loved one has passed, but my family was very pleased with the care she received while there. And being close by was a major plus

reviewTitle: Review for Sky Ridge Senior Living
review_text: We picked this community because it was smaller and one story. They also had a patio room and a decent price. They also agreed to take him to dialysis on Saturday and during the week. It's working out great. Very happy we put our dad there !!
I would highly recommend this assisted living home. Great care givers and they took really good care of our family member up until he passed.

This place has bedbugs and she is NOT licensed! There is no recreation or "scheduled outings". I am a resident here at Comfort Home in Tucson. She has been asked several times to get professional pest control for the bedbugs but refuses. I've even offered to help pay for it! The food is good. The owner/caregiver is very unstable. I am moving out next month.

Overall, I feel my time at Solstice Senior Living has been good. Initially, I felt comfortable from he moment I walked in the door. The staff  was helpful, and everyone greeted you. A new company has just taken over management, so there are a lot of changes going on that sometimes make it hard to keep track of things. Generally though, the staff is helpful, the food is excellent, the place is clean, and they always have plenty going on for the residents. It is still a good community, and I'm hopeful that when the new management settles in, things will run more smoothly.

The Forum at Knightsbridge is just an overall great community and based on the experience we have had so far, we would recommend this community to other families who may need a place for their loved ones.
In an excellent facility with many excellent staff! Our loved one gets wonderful care.
Property Address: 3720 George B Lake Parkway, Elkhorn, NE 68022

review_text:
The community is more independent living the assisted living and if you need additional help you may need to use private pay.  The community is kept neat and clean and the staff is very friendly and helpful.

I would recommend this community to others based on my experience.
Property Address: 7575 Willow Chase Blvd Hwy 249 near 1960, Houston, TX 77070

review_text: My loved one really likes it there. He did not like the food at first, and they changed the food for him. I like the staff. The nurses are really good with him. He likes one nurse especially, and they take good care of him. His nurse calls me if there is a problem. They lose his clothes a lot. I have to buy clothes for him a lot. The facility is clean. His room is clean, but in the hallway they do not mop enough.
Property Address: 1500 W Warm Springs Rd, Henderson, NV 89014

reviewTitle: Good meal. One bedroom 1 bath with Si...
review_text: Good meal. One bedroom 1 bath with Side room. Patio kitchen $  Maid service weekly. Pet ok under 25 lbs    ? Independent cottages but assisted living is available as well as memory care but you would have to move out of your cottage into an apartment to get increased care.  ? You would have to go out in the weather and walk a steep incline to get to your meals.  ? Meals are served buffet/cafeteria style.  You would have to carry a tray from buffet line to your table.  ? Full kitchen?all appliances furnished  ? Fresh paint and new carpet with each change of tenant  ? Hook ups for washer and dryer  ? All utilities included except for cable TV, internet and phone line  ? Small patio at both the front and back doors.  Lots of cement, not much grass.  ? Bath tubs with showers?tub could be cut out to make one a step-in shower.  Without renovation you would have to step over the tub to get into shower.  ? Exterior of the buildings showed signs of mildew.  Interiors were OK.  ? Located on a very busy street in Little Rock.  I noticed lots of traffic noise, sirens, etc.  ? Small dogs were welcome.  ? Rooms available for any over-night guests you might have.  ? Individual mail boxes provided.   ? Housekeeping services are provided once each week at no cost to you.  ? Transportation is provided to shopping, doctor appointments, etc. but must be scheduled.  ? Beauty shop available on site.  ? Staff on duty 24 hours a day/ seven days a week.  ? Some programmed activities for residents.  ? Some exercise equipment available on site (as well as physical  therapy at extra charge)  ? Nice sized bedroom closets and a pantry in the kitchen.
Property Address: 800 Napa Valley Dr, Little Rock, AR 72211

review_text: Through a referral I found Coles Assisted Living for my brother.  He has been there since August 2017 and seems to be adjusting very well.  [Removed] and her staff truly care about the people there and they walked with us through every step in getting my brother settled in.  My brother was in another facility and it was pretty horrible, the conditions were deplorable and now he is thriving, from the positive energy and interaction with the staff and other residence.  I am truly thankful to [Removed] for giving my brother the opportunity to become a part of the Coles family.  Keep up the great work!

A Place for mom booked my mom 3 tours in Decatur. The Regency House was the first community we visited. We were very impressed with the friendly staff. Residents, lunch, and the community it's self. We visited the other two communities due to have appointments, but nothing compared to the Regency House. If you are looking for a great place to live, I recommend visiting this community. While your there ask for [name removed], my mom. She absolutely loves living at the Regency House.

My sister was a resident until her passing. There is charm in the age of the facility with efforts to connect the "old" with the "new." My sister had lived in a number of facilities, but due to the closing of the two other sites, she had to move twice. Stapeley was her third residence. She was anxious and concerned about another move. 

Surprisingly, she adjusted rather quickly. Her room was simple, and all that she needed. She made friends and connected with the staff.  She knew their names and welcomed their care and concern for her. In reflecting on her experience and mine as well, I wish we found this place earlier before all the others. She enjoyed her meals and the friends she made. I can't comment on the activities, but I do know that there is a monthly schedule provided. I am very grateful to all who made my sister's day-to-day pleasant and comfortable.

They have done an incredible job with regard to the Covid-19 pandemic and have had zero cases. They took very early action to close the place down. 

They keep the community pretty clean, although it could be a little better. The staff is very friendly and they consistently keep the same care givers with my father so he can get to know them better. He seems to really like them and seems to be happy. They have done a good job with my father's care. he does not participate in the activities at the community and they do seem to try to engage him, but it does not seem like he is involved at all. They are pretty expensive, but compared to other communities in the area, his apartment is pretty nice.

Artis in general as a whole has a great philosophy one that everyone should live by. However once behind those door it's a different story the employee and managers are so far from the Artis way it's a true shame my heart goes out to the residents and their families.
Property Name: Artis Senior Living of Huntingdon Valley

reviewTitle: This would be a definite fit for my m...
review_text: This would be a definite fit for my mom.  I love the layout of the complex...tons of plusses...the only negative for us is the distance from our home...still would consider...
Property Address: 7575 Willow Chase Blvd Hwy 249 near 1960, Houston, TX 77070

review_text: It was the warm smiles and winning smiles that came with the reception that let me know I had found the right place to call home.  Everyone was helpful and welcoming,  showing me the ropes.  Dinner schedules, social hour, and trying to see that everyone is thought of and made welcomed.  I couldn’t have asked for more.  After living here four months I consider the residents to be a family.  We all look out after each other and are there for each other.

reviewTitle: Friendly Staff and Compasionate Care with Dignity
review_text: My Father, who lost his wife of over 50 yrs due to COVID, found himself in a challenging scenerio that Our Lady Of Mercy was able to support. He loves this place as the nurses provided great care in assisited living as well as the rehab team getting him able to live independently!  He has made the most of his challenges and calls this place home along with many wonderful residents that care.  His favorite part of the day is talking with the entire staff and eating the best food.  He raves about the quality of meals and how we much the staff treats him like family!  We love this place for so many reasons and highly recommend it to everyone!  Best in KC for sure.
Property Name: Our Lady of Mercy Country Home

review_text: My loved one seems to like the staff.  They care is pretty good.  I would consider them again.
Property Name: TheKey Corporate - Salt Lake City, UT
Property Address: 7833 South Highland Dr, Salt Lake City, UT 84121

review_text:
This is an independent living facilities so no care services provided. No activities are provided unless initiated by the residents. Management is not friendly and would prefer not to interact with us. Ever.

This would have been 4 star prior to January 2020 when the facility was sold. The new owners and their managers are horrific. There is almost no communication of changes that affect us, nearly everything we do get is written in a threatening way, and we are treated like 5 year old inmates.

We received a 20 page, single spaced 10 point type, written in paragraphs of things we couldn't do. 

They do not post information letting us know what is going on, for example, they are closing the laundry room except between 9 and 4:30 M-F  - we are just faced with a locked door. For two days, for reasons unknown, mail was no longer going to be delivered to our mailboxes and we were to go to the post office to get it. No notice was posted. We found out by word of mouth.

They do not process paperwork in a timely manner and only give you last minute notice of things you need to do (for example the night before it is due they place it on your door and don't even knock). 

They are not good about answering the phone, you are not allowed to go to the office to talk to them. Their notices say call or email but they do not include the the email address on the notice.

They don't give receipts for rent and have lost more than one person's rent check. They then give out notices you have to be out in 10 days (state law says you have to be taken to court and you have 30 days to pay the rent before they can do that) and they just put it on your door. To my knowledge (eg people talking about it) all lost rent checks have eventually been found, but they are not careful. 

They don't follow up on what they say they will do without repeated reminders - which mostly can only be done if you happen to see them in the lobby and then they often don't make eye contact, pretend they don't hear you or tell you that you can't ask a question. They rarely answer emails even if you are asking questions. You are to tell personal information to the resident who mans the lobby desk for her to pass on. 

They will inspect your apt 4x a year and the rules say if you fail inspection (for example a bit of dust on top of the fridge, or have too much stuff, too many collectables on shelves, etc.) you can be evicted per their rules. They made people take down door wreathes... And the list goes on and on. 

When they give out recertification notices they don't even bother to proof read them.  A couple people had one that said the manager was calling each of those people at the same time. While I haven't gone through recertification yet, people who have said they aren't given the forms you are supposed to fill out, they only take a small amount of info verbally and all of them that I have heard complaining said their rent was raised significantly even though circumstances haven't changed. Medical expenses, including medications are supposed to be subtracted from one's gross income/amount of money you get a month and apparently they aren't even asking about that. It is clear they don't know all the HUD rules for 62 and older/disability HUD. 

Although the building is old with serious foundation problems, the apartments aren't all that bad (although they are small - 2 rooms and about 525sf). The location is convenient, although it is not all that safe to walk around outside of the parking lot after dark. 

It is supposed to be a smoke free building and smoking, even in your apartment (supposed to smoke outside, I guess standing in the rain), but the halls frequently smell like cigarette smoke and weed. I am tired of the stink and I wish they'd spend the time to enforce those rules rather than yap about more minor things.

I could go on and on... The upshot is that it is better than being homeless, but under the current management, if you have another choice I'd not move here. Many people have left or are looking to leave (and are on waiting lists to get in elsewhere) due to the new management.

reviewTitle: Review of Highland Lakes Care Home Residential Care Home in Glendale, AZ
review_text: Nice home, but not the home for my dad.

reviewTitle: My Review of The Gardens of Germantown
review_text: This was a good place, but nothing stood out to me about it.

I toured Bright Oaks of Aurora and it was a beautiful facility! My actual tour was great. The informational one-on-one meeting with the staff was comprehensive and I did not feel rushed. The staff follow up after my tour was great also. They offered creative opportunities for us to join their in house events to get first hand experiences. The facility was clean and well maintained.

I like living here very much.  It is a very unique in that it is a continuing care community.  Things have change a lot since the COVID, They turned the fourth into a recovery floor for Brookdale COVID patients, which was very good.  The care is really quite wonderful here.   I chose this community because they had wonderful food but right now the quality of the  food it not as good with delivery of the food.  I would recommend this community very much so.  They are trying very hard to please everybody which is very hard to do.  The had zoom meetings with updates and zoom happy hour.  The are working on setting up family visits, but they are being very cautious and careful about it.

I have been a resident here for a little bit, and it is well worth the money. Staff will go out of their way to entertain the us, and the food is also very good. The community is well worth what I am paying, in fact it is cheaper than the last place I lived. I am very happy and content here.

reviewTitle: She is having a great time there
review_text: We have had no issues with the cleanliness of the community, and she is loving the meals and dining service that gets higher than 5 stars. She is really enjoying the activities like card games, bingo, church and the outings they are able to take. Our loved one was really lonely at first, and this community is really helping with that.

We were living that nursing home nightmare. I didn't really have a life anymore because I felt like I had to be there all the time to make sure she was taken care of. To be totally honest, in general, I would say if you compare it to other nursing homes, it wasn't a bad place. Some of the nurses and LPN's there were fabulous, but not all of them. There was one on the later shift that was especially gruff with my mother. Some were more attentive. Sometimes she had to wait 30 minutes for help, but the bottom line is that they are understaffed. When you interview, they tell you you have X number of LPN's and CNA's but it doesn't always pan out that way. Those women are really scrambling and working hard trying to take care of everybody but there's more work than they can do. The rehab staff we loved. It wasn't bad care, but the other thing is, she was in the rehab the whole time she was there, not long term care. I don't know what would have happened once she was expected to be there permanently. There was an incident that never got resolution that confirmed that we made the right decision to pull her out. There was a day that they got her up and took her to rehab and had her sit up for awhile. Her roommate wasn't there so she was by herself in the room. My cousin got there after 4 and my mother was still sitting up; she had been left in the chair all day long. They had the wheelchair locked so she couldn't wheel it out into the hall, and she couldn't reach her cord to get help. She wasn't on her feeding tube and hadn't be changed. We talked to the director about it and he said he would get back but we never got any answer or response or follow up. To me warrants a phone call. Most of the girls were pretty nice people, but when shift changed around 9 we would see six CNA's all sitting in the lobby. She was supposed to get her meds by 7 and sometimes it would be 8:30 or 9. At the time she was there her mind was totally sound and out there you would have everyone - people screaming, or in a vegetative state. There was no area for people of sound minds to be on their own. She wouldn't come out of her room because she didn't want to be around all those people, but I guess they can't help that kind of situation.

reviewTitle: The staff is so caring & it is a wonderful community
review_text: The staff is professional and goes the extra mile for the residents. The food is phenomenal and I love the “Anytime Cafe” where residents can go get late night snacks and beverages. I highly recommend Peregrine!

reviewTitle: you really should take care of the easy things before they fester
review_text:
So far mom has enjoyed her  stay.  however if you are thinking about having a loved one stay here  or any facility for that matter, get the advanced info on who you need to talk to about taking care of all issues and in this instance: regular maintenance.  Gosh  with all the major important issues,  I would not have thought this would be on the top of our first experience list.    Have been dancing around this since she moved in. Lots of empathy but no resolution.
Great entertainment for the residents and excellent dinning.  If I would not have to continue to follow up on basic maintenance  that would be mighty fine
Property Address: 920 Riverview Dr SE, Rio Rancho, NM 87124

review_text: These folks were so nice to give me a buzz during the hurricane to ask if I needed anything, makes me think they really care about people.

reviewTitle: Convenient location for Mom but problems with billing LTC insurance.
review_text:
When we moved our mom into Brookdale, it wasn't organized.  The director, head of nursing and activities director did meet her in the next few days.  But the executive chef actually showed us around the building upon move in.  I explained we're paying through long term care benefits before we made the commitment to move my mother to Brookdale.  The sales director and executive director both said they work with and bill LTC providers.  Having invested a great deal of time contacting the LTC provider and many e-mails and phone calls to the executive director, the December and January invoices were faxed mid-late February.  I was told that was unusual and things would go smoothly from then on.  As of today, the LTC provider has not received my mom's February invoice.  Again, I've made many calls and sent numerous e-mails requesting the invoice/claim form be faxed which Brookdale has to sign off on every month.

My mother chose Brookdale North Naples because of its convenient location, close proximity to her doctors and larger room size compared to other assisted living communities.  Hopefully the insurance situation will eventually get resolved.

reviewTitle: Review of Wingfield Hills Health & Wellness
review_text: They were very good upon my mother's arrival to the facility. The people at the facility have been so, so kind. They are getting her involved. They have acknowledged and provided her with everything she needs. Her therapists have been amazing with her. They have established really strong bonds. She has already had her hair cut, and this has made her feel better, as well. The head of nursing listens to you and acts on what you say. The social workers have been fabulous! The nurses have been so good and prompt. Everyone from the facility has really taken the time with our concerns. I feel as though everything is addressed and taken care of. Each department has established a relationship with me and have done everything in their power to make this go smoothly. Some meals are beautiful, and then other are not quite there. It is unpredictable. Also, there could be a little more attention to what the patient wants to eat.

Much better than that place in Holland. We haven't experienced ANY of the issues we had there.
Everyone has been extremely cooperative understanding and supportive. Always available to answer concerns and the building is clean and residents all appear happy. 
We chose it because of the cost and location. It's right next to my house so its convenient.

reviewTitle: Review of Harbor Chase Of Naperville
review_text:
We love Harbor Chase. Please get a hairdresser in. Residents hair looks terrible. It's been 6 months. Extend outside /table visiting hours from Monday – Wednesday- Friday to Monday - Wednesday - Friday - Saturday - Sunday or every day .
Thank you for taking care of my parents.

We toured Raybrook Estates 3, which were beautiful. She is looking for living quarters very much like this but, we were all very uneasy about the buy-in aspect and the how and why. her comment was 'outrageously expensive'
Property Address: 2121 Raybrook Street SE, Grand Rapids, MI 49546

reviewTitle: Review of Waterford At Carpenter's Creek
review_text: I love it! Everbody is great!

We chose Wickshire Bl;ankenbaker mainly because of the convenient location to me and I am the main caretaker for them. The apartment sizes are pretty good, definitely suitable for what they needed. It is a very pretty facility and they have nice landscaping on the outside. The facility provides independent living as well as assisted living if you need to level up to that. I would recommend to others looking.
We chose Talem Home Care because we were able to get shorter shifts with them. Scheduling has been good for the most part. I would recommend to others looking.
Property Name: Talem Home Care - Colorado Springs, CO
Property Address: 3230 E Woodmen Rd Suite 110G, Colorado Springs, CO 80920

review_text: They recently changed ownership, but all the changes have been mostly positive. They still have some  staff that stayed, a good sign. We picked this community because of the value for cost, for sure. Homey atmosphere. Size and location of the facility. We  just knew it was the perfect choice for my mom.

What we like most about The  Auberge at North Ogden is the friendliness of the staff and the caring manner they have for my father. Based on the experience we have had so far, we would  recommend this community to other families.

I was very impressed with the facility. Stephanie was honest and caring about the services they could provide. Although the facility was in the middle of renovations, the rooms that were finished were clean, bright and ready for tenants.
Very friendly staff. Very clean.

reviewTitle: people were warm and friendly, kept m...
review_text: people were warm and friendly, kept me informed about my father
Property Name: Charter Senior Living at Woodholme Crossing

reviewTitle: A good community, but there is some room for improvement.
review_text: The residents need to go in one or two small elevators to do anything so they are stuck waiting for the elevators. I ate there and I thought it was pretty good, she hates it. There aren't a lot of options, and not a lot of variety. They are very friendly and it has a clean smell and is in a nice location for us, it's in a good community for her. It definitely competes well with some of the higher end communities.

I never would have found it if I hadn't reached out to A Place for Mom so I'm grateful for the recommendation!I would absolutely recommend it to others and I have. The staff is amazing and the facility is beautiful with lots to do and lots to offer. My mother loves living there.

Longevity with staff and residents, Morningside House of Friendship is truly a family! Families and residents are welcomed and included immediately. They offer an array of activities that meet desires of their residents. They are attentive and caring.  They go out of their way to make life fun, enjoyable and eventful. Even during these tough times, they have taken the safety of residents and staff very seriously while still trying to give the residents the attention and stimulation they still need.

So many things to do from main street - theater to catch live performance or catch a movie. The lobby off main always has fun card games, karioki, just visiting with friends. Meals comes off of main with servers to help, with such good. Food all smile face.
Property Address: 11352 S Redwood Rd, South Jordan, UT 84095

review_text: The community and apartments are beautiful, the staff is very friendly and helpful. We would recommend this community to other families based on the experience we have had so far
Property Address: 16455 E Ave of the Fountains, Fountain Hills, AZ 85268

review_text: They are upgrading the lobby of the facility nicely. The staff does rotate a lot but that's probably to be expected for a 24/7 facility. They do have activities for the residents which my mom comments she enjoys. They also generally seem easy to get a hold of.

We love Sunrise community, we think it has been great and the staff members have all been very friendly. The director knows us, and is always keeping us informed. There were many reasons we chose this community and the price was one of the biggest reasons. Also, it is very close to our family, just a couple minutes drive time and 10 minutes walking. It is in a residential area, which is super nice. Our loved ones apartment is amazing, the staff treat him very well as well as the other residents. Our experience has just been great, our only issue is still the covid restrictions. Everyone who works there and everyone who lives there has been fully vaccinated so we are not sure why the residents are still restricted.

The staff is friendly, the place is immaculate, but be sure they evaluate your loved one completely and accurately. My mother was there for about 7 weeks when I was told that she needed dementia care, and she would have to move to another facility. I feel if she had been evaluated fully and correctly, I wouldn't have had to put her through the trauma of a second move. I wish she had been able to stay there, as she was starting to find friends there. But her night terrors were frequent, loud, and unpredictable, and that's mostly why she had to move.

DO NOT go here!!! The weekend care taker was so bad that if I could file a report on her with the State, I would. Anyway, our mother was in bad shape and the owner told us that they could take care of her until end of life. She was there for a month and he calls us and tells us that she's exceeded their care and we have to move her. They let us know that the sooner the better and that they just can't do it even though they were told AHEAD of time that she was a FULL ASSIST patient and would need help in going to the bathroom. 

This weekend caretaker (Fri-Sun) would throw her into the bed with the help of another care taker and tell her, "Don't bother turning on your call light as I won't answer it!" So, if our mother needed to go to the bathroom she'd have to lie in it for the entire night as the care taker would refuse to change her. By morning this would be unacceptable as you can imagine!! An adult depends can only hold so much. Plus, the weekend care taker didn't seem to care that our mother had loose screws in her back that was causing her pain and by throwing her into bed was also causing the screws to move all over and jarring her back. The care taker would get mad if the plates weren't put back on the table correctly - who cares if it's not set right - if someone wanted to use it during the day. It was all for show anyway! The weekend care taker was always on the phone doing her own thing and never doing anything that she should have been doing and was listening to her music or talking to her family on the phone. Forget that there's people that need to be taken care of there. 

The only good care taker was the weekly one who was the manager of the place. She made sure the people there received the proper care and really looked after the people. That's the only good thing there. One person who was good to the people. That was it. Other than that nothing else. 

The owner wouldn't respond back after numerous attempts of contacting them. They would run of out supplies multiple times during the week and he would be very insistent on them hand washing the dishes instead of using the dishwasher as he didn't want to use up the extra water and electricity. 

Overall, do not go to this place! Go to just about any place other than this one!!!!

I cannot rate them on friendliness because they are neither friendly nor mean They just don't talk or look at you. This includes the managers.
They say there are activities but they have bingo with 2 cards and that is not fun!! The food is not good. It is tasteless and unfulfilling.I am thinking about moving!! These golden years should be "GOLDEN"!!

reviewTitle: Dad loves his new home at the Grandview!
review_text: We just moved my Dad to the Grandview to the Cottage memory care.  He loves his new room, raves about the people who take care of him, and raves about the food every time I see him! It is true; we feel he is being treated with compassion. The place is pretty and clean.  I like to sit with him outside on the patio to visit and watch the birds. They have lots of fun activities for seniors to do. Everyone has been so nice and helpful, and we are pleased with his new home.
We love this place! The people, the care, everything.  Our mother is receiving the care and support she needs at this point in her life, and that's a huge relief for the family.

My mom lived at Clare Bridge for a couple of years before her death. Everyone there was loving, caring, and so wonderful throughout her time there, especially during her last days. The staff is absolutely wonderful, treating our family like family. You can tell they love their work. My mothers dementia got very severe towards the end of her life, and the staff always found ways to keep her active and social in whatever way she was able. Although more expensive than other memory care in the area, you truly get what you pay for. I would recommend Clare Bridge to anyone looking for their parent who has memory problems. I had a great experience there, and I know my mom did too.

I would recommend Winslow Court to other families. The staff that they have is good, but my dad says they are short staffed and have a lot of turn over. My dad loves the community and also loves the food.
Property Address: 3920 East San Miguel Street, Colorado Springs, CO 80909

review_text: I am satisfied with the Sunrise of Richmond so far. They are great. Perhaps more activities would be great.
Such a beautiful facility. However the more intensive need for physical therapy has us choosing another facility for respite care they are first on the list as an assisted living facility.

Per mom once she toured this place she didn't want to go anywhere else she fell in love with it. Her living space is comfortable and the right size for what she wanted. Everything is clean and well maintained. We have had some minor issues but the staff is actively working on resolving them. They are friendly and kind. 
Mom is doing puzzles and playing cards and generally socializing with people which are good. 
She loves the food there.
All has gone well

This facility seems to have all of the necessities to a comfortable life and so many extras to keep people moving, learning, mingling, and having fun!  Great decor as well, friendly staff, and a real sense of belonging.

All 5's. They were very nice people. The day he arrived they literally rolled out a red carpet and the whole staff lined the hallway to welcome him. Since he was a veteran they posted his picture on the Wall of Honor. When my father passed away, they rebated all the fees for the last month. I would recommend them.

reviewTitle: Review of Morning Star Assisted Living & Memory Care Of Fountain Hills
review_text:
[name removed]and team!
 God bless Morning Star of Fountain Hills!!! Everyone provides such a nice place to live! We love you all. Thank you. Thank you. Thank you. Thank you.
Property Address: 16800 E. Paul Nordin Parkway, Fountain Hills, AZ 85268

review_text: I love it here. I feel very much at home. All the staff is top drawer!!

reviewTitle: my review of Mission Chateau Senior Living Community,
review_text: This is a new community and had great amenities, but it didn't fit our needs with skilled nursing.
The one area I can think of that they can improve on is their meals.  The meals often sound good but don't taste as good when we get it.  Very clean and friendly place.

My loved one has good care there and he is doing very well. The staff treats him very well and they are very nice. They call me for everything; if they have to take him out they call me, if he falls they call me.

This is was a nice community tour. The staff was nice and helpful. They did offer activities to the residents. We would recommend that families take a tour to see that it is clean and to speak with the wonderful staff that is very helpful.
Very nice inside.  We just toured.  The room was very nice and good sized.  We liked the patio for mom’s flowers. Staff seemed very friendly.
Property Name: Streamside Assisted Living and Memory Care

reviewTitle: Toured. Liked the facility, and consi...
review_text: Toured. Liked the facility, and considering it.

As far as improvements, the only thing would be to change up and have a few more varied activities, instead of the same thing every time. As far as everything else, it has just been a good experience as far as the facility and the people with I have worked with.

reviewTitle: Nice place, do not accept pets
review_text: We toured this community when we were looking into care options for a loved one. I thought this was a nice looking place overall, and we liked that it had both independent and a memory care section. The facility itself was beautiful, and very clean. However, they do not accept pets, which was a dealbreaker for us.

This community is very beautiful with lots of great features and amenities for my loved one. I am really enjoying the variety of activities and the meals they serve throughout the week. The housekeeping team does a great job at making sure my room stays well maintained as well as the rest of the building.

We visited Kings Grant House on Tuesday, 12/6/16, and met with Susan.  This was our first visit to a facility.  The tour was so nice and Susan was very helpful answering our questions.  We had a change in plans and are looking for a place for mom and dad so we need independent and assisted care.  Kings Grant begins with the assisted level.  Nice place but not what we need.
Property Name: Commonwealth Senior Living at King's Grant House
Property Address: 440 North Lynnhaven Road, Virginia Beach, VA 23452

reviewTitle: It was NOT the place for my mother.
review_text: Sadly the place is short on help and cant provide proper care. Care helpers were not around in one area. In another a helper was reading a magazine ignoring seniors.. A wild senior was screaming like a banshee and was yelling threat. There was a scary older patient lurching around and  pissed on the kitchen floor. A young male staff member said that'is normal behavior and management knows. Seniors in wheelchairs and passed out in chairs is not being active or providing memory care. A few patients looked malnourished, and unkempt. It does not fit the online profile. Definitely not a place for my mother
It serves the needs of my loved one. They seem to care about the people that stay there. It is nice.
Property Address: 795 Penllyn Blue Bell Pike, Blue Bell, PA 19422

reviewTitle: Nice community, but did not end well
review_text: Overall, in terms of the care and the facility itself, Grace Manor did a good job. It was a very nice looking, clean community, and the staff were all very friendly and helpful. However, my loved one ended up in the hospital, but was very interested in returning to the community. They told us they would send someone to reevaluate her condition to see if she could return, and they just never showed up, which really soured this whole experience.

reviewTitle: Overall good place but wish food was better.
review_text: Charter Senior Living of Oak Openings is a nice facility, and the staff are nice too.  Overall it's a good place, but I wish the food was better - it's inconsistent.
Property Name: Charter Senior Living of Oak Openings

review_text: Staff is amazing

The staff at The Village are kind, caring and loving. 

They could improve on the activities by adding more of a variety - especially for the more cognitively impaired residents.

I would recommend this facility to others.
Property Name: The Village A ProMedica Senior Living Community

reviewTitle: I believe this is the best facility in Arkansas
review_text:
I placed mom in the memory care unit at Village on the Park in about 2021.  It was the best experience for her.

She probably spent some of her best years here.  The staff fell in love with her and visa versa. 

I didn't have to worry about her at all, the nurses had my cell and kept me updated.  She was also a block away so I saw her several times a month. But that's because I wanted too see her, not because I was concerned about her... at all.  She was SO happy.  I am an RN, so I would know if she isn't being treated properly.  The facility provided daily activities for her, painting, movies in their theater, games...  She was treated exactly the way that you would want your family member to treated.

My daughter is a licensed social worker who says that VOTP is the best facility in the state of Arkansas. I fully believe that after my mothers stay there for the last 3 years.  I have nothing but the best things to say about the entire facility.  We never had a bad experience.
Property Address: 3800 SW Mount Carmel Dr, Bentonville, AR 72713

review_text: Originally hesitant to get care for my mom as I live out of state, especially with some early experiences, but the model Senior Key Care has created of having care coordinators review and organize their care givers has been a blessing. We tried a different agency for a while, but were met with unexpected call offs and no one to cover, leaving my mom all alone. That hasn't happened with Senior Key Care, we are 6 months in and I can call [name removed] the owner anytime to see what is going on. Would recommend to anyone looking for care.

We needed a place for dad.  Here we found a fantastic group of humans with love and compassion for our dad and the rest of the residents.  

The menu is interesting and healthy with yummy comfort food sprinkled in.  They were very accommodating with my dad’s requests.  

Clean and odor-free. Activities, outings, social gatherings and exercise.  I really wanted to join the BINGO game when I was there.

Dad needs help?   Press the button and help arrives within a couple minutes. 

If your loved one’s safety, health and quality care is your priority you can’t go wrong with Redwood Heights.  I could not be happier with our selection.

This is a nice facility, and our tour of it went very well. The staff we met was polite, and informative. Our questions were answered. The community looked nice, and well-kept from what we saw. The experience went well, and everyone was kind to my family, and I.

Windcrest is a smaller place with just 2 levels. It was so inviting, friendly and clean. The residents visit among themselves and having a good time. A few of them told me they feel spoiled living at Windcrest. The apartments are very spacious and light.

I'd say it was the best place we looked at (and we looked at a LOT) and overall Mom is happy there. I think the facility struggles with staffing (especially in meal prep and dining services) but I would imagine most other places do as well. Overall I would highly recommend StoryPoint.

My mother is starting to finally adjust to this community. It has been an adjustment process for the her and the family. We are getting use too the routine around the community. She is starting to take an interest in her surroundings. She has made some new friends, and that has made the transition better. The staff has nerves of   steel. They are very patient, and attentive. I'am starting to feel more comfortable with the care she is receiving here. Overall this is a community I would recommend, it a nice place.

So far the care here seems wonderful! It's a beautiful community, and they always keep it looking well kept and clean! The staff are all very friendly, and they really seem to care about the residents on a personal level. I'd give them top marks across the board, and I'd recommend anyone looking into care take a look at them.

Friendliness of staff- 1 of the big draws for us, everyone with few exceptions very welcoming and friendly. Meals/dining - only true negative.  Has deteriorated significantly since coming here. Probably tight budget but food very important to many of us. (Uniformly not hot and over or under spiced) Could also be  staff related but servers wonderful  (many students, really try hard).
Property Address: 6500 North Cosby Avenue, Kansas City, MO 64151

reviewTitle: Grateful for Trinity Community of Beavercreek
review_text:
My father lived at Trinity Community for 3 years, both in assisted living and memory care. 
 We chose Trinity for multiple reasons:
1. The positive perspectives of friends who live there and friends whose parents lived there
2. We knew he would never have to leave, since Trinity accommodates every level of care and also works with you through the Medicaid process if funds run out.
3. Many of their staff have been there a long time.
4. During my initial visit I did not notice any strong urine smells, which was not true of other facilities that I had visited.
We are thankful for Trinity because:
1. Over the years, many staff mentioned to me that they loved my dad and that brought me confidence of their care for him
2.  The physical & occupational therapy staff were fantastic! Dad  loved his time with them.
3.  During his last days, his nurses and care staff WANTED to be the ones to care for him, and they did so with such kindness and sensitivity, not only to dad, but our whole family!

reviewTitle: Cardinal Village is home sweet home
review_text: Cardinal Village is a very nice and beautiful community this place is home away from home for the elderly very clean and the atmosphere is very relaxing for the elderly.The staff is very friendly and caring that makes it very easy for the residents to fit right in when they come here.

My loved one was previously a resident at SoCo Village and the overall experience was okay. It is a newer facility, however, it is in a busy intersection part of the city and there were lots of homeless around so it didn't feel completely safe when my loved one ventured off from SoCo. There weren't many food/grocery/restaurant options nearby that felt completely safe. My biggest complaint was staff turnover, in all areas, which lead to shortages of all kinds.

I love Phoenix. This is a top notch community. Communication is very important.  Affordable for top notch. My mom has been here since [date removed] and I am very very satisfied. The staff is professional, very attentive, friendly, and meet all my needs and requests in a very timely manner.  When I get a phone message giving me an update on mom, it is not just short, it is detailed and I feel they go above and beyond and that just tells me they are passionate about what they do and that is the key. [name removed] the Executive is on the ball and always great to work with, no question.

5/12/16 - my grandmother was a resident at this facility for 11 years through 3 owners Sunrise, Tranquility and finally Bickford. Of the 3 Bickford has proven to be the worst. In the almost 4 years since they've acquired the facility it has continually declined. [removed] She was very happy there until the last few weeks of her life. Sadly since her death very few changes have been made in a management presence during the weekends. My advice is if you put your loved one here and they require a good amount of care you need to make sure you visit often especially on weekends. I was there at least 5 days a week and it turned out not to be enough. It's a beautiful facility and was once a thriving community and while there are some amazing staff there there are more that just do not care. I think it can be a wonderful place again but changes need to be made.

1BR/1Bath $899/month. 2BR $1,099. Large 2BR $1,250 all utilities included. All apartments $500 non-refundable deposit. All residents must have renter's insurance. Emergency pull cords in bathroom and bedroom. Trained nurses on sight. Grab bar in bathtub. Big bathroom, small kitchen, lots of closet space. Private entrance to outside as well as an entrance from the commons area. Some activities in the building as well as activities with the assisted living community  nearby. Apartments come with a deck or patio. They do offer trips to the store, but you have to sign up early to reserve a spot. Laundry room in building. This property has independent living apartments, assisted living, and a nursing home. There is a lovely lake with fishing allowed and a wooden bridge to walk across. The apartment was clean and fresh. Light housekeeping is available for $60/month. One pet is allowed under 20 pounds with a non refundable deposit of $500. I could see my mom living there.

This is a new community that just opened and dad is settling in very well. The people were involved and friendly. They take care of his medicine for him. They will engage him in the daily activities. He has a 1bdr 1bath with a shared kitchenette. Housekeeping will come in weekly to clean. It also has a nice patio area with a pit out there. They offer 3 good meals a day with snacks as needed. I would recommend this to families.
Property Address: 40 Robert F. Toner Blvd, North Attleborough, MA 02763

reviewTitle: A warm family environment for my mom
review_text: Some of the staff has been there for the 3 years my mom has lived at The Remington. All of the staff are caring folks and work hard to make a comfortable, safe and enjoyable home for the residents.
Property Address: 8707 Valley Ranch Parkway West, Irving, TX 75063

review_text:
Overall, the community is nice, the employees go out of their way to make you feel at home.

I do not care at all for how the dining room is run. When my mother moved in and went to the dining room for the first time She was sat at a table by herself, which made her feel completely ostracized. She has not been back since and refuses to go back, and eats alone in her apartment every night.
Property Name: Five Star Premier Residences of Plantation

reviewTitle: There is so many wonderful things I want to say.
review_text:
I think that this place is nice, its clean and my mom gets good care there. I feel she is very safe there and that is very good to me. The staff is very friendly and helpful and very good. I have not had any complainants only that there was a ant problem in my moms bathroom but they took care of it right away. 

Promenda has plenty of activities but my mom doesn't care to partake in it. They have sing along, current events reading and she is 90 and says "I don't want to hear about all the horrible things going out in the world". They also have bingo and they had kids come in to play games with the elders and my mother actually enjoyed that. They kind of force them to get interactions and its helpful. My mother did have a very hard time adjusting and is receiving the highest level of care. I would definitely recommend this place to anyone. They accommodate in every way. My mom doesn't like the food but she is a very picky eater but she said the soup is good. She has two aids that she loves, my mother said "my face lights up when Donna walks into the door and I now the day will be great". A Place for Mom was wonderful I didn't know where to start when she was declining and than it was like boom I  was so happy I had looked at some places before all of that happened. A Place for Mom was so helpful to me they gave me places, ideas. Also the Promenade told me even if she runs out of money they do take medicaid and not very many areas do that. Martina Donahue told me about other places that would be great as well. But this place has a support group once a month with the social worker and anyone that wants to come. I have found them so helpful.
Property Address: 168 Red Schoolhouse Rd, Chestnut Ridge, NY 10977

review_text: Community is usually clean. Previous to the Covid-19 pandemic, the activities were pretty good. We do think the quality and variety of the food are pretty good as well. I do think the price is reasonable given the level of care they are offering at Atria Crossroads Place.

reviewTitle: Toured May 13th doesn't allow pets, a...
review_text: Toured May 13th doesn't allow pets, all one level, spoke with the director.

We chose Sky Pointe because it is all independent living so they were much more open during the covid time. We also loved the whole facility, it felt very warm and welcoming. They availability as well and the price for Denver was excellent. The apartment sizes here are great and super spacious, my mother has plenty of room and I think she has the smallest apartment that they offer. I would recommend to others looking

Brookdale Brushy Creek is a very clean community and that was something that stood out right away. All of the residents we saw seemed to be well taken care of, and we would recommend this community to others.
I've been at Waterford going on 6 year and I'm very pleased with staff. Residents become family.

reviewTitle: Review of Park Crescent Healthcare and Rehabilitation Center
review_text: Some of the dining staff are friendly and some are not.
Property Name: Park Crescent Healthcare and Rehabilitation Center
Property Address: 480 N Walnut St, East Orange, NJ 07017

reviewTitle: Best Caregivers and Directors at this one!!!!
review_text: Toured two other communities and realized that most of them offered the same amenities and around the same rates so what finally nailed it for me was the staff.  At the other two no one made eye contact with me. Very few staff members were smiling. They just seemed miserable.  Walked in to Shallowford Elmcroft and it was amazing. Everyone smiling and seemed very happy to be there (residents and staff).  Everyone made eye contact, smiled, introduced themselves (even the residents). You cannot beat the care at this community. The staff definitely stand out.

A nightmare from day 1.  They were way understaffed and what staff they had was very inexperienced.  Mother's care was so terrible we didn't leave leave her side during the day.  We got her out of there as soon as we could
Property Address: 13700 NE Salmon Creek Ave, Vancouver, WA 98686

reviewTitle: Review of The Woodmark at Sun City
review_text: The community is beautiful. All of the staff is very caring and attentive. And, their cook is superb! The food is delicious! I recommend Woodmark to all my clients who are looking for independent or assisted living or even Memory Care.
Property Address: 17207 North Boswell Boulevard, Sun City, AZ 85373

reviewTitle: Nice looking place, and very personable staff
review_text: This was the location we selected for my loved one, and we're pleased with it. It's a nice looking place, it is an older building but they obviously take very good care of it. I liked how it was a single floor, I didn't want my loved one to have to worry about stairs or elevators. The staff were very knowledgeable and knew just the right questions to ask to be able to provide more personal care. They were much more flexible in terms of their care philosophy than other communities we looked at.

Mom is settling in well at Sterling Ridge. The main reason why we chose this community is the people who work there are all have caring, honest, genuine personalities. Mom is really happy with the quality of care they are providing for her. The atmosphere when you enter the lobby is warm and inviting. While some of the amenities need some updating, it is the people who make the place a great place to live. Some of the meals they prepare are good but if you don't like what is served there is a daily menu to choose something else. They offer activities to the residents but they do not push them to participate which is a good fit for my mom. She is very pleased with her room, one bedroom with a small living area. There is a small courtyard that she enjoys walking around and enjoying the fresh air. I would highly recommend this community to others who might find it to be a great fit for their loved one.
We were very fortunate to find Legends for mom. She has been well taken care of. We never wanted to take mom out of her home, but we had no choice. Legend has been the best place for her.

I have visited several times and the community is absolutely beautiful inside and out. The staff is very friendly and welcoming and I would absolutely recommend taking a tour and seeing for yourself!!
Dining room super wait staff [Removed] is always helpful. She always asks about residents that are ill and worries about those who aren't eating.

reviewTitle: A place where there's an opportunity for quality of life - IF you take advantage of it
review_text:
It's important to note that my loved one doesn't like it here, but he wouldn't like it anywhere.
From his point of view, it'd be a completely different perspective from mine because he doesn't want to be there, but knows he can't be at home. So he's unhappy with a lot of things. For example: the activities - I know they have them and they offer them, but he wont initiate or engage in them. He hasn't experienced them because he doesn't want to, even though we try to encourage him to do so. With the dining experience: they offer round the clock food with different items and three meals a day, but he only goes down for lunch although we try to encourage him to go down more often. But because he won't, we bring him extra food. He's not utilizing a lot of the services, so it's not as bad as what it may seem to be in his eyes. He has troubles speaking up in regards to care services, but from what I've seen they try to do things for him. Another example: he stopped physical therapy because his arms were hurting, but most times you have to build muscle which can result in soreness. So the perspective behind it is that unfortunately my loved one would not be happy anywhere. 

I know that right now every industry & staffing is an issue. What I've seen is a lot of different staff coming and going with Rock Creek and with that, there are some things that haven't been done. It appears to me that they are trying. The staff issue is noticeable, especially in his case. He really liked one lady and so did I, she was fantastic, but she left. There have been a string of people that have left including directors. There's been three directors since November. There are inconsistencies in the staffing area. There's no chef, but the times I've experienced the meals it hasn't been that bad. There have still been inconsistencies, as other residents there have mentioned that it's not the best. My loved one doesn't take full advantage, but some of the menu items and combinations have been a little questionable. For example: they had a July 4th party where they served hot dogs with beans. Staffing I think is an issue as people need more help, but when you have staff coming and going there are going to be inconsistencies. 


Although my loved one doesn't participate, as I walk through I've noticed that there are activities always going on. They have bingo, Uno, a lounge area, a workout area, and a garden. 
The medical at this point is great. He fell one time and had to go to the emergency room; they were right on top of that and made sure he got there. They recognized the fact that he had an infection gong on, so the medical staff seem to be on board and they know what's going on. The other day he made a comment and the head nurse and / or medical director came to him to clarify some things. So I think the medial staff does a pretty good job. 
One thing we were originally told from the Assisted Living Director, who is no longer there, was that a nurse practitioner would be there every month and that does happen; but we were also told that he would be able to see a Doctor once every six months. He hasn't seen a Doctor yet and it's been past that. I'm unsure if that was a misunderstanding or if its supposed to be included - but I think it'd be nice to have a Doctor who could come and speak with the residents. 

Rock Creek Senior Living is a nice facility and it's in a nice area. I picked my loved one's apartment which overlooks a greenery of trees and a creek. Some people don't always have that option, some people face the parking lot, so that aspect of it makes it a pretty nice place. It's located in a nice clean part of town. I also think it's great that they work in conjunction with the hospice service, whether it's immediate or a long-term event. That's a nice feature that the residents don't have to leave the community. The fact that they work hand in hand with a hospice service is a nice surprise for us.

Everything is positive, and perfect.  They take care of the residents.  They are keeping up with some activities even during COVID.

They have had Singing in Doorways, happy hour where they walked around with wine, a piano player was brought in and they sectioned the community room, there was even a dinosaur that has walked around.
Property Address: 1301 Laurel Oak Rd, Voorhees Township, NJ 08043

reviewTitle: Review for Vitalia Senior Residences of Montrose
review_text:
The actual facility is in a completely different league than any of the others we looked at. Just beautiful 
FYI we looked into 8 places. All the staff  at Vitalia from management to care givers to nurses to wait staff to activity coordinator were/are all helpful kind and cheerful. Not that other assisted living homes we looked at were bad at all, just not in the same class

The facility is very attractive and well-maintained. The management and staff are very capable and management displays general concern, with the physical or medical aspects of residents. There is transportation for shipping, appointments, church, and offsite gatherings. In summary, a great place to reside and call home.

I have been a resident for over three years. My husband passed away about seven months ago. Our life here together was a wonderful experience providing us with a life of friends, activities, and a diverse calendar of events. Now that I am alone, it has been life-saving to me in mind and spirit.

My wife & I toured several & after we finished up we feel Citadel was the favorite & right place for my parents when it’s time to make that move. [Name removed] was our tour guide & was very helpful & fun to be with.[name removed] our Senior Living Advisor [name removed] is great help to find the right community. Thanks! D&E.

reviewTitle: Review of Rose Garden Nursing And Rehabilitation
review_text: So far everything has gone very well. It is clean and friendly.
Property Address: 1579 Old Freehold Rd, Toms River, NJ 08753

review_text: I visited this community and it was so well put together and beautiful. The workers are all so amazing and care about everyone so much. I was blown away by all the staff, and the way everyone was so happy to be there.

Our family had an in person tour with Oaks at Habersham and the reason for the overall rating is simply because they seemed confused. We had an appointment and we waited for like 30 minutes before anyone came to talk with us. So we were turned off pretty quick there. Plus there pricing to is was a little steep for that place.

From our first moments here, we have seen smiling faces everywhere, and we have never felt patronized or uncomfortable. The staff and the management are sincere, warm, and genuine. They really enjoy their jobs and the people they work for. We were warmly welcomed immediately by both the staff and the other residents. The activities here are excellent. One resident told us when we arrived that "If [we] are bored, it's [our] fault." and that is right. There are lectures here, efforts for the homeless, happy hours, live entertainment, and so many other things. They also have excellent groundskeepers here and cheerful housekeepers that come once a week. We are so happy here. I really do think this is one of the best communities
Property Address: 8700 N La Cholla Blvd, Tucson, AZ 85742

reviewTitle: Better quality of service and care at a better price
review_text: Our loved one seems to be very happy at Carriage House, and compared to the precious community she is enjoying these meals so much better. She does not participate in activities now but we are working on it and we can see all the different things they do. We also are paying less at Carriage House but receiving more then our loved ones previous community .

Everyone at American Grand was absolutely great to work with.  The marketing manager spent lots of time with us going over everything and giving us tours.  They evaluated Mom right away and we got the last available room they had.  Her condition was not good and I can’t say enough about how wonderful the staff was with her.  They were so understanding and patient with her.  Moms last days were filled with much care that we couldn’t give her.  Even at the end when she passed they took the time to talk with us about her last moments.  They are angels.
Recommend this facility, care is good and facility is clean

reviewTitle: Excellent Care for a Loved One
review_text:
I would highly recommend it.  The community keeps the residents engaged and safe.  They have multiple activities, the friendly nature of the staff, and I think they really take care of the residents.

My loved one had a one bedroom.

The facilities were very bright and inviting. Everything is on the ground floor. The staff was very nice and informative. This senior living facility is all inclusive and even gives all residents a monitor to wear for their safety. We were very impressed and my mother-in-law is happy and signed on right away.
Property Name: Village on the Park Onion Creek

reviewTitle: Review of Glen Mills Senior Living Assisted Living in Glen Mills, PA
review_text: Beautiful place, talked with Laura, she went over everything, showed me around, answered all questions. impressed with the friendliness and cleanliness.  reasonable pricing. very accomodating for moms needs.
TERRIFIC! :-)

reviewTitle: Excellent Community, Staff and Experience. Highly recommend!
review_text: From what we've experienced so far, I'd give Peterson Meadows a 5 in all categories. We haven't needed/experienced much related to category 4 as my Mom is under Independent living and doesn't require much concerning quality of care, physically/health/medical. However, I've got a confidence that they earn a 5 in that category as well for those that require more care and/or if my Mom ever does.

A wonderful touring experience! Very welcoming. Was not what I was expecting. Very friendly and engaging staff. Definitely a consideration. I love their age in place philosophy. They took the time with us and made us feel like we were already a part of their communiry. No question was left unanswered.

reviewTitle: Review of Pacifica Senior Living Spring Valley - Las Vegas, NV
review_text: Every caregiver is excellent. They care for the community residents & show compassion. The Directors are on point & making the community great. The ED pay attention to the needs of the residents & know them all by name.
Property Address: 8880 West Tropicana Avenue, Las Vegas, NV 89147

review_text: I've met new friends and have a new extended family.

We have already gotten Mom situated. We love Amethyst Gardens. Mom had fallen and we didn't know at that time that she was having problems with daily activities. When we went to Amethyst, we set it up so that she could have assistance with dressing. It turns out that Mom got better and she did not need the assistance. We did not really utilize the service and they credited our money back. It really was nice of them to do that. The food could be a little bit better.

reviewTitle: Review for Chapel Hill Senior Living
review_text: It's the nurses, housecleaning, dining, and other staff that make Chapel Hill a great fit for my mother. Staff are excellent. But the administrative side needs to increase their van driver recruitment/retention efforts because missed medical appointments due to driver unavailability is problematic and should be avoided at all costs.
Property Address: 10 Old Diamond Hill Rd, Cumberland, RI 02864

review_text: We toured several Emeritus locations while looking into options for Mom, and while this was not the one we selected it was a nice looking community. Everything looked good during our tour, but we ended up selecting another location based on accessibility for our family, and a great experience with the staff.
Thank you for looking after much loved family members and for being there today.

reviewTitle: Good Place if you need help.
review_text: If you are independent it is great. I am one of the youngest residents. Most of the other residents are much older around 90 and the activities are geared more to older people. I would like some more active or outdoor activities added. They have larger units than others in the area. It has a nice layout and a walking area around the building. They have a nice exercise room.I am unhappy with the food. They have not worked with my dietary needs as they promised.
A fabulous place to live. I am absolutely thriving.

Wet good experience with the sales marketing lady [name removed]. She’s wonderful. Place is nice and staff is awesome but it’s more nursing care than other assisted living and because of that kind of expensive for not having much to do.
Property Address: 1250 W Central Rd, Arlington Heights, IL 60005

review_text: I love all the new property updates interior and exterior.staff is very professional. They make you feal welcomed and at home are are very helpful .
Property Name: Great American Assisted Living at Tampa

review_text: I have really enjoyed my dinning experience,my needs have been more than met when it comes to the food it is absolutely excellent. They have great activities on campus including my favorite one the singing group. I would defiantly recommend this community to a family member or a friend.

reviewTitle: great choice for a loved one, excellent care, attentive staff
review_text:
Always available any time with love and excellent care. My mom passed there on [date removed] of this year..was so thankful that she took her last breath with [name removed]!

I would recommend with no hesitation!

I think it's better than the other ones we checked out because the main thing I didn't like about the other places was that they had assigned seating at meals. He sleeps at odd times and he's very gregarious so I didn't think he'd like to be with the same people for every meal, he'd get bored. The food is fine, the people are very friendly, everyone's friendly and they had a meet your neighbor evening so he could play the fiddle. He's memory's not that great and he's easily distracted so it's hard for him to get anywhere fast so that was good. It's also nice that he has to go downstairs and walk to food, so that's much better for him. Most of the time the care is good, you have to keep after them to make sure things get done. i find I'm spending a lot of time there to make sure he gets up for meals.
Too high in price.
Property Address: 6605 North Quail Hollow Road, Memphis, TN 38120

review_text: We were atrracted, to the staff and the reviews. I talked to people who had loved ones here. We picked this community, because they were proffessional, I liked the friendliness,and they went above and beyond to make us feel welcomed. It seemed like a better fit for my loved one.The billing has been an issue, so it would be nice if they had a better system, and followed-up with phone calls. I would recommend to other families.

So grateful to get to partner with The Waterford Fort Worth! Their team is knowledgeable, understanding of their residents and always go above and beyond to keep patients safe and in their “home” with the utilization of additional services like caregivers, home health and hospice.
I was let go yesterday and was sad. Today something happened for the better I was blessed all I want to say is thank you and wish you the best . We all deserve to b happy

They are unorganized, probably understaffed. We have been trying to get a doctor appointment scheduled for weeks, it is still not scheduled. My mom likes the food. She feels safe here. Most everyone is friendly.

My sister has lived in Avalon Assisted Care, Memory Care, for approximately five years. Every time I visit her and leave, I go out the door and am extremely grateful for the staff that works there and for the care that she receives. I leave her and I know that she is in extremely good hands!
I am also appreciative of the many activities that are provided for her at Memory Care.

I feel that Jhonathon is a very good supervisor and tries to keep families informed about events regarding their loved ones, as well as events that occur at Memory Care. I also feel that during the time that he has been the supervisor, the facility has undergone some very positive physical changes and presents a very warm and inviting atmosphere.

reviewTitle: If you love your family dont send them here
review_text: 1 star is generous but didn’t have a choice. Horrible place for any human being to ever be at. Continuity of care is non existent. Nurses and CNAs treat the residents horribly. They do not provide medical equipment to residents like they are supposed to. Management is a joke, all they care about is money. If you’re in the healthcare field and your family member is there they will try to kick them out to cover up the wrong they are doing.  The building doesn’t provide enough supplies for CNAs to properly take care of the residents. A CNA was put in the social worker position with no license and telling everyone she is the social worker. She is not licensed at all and has no idea what she is talking about when she calls family members on the phone. This place needs to be shut down.

The staff is very personable, polite, and helpful.  The main areas are always kept very clean and tidy. The staff will communicate with family when needed and has always called to notify me of emergencies with our loved one. I would most definitely recommend this facility to family and friends to provide care for someone.

We moved my mom to Crystal Creek into the assisted living about 4 months ago and we are so happy that we did! My mother loves the caregivers and has met so many friends (this was a problem at the last facility) because the activities team works to get the residents involved. She loves the food and has fun with all of the outings. For us the biggest plus was communication is no longer an issue. When we call, we get a prompt response from the Director. Something that seems impossible at other communities. We wished we would have moved her here first but so grateful that we found the best place.
She's really happy there. It's really good. We looked around for various different place and this was the best choice. It was a smaller group of people where she could get more attention.

We chose Brookdale Reno because when i visited I got a good first impression. The room sizes here are very spacious. The food is served off a menu with choices the residents are able to choose from. The staff members here are also very friendly and I would recommend to others looking.

Helena Square is a small/cozy community that feels like home as soon as you walk in the door. Family, friends and pets are welcome. There is a beautiful courtyard filled with flowers that feels perfect for rocking on the porch. Activities are endless and so much fun! The staff is friendly and reliable. Helena Square is a great place to live!!
near hospital  near shopping

Things have gone well so far with The Lantern at Morning Pointe. It's a nice looking place, and the staff have all been very friendly. The entire place just has a very welcoming atmosphere. My loved one really enjoys that they bake fresh cookies every morning! Overall it is a very nice place, and worth a look if you're looking into options in the area.
Property Name: The Lantern at Morning Pointe of Lexington

review_text: So far our experience with The Pines on Carmel Senior Living has been really good so far. The staff and care services have been great we are super pleased with that. When we get to visit our loved one or speak with them over the phone they say how good the meals and dining service has been so far.
Property Name: The Pines on Carmel Senior Living

review_text: I was impressed when walking into this facility; however, when touring the rooms, I thought it was quite dark and gloomy in the halls.  If a senior had any confusion they wouldn't know how to get around.  Too large of a place for my mom.

After a terrible experience at another memory care facility, I was very nervous about moving my Alzheimer's afflicted father into Rivendell Legends. He has always taken care of me, & I wanted him lovingly cared for when I couldn’t.  I could not have chosen a better place for him. The staff has been unfailingly kind, caring & involved. They put me at ease with her obvious concern for my dad & the rest of our family, answered all my questions & assured me that the staff at Legends was highly trained, patient & caring.  The intake with my father was done at his previous facility to minimalize the effect on his routine.  The director made sure that I not only felt comfortable  and gave me his cell number so that I could reach him at any time if I had concerns or questions. He even came to my home to complete the paperwork. The day we moved my dad into the facility, he spent hours with him, making sure he was taken care of & comfortable while we completed the move. I’m beyond grateful!

reviewTitle: A great place for loved ones!
review_text: Sunrise of Lenexa has been a great place for our mother. The staff members there are very friendly and it just has an overall nice atmosphere. When our loved one is hungry she says the food is very good, and the activities are starting to come back.

reviewTitle: Love and Care for a friend
review_text: I really liked the care my good friend received here. She liked the staff and we would of not gotten better care then then what she did receive here. The community is very clean and nice. The food was extremely good. They did have activities, and did enjoy the live music. The care and the love that is shown here is outstanding. They kindness was so meaningful to see that she was so greatly taken care of here.

The CNAs are understaffed and have a hard time keeping people. I believe that it's up to family members to have communications with care givers when they aren't there, and you have to make sure it's accurate.
Property Address: 1500 W Warm Springs Rd, Henderson, NV 89014

review_text: Ratings above
Life Guidance unit is below par.  This [removed] does not hire some staff that likes being there. It has not been a good experience.
Property Address: One Elizabeth Court, Rocky Hill, CT 06067

review_text: The building needs to be upgraded. Ice hanging from everywhere. ceilings are leaking. some of the residents need more help in the dining area. Staff is very friendly and helpful to my mom.
Property Address: 2006 Five Mile Line Road, Penfield, NY 14526

review_text: So far Park Place has been all that we could expect. But it is a little too early for me to give a complete 5 star rating.

My daughter lives in Denver and was looking for a nice place in the area CO - DEN, she found Melody living brand new, staff and management are great. I have found so many lovely new friends, I enjoy the dinning room and Bingo.
Property Name: Melody Living of Colorado Springs Independent Living

review_text: I had very good tours of many places with one being Foothills Place. The nice lady that took us around did a very good job in giving me information and answering my questions, Everyone there was friendly in the facility itself was very clean and in good shape. It all came don to location and personal preference.
The community is doing the best they can during covid.  I would recommend this community to others

reviewTitle: Review for American House Elmwood Senior Living
review_text: Very happy with American house Elmwood yes, I would recommend it to others.
Property Address: 2251 West Auburn Road, Rochester Hills, MI 48309

review_text: Maplewood at Southport looked great and a good option. Based on the surface and what we saw. That does not pertain to the activities/food/quality of care etc. because we do not have a loved one there. I thought my aunt would be a better fit at another facility though.

We are not sure on the activities, but as for the value for cost that is so far so good. Spring Gardens Draper community really has a good atmosphere . The building is beautiful but the employees are all so great and that's what really counts.
This is a wonderful place to live.

reviewTitle: The location of this community is absolutely wonderful!
review_text: The staff members are very good, It is a little expensive but for us its worth it. Prior to COVID and even after they have entertainment twice a week with dinner which is very nice, they also have bingo, a gym and arts and crafts. The food here is absolutely wonderful, they have a great variety to choose from. On Sundays we get our food delivered and we even drink champagne and watch the footballs games. Our apartment and terrace is very spacious and very beautiful. The view is gorgeous, we have a marina right in front of our terrace and we can walk down to the local restaurants.
