I toured this community while looking into care options for a loved one. The facility was well kept and clean, and all of the staff I met seemed friendly and professional. We ended up selecting another community, but this is somewhere I would have considered as an option for my loved one.

My loved one has improved since she has been there. The food gets to her cold and late. At first we had problems with the nurses talking bad. All has been resolved but the food. The nurses are slow but the staff are really nice. I go there every day and some days they do not sweep her room. Things spill on the floor and I have to ask them to clean it. Overall it is good.
My parents moved to the Sheridan three months ago.  A+

My stay with Regency was pleasant only because the people at Regency are wonderful!

Many thanks to Carole, Rosemary, Carmella, Salina, Marybeth, Kristen, Kendra, Tyrone, Toya Veronica, Mary, Liliana, Kerry. 

If I missed anyone you know I thank you so very much!

Liz C.
Amazing staff that care so much about their residents. Everything about this place amazes me. Thank you for all your hard work.
Very nice.....clean.....Owner and husband very helpful......
Property Address: 15080 De Ville Place, San Antonio, TX 78248

review_text: They want a 2500 dollar entry fee and over 4000 for a studio and one bedroom and then you bring your own furniture. There are less expenisive, better options, closer.

Having actually LIVED at Montara Meadows from Feb. 26th until April 1, 2018, I'm definitely in a better position than most to give an opinion about living there 24/7 for an entire month.

First, however, let me tell you that I did meet some really great ladies and men there during my stay and the staff behind the front desk, the cooks and waiters, chefs and food handlers are all just great people and weight on the residents hand and foot.  They are all very nice, warm and friendly and really care about making us all happy at meal times!  They were great to us and I had a lot of fun teasing and having fun joking around with them.  They also prepare really nice food but during my month stay, the kitchen was being remodeled so it made it really hard on everyone, especially the food service staff to get our food to us hot, but all things considered, they did a good job!  Having styrofoam cups and plastic glasses, and then plastic eating utensils, is not what I expected, but it wasn't their fault.  Monday, April 2nd, however, the kitchen was supposed to open back up as normal.  Since I'm not there anymore (thank God) I can only assume things improved for everyone by now! 

The buildings were built a long, long time ago and I'm sure when they were "new" they were truly amazing, however...it's now 2018 and other than the main building/clubhouse/dining room, living room, etc., it's still the same as it was decades ago. 

That in itself is bad enough, but when you add the fact that people smoked a lot back then - cigars included - those disgusting odors have lingered and remained in the old, worn out, carpeting that runs throughout the entire hallways and lobbies in each of their buildings.
The stench of all that old smoke is really nasty but to add to that - the overstuffed, outdated, old furniture also is full of that smell too.

The ceilings are all "popcorn" and the walls of every hallway and lobby are covered with large, heavy printed framed "artwork"....like what your great grandma would have hung over her mantle times 100!   

The place has horrible cell reception AND no one has WiFi in their rooms or in their buildings for that matter!

So, if you don't stay in the main building to use your device - good luck trying to reach anyone on the outside!  If you do, however, the call will drop every now and then at the very least.  Most annoying! :(

The fact this entire facility has ONE DESK TOP computer in the main bldg. (2nd floor) - is the only way you're going to be able to reach the outside world - but only between 7:30am and 7:30 pm, 7 days a week!  lf you are on the PC, however, and someone else wants to use it, then you have to stop what you're doing and let them use it.  

The room I had was clean, quiet and faced north on the second floor so at least I had that luxury.  The view out that slider was really nice, but it didn't make up for the fact I had no internet or WiFi in my room - or building.

Of course, pay for internet and altho they provide FREE basic Cox TV cable - you would have to pay more to upgrade that.

All that being said, however, the main reason I was miserable there was because I was given the impression there were other ACTIVE, INDEPENDENT seniors living there, which turned out to not be true.

The average age of the men/women at MM is 85+ and some are in their 90's and one super great lady is 100!  

Therefore, I was the only one much younger than all the rest, so I spent all my time there ALONE - either on the PC or in my room watching TV.  Meals, however, were fun for me because I got to sit with those I really enjoyed being with but that was only 3 times a day. 

Of course, I was able to walk around the neighborhood so I tried that five times the first two weeks, but then decided it wasn't worth the trouble.  The entire area around MM is IMO - an old, dirty, run-down slum.  Even the stores around there were old, nasty and dirty.

Then there was the great "Geezer Express" or shuttle.
This bucket of bolts should have been sent to the dump at least 10 yrs ago...and yet, it's still chugging along.  Wait till you ride that thing a few miles...you won't believe how awful it is.  I thought my back was broken the first time we came back from Walmart on Eastern Avenue.

Now, if all of this has you wondering why I wound up there, let me just say this..."it wasn't like it was in the brochure" and I was grossly mislead on the phone as to the others my age that were living here.  l never did find them or the purple unicorn either for that matter.

Now comes the real kicker!

I paid $2,200 a month for my 550-sq-foot apt with a tiny kitchenette AND on top of that - $2.5K for the homeowners fee.   They make you sign papers that you will pay them $2.2K x 3 months but on top of that the $2.5K HOA fee at the same time!  It's a 90-day lease and can't be broken period! 

Of course, after the 90-day period is over, your rent is month-to-month.  

Well, if you do the math on this, that's a S-load of money for what I just described to you!

A lot of the people at MM should not even be there in the first place.  They should be in either a nursing home or an assisted living facility.  They are NOT active or independent as 90% of them cannot get around without a wheeled walker or an electric scooter.  

Some have dementia, Alzheimer, or are on meds so they can't think clearly but even worse than that, some are extremely handicapped, missing arms or an eye,
so that's really hard to get used to seeing all day every day if you have never been around that before.  It's very sad really, but there have also been some that have gone away in an ambulance never to return. :( 

So, I guess what I'm trying to tell you is BUYER BEWARE!  

If only I had seen the area around Montara in person, I never would have looked twice at it.  It's a fairly nice looking place but it's surrounded by a ghetto in my opinion.  It faces East Tropicana Ave., which is one of the busiest, 4-lane streets in the entire city of Las Vegas, so you can only imagine how scary it is walking near that or living on top of that street!  It did get very quiet after midnight, however...so that was nice.

There is no central a/c in the rooms either.  They have a window unit but it's stuck in the wall and you have no idea what the temp. in your room is, only what you set it on.  That's really not good either, but at least it works.

The other thing which never occurred to me before Montara - and that was - how low to the floor their commodes are!  Maybe back in the 1950's they thought it was a good idea to sit as close to the floor as possible when you used the restroom...but to me that's dreadful!

The older you get, the harder it is to get up and down from a chair - so imagine a commode as low to the floor that you could possible imagine.  That's just insane!

Anyway...the manager is a super nice gal and I will always think fondly of her and several other staff members too, but as a woman who worked in business offices my entire life (1965-2009) I find it very inappropriate for any woman in a "front desk" reception position to show as much cleavage as possible without being arrested.  It's just so out of place in a senior facility and yet, this very nice gal - who happens to be about 50 pounds overweight, thinks it's "cool" to sit down behind the main lobby counter and show off as much of her huge chest as possible!  

So, remember this....

If you think that spending $3K+ for 90 days is worth all of this I just described...by all means go there and sign up for a room!  The 1-bedrooms are $1.2K/month but the "studios" are only $1K per month....just don't forget that you will pay the $2.5K over the first 90-day period in addition to the rent for the "one time only" HOA!

I moved out 4/1/18 but MM will still take out another ton of money from my bank account up until 5/26!

Be aware of something else too...

There are quite a few
Property Address: 3150 East Tropicana Avenue, Las Vegas, NV 89121

review_text: I toured Arden Cts. A very well run and N.C community. The staff was very knowledgeable and kind. Would recommend for a love one.
Property Name: Arden Courts A ProMedica Memory Care Community in Glen Ellyn
Property Address: 2 South 706 Park Blvd., Glen Ellyn, IL 60137

reviewTitle: Review of Senior Suites Of Jefferson Park - Chicago, Il
review_text: It is a very nice place to live. The staff is very good and there is always something to do.
This facility did not work out for us. We have transferred to another facility where she is now happy.
Property Address: 208 W Due West Ave, Madison, TN 37115

review_text: Sunrise is a beautiful, homey, friendly, clean, and flowers everywhere home for my Mom,
Property Address: 11621 New Hampshire Avenue, Silver Spring, MD 20904

reviewTitle: Apartment is nice. Management needs improvement.
review_text:
I've been here less than 3 months and the elevator has been down 3 times. Last time it was for a week. I'm on the fourth floor and in a wheelchair so.... I've been stuck on my floor. 
The building manager was new and only here about 2 to 3 weeks before I got here and had quit already due to stress. Most buildings have a full time manager but this one is supposed to be here Monday, Wednesday and every other Friday. If you're lucky. 
I've also put in a few needs request more than once and I'm still waiting for them to get done.
On the upside the residents are VERY nice and friendly people. They are always ready to help me.
This is a nice looking community.  They seem to offer some nice amenities. This community has a nice porch to enjoy the outside and an enclosed courtyard.

everything is going great since LivHOME have come in and start helping out my mom. It's taking a time to adjust with someone new coming in and helping out, but I know it will take some time and thats okay. The people that have come in and helped have been very nice and responsive. They have answered every call and every text so I would say their responsive time is very good. I would say that the agency is very good at listening and finding a caregiver that fits your needs.
Property Address: 3459 Holcomb Bridge Rd., Suite 100, Peachtree Corners, GA 30092

review_text: The memory care section is very depressing, the staff is not as caring or involved or as friendly as the assisted living side. Weekend staff are AWFUL.  You get an ignored depressed feeling walking into the locked memory care doors.

Vibrant community, with weekly concerts in the park and many things to do. Having 45 meals for independent living included was a value. Many little perks and peace of mind for safety with emergency call pulls in the apartment in case of emergencies is an added benefit. Great dining & Coffee/cocktail socializing places for family and friends. The atmosphere was happy social.

The Atrium cares for advanced memory care residents and my loved one wasn't as advanced.  There were some staff that were exceptional, and some staff were not.  The community itself is large.  I was initially told that my loved one would be able to mingle with residents that were not as far along in their memory care health as others.  This didn't happen.  

We ended up moving my loved one, due to they needed a smaller community.  I can tell the staff really care about their residents here.
Property Address: 1160 Elm St Ext, Rocky Hill, CT 06067

review_text: My loved one says that as far as the food is concerned, a lot of the times what is displayed on the menu is not what they are serving. Also she says that she would like to see more choices available as well.

reviewTitle: Thanks for making a tough situation easier!
review_text: Received a referral from A Place for Mom on a situation where I needed a nurse  to care for my father while I went to work.  I started communicating with John about three days prior.  He was so ez to reach and extremely responsive!  He even provided me with additional numbers to reach him or a representative after hours as my situation was evolving somewhat over those days.  As well, he was thorough with information.  The nurse he sent was extremely professional and took great care of my father.  As a matter of fact, he invited her to dinner with us when I came back to meet them.  I can't say enough about the ease and professionalism of this experience.  In this day and age, it's rare, but it does exist in this case.  I would use them again, as well as recommend them.
Very pleasant and friendly atmosphere- attractive and comfortable rooms - great staff! Dining room very pleasant with large tables, good service and very nice and a cured menu, cooked well.

My Mom has been at Belmont several years and has been in memory care the last 4-5 years.  In all of the times I have been there to visit her, I have never seen the staff be anything but caring and nurturing to all of the residents there.  My Mom can be very difficult to deal with so that says a lot.   She has never said anything negative about any staff member and that says a lot as well.   She is always telling me how good the food is there as well.

The only thing to consider before choosing Belmont -- they do not have low income beds.  So in another few years if her money runs out, we will be forced to place her in another facility in the area.

if you are looking for a senior style apartment with a sprinkle of assistance, then this may be a good fit.  For dementia it is TERRIBLE.  Their memory care is not for high functioning.
In the assisted living section, my mother was consistently having issues.  i found out she was sleeping in her jeans and no one would encourage or help her get ready for bed.  management would ignore my calls and actually had a text group with other staff not to talk to us.
Food was acceptable at best.  lots of fried.  but it was served "restaurant style".
we have found a much much better place and have had zero issue since moving out of oakleaf/ kempton of greenville.  i have learned a LOT about what is going on at assisted living facilities and what to look for.
dont be fooled by the pretty decor.

Toured here in search of a place for our Aunt.  (CA March 2013).  We liked the facility and the staff.  We thought it had a nice feel and could definitely have seen our Aunt here.  The price for the area $4K+ we thought was pretty reasonable.  We chose another facility further west of Leesburg that we would have used had GA not made more fiscal sense.  This was our second choice for this area - just didn't look forward to driving east on Rte 7 into Leesburg.  Wife (nurse) got all the right answers.  When asked about turnover - lady was honest and admitted higher than they'd like - but that seems to be the norm in this field - CNAs nor nurses just don't get paid enough!
We chose A New Well because they were able to be flexible and meet our scheduling needs. I would recommend them.
Property Name: A New Well, Inc - Peachtree City
Property Address: 401 Westspark Court, Suite 200, Peachtree City, GA 30269

review_text: All the staff, and Amy herself, are all very friendly.  Mom is in a very friendly and sociable environment.  I looked at a lot of different places for mom, and Amy's was the best.  She has a fireplace in her room, and it's a great facility in a great neighborhood.  I really don't think I could have done any better!
Destinations Oakey has been rebuilt and looks really good, the rooms are nice, a beautiful dining room. The employees are all very friendly and care about me. Food is good, Activities are fun!
Property Address: 3900 W Oakey Blvd, Las Vegas, NV 89102

review_text: We chose Griswold Home Care because it was needed at the time and I did not have a lot of time to look around. We have never had any issues with scheduling so that has been good. It is a 3rd party to a 3rd party, I report to a hiring person and then she calls the director of the company so it can get a little messy if we have any issues. I would recommend to others who are looking, but it is expensive.
Property Name: Griswold Home Care of Mesquite, TX

review_text: I came to this community to visit and it's really beautiful.  The residents seemed really happy together.  The staff was very personable and genuinely showed that they care.  The chef made a great meal for us too!  Very happy!

My mom stayed there for 3 weeks while we went on a trip. The communication process was a little lacking. 

Nobody asked me what time we were coming to check in. We got there at 8 am and had to wait and ask for help for a cart to put mom’s things on and had to ask the nurses to find out which room was hers. I also didn’t know I was supposed to bring a trash can and towels. 

But when I picked her up she seemed fine and we didn't have any issues after getting home. Surprisingly, it was like we had never left her. 

I just wish we had some sort of log that told us what she did while she was there but they apparently don’t keep those kinds of records.
So I don’t know if they took her out for lunch or on any outings. 

And they didn’t keep track of any visitors she had.  So I don’t know how she did or what she did. 

But my two sons told me they visited her. My oldest brought his kids to see her and sent me pictures and videos of their visit and my mom seemed so happy to see them.
Property Name: Briar Glen Alzheimer's Special Care Center

review_text: My Mom is now living in a memory care unit at Springfield Residence in Wyndmoor ,Pa.From the moment I entered the property I could tell that this place was different.Every one we came across greeted us with a hello. The staff was very reassuring and answered all our concerns about my Mom coming from another state,Florida.The place is very clean and has a lot of activities which was important to us since we feel Mom needs to be active and stimulated.The residents were pleasant and seemed happy.The room accomendations  are spacious and you can bring your own furniture which is a plus to make it more homey looking.Mom has been there for not quite 2 weeks and already she has made friends and she and her room mate are getting along fine,a perfect match.Would recommend to everyone that if they are looking in this area you would not be disappointed with Springfield residence
Very respectful and work with you to meet the clinet needs.
We have enjoyed the caring and warmth from all the staff. This place is well kept up, thanks to the building engineer. We love living here.

reviewTitle: My review of Autumn View Gardens
review_text: Excellent experience touring the building, residents & facilities. I enjoyed the friendliness of residents, staff members and the warmth of director giving the tour. Very comprehensive and positive.
Property Name: Autumn View Gardens, Assisted Living and Memory Care

review_text: Thx staff is courteous and very helpful. [name removed] maintenance goes out of his way to help us. [name removed] always has greY activities for us and [name removed] the GM is always cheerful and makes us feel special.

It continues to be a great experience with the leadership team of [names removed]. From our first tour, to move in day, until today. They truly make the residents feel special and it’s so appreciated. We feel confident with the care provided, and especially with the staff, who really make the difference. My father-law constantly tells us how comfortable he is and how the staff is like his new family. 
Thank you for everything you do!

reviewTitle: My Mom’s Story at Story Point
review_text: My wife and I decided to move my mom to Story Point Assisted Living in June of 2021. We chose Story Point because it was much more patient centered. The staff really cares about my mother. From the receptionist, to the nursing staff, to the maintenance staff, to the administrators they know who my mother is and act promptly to meet her daily needs. They design daily activities that encourage participation and cognitive stimulation. Mom is very happy about the menu choices that are offered at meal times. There are weekly bus trips, shopping excursions and even sightseeing tours. There’s a weekly movie night in a real movie theater- complete with popcorn! Mom enjoys making her own hairdresser appointments and she really likes the weekly opportunities to attend religious services. Story Point has been a wonderful experience for my mom. She has her sense of humor back and she is enjoying her life again. The patients’ needs come first in this facility and I am thankful for that everyday!

I had a very good tour of this community. Everyone was very kind to my family, and I. The experience was a pleasant one.  The community looked great, and everything was very well-kept. The staff was very kind, and informative. My questions were answered. I will return to get more information about this community, it is a nice facility.

Watermark has the most beautiful indoor pool.  It has glass panels and sliders enclosing it.  As you look out you are surrounded on all sides by 14 acres of large old trees and greenery maintained by a gardening service.  The pool is kept at a comfortable temperature to make walking or swimming enjoyable.  A new easy access door has been recently installed which makes entering and exiting easy.  Anyone coming to Watermark will love the pool!
Property Name: The Watermark at 3030 Park, a CCRC

review_text: The tour at this community was nice but we just knew that this community was not thee right fit for my loved one at the time. They gave me all of the information that I needed and answered all of my questions.
Property Address: 9160 East Desert Cove Ave, Scottsdale, AZ 85260

reviewTitle: Excellent community with a wonderful staff.
review_text: What we really like the most about the Sunrise of Huntcliff Summit is the staff. The staff members were very easy to work with, and the community offered everything we could of asked for and more. We would recommend this community to others

reviewTitle: Definitely the most favored of the on...
review_text: Definitely the most favored of the ones we visited.  The staff was kind, compassionate and gentle while answering qustions and offering information, Very clean, neat but HOMEY and warm.

My loved one is doing much better than he was at first. The rehab therapy is good. The cleanliness is good. The facility is giving me the right information. They contact me every month, but I would like them to let me know what is happening every week or two weeks.

This place is the worst!  Staff lack the proper training to do their jobs.  There are a few special LNAs and nurses, but most are too burned out and don’t care about the residents.  The building is old and in need of upgrades to their heating and cooling system, phone lines, cable, and internet.  Cooling and heating is a major safety issue and temperatures in the resident rooms can be unsafe.  Food is not great.  A lot of processed and canned food and no fresh fruit or veggies.  Concerns and complaints are not addressed and all you get is lip service.  It is a full time job to advocate for your loved one to receive proper treatment and care.  I would look for any other place before going here.

reviewTitle: Being Resourceful to the Uneasy Decision Maker.
review_text:
Resourceful, compassionate, and patient are the adjectives I have been using to describe my experience with Margo, and also the management and staff at Sunrise Senior Living. Not knowing what to expect as I journeyed along the unknown road of senior care selection for my wife, I was overjoyed when I found people who cared about providing a "high quality of living" for their residents. 
I was skeptical when I first considered the idea of a senior living facility for my wife but that soon changed to "Yes" when my heart was satisfied that she would be receiving the loving care that she needs and deserves.
I have entrusted to them, my "Most Valuable Partner."

I was almost sold when I visited with the owners over the phone.  They were knowledgeable, compassionate and professional.  When I entered the house, it was clean and had a fun atmosphere.  The perfect place to put my mom in.  She's been there for about 4 months and on a recent visit to my home, I asked how thing were going and she had nothing but great stuff to say.  That is very comforting since my mom has always said that she did not want to be put in a nursing home.  This is a home up to 8 women, two care givers 24 hours a day and nurses that visit daily to check on the patients.  Fabulous place.
Property Address: 1732 Sherwood Forest Blvd, Baton Rouge, LA 70815

reviewTitle: Review for The Village at Mariners Point
review_text: I would recommend.  Mother has accepted and appears happy and content. We were attracted by the location. 12 minutes from my home.
Property Address: 111 South Shore Drive, East Haven, CT 06512

review_text: This is a beautiful, brand new facility, and so far things seem to be going well for my loved ones! We really liked the floor plans here, as we were able to get a 2 bedroom floor plan that felt like it was designed for two people, as opposed to a master/guest suite type setup. There are a few services that have been a bit rocky so far, which I'm sure is just due to the community being so new. As of this review they have not yet contracted a beautician for their on-site beauty shop. I also am not entirely happy with the visiting PT/OT service they contract with. But they're very willing to listen and work with me on these issues, and we are looking forward to things getting even better than they already are!

reviewTitle: Love this place, just wish it was not...
review_text: Love this place, just wish it was not so far from where I work.
We had a very good tour at Van Mall.  I really liked them - they would have been my 1st choice.  But my loved one preferred a different location.

I was not impressed with this facility. It was way too dirty for it to be this expensive. The percentage of staff members to residents is way too awful and low. I did a tour on the weekend and they only had two staff members for a very large amount of residents. It was dark and dirty here. When I used the community restroom, it was filthy. It just looks run down to me. I was just shocked when I walked in. I couldn't imagine putting someone here let alone anyone wanting to be here. I would not recommend this facility.

Adorable! The colors are inviting, the atmosphere heals just by looking at the pics, love everything  but a bit too pricy for me... would have have full understanding of the costs of living at Windsors. Beautiful!

reviewTitle: Really happy with the care they have!!
review_text: I am very happy with the quality of care that my father has been receiving at this community. The staff have been very helpful and accommodating to all of my mothers needs as best as they can. She has had no issues with the food and has been enjoying the activities they provide.
Property Address: 12016 E Cataldo Ave, Spokane Valley, WA 99206

review_text: We had to move my stepdad into a memory care facility from assisted living .  The move was very short notice but made easy due to the administration’s assistance.  We have been very happy with the care he is receiving.  The staff has been very helpful.

StoneRidge is alive again, post Covid.  We have begun to resume all of the wonderful activities we previously enjoyed. I recently had the pleasure of attending a lecture with a real live presenter!  [name removed] from [place removed]. was the lecturer.  He is a well recognized author/speaker, Newport Historical Society’s architectural historian.  I listened to a Zoom series this past winter at which time he spoke about the architecture and history of the orangeries of the past. His recent live lecture here was about the architecture and history of some of the ‘cottages’ of Newport.  I recommend his work.  [name removed]
Property Name: StoneRidge Senior Care LLC dba StoneRidge

review_text: Bathrooms too small. Older facility.
Property Name: Brookdale High Point North Memory Care
Property Address: 1564 Skeet Club Road, High Point, NC 27265

review_text: I love the homey feel of this beautiful place it is very clean and welcoming! A great place overall.
Property Name: The Wellington at Lake Manassas Community

review_text: I am so glad I live here. Things have changed in my life and the support the other people have given me, has been amazing. So many of the other occupants have experienced what I am going through, really understanding. Their support is very much needed at times.
Property Address: 14201 N Kentucky Ave, Oklahoma City, OK 73134

review_text: We chose Morningside because of the value for the money. I do think that the night time staff are a problem, they were grumpy and not very attentive to residents needs. I did have an issue that my mom was here 32 days and I had to move her because of care she needed, they charged me for an entire month extra for medications and the upgrade for the level of care that she was. Due to our experience I would maybe recommend to others looking.
They are very prompt, efficient, and they fulfill the requests. They help me with cleaning and drive me places to help me run errands. They help to provide what I need when I need it.
Property Address: 3017 W. Ina Rd., Ste. 151, Tucson, AZ 85741

review_text: We have met some wonderful caretakers through Ezra.  Our favorite ones were caring, responsible, patient, and understanding.  When I was away on a short trip last year, I left my mom in the care of a fabulous young woman whom Ezra sent as a live-in. My mom and she got along like two peas in a pod, and I had peace of mind that mom was safe, well-cared for, and having a good time! We have been using Ezra caretakers for over two years now.
Property Address: 1087 Beacon St., Suite 304, Newton Center, MA 02459

review_text: My tour at Windlands South was a good experience.  They provide meals for residents and have people come in to clean and help out.  I felt they were on par with the place I ended up choosing.  But I wanted to be closer to my daughter.  And another minor reason I chose a different place - theirs is a very tall building, which would not good with my vertigo!

reviewTitle: Highly recommended facility for your loved one
review_text: My dad is a resident at Harbourview Assisted Living. Prior to his move in to AL, he was in subacute rehab at Harbourview as well. Admissions was extremely helpful with guiding us step by step during his transition. It is a great feeling to see how far he came along after being in and out of the hospital, thanks to the nursing and rehab team. The staff is extremely attentive to his needs and are always available to discuss our concerns. They care for the residents with grace and compassion.

Since the Peppertree company sold out to Lamplight Inn the care for the seniors has fallen off.  My sister lives there and she has had numerous problems with staff. Her medications are not given accurately or in a timely manner and her requests for a room with no carpet have been ignored. The staff turnover is constant and the persons hired appear to be undertrained. 
It is certainly a shame that the new owners care more about themselves than their seniors in care.

Staff adjectives: Knowledgeable, patient, kind, hard-working.

Facilities adjectives: Safe, clean, good size, comfortable, beautiful grounds, well-maintained
Welcoming and friendly. Great staff and other tenants eager to include you.

This is not a place for mom or dad! Do not schedule a tour. This is the last place on earth anyone would like to live! Criminals are on staff, employees use illegal drugs and do not care about the residents. If you are interested just drop by and look at ALL THE GUEST ROOMS AND INTERVIEW STAFF. MEDICATION IS NOT SAFE! I do not recommend this facility or Corporation!

Not only does the staff treat everyone as family but they are always willing to put in extra work to make sure the needs of the elderly are met with respect! My nana has lived there for almost 9 months and they treat her with respect and kindness. Highland Glen works together as an amazing team!
Staff was friendly and helpful. Residents all seemed happy. Building was well maintained.
Property Name: Westwood Commons, a DePaul Senior Living Comm
Property Address: 50 Union Square Blvd, North Chili, NY 14514

review_text: We chose Seasons because of their reputation and their location. We would definitely recommend Seasons to our friends.

I toured with McDowell Village and it was very nice with a big full kitchen, etc. but a little too far from me and my mom doesn't need a stove at this point!  It wouldn't be safe for her to use. The tour was great, it was very informative and they had great follow up after.
I’ve seen a lot of change in the 4 years I’ve been here. Things are much improved.
I am very impressed with Cherrywood. All the staff were professional and kind and very accommodating to my Mother. I am very grateful that she was cared for at this Rehab.
I thought this was a pretty good community when I visited. The people I met were nice and they do offer some nice amenities. This community was a little farther away than what I was looking for.
Property Address: 13060 South Metcalf Avenue, Overland Park, KS 66213

review_text: The intake staff and process was very good, the direct care staff was very helpful and knowledgeable. We did have to inquire on somethings, somethings were not initiated on their part but overall it is a very good facility and based on the experience we had we would recommend them to other families

Overall worse experience for my parents and family. What was told they do for memory care residents was not even close. They are not trained for Alzheimer's patients very bad for my mom and dad. Instead of redirecting her they would sent her back to her room, my dad never got to leave it was the same as them both being in their home! Awful place do not refer other families.
Poorly lit, smelled of chemicals, horrible décor coloring, no onsite Activities Director.  Studio and one bedroom were nice and had a good floor plan.

My mother was there for 4 years. She was very happy there. She was the first person in the memory care wing when it opened and everything was perfectly fine because she didn't have any kind of nursing needs to speak of. She just needed the supervisory enviroment. She loved the idea of having her own bathroom in her room. It was brand new and sparkly clean. Her room looked out on to the quadrangle with gardens and walkways. It was very attractive, bright, and cheery. Everything was just fine until she fell and had to go to nursing care. Also, towards the end of her stay there there began to be turnover in the staff that caused a massive breakdown in the continuity of care.

The Gardens at St. Elizabeth has been really nice, and my mom is really happy.  I think they give personalized care, and they're really friendly.  It just has very good energy. 
 I think they could use a lot more activities though.
Great staff, med techs, caregivers, our meals 3x a day are delicious! Fun activities, exercise program every morning.

reviewTitle: hope someone reads that actually cares.
review_text: was invited to a crab fest by my uncle by 530 of a party that was to last until 7pm there was no food. the crabs were outside with no warmer or ice. the so called chef{absolutely not even much of a short order cook} was drinking and didnt care that nothing was left to eat. the folks serving the food were great and apologized but they were not to blame . [name removed] was the one that was supposed to be the chef. it was pitiful to see these seniors looking for what was promised to them and they didnt have even a third of what was needed. i complained to the chef and he ignored me and obviously did not care. we are moving my uncle to another home and hope all others follow suit .this place is terrible.

Villa Court is like home. Everyone knows your name. You can't ask for a better place to live. You have everything you need. A beautiful room with cable/Wifi, as well as wash and house cleaning once a week. Three meals a day. A touch of the button for whatever you need. They take you to Doctor's visits and also outings to restaurants. Bingo every day. You couldn't ask for anything more!!
Property Address: 3985 S Pearl St, Las Vegas, NV 89121

reviewTitle: Really only an ALF, with lo...
review_text: Really only an ALF, with lots of Memory Support folks. Outdated, small one bedroom. Not right for folks. Kind of depressing.

After an unexpected death before Thanksgiving turned our small family upside-down, it became clear that my mother could not continue living on her own.  The staff at Belmont Village near our home made it possible to welcome her for respite care just after New Year's, and after a month or two had passed, Mom became convinced that it was the right place for her to be on a continuing basis.  She lives in a room that she has been allowed to personalize, has made special friends, and receives care that generally addresses her needs without unduly compromising her independence and dignity.  The facility is clean, spacious, and welcoming to residents and family members alike.  I am comforted in knowing that Mom is getting regular meals in a relaxed, open setting, that any changes in her physical or mental condition will be addressed appropriately, and that Belmont's thoughtful leadership will involve us in decision-making.  My wife and I are grateful that Belmont Village is there for Mom.

We realized that my parents needed to move from their home into a facility. We knew absolutely nothing about where to go nor how to get there. We learned that an organization existed, A Place for Mom. We called and requested an education and how to go about that.
There are a fantastic organization, our family can not say enough about their ability and willingness to provide assistance.
Our family, my two brothers and our wives visited different facilities. We visited different facilities because rating by others does nothing, it is just an opinion and you have no idea what it is based upon.
We visited, listened and observed what was taking place. We were interested in the facility itself of course, but more important were the people at the facility, those who worked and those who lived there. The interaction between them and the relationship that existed.
Your facility we were very impressed with, not because it was new but because of the people who worked there, their interaction between themselves as well as their relationship to those who lived there.
The people who work there at Arbor Oaks, are a fabulous and caring people. It tells us that those who manage the facility are doing their job when they surround themselves with quality people.
Keep up the good work, remain focused, caring and seeking ways to improve.
Was also impressed with the services provided for residents.

reviewTitle: Nice place to Live 10 years and going strong
review_text: The staff is very involved with residents and provide activities for all residents based on their individual interest to participate. The meals are well prepared . The home is clean, my family member is happy and well cared for and looks forward to returning home.  When she was admitted we where informed that the home does not provide incontinent supplies.  We were given a contract.  They are very professional and handled any discrepancies in a professional manner.

reviewTitle: Review for  HarborChase at Evergreen Walk
review_text: The staff are kind and helpful. I feel as though my mom is safe and taken care of there. The food is good and my mom enjoys the trips. It is expensive but it feels worth the cost.

The day to day cleanliness is pretty good, but there are some things that could use some attention, the carpets could be cleaned. They were very friendly when we were first looking, but once they got there they were kind of on their own. When they very first moved in, nobody came and greeted them, or introduced themselves, or even showed them around.  They are able to have their pet there. They complain daily about the food. The big meal of the day is during lunch, and the dinner meal doesn't have much for choice. The entrance isn't very smooth for anyone with a walker. The apartment itself we liked a lot, the square footage is good, the actual living space is good.  They have been slow getting back to them to have some help with things in the apartments.
Property Address: 8709 SE Causey Ave, Happy Valley, OR 97086

review_text: They think they do a sufficient job there.  Their very attentive with their residents and they have it well under control.  I think they are doing a great job here.
Property Address: 220 Pleasant Valley Way, West Orange, NJ 07052

reviewTitle: My Mother Is Doing Wonderful Here
review_text: This is an outstanding community. Everything is working very well for my mother here. They are taking very good care of her and her needs. This is lovely community, they do a great job with the cleanliness. They have an excellent staff. There are on going activities daily, many for her to choose from. The meals are delicious, the chef has a private garden on the community. I know she is safe and in good hands here. I would highly recommend this community.

reviewTitle: a long search ended at Heartlands
review_text: My first experiences are all about the search, review, visits, and meeting the staff (directors and caregivers.)  Over a few months we reviewed many, visited a few, and concluded that The Heartlands of SP offered the best value.  The Heartlands folks were best able to articulate and offer a plan for my 93 year old Mom's last years.  They have relationships in place with other providers to accommodate her inevitable declines.   My mother will require a lot of assistance in the future, and Heartlands seems more than able to deal with all her issues.  We found a lovely corner room that offers great cross ventilation, and we're allowed to decorate to suit Mom.  I can not yet offer review of their care services because she has not yet moved in.  I do have high hopes and expectations based on interviews with all the key staff.  Also, current residents of Heartlands I spoke with expressed satisfaction, comfort, and high praise for the facility.  The residents are happy; this alone has to be good.
Property Name: Heartlands Assisted Living at Severna Park

review_text:
Over all the best, I'm happy
Cleanliness is above expectations, no smells
Staff is friendly, occasional  concerns have been resolved.
Care has been excellent
Food is bland, yet nutritious
There are daily activities as well as special events 
I am well satisfied with the expenses and see the costs as fair and of good value for the money

I feel that I was fortunate to find such an exceptional place fo my wife. The grounds are beautiful with a lovely lake and many trees.
Lots of shade to sit outside or take a stroll!

reviewTitle: Friendly, they really involve my mother in lots of activities
review_text:
They have everything that my mother needed.  She's tickled pink with it.   Everyone is friendly and helpful. It's really nice.

They have lots of activities, all day long, that help my mother with socialization.  Alot of the activities are on her floor, so she doesn't have to go up and down.  They make it very easy for people to get involved.   They have a transportation bus.   

The food is really good.

The cleanliness of the community gave off a great first impression, and even when we would come unannounced all of the staff members were engaged with the residents. Even on the tour they took us around to see the residents rooms and not the model rooms which we really appreciated. They also have great activities.
It is a very nice place! My mother always said the meals were good.
Property Name: Lakeside Manor Nursing and Rehabilitation Center

review_text: top choice at the moment.

Our experience with the team at Brookdale Nacogdoches has been a positive and reliable partnership for several years. The leadership team has always exemplified the highest standard for care and we appreciate their commitment to excellence.

reviewTitle: Review of Pendleton Manor in Greenville, SC
review_text: I would recommend this to everyone. The help is wonderful. The community is clean. The food is excellent. The managers are excellent.
move in was easy! Staff has orientation ready next day. Meals re good - love the restaurant style set up

reviewTitle: very nice, but new and working out some kinks
review_text:
What I hear from my mother all the time is that they opened the place before it was really ready, and they have had a few problems with things, such as the water getting shut off, as one example.  We are also noticing that there were some things the sales people led us to expect that have not come to fruition.  

The people there are very nice and extremely helpful though.  I think it's just been a little rough because it is a new community.  There are still some kinks they need to work out but I trust that will all be taken care of in time.

They are fantastic. They are very clean, and the staff is very friendly. We use them for respite stays. I would rate the food at about a 4. I think one thing they could maybe do a little better is to speed up on the check out process. They seemed to be the only place that offers this type of respite care.
Property Address: 6450 South Boston Street, Greenwood Village, CO 80111

review_text:
I would let others know that there are professional staff members throughout the facility. 

The Director [name removed] has been very helpful in assisting with the initial application,  and later on with Medicaid applications as well.

This facility is in a great location too! 

There do not seem to be many activities provided to the residents. 

I would definitely recommend Victory Centre of River Woods, I have also recommended them via other online surveys as well.
Property Address: 1800 River Woods Drive, Melrose Park, IL 60160

review_text:
I would recommend the "Roseville" to my family or fiends. [removed] (now deceased) and I were very satisfied when our U. of M. nurse, [removed], recommended this location. We were pleasantly surprised with the service that [removed] supplies- excellent!
Very friendly and pleasant atmosphere.

reviewTitle: Good care for my Mom and good communication to her family
review_text: The staff have all been kind and compassionate. When something occurs out of the ordinary,  they call my sister timely, to let her know what has ocurred and the action taken or needed. They include the family in care plans.

We have been very pleased with Waltonwood.  It is a great facility, clean and very well kept.  The staff is exceptional, from top to bottom.  They are attentive and kind; we are very thankful for the way they care for our mother.
My mother has lived in Independent Living for 6 years now and we've always found the staff helpful and easy to deal with.
Property Address: 14901 North Pennsylvania Avenue, Oklahoma City, OK 73134

review_text: The people working there are great, helpful, kind. They try their best at all times. Very welcoming.

My loved one was previously a resident at TerraBella Greensboro and everything about her experience at this facility was great. The staff at TerraBella were wonderful and so caring. This facility is a beautiful campus. They offer a lot of activities for the residents to participate in. Unfortunately, my loved one passed away recently, but her experience at this facility was wonderful. I would recommend TerraBella Greensboro to others.

We really like Fairwinds, our grandmother used to live here and we had a good experience during that time. So when it was time for us to look again we decided to go with them based on past experience. The community is very beautiful and the rooms are very nice. Compared to the other communities in the area it is the best one next to the brand new communities but those are really expensive. We are happy with Fairwinds and what they provide.
Property Address: 920 Riverview Dr SE, Rio Rancho, NM 87124

review_text: Way too expensive for my Mom!
Property Address: 6086 S Ridgeline Dr, South Ogden, UT 84405

reviewTitle: Dad attends daycare here 2-3 days a w...
review_text: Dad attends daycare here 2-3 days a week.

reviewTitle: My Review of Pacifica Senior Living Sunrise
review_text: [Name removed] was very kind, personable, and efficient.  The tour was excellent and the facility is beautiful, new, clean, and well attended.

Sunrise of Lafayette Hill is a medium sized Assisted Living facility. The atmosphere is friendly between residents and between staff and residents. They provide a cozy environment for senior living.  They are making a real effort to do improvements on a timely manner.  The staff and most residents are friendly and accommodating. The food is good, but they could improve on the overall dining experience.
My dad is a resident at Talamore Sun Prairie. He loves it. He is very comfortable and has met friends. I'm glad they have a lot of activities for him and he participates in a lot.
Property Address: 275 N City Station Dr, Sun Prairie, WI 53590

review_text: My father has been at Arden Courts for over a year now and we are very pleased.  The staff are very kind and really get to know the residents. They are patient and seem to really understand how to work with people with dementia.
Property Name: Arden Courts A ProMedica Memory Care Community in Fair Oaks
Property Address: 12469 Lee Jackson Memorial Highway, Fairfax, VA 22033

review_text: The caregivers were very nice, but I could not depend on one of them to be on time.  I did not receive the paperwork that I was supposed to receive, and I did not receive a written schedule, and my scheduled times got all confused.  I wish they had been more on top of things instead of off the cuff.
We liked this place.
You did a great job
Property Address: 35605 N Moyes Road, Queen Creek, AZ 85142

review_text: All the feedback that I have gotten from my loved one and family members about the Brookdale Valencia has been good. They have been very accommodating, but I think that the food served there is just alright.
Awesome don't listen to any bad reports

reviewTitle: Review of Colonial Gardens - Fort Worth
review_text: My husband was in this facility for 2.5 years. The staff and medical people were great. I received so much good and concerned care that I felt he was safe and caring. They were so kind and professional the whole time he was there. My thanks to everyone who came in contact with my husband.
Property Address: 6939 River Park Circ, Fort Worth, TX 76116

reviewTitle: Review of Belmont Village Hunters Creek - Houston, TX
review_text: Belmont Village Hunters Creek is the perfect place that I has searching for! The cause of the community is amazing - the staff has helped my father feel safe, at home, and part of a group again. He is actually participating, which was no easy task! My mind is at each knowing that he is being looked after as I would look after him.
Have been satisfied thus far.
Property Name: Iris Memory Care of Turtle Creek

review_text: Very cozy place to live. The rooms are bright and cheery! The building needs a facelift to keep up with all the other independent care facilities in same area. The food needs much improvement.  It is awful. I also feel staff (management) should be there overnight. At one time the managers (2) lived at Summer Place. Felt way more secure having my Dad living there at that time.  All staff go home at 7:30. No one available for folks living there after that. I feel that yearly increases in rent should never exceed 3 percent. That is reasonable. This year it was more than 6 percent, with no renovations or updates to the place, that I feel is needed. Last year it was close to 6 percent also. Way to much for these elders with limited funds.

My dad was there 2 years , and the only nice thing I can say about that facility is that my dad's  (home health aid) cause I don't think they have real RN's working there was very nice  and attentive to his needs.  Other than that the place needs a huge paint job, and an inspection. Its filthy with stained outdoor furniture,  water bugs in their bathrooms and patients rooms, and it smells like urine in the whole place. Their patients are kept very drugged up and soiled. As far as activities go, they have none!! Nothing to keep their patients active or their mind going. Very sad! And they are very expensive!  They do tend to celebrate some holidays, Thanksgiving,  Xmas, . They do have a cook on site, their menu is somewhat decent. But over all, I regret placing my dad in their care!!!    I Don't recommend this place!!!!!

Toured on May 10, 2014. Very nice. 28 resident capacity in memory care side. 20 resident now. Clean. Low turnover. Memory care workers sign contract of commitment. Can move mom's furniture in, but not large furniture. Semiprivate room would help to stretch her resources. Can name dr. affiliated with Dominion Village as mom's PCP. LPN who works under this PCP visits every other weeks, but comes in when called by Tabatha, Director of Nursing at Dominion Village.
Overall, the facility is ok. Staff is a hit or miss. Some are great and some not so much.

Everything is going just great! The staff are very accommodating and the facility is kept very well maintained. My loved one also gets many chances to participate in activities with other residents. Overall, we are satisfied with the experience!

reviewTitle: Taking care of mom, the next chapter.
review_text: [name removed] put diapers in city recycling bins that have stickers on the lids of what not to put in recycling. She locked herself in the bathroom that she has used numerous times and shoved open the door causing damage to the door frame. The door opens inwards and she tried to open it outwards. Mom is always clean, her clothes and bed linens are always clean. [name removed]  she would leave pans dirty, allowed grease to run over inside the oven, she frequently ate our food and or take grocery items home with her.  [name removed]used the counter top as a cutting board when several were available until we advised her to use the cutting boards. :[name removed]encouraged mom to eat cranberries to help with her UTI's which was helpful. Gloria has mom do some neck exercises.
Property Name: Cardinal Senior Care - San Antonio, TX
Property Address: 4402 Vance Jackson Rd, San Antonio, TX 78230

review_text: I am enjoying living at Brook view. They give or provide us with a safe area to live which includes walking. I also have enjoyed our beautiful pool. After hip and knee surgeries, the water provides healing.
We toured Brookdale Portage and we did not like that everything was done in units rather than being open to all residents. Also the rooms here were smaller than some others that we looked into.

It was hard to find a place for my mom. I must say this had to be the best choice. Everyone is so helpful. The staff has been great. The place is always clean. They treat everyone with respect. My mom is so happy here. Any information you need there is always someone who tries to help you. They make the transition very smooth. They handle the paperwork. I highly recommend this facility.
Property Address: 799 E Gun Hill Rd, Bronx, NY 10467

review_text: Nice facility

We searched around.  The location is excellent, central Raleigh.  Meals, housekeeping, activites, nice courtyards are inclosed, shuttle, worship services, movie night, music, billards, salon, nursing staff, and nearby shopping!  The people a warm and welcoming.  Great place for my mom.  Safe and comfortable, privacy apartment with kitchennet.  Call button necklace will bring help in person. Staff on site 7 days a week.  Age in place.  Great place to call home.  Blocks from Rex Hospital. AFFORDABL, not a country club.  Practical.
Property Address: 3113 Charles B. Root Wynd, Raleigh, NC 27612

reviewTitle: Terrific experience @ Wesley Woods Senior Apartments!
review_text: Since moving to Wesley Woods Senior Apartments, I’ve found it to be a happy, active & interesting place to live. The residents all seem to be happy to be here. The longer I’ve been here & met different people, I’ve found some really interesting & talented folks. One such resident is an artist whole sculptures are being shown in a local gallery soon.  Also so many others who are retired from interesting careers. No lack of conversation for lunch in the dining room!
My loved one has not been here long, but so far the experience has been a good one. Everyone seems very friendly, and the residents look well cared for.
Not great curb appeal but a thriving community with travel/exchange option that is very tempting, but I worry about the age of the HVAC system, ste.

The staff at this community are always around and there to answer all our questions.  Mom thinks the food is wonderful and they work with her diet needs. They offer daily activities. I would recommend this well taken care of community.

Discovery Village is such a pleasant place. I totally enjoy coming here twice a week to provide service to the community. I've been providing service to the community since 2019. And I must say., It's always a wonderful day at Discovery Village!

My husband and I moved to Brightwater 12 years ago.  It had everything we wanted in one place.  A fully equipped Wellness center, indoor and outdoor pools and a professional staff that encourages as well as instructs.  There are activities galore from crafts, local trips, entertainer and member generated activities.  There is never a worry when it comes to maintenance.  As small as replacing a light bulb to maintaining the air conditioner there is never a worry.  Don't worry about what's for dinner as there are numerous choices daily for healthy, happy dining.
A safe, pleasant community where your physically needs care met my children picked it out for me.

reviewTitle: It's a safe and quiet location, but it can be difficult to get to shopping and such.
review_text: The activities are mostly geared toward females. The only thing I would like, is to be better connected to public transportation. It's a safe and quiet location, but it can be difficult to get to shopping and such. The safe and quiet location is what I like about them too.
dark and long halls.  Must walk alone to get meds and to dining.
Property Address: 275 S. La Salle St., Aurora, IL 60505

review_text: My mom is in this community. I like most of the staff, but there are times when they do not speak not too nicely to the residents. The building in the community is too hot and the heat can not be regulated. The director is amazing. The wellness center the staff are not very nice at times.  I do not feel that this is good for my mom to hear. I do like that they are offering her a lot of activities for her to participate. I think that they could be more friendly.I feel that this community has some improvements that should be addressed. I want my mom to feel comfortable with the care that is given to her here.

This was one of the locations we looked at for Mom's assisted living. It looked like a very nice place, it provided all the care she'd need and the staff were friendly. The major problem for us was that it was not a convenient location for our family to be able to visit, otherwise its very nice.

reviewTitle: Review for Woodland Terrace of Carmel
review_text: It's been a wonderful experience so far. We've had a really  good experience with WT. my mom loved WT the best, because of the decor, the physical therapy opportunities that are on site, the exercise programs, outings etc. Absolutely recommend. She's very happy at WT.

From the first interview, the staff was concerned, caring and compassionate. They are always friendly and concerned about my mom's wellbeing. Also helpful to the family! Did not give a 5 as I have nothing to compare it to.
Property Address: 12110 Morris Bridge Rd, Temple Terrace, FL 33637

review_text: The friendliness of the staff members are excellent, an the meals and dining services are very good. They have a wide variety of food options to choose from and we were even able to help our loved one pick out her menu.

The first 2 months were great (my father has been there 9 months now) It has been down hill since then. Some staff members are wonderful, and the only reason my father is still there is because the staff members that physically care for him are wonderful. The directors do not respond to any communications- and as the Brookdale Company is taking over the home they have let staff go or had staff leave and not replaced them. It was at one point very easy to talk to the department heads and stay on top of my fathers care- there are no department heads (managers) at this location any longer and it takes weeks to get questions answered. There has been no notification for families as to the change of contact personnel- I have sent emails, made phone calls only to be told after a week or more of trying to track someone down that they are no longer employed at Emeritus (now Brookdale). When a staff member leaves their email and phone are not monitored or disconnected.
Property Name: Above and Beyond at the Knights

review_text: I have had a loved one in this facility for over a year now and I concur with a couple of the other reviewers.  Many improvements are needed.   When I signed up to bring my loved one to the facility, I was misled about so many things but the two things are the care and pricing.  Jean, the head of Wellness should not be dealing with the public as she is a very unfriendly person.  The Executive Director just hides and smiles and always seems to turn their issue back around on your loved one as if that is going to appease people - to blame them rather than correct their problem.  Three times over the last month, my loved one pressed the alarm button and no one ever came to help.  This is totally unacceptable.  This place only seems interested in how much money they can charge for services they don't provide..   The food is tasteless and when my loved one, who will eat most anything complains, I know it's bad.   I've eaten at 3 Assisted Living facilities and this is way below even cafeteria food.    The location of the facility is great but I am currently looking for a better solution.  This place is just not cutting it.

A very clean community with happy, friendly residents. The staff cares so much for everyone - working so hard to make sure folks feel safe, welcomed, comfortable and cared for. Many of the staff , from the community director, [name removed], to the front desk and kitchen staff are quite frankly angels walking on earth. They have made this move so incredibly easy!
Old, small & dark, not inviting, home doesn't have a safe feeling
Property Address: 7410 S Osbourne Rd, Upper Marlboro, MD 20772

reviewTitle: So happy to have found this place
review_text: After having removed my father from an assisted living that had just the bare necessities. It was such a relief to know that places like this exist who actually care about the person. Every part of the person. Instead of feeling like a patient he is treated like a  man. So great to know this. I can now sleep at night knowing that he is well fed and cared for.

can anyone help these corralled Sr  people  ??
The food is boarder line eatable. The only people  who care are the residence.  As one patron said to me; I don't buy it ,
I do not  cook it but  it is horrible,, [name removed]

Everybody there at Atria Inn at Lakewood is terrific!  They are very personable people.  I can go in and talk to them any time and they are always available.  My brother is the one staying there and they are treating him really good.  I am very pleased.

My husband has been a resident at this facility for a year. I have found it to be a place where the staff sincerely cares for those who are living there. They meet frequently to discuss individual care and find solutions to problems.

reviewTitle: Review of Silver Comet Senior Village
review_text: Perfect. My apartment is spacious, has a balcony, and I enjoy all the additional outdoor space offered. Enjoy the other residents and love the staff, especially [name removed], the Directors. She loves her staff and residents.
Property Address: 4900 Richard D Sailors Pkwy, Powder Springs, GA 30127

reviewTitle: Review of Pacifica Senior Living Portland
review_text: My in-laws are together in one cottage. Mother-in-law on hospice, FIL in and out of the hospital. The hospice nurses have trained the caregivers in cottage in helping MIL. [Name removed] the head pacifica nurse, is wonderful. Most of the staff has been, as we've had a lot of trauma (falls, amputations) since moving in, My only complaint is the receptionist, who has not been friendly at all to my family when we visit.
Friendly and caring staff, excellent food,large resident room.

Since last year, a family member of mine has resided in Villa Lorena. The treatment is excellent, and we are extremely happy with their services, in addition to the setting being lovely, homey, and classy.  When compared to the needs of patients in memory care, the entire crew is kind and takes pride in their work.  Most significantly, my aunt is content and has adjusted to her new surroundings. The owners are also incredibly generous. My mother, who resides in a retirement community at [removed], was even urged to relocate.

reviewTitle: I trusted them, and they let me down
review_text: My mother spent four years at Delmar in the recent past. Every year the quality of care diminished.  Her last few months before she died, they SAID she fell from the bed and broke some bones but truth is she couldn't roll over to fall. The nurse said to me, "maybe she'll stay put now". A CNA told me she was mad at other CNA personnel because of what they had done to her.  RUN AWAY. What you see is not what you get. You get nothing!!!
Property Address: 404 King Springs Village Pkwy, Smyrna, GA 30082

reviewTitle: Review for Legacy at Grande Vie
review_text: We picked this community because of the location, only one my mom liked, staff answered all my questions and there were a TON. If a friend asked about my experience, I'd suggest she'd reach out to [name removed] to get her started. I'd suggest she tour a few properties as each has separate amenities. I love that GV has ambassadors that help each resident settle in and get used to the community. They try to match personalities so residents are more comfortable. I personally like that there's a clause in the lease that if they become incompetent that GV will attempt guardianship so she wouldn't need to immediately move. My mom likes that she can come and go as she pleases and could bring her cat.
Property Address: 2140 Five Mile Line Rd, Penfield, NY 14526

review_text: I moved to Cogir in [date removed]. I have found other residents and staff very friendly and accepting. the activities are varied and stimulating. I like the group exercises, especially those in the pool.

reviewTitle: Pick to right facility - watch out for the sales pitch.
review_text: Be very careful when choosing for your loved one.  Once in facility they are usually afraid to move and make change.  We went to facility every day, we installed cameras, we wrote letters, we meet with staff and management and to no avail.  The staff was not trained properly.  The staff was cruel at times, the staff made fun of the elderly and the management was not interested in making things better.  They were afraid of the staff.  I keep records for over two years and the facility just got worst.  There was staff that saw what was happening and tried to make changes however they were dismissed.  I really can't write about all our problems and concerns from clean room to food service.  I get sick when I go back over my records and see whatmy mother-in law and dater-in law went through and feel that I should have had more backbone to do something.  They were afraid if we complained they would be treated worst.
We picked this community, because of the cost and non profit and set up to receive state funds if funds were to run out. Staff is really kind and compassionate. They are for the residents.

reviewTitle: My 88 year old mother moved here
review_text:
we had to wait a long time for the apartment to be ready.
no one contacted us during that time--we had to call and got some strange responses such as 
"of course it is ready--it never takes longer than this to get ready"--to "no it is not ready"

We just would have appreciated being kept up to date--elderly people don't like to spend money and then have things unsettled.

Our experience with Brookstone has been wonderful. They are great people and mom has settled in well here. She has made so many good friends and she absolutely loves it. She is actually starting to gain some weight and is looking much better. They have lots of open courtyards and places to sit outside, you do not feel like you are trapped in a building. The rooms either look into woods or the inner courtyard, even in the memory care unit. Memory care also has their own courtyard and it is lovely. For what they offer, the value for the money is great. They do allow dogs as well which is great. They do happy hours every Friday night and the residents really enjoy that. I would absolutely recommend to others who are looking.

reviewTitle: Not bad, but definitely not the best
review_text: I've been here at Westwood ridge now for going on my fifth week. At first the service was great, but as they got more patients it seems like staff hasn't increased to maintain that high level of service. I often find myself waiting over 15 minutes when I hit the call button and I'm often left hooked up to an IV for hours after it's completed to a point where I have to unhook myself. I've had to do my own wound changes as the nurse simply left for the day and decided that I didn't need to have it changed. They refuse to purchase the necessary supplies to complete a proper wound change. They have the cheapest tape and are simply unwilling to buy better tape. Bottom line... I would keep looking for a facility that cares more about the patient then the bottom line.
Property Address: One Thompson Ave West, West Saint Paul, MN 55118

review_text: I would not reccomend Montara Meadows.  The property was run down. The elevator went out four times while I lived there.  My husband is in a wheelchair and he was alarmed because we couldn't get downstairs for four days once. They had to deliver our meals. The change over in kitchen staff was constant and the same with housekeeping.  The staff tried their hardest to  have corporate to change their policies but our challenges were never taken care of.
Property Address: 3150 East Tropicana Avenue, Las Vegas, NV 89121

review_text: My Mom has been living in Brookdale for nearly two months.  I looked at a number of facilities and was personally in the business a number of years ago.  I knew what I wanted for my Mom and Brookdale delivered.  Mom is very happy the staff if delightful, my heart is happy because my Mom is happy.  They say there is no place like home... until you call Brookdale home.
Accuaid acre provided excellent care for us. I recommend them.

It was higher priced. The director knew nothing about anything. He was new but he hadn't even studied up so he'd always say "Well, I'd have to check on that" or "I don't know" or "talk to so-and-so about that." I was not impressed with that.

reviewTitle: He is well taken care of. Everything ...
review_text: He is well taken care of. Everything is fine.
Top of the list.

This is a wonderful community.  The staff communication with the family has been good anytime we have had questions or concerns.  There are three meals a day served to the residents, and they have choices to choose from.  The community could use more staff overall to assist with the care of the residents.  Overall, it is a community I would recommend to others.
great staff i uncle loved food and home-like  atmosphere highly recommend won't be disappointed thanks CLARAS PLACE

reviewTitle: Review of Coventry Meadows Assisted Living & Garden Fort Wayne, IN
review_text: Nursing care, food service, housekeeping, maintenance, front desk (Rita), activities, laundry all performed in an excellent manner.
Property Name: Coventry Meadows Assisted Living and Garden Homes
Property Address: 7833 W Jefferson Blvd, Fort Wayne, IN 46804

review_text:
Activities have been a lot of fun. We have a nice activity director. She's an A+.
Cons- building needs updated, better food
Everyone at Brookdale does an amazing job making sure my mom is well taken care of. They have gone above and beyond helping me in all respects of my mom's care.

Dad is still adjusting to living at this community. He does not yet participate in any of the many activities they offer. He makes his own food. The community is clean and the staff have been very helpful. We like that he is able to be more independent and I would recommend this community.
I enjoy being here at Legacy and visiting people daily. I enjoy things and staff are great!

reviewTitle: Review of Ashwood Court North Richland Hills, TX
review_text: Weekends are not good. (Anonymous Name) has a hard time getting baths. Good place to live and it is very safe.
Property Address: 7501 Glenview Dr., North Richland Hills, TX 76180

reviewTitle: Great but rude manager and rent increases signficiantly every year!
review_text: My parents have loved the activities and other residents at the Holbrook, and the building is clean and beautiful, however, the new manager is very unpleasant and rude to the residents (I've heard from many). They have also raised my parent's rent significantly every year while they pay their staff poorly.  I've gotten to know some of the staff  and most are making just above minimum wage.
Our family had an in person tour and it was a really nice tour experience

My mom lives here and they have very caring people. It’s very clean and upbeat, the food is good, and the people there seem to be very pleased. They have weekly meetings for the residents to get together so they can talk about things that need to be fixed, which I think is great. I like all of the staff and the management is very open to suggestions and they ask a lot of questions on how they can do better. They provide all kinds of activities. You can do whatever you want or you can pick and choose. They have church and devotionals, art projects, there are a lot of people that will come in to entertain or visit, and therapy dogs come by to keep everyone company. They have lots of different things going on all the time. Right now, my Mom is on the assisted living side on one of the higher levels of care. There are 3 tiers of care that they provide – independent, assisted, and memory care – so it makes it great for those who require different levels of care. The only downside that I’ve found is that, because this place is so nice, there’s a really long waiting list. Once you’ve seen this place, it’s pretty hard to decide to go anywhere else. The security is wonderful here, you have to have a code to go in and out of the doors and my mom is very impressed with that.  I would recommend them.
Property Name: Village on the Park at Oklahoma City

reviewTitle: Recommend for moderate to severe dementia stages rather than beginning stages.
review_text: I think it's ok for moderate to severe Alzheimer's/dementia but not a place for beginning stages.  Place is really nice but need to spend money on residents than new accessories!!  I wish I would have checked out places that take in consideration of stages of dementia/ Alzheimer's.... so when interviewing people looking that would be helpful as I know there are some places that have different areas for different stages.
Property Address: 100 W Queen Creek Rd, Chandler, AZ 85224

review_text: (Activities Not Rated) Atria Chandler Villas is really an awesome community. She really loved living here. The food is really good, they have a chef that cooks the food fresh and they use fresh produce not like institutional food there is nothing out of the can here. They have an extremely good response time when a resident pushes the button on the device they give them for free. The response time when our loved one pushed it was really impressive. They allow you to paint the rooms, change out faucets and pretty much do anything else you want to do just to make it your own home. The doors open to the outside so it provides a resort feeling rather then apartments where the doors open into a hallway. The balcony that she has is huge. The staff is very helpful and accommodating. This community is just amazing you just have so much freedom to really live the way you want to. We would recommend them to anyone.

The staff at Be Well Senior Living gave excellent care to my father who lived there for almost 4 years. The people are caring, sensitive and responsive to the needs of their residents. My father valued his relationships with these people and he called this place his "home" and the staff there was like family to him. I was able to rest easily knowing that my father was being well taken care of.

Our family had an in person tour and Merrill Gardens is a lovely community, everyone was very nice and accommodating. However the food plan was going to be an issue, its an additional fee every month and it was just not going to work.

reviewTitle: Review of Cedar Lake - Lake Zurich, IL
review_text: I like the assisted living area however the memory care area was not a good fit for my loved one
Property Name: Cedar Lake Assisted Living and Memory Care

review_text: My parents have been at The Clare since 2008, first in Independent Living, then my Father in Memory care and now my mother in Assisted Living.  They chose the Clare as their plan for retirement.  They both have enjoyed it as a place of social enrichment, engaging activity and an overall good place to spend their senior years.
