They were always kind to him and someone was always near him to make sure he didn't fall.   The care ratio is superior to any other place; at the time he was there there were only seven other residents and the care was two aides to the seven which is wonderful.   They always made sure he had enough fluids and he was always kept clean.  My father was quite content there and I was relieved that he was safe.  I had to take him out of a Benchmark facility after three weeks where the care ratio is 1 aide to 18 and he fell twice and ended up in the hospital.  I feel so fortunate that he was able to spend his last months safe at The Dorothy Francis Home.

The community itself was kept very clean, however our loved ones room was not as clean as we would of liked for it to be. The communication was excellent, they were always in contact with us about our loved one.

During the time our loved one was there our interaction with the administrator was very good, she was very professional and hopeful. When it came to the meals our loved one did say the portions were to big, and they didn't really make any changes to fix that or be more accommodating.
Fabulous facility.

They deal well with the residents well and they are very patient with them. However, I was told some things before my mother moved in that were not true. They have problems delivering papers in the mail though.
The staff is very nice. I would recommend it. We picked this community because, it was the most reasonable one for my father.

reviewTitle: Review of St. Andrews Memory Care
review_text: It's an exceptional gorgeous historical building with a wonderful staff of people. I'd recommend this facility for anyone with family that suffers from dementia in need of assisted living care. Good food, clean and healthy atmosphere, great staff what else could you ask for!

reviewTitle: Visited the Christian Towers. Dad did...
review_text: Visited the Christian Towers. Dad didn't care for the facility because it has 19 floors and too much traffic on Church St.
Looked very nice but was more expensive.

reviewTitle: Attractive, updated, facility with awesome staff
review_text:
The place was clean, but apartment had small roaches throughout. Very little variety for food - did not like the food.
The staff there is awesome! They had a huge turnover of staff right before we left. Got a new director who seemed really engaged. 
They were doing some upgrades, new carpet throughout, was a nice lookin facility. 
They were only at about 50% capacity the entire time we were there so it seemed rather quiet.
Property Address: 5331 Hamilton Wolfe Road, San Antonio, TX 78229

review_text: My mom is a resident at Autumn Wind Assisted Living and so far it has been a great facility. The facility is clean and updated. Very clean. The staff seems to really care about the residents as well as their families. The meals are good quality. I would recommend this facility to family and friends, for sure.

The only negative was actually with the marketing and sales force. We received poor information and had much miscommunication before moving in. Then move -in day was awful because that department TOTALLY dropped the ball. Once we let the facility director know what has happened things were fixed quickly.

Well, I feel like home myself. I really like the caregivers they are so caring and fun. They have been taking care of my brother for a few months and this is the best place I could have find. My brother and enjoy the music and the activities they do!! They let the families participate and the staff is very welcoming.
Dont like where it is, too far from my home, not sure Mom would like it there, very safety minded, good staff/client ratio, activities for residents
I think that overall The Wellington at Arapaho is a good place for a loved one's care.  They do a good job with cleaning the rooms and clothes regularly and serving meals on time.

reviewTitle: Review of Pacifica Senior Living Millcreek
review_text: Pacifica Senior Living at Millcreek is a community of seniors that provides a safe and comfortable home and numerous activities to meet physical, social and intellectual, and spiritual needs. One is able to find assistance with demands that are challenging so there is more time spent in activities important to you.
Property Address: 777 E 3900 S, Salt Lake City, UT 84107

review_text: This facility is beautiful, furnished nicely and clean. However it is also pricey. The majority of the staff are caring and competent. We came to have true friendships with many. There is High turnover!!  Always someone quitting and training new care aids. Food is ok. The residents there are safe and well cared for. I never saw signs of abuse or neglect which is the most important factor in choosing a facility for your loved one! The nurses on staff have worked there many years which is a big plus. There is always some activity going on if the resident wants to participate. Was not impressed with administration the years we had a loved one there. They are never on the floor interacting with residents. Always seem to be in a meeting or out for long lunches. Some of the very good staff should get a medal!
It's worth it. They are good. They provide a variety of meal options. The staff are very helpful and welcoming.
My loved one has had good care. The staff is very attentive to any needs and questions. They check in on him.
Property Address: 1901 S Trade Days Blvd, Canton, TX 75103

review_text: The staff has a good attitude. Compared to other places, the general, positive and accomodating attitute is pretty rare.

After viewing several memory care homes in the Tacoma area, the Meridian is the best place we have seen.  This is based on the quality of the facility, the staff and care received, the food, and the programs available.

reviewTitle: This is my first pick.  Loved this fa...
review_text: This is my first pick.  Loved this facility and think that I and staff will work well together for moms are,  price was manageable!
I am currently a resident at Discovery Village at Castle Hills. It's a great place to live.
Beautiful community - big 1 and 2 bedroom apartments.  Friendly staff.

This place has gone downhill the past few months. All the old workers have been replace with young people who don't have the compassion, friendliness, or attention of the older employees. My dad has gained 35 pounds in a year on the starchy food. His assistive device for getting out of bed was taken away so he is no longer independent. They have messed up his medications on multiple occasions, administering meds discontinued by doctor, leaving liquids in his room when he's on a liquid restricted diet, and continuing to order meds from Dougs when they had plenty. At his last doctors appointment they failed to have him or his med list ready. He went to the doctor filthy and I made sure the hospital staff knew Oakley Place was responsible. It was embarrassing! We might consider staying if they fired some of the "children " they have hired and get back the competent and caring staff. Don't bring someone you love here!!!

reviewTitle: Review of Trinity Community at Miami Township
review_text: Great place for mom and dad! Life is very enhanced with all the activities. Each day life is better because of the residents and staff. We are so grateful to god for helping to find this place. A difficult decision in our age group. Make a big different but like is so much better in a community setting.

reviewTitle: Would Recommend But Keep An Eye On Things
review_text:
Make sure you stay on top of things and anything goes wrong make sure you report it right away. A few of the people at the front desk that are nice, others are pretty rude. We had a hard time trying to get her medicine taken care. 

Things have improved with her medications currently. This location has 3 floors. Housekeeping comes once a week. They offer some transportation with a 24-48 hour notice. They allow pets.
Property Address: 1620 Indian School Rd NE, Albuquerque, NM 87102

review_text:
We really enjoyed visitng a family member. We stopped in on our vacation. 
The staff was very friendly and help us find our way through 
the building.
The dining room seemed to be a delightful experience.

Thank you for taking care of our loved one.

reviewTitle: We Are Happy With This Community
review_text: My parents are living at this community and they both seem to be happy. The community is great and very clean, the staff do laundry and pick up after my parents. The staff are very helpful and very attentive. My parents do not complain about the food so I would like to think it's good to them. My mom likes to play bingo and she joins in other activities. I would recommend this community because its a great place and close for the whole family to visit our parents.

reviewTitle: Review for Harmony at West Ashley
review_text: The apartment is nice and the people are nice but the food is not that good and it takes too long to be served. We chose Harmony because of its location and the ability to get one meal a day for my Mom.
Everyone has been very helpful and caring for my mom. Day concierge is always very pleasant and helpful, she's awesome.

I am really happy with this service. The care takers are good and we have been informed that they go out to the homes and people the client. They help with many different thins as the families have requested.  I do know that I have been able to refer families to use this good in home service for the care in a home for a loved one.

Since we moved in 5 months ago the facility has declined greatly. Several of the administrative staff have been replaced . The maintenance and housekeeper have both quit, therefore the facility has become unclean and the rooms are not being cleaned properly. We were promised a shower three times a week but if we are lucky once a week -if we complain. The caregivers are not answering the call lights in a prompt manner in the night.  I don't think there is a good training for them to attend to residents with dementia. The caregivers are expected to do more than caring for the residents, like house keeping,  feeding, cleaning rooms laundry, etc.  The meals are always late and the times have been adjusted to accommodate the schedules of the caregivers.

My loved one went to Vitality Living Springdale for a respite stay.
The staff were all very attentive and easy to reach when I wanted to check on my loved one. 
The only thing that was disappointing was that they were private pay only.
I would recommend this facility to others.
The staff is warm and caring. It is a homey atmosphere. And I feel that my husband is being well cared for, and they strive to meet his needs emotionally as well as physically.
Property Address: 8720 W Flamingo Road, Las Vegas, NV 89147

review_text: Staff is super friendly and helpful. Dining had some issues but I believe they have been resolved. The waitstaff all quit at the same time. The only problem we have found is the WiFi is not strong enough to use in my sisters apartment even though we were told it was available. So she expected to be able to use WiFi to stream the Roku. I will add that my sister is very happy living there. She is making friends and trying to join the activities when she can.

I'm very satisficed with the assistance they have been able to provide for us.  They are assisting with daily living activities for my loved one.  I would recommend Michigan's Home Help Care Services to others.
Property Name: Michigan's Home Help Care Services, LLC

review_text: They seem to really care about the residence, and a comfortable place to live,  I would recommend this community to others.
Property Address: 4445 S Grand Canyon Dr, Las Vegas, NV 89147

review_text: They have been an amazing staff. Very compassionate and hopeful. They really take the time to understand family dynamics and to get to know the residents to improve their quality of life and go above and beyond to make my mom feel comfortable. They have been incredibly patient and respectful in their care towards her.
We picked this community, because of the location, friendliness of staff and the cost. The caretaking staff are very friendly.  The facilities need better up-keeping. They could improve on the food.

The facility is a bright, pleasant place tucked in a wonderful Quincy neighborhood close to the water. Many of the residents seem friendly and get involved in numerous activities offered at Atria. The staff seem to do their best to be attentive to residents needs.

My father is doing great with his move to this community. I'am comfortable with his move here. They are providing him with great. They have a good staff at this facility. He is pleased with the meals. Everything is working out well,  and I would recommend this community.
Property Address: 700 E Euclid Ave, Prospect Heights, IL 60070

review_text: I loved the staff. They were great with my Mom and kept me updated when needed. I liked it because the living arrangements were a good size...not too compact...there were not a lot of residents so they were more personable and readily available to help if needed. The only complaint Mom had was the food. She said it was bland but she was a little spoiled. They did have some staffing issues/changes during Mom's stay which Mom didn't like but they still gave great care.
Property Name: The Gables at Spring Lake Assisted Living

review_text: We chose Touchmark at Coffee Creek because of what they had to offer. After looking around, everything is just so well kept. It is really a 5 star facility. The staff are fabulous and we really enjoy working with them. I cannot say enough about them, I would absolutely recommend this facility to others.

Mom could not be happier, everybody is extremely helpful.
The facility and grounds are amazingly beautiful and well kept up.
Overall could not be a better place for our loved one.
The staff took the time to get to know me and my family and made sure they could cover all my wants and needs.  Great staff!

reviewTitle: Did a tour at hickory villa and found...
review_text: Did a tour at hickory villa and found the staff friendly. One lady poked me to tell me how much she liked living there. It seems like the residents are out of their rooms a lot socializing and everyone seems higher functioning. The rooms are VERY small. They take the Medicaid waiver right away,

My aunt was admitted to LPD a few months ago. She loves it there! The staff is very friendly and treat her like a family member. She never wanted to go
Into a nursing facility and fought it for years. But now she is content. Her home was actually just sold and the process went very smoothly with no regrets! The staff has been amazing! All I can say is Thank You! My aunt hasn’t look this good in years…and I am being totally serious! I would absolutely recommend LPD to anyone looking for skilled rehab/LTC.

reviewTitle: Monterey is best facility I've been to
review_text: Top notch facility. Recently had rehabilitation here for a hip replacement and the nurses were so caring and on top of my care. They treated me like family. The therapy staff worked very hard to get be moving again and ready to go home feeling confident.
Property Name: Monterey Rehabilitation Center Skilled Nursing and Memory Care

review_text: Escalante at Willow Creek was my first choice.  I would have placed my loved one there had it been my choice to make.  It seemed to be a good value.  I thought it was a step up in terms of activities and food over the other places we toured.  The staff seemed more friendly.  My loved one chose a different community because Escalante was slightly more expensive, and he doesn't like to spend money in general.

I've been through a lot since moving here in terms of my health but Brandywine has made it a little bit better. I like happy hour and the trips we take to restaurants and shows. They have a good team here.

They have short staff due to covid. It seems like what they told us it would cost it is a lot more than when we originally made agreements. There have been times when my loved one pressed her call button and it took over an hour for someone to come and help my loved one. I think that my loved one feels that she has to maintain more of her care than what is being provided at the community. Medication management and trying to get all of the right supplies can be difficult. We had a care plan meeting a few weeks ago and are hoping for improvements from that but it may be to early to tell at the time.

reviewTitle: Not as Nice as You Would Think
review_text: You would think "Oh, that would be a beautiful place to live," but when you go inside there is pipes running along the ceiling and it's not as nice as you would have thought. The apartments themselves are cute but they are very tiny. We couldn't live that crammed up, plus we have two little Yorkies. We also heard that the elevators were a problem.

reviewTitle: Review for The Addison of Lindsay Place
review_text: No I wouldn't recommend to anyone. My mom is unhappy there

reviewTitle: Place Your Trust in Georgian Manor
review_text: Our experience with Commonwealth Senior Living at Georgian Manor has been top notch. When we arrived for our initial meeting with [name removed], the Marketing/Sales Director, we were immediately impressed with the look and the feel of the place. The staff was very friendly and accommodating. My mom really enjoyed meeting everyone on the staff too. All of our questions were answered to our satisfaction and we were able to move my mom in quickly, which was a real relief. My mom enjoys the food! I would definitely recommend Commonwealth Senior Living at Georgian Manor to others.
Property Name: Commonwealth Senior Living at Georgian Manor

reviewTitle: Had a good tour here.  Nice place, go...
review_text: Had a good tour here.  Nice place, good feel.

All of the staff were friendly and I thought it was a nice place for him, there were a lot of good things about it. He acted up and I do not think they handled the situation well at all. If your loved one just needs assisted living it would be a really great fit, but I would not recommend for memory care.
This is a retirement community so basically when you get in the apartment you are on your own.  However, the staff that I have met are very nice and accommodating when we come.

I have been pleased with Arden Courts since my father moved there in 2015. He was living at another facility in Florida, and the difference is amazing. The staff is very caring, professional, very accommodating, and I appreciate what they do. The facilities, activities, and food are all great. I visited many facilities, and am still pleased with our choice.
Property Name: Arden Courts A ProMedica Memory Care Community in Northbrook

review_text: It was a good tour and our guide seemed knowledgeable about the community. The facility was nice and clean. After seeing the community we found out that the staff are not knowledgeable about our dementia and they had no rooms available.

My father was placed at this facility. The staff is great and it has a wonderful family environment. The owners are a nice couple. They are really clean an professional. They are very current in regards to treatment, equipment, and care plans. They allow pets which was important! They serve quality foods which is also something I looked for. My dad has come around at this place, he enjoys his stay!

We had almost no time to find a place for my husband, who was discharged from the hospital in no condition for me to take him home. Canterfield made it easy to ready a room in assisted living.  It was determined that he would need extra care.  Unfortunately it turned out that he needed more and he was moved to Memory Care. The staff  made that move with great care, even hanging up planes and pictures on the walls. (his favorites).  The contact with his caregivers is prompt and very helpful.

reviewTitle: Overall I think they are doing a relatively good job.
review_text: Overall I think they are doing a relatively good job. Everyone is very friendly and nice. They need to work on being more assertive, I think. I don't have to worry about people not showing up, they are pretty good about getting a timely replacement if someone is sick. We mostly have the same couple of people that come out to help, unless someone is sick. I just think there is some confusion about what needs to be done, that is where I think they need to be a little more assertive.
helpful tour, possibility.
Toured this property yesterday.  Did not like this property due to:  No kitchenette in the rooms.  No RN on staff around the clock. The meal times were scheduled, instead of all day dining.

reviewTitle: Review of Collingswood Rehabilitation & Healthcare Center
review_text: Overall, everything was good.

Maplewood at Weston has worked hard to continually improve their services throughout the 4 years my Dad has been a resident.  The staff is keenly aware of the intellectual interests and needs of their elderly population  and programming reflects their understanding.  In addition, meals are nutritious and modern, which makes meal time visits enjoyable for family members in an inviting dining room setting.  During the ongoing pandemic, the corporate offices and local staff worked tirelessly to keep residents healthy.  I can't thank them all enough for their efforts; from months of room service meals to multiple temperature checks per day while continually trying to keep residents socially engaged in small groups and individually, the staff truly outdid themselves.

They can improve on the following: Communication between the staff. Staff turnover is extremely high. Coordination of the medical staff with the patients' medical team for the right type of care. Don't send a loved one there.
Property Address: 601 South Park Road, Spokane Valley, WA 99212

review_text: Hope greeted me when I arrived for my scheduled tour.  She was very gracious and patient in listening to my family situation and concerns regarding my mother.  Hope was able to answer all my questions.  The facility was clean and has a relaxed atmosphere.  The residents that I encountered seem comfortable and pleasant.  They seem to have a nice rapport with the staff. I was pleased with the facility.

reviewTitle: My review of Morningside House At Satyr Hill
review_text: Our family had a virtual tour with Morningside and we loved it, it was in our top two choices. The only reason we were turned away from here is that they did not have a kitchen area and the other community that was in the running did have one. Besides that though we loved the tour.

Recently visited a family member and bought an overpriced lunch sandwich before my drive home.  I had to throw the bread out the window of the car as it was completely stale.  I have heard the food is terrible and know I k now it is true.

I would not want to live here!

The Brookdale Lake Highlands memory care unit is awesome! The entire staff takes personal interest and gives loving care to every resident. My mom is quite happy and I am very grateful to her Guardian Angels and all the support they give me.  The facilities are nice also.  I would highly recommend this amazing team and property.

reviewTitle: Good and Bad - make sure you visit often
review_text:
My father stayed there for a month of rehab. There was good and bad.   
The good: Clean and no bad smell, much of staff is friendly and helpful, the food was fine, the rehab staff was good and he definitely made progress while he was there.  
The bad: They only give showers / bath twice a week and if you don't speak up you may not even get that. After he was there a week I realized that they weren't brushing his teeth so I ended up doing it myself to make sure it was done. They left him in the same clothes for 2 days a couple of times.

Sunrise Senior Living of Westtown is one of the most warm and home like places I have visited.  They are very accommodating to the residents, tending to their individual needs.  

The only thing where they might could improve would be with their communication during the initial move-in period to help the residents and their families get acclimated and know exactly what to expect.  It seemed a little disjointed and took quite a while after we were there for someone to come up and start working with us.  

Other than that it has been very good and she is doing very well there.  I toured a bunch of places, and this place really stood out.  My aunt is doing great, is very happy, and making good friends.  If I had to do it again, I would certainly make the same decision and go with them.
I thought Atria Tanglewood was great.  The building was fantastic.  The location was nice.  The only problem was they don't accept wheelchairs.

Run by greedy, careless administrators that cut corners,[removed]

FL is run on the cheap: frazzled CNAs who staff the desk, help residents, do laundry, administer medication, serve meals and generally run the show with very little oversight. Many are immigrants doing the most difficult work for little pay.

There's an on-site nurse, [name removed] (I'll get to him, later) and he's the only supervising health professional on site. He's there M-F from 7:00 am to 3:00 pm. Should you even utter the words, "do you know where I can find [name removed]?" you'll get a dismissive scoff from the staff, "who knows when he's here!" When I do find [removed], he's in his office doing paperwork. I have never seen him with a patient.

Care issues that my family member ran into, while being "take care of" at Fred Lind:

1. They made no fewer than 6 documented medication errors. I also learned that one of these medications had NEVER been giving during the entire course of my relative's stay at Fred Lind, which was about a year.

2. My family member was twice given morphine, which I suspect (but cannot prove) was given to either incapacitate her to make her more manageable -- even though my family member made it very clear that she does not want to take pain medication.

3. My family member is on oxygen and has pulmonary issues. Aides tipped the diffuser on the oxygen machine, which pumped water into the tubing (can you say pneumonia?) and dripped into her nasal cannula.

4. When my family member developed a skin condition, we had an outside care agency providing wound care. The visiting nurse was very skilled, and recognized that the two wounds needed different treatment. One needed drying (silver powder) and the other needed moisture (antibacterial ointment). Fred Lind reversed the care and ended up [removed]. And of course, charged us an extra $60/month in wound care.

5. My family member fell out of bed and laid on the ground for 8 hours without anyone checking on her. She has arthritis and was unable to raise her arm high enough to reach the emergency cord. [name removed] shifted the blame to my family member, saying that she "lacks the judgement" to call for help and blamed her for "being confused." However, my family member said she called for help until she was hoarse, and this is an outrageous thing to say to an older person [removed] left on the floor all night.

6. [name removed]. The most anxious, strange individual I have ever met. I'm shocked that he's in geriatrics, because he catastrophizes and says things like the following, all mentioned when my family member was completely healthy, self-transferring and ambulatory:

-"soon she'll be bed-ridden and unable to transfer herself"
-"she's going to be totally incapacitated"
-"she needs a wheelchair and transfers to everything; she can't walk"
-"she weighs [weight] and it's a burden for our staff to help someone so heavy"
Note: my family member is plump, but not exactly the half-ton man!

We experienced a constant barrage of negative messages from [name removed] about how horrible our relative's health was, or how she was on the verge of dying, etc. We'd rush over to FL only to find her eating popcorn and watching the baseball game. Nonetheless, our family member, who uses a walker, had to be pushed everywhere in a wheelchair and wasn't allowed to go anywhere without being accompanied -- for a fee, of course.

When we one day found our relative in bed and unresponsive, after seeing two back-to-back doses of morphine, which our relative always refuses, we had this sinking feeling (which again, we can't prove) that the medication was given to fulfill [name removed] prophecy and bully our relative out of the facility.

7. GREED.

My relative ran out of assets and had to sell her house. As you might imagine, this is a process that takes time, and our family communicated with FL throughout. A week before the house closed, the Director, [removed], sent an [removed] message, accusing our family of elder financial abuse and Medicaid abuse (she's not even Medicaid eligible or on Medicaid). "That can be the only explanation for your failure to pay, and if you do not remit payment promptly, I will have to report you and have you investigated." 

I recognize that this is a lame-a** attempt to scare and threaten us into paying, but was harassing, slanderous and downright uncalled for.

If I had more space in this review, I could go on and on. Bottom line: if you're thinking about moving your family member to Fred Lind, think twice!
Older community that came across as more of a hospital setting.  No independent living options.

I toured this community for care. We liked the manager who was friendly and caring. The menu was nice with a lot of variety. They have activities. We looked this community, but we did not have the feeling e were looking for. We would recommend that families tour this community for the care of a loved one

The nurses and caregivers have all been wonderful!
What stuck out about Sunrise of Roseville over other places we looked was the ease of communication with the admissions staff.
It is a great place for a loved one.

reviewTitle: Friendly staff, a nice community and a good place for loved ones
review_text: The friendliness of the staff and all of their accommodations have really stood out to us. When we came for the tour before we stepped through the entrance our loved one was very hesitant about the situation and kept saying there was no way they were staying here. However once we got through the tour they really enjoyed it. Our loved one made a friend and was even given lunch - they were thoroughly impressed and happy. it was a very good first impression. The staff have been very accommodating and helpful in every aspects. We do think it the value for the money is really good.

Clare Oaks is bankrupt.  Clare Oaks lost a $4.1 million dollar lawsuit when a jury found that a resident's medications were mismanaged leading to negative health consequences. If you love your parent, do not put them in this facility. You will regret it forever.
Property Name: The Oaks at Bartlett, a CCRC

reviewTitle: I am very impressed with them.
review_text: They are doing very well. The staff is very friendly. The response time could be improved a little bit, we've had to wait up to ten minutes. They have quite a variety of activities. They are very strict about over the counter medications. Some of the reasons we chose them were that, we liked the activity level of the other residents, the social atmosphere. The staff was really very friendly, and the cleanliness of the area was really good. I liked that they were able to keep the residents in the areas that would most benefit them so that those with higher needs aren't mixed in with those that are more independent. I liked that it didn't have the nursing home feel. I am very impressed with them.
When I needed Respite Care they did an unbelievably remarkable job to make it happen.

We were very impressed from the first time we went to Bellevue. All the staff AND residents that we passed said "Hi". And they all seemed cheerful and happy. The public rooms are spacious and inviting. Expecially, mom seems to be more perky and sociable!!
Staff very friendly always knowing mom by name. Nice environment – Great Meals!
Property Address: 4010 S. Ironwood Drive, South Bend, IN 46614

review_text: You can do anything you want here at StoryPoint of Rockford and it's FUN!!!

We like the care that my mom is getting here . The community is always clean and taken care. The meals are appealing. They have alot of nice activities that are offered and she is always active and participating with the other residents. We are glad to know that she is getting excellent care for a great value.

I picked this community because of the location. This is an active community..the updated vestibule is impressive..rooms are adequate sizes and they respond to updates in rooms in a timely manner..the landscaping is beautiful & their walking paths around the lakes with the swans are perfect!
I have been at Wittenberg Village for eleven years and have loved every moment. A wonderful, caring, friendly community and LOTS OF FUN!

reviewTitle: Great Location is the Best I Can Say
review_text: Owners and management company just don't seem to care and definitely do not follow through.  If you think this is the place for you, at least speak with a few residents before you sign anything.  The community rooms are beautiful and they remodeled some of the units, but make sure any work you need done is completed before you sign a lease.  Read the lease carefully, especially your "move-in" date.  Issues include residents smoking (at night) right outside one of the main doors and you have to walk through a cloud of smoke to go in or out; low-quality and sometimes old and stale food put out for the continental breakfast; persistent blackouts on certain cable channels with Senior TV, which is the company included in the rent; problems with AT&T internet either shutting down or being very slow; meetings, events and breakfast items (and sometimes times) being changed with little or no notice to residents, etc.  Although there is an after-hours emergency phone number where you can leave a message, management is not on site after daytime hours.  Some of the employees are amazing and the saving grace here; while others brought on by the new management seem to think they are doing you a favor by working at Hanover Place - they will walk right by you without so much as a hello, with their nose in a cell phone.
Property Address: 16851 S Harlem Ave, Tinley Park, IL 60477

review_text: This has been a wonderful experience at this community and everyone seems to be very friendly here. They have activities like bingo and cocktail hour and more for the residents to do.

Turnover is an issue but there are a few techs who have been there for some time and they are really good at what they do. All of the med techs were extremely nice and accommodating and many truly care and are good at their job.

The food is more like cafeteria food and not healthy or very tasty at all. 

The memory care building allows the residence freedom, guidance, caring workers. 

Assisted-living rooms are small.  No sinks, countertops etc. Room for a small fridge only. Has a dorm-room feel. 

They do have a large activity room that has a full kitchen and many tables and can be reserved by the residence's family. 

The caretakers and the campus are what make this a nice place.
Property Address: 3620 Happy Woods Ct, Myrtle Beach, SC 29588

review_text: The staff at this care home work with the family.  They are flexible and get to know the residents. There is a Registered Nurse on site. The community is clean as they are particular about the environment. They are knowledgeable about the rules and regulations in Oregon. The food seems healthy and is homemade.  They offer fresh vegetables. They do go on occasional outings and they have card games and puzzles to cater to each resident.

Make sure you get what say in writing before you commit. It is a good value for the money. They have updated staffing. They have finished remodeling. This place did not have add on's and it was all included. Plus it has dedicated memory care. Those are the key factors. No place is perfect. This is the closest thing we could get in our time constraints.
It's a great place just pricy. This was the only one available at the time due to necessity.

This is a warm and inviting environment with places for residents to gather for visiting and to engage in activities and comfortable apartments where people can in their own home.  The food is excellent and served with fine dining finesse.  The leadership provides an atmosphere of wellness, quality and kindness.  The facility offers a significant variety of activities people can join both at Winslow and off-campus for companionship, fun and enrichment.  
I see nursing staff, dining room staff, and activities staff interacting with care and compassion to provide excellent day-to-day quality living for the people who reside at Winslow.  The administrator leads the team in this with kindness and accountability.  She continually promotes that all staff step up and do the right thing every day for each resident of Winslow Court.
Property Address: 3920 East San Miguel Street, Colorado Springs, CO 80909

reviewTitle: A caring staff in a nice community.
review_text: What we really like about Brookdale High Point is its very clean, but consistent care could be improved. However based on the experience we have had so far with this community we would recommend them to other families .
Property Name: Brookdale High Point North Memory Care
Property Address: 1564 Skeet Club Road, High Point, NC 27265

review_text: My mom moved here in August! She has made great friends, likes the activities, and the staff has been very friendly!  Made a good decision! Great Keurig coffee machine in the lobby, a store for the residents, holiday  parties, music, bingo, and gardens!
Property Name: Cogir at The Narrows  Tacoma Assisted Living

reviewTitle: Summerhouse Beau ridgeland was a Godsend for us
review_text:
The Memory Care facility has been wonderful.  We have been blessed to find a place for our mother.   
Everyone there has been so caring and kind.  
It was a very emotional experience for us to have to find a place for our mother but the transition was so easy.  We are forever grateful to all the staff there.

It was a beautiful facility.  Staff and residents very friendly.
We loved it.

Mother chose to live at The Abbey 3 yrs ago. Since then her health has improved and she just turned 95!  She is happy. The caring staff at all levels sees to it that she is safe, clean, properly fed, and busy. Our family too has been cared for in many ways. All these services are great and offered with smiles. We are pleased that she lives in a good place.  I would highly recommend The Abbey.

reviewTitle: Wonderful place for my loved one
review_text: I wanted to share our experience on our recent moving of my loved one to Sea Brooke Point.  We found that it is beautiful, affordable, and the perfect balance of activities, meals, and accommodation.  The staff has been wonderful and we have found that they offer so much more at an affordable rate.  Thank you to [name removed] and all the staff!

reviewTitle: Mi Casa Senior Living   - they really care !
review_text:
Mi Casa Senior Living   
 
This is a beautiful Assisted Living that caters to Memory Care .  They really care for each of their residents and treat them as part of a family. 

 The Management  team and  Staff  take the time to personally know their residents .  My mom has been in the facility for over 90 days and  I have seen how special  they treat her. 

Mi Casa has daily activities ,  games, music, good healthy meals, and above all are loving and  compassionate to the the Residents and families. 

You and  your loved ones will not be disappointed ...

The registration process and everything was fine, all done quickly and on time.  However, we had paid up front for the whole month and my father ended up only staying there for a day before he had some issues and had to move out.  We are still waiting for a response back from them regarding the finances of the situation.
Property Address: 1007 N Martel Ave, Los Angeles, CA 90046

review_text: We had an excellent experience with Golden Heart.  My sister and me were overwhelmed taking care of my mother.  We started with Golden Heart when we needed a break but as my mom's condition deteriorated, we needed more help.  Golden Heart was great throughout all the way through hospice.  I would definitely recommend. [Names removed] and their team really care about what they do.
Property Address: 233 S. Sharon Amity Road Suite 207, Charlotte, NC 28211

review_text: The Brookdale Eden Prairie was nice, but it was very far from our home which was the deciding factor. Other than that, the place was clean and the staff was very friendly.

The activities and the people that live here are great!  The staff is remarkable! There are many opportunities to get involved.  The food is ok.,..but I am picky!  The variety of activities should appeal to everyone.  [name removed] the activity director is awesome!

The tour that the staff took me on was done well, they answered my questions and there were some things that they had to offer I thought were nice but I felt that it was somewhat outdated and I just did not feel comfortable here.

reviewTitle: Great new facility on the South side of Indy
review_text:
My mom is very happy at Demaree.  The staff are all pleasant.  The food is excellent.   My mom has gained some weight back that she had lost because of poor quality of food at another facility.  
I also thank A Place for Mom for all their help.

I am over the moon that my mother is a part of the Sodalis Pensacola family! Moving her from [community name removed] to Sodalis Pensacola, sight unseen, was very scary, but the transition exceeded my expectations! As soon as we walked in, so many new faces greeted us and at that moment I knew how lucky we were to call this mom’s new home! The facility is beautiful! The staff so far has been A++
I know my mother is safe in their care.

reviewTitle: cannot say enough good about them.
review_text: I am very pleased with Sunrise of Sandy. The staff is very personable. They have gotten all their paper work done to build their insurance. They have made my father-in-law feel welcomed and important. They have a very clean and pleasant atmosphere here. I would not hesitate to recommend this facility. I cannot say enough good about them.
We are moving my dad to another community. Since the change in director, the overall atmosphere has changed. We appreciate the care provided, but feel it is time to move on.
I toured this community and wasn't impressed. It's very old, small, needs updated, and not a very active community from what I saw.
I had no problems during my respite stay here. If I wanted to move into a community, I would go back.
Clean, friendly and quiet. Very good first impression.

Our first impression was on the tour and the person who gave the tour was very open, and friendly and very professional showing us everything they had to offer. They were also very accommodating to us because we had to come back twice. During the tour we were able to eat lunch at in cafeteria and we have a variety of options to choose from and it was delicious. 

We love this community, the people who work there are amazing, very professional and really seem to care. The residents who live there are also very lovely. This community is very clean. We absolutely feel we are getting our money's worth. The activities are great, they sometimes take the residents to the museum or the theater.

I filed a complaint about them with the Atty General WA.  Had to struggle over billing, services, and lack of communication.  It's an industry thing I think, and I hope it makes a difference in the long run.  They sold care for people and delivered care for corporate.

Not only is The Landing community very clean, beautiful, pleasing to the eye and well maintained but the friendliness of the staff members has continued to stand out to us. Their constant help to our family whether its giving us meals when we come to visit or helping us move our loved one in, they have been amazing. From the house keeping to the director they are all just wonderful. Even though our loved one does not always participate in the activities, there is always plenty of opportunities to get involved.

reviewTitle: Review of Horizon Health and Rehab Center
review_text: The nurses are very rude. I like the physical therapy and occupational therapy. Some of them are very helpful but there are certain nurses aides I like. I do not get any updates. The nursing dept. needs to improve on their attitudes with talking about people in the hallways and they need to treat the patients better.
Property Address: 660 S Martin Luther King Blvd, Las Vegas, NV 89106

reviewTitle: Review of The Gardens of Pelham
review_text: Good place to live

My aunt only wanted a one bedroom and they gave her a two bedroom for now. The only ting is they did not let us know that we are going to be on a waiting list. They said as soon as a single room is available they will let us know but we didn't know there were people ahead of us. They should have told us right away because now we don't know how long it will be before she gets a single room.

We chose Pacific Inn because, number one, it's close to our house. Number two, my aunt liked the place although they have very limited parking for guests, even on the street. It's not encouraging for family members to visit. I think they have an activity coming up for family members to join but if everybody comes then there's no parking. All that matters is she likes it there and she does.

reviewTitle: Review for Tuscany Villa of Naples
review_text: I would say they are the best. Provide care with heart!I always recommend.

5's across the board! What has made the Flushing House such a great experience so far has been the staff and residents. The staff and other residents work very hard to make Flushing House a kind and caring community. We would recommend this community to other families

reviewTitle: This facility has a terrible policy of isolating residents from family members.
review_text: I would not recommend.

My mom really likes it a lot.  The place is very clean and the rooms are very nice.  The workers there are very friendly.
I am not super impressed with the activities so far.  And we are having minor issues getting my mom's cable TV to work.
The food is fine.  Overall, my mom is very happy.

I would like to say thank you to all the staff, at Home Away From Home, for all the work they put into making tonight's Thanksgiving dinner a success. It was great!
Thank you!!!
Property Name: Home Away From Home Assisted Living Center

review_text: A Nice, handy place to live. The building is close to all the stores I enjoy going to. I the like the people that live and work here. They are nice.
Property Address: 3080 S Richmond St, Salt Lake City, UT 84106

review_text: [Name removed] was absolutely my life saving angel in getting my loved one into the community, and settled, after our original place fell through, I cannot believe the wonderful reception.

reviewTitle: Review of Dry Harbor Nursing Home
review_text: My father seems stronger mentally since he has arrived at Dry Harbor. Physically there has been somewhat of an improvement. The trouble is more with his condition and not the fault of the facility. The staff has done very well with him. They are attentive and caring. My mother spends a lot of time with my father up at the facility and she thinks the care has been very good.
Property Address: 61-35 Dry Harbor Rd, Middle Village, NY 11379

reviewTitle: Review of Elmhurst Rehabilitation And Healthcare Center
review_text: I'd recommend Elmhurst to a friend.

reviewTitle: Exactly Like Being in Someone’s Home
review_text: I toured Sunrise for my loved one's respite care. I really liked it there. It was very homey and comfortable, exactly like being in someone's house. The staff was also very nice and helpful. However, I did not choose to place my loved one here because I was not able to arrange for her care far enough in advance for my liking.
Property Address: 4950 Olson Memorial Highway, Golden Valley, MN 55422

review_text: At first, the community was clean and so was her room, as time went on the cleanliness went downhill.  The communication from the community was not good at all and I was not getting basic info sent to me.  We had billing issues with the community also.

i moved in on 7/6/16. My new home is on the third floor via the elevator and a back view which I don't mind. My home is quiet which I do want. Moving makes for walking a lot which I don't mind too much. Exercise is always good. Residents are very friendly and say hello to you. Looking forward to doing activities. Can take shopping van with group or go shopping alone. Very friendly staff. Very exceptional place to live I think for what I am looking for. Price is in my budget. Calendar is at table by each elevator that has month's activities and you look under your apartment numer for correspondence from office. Large bulletin board lists everything going on with other ads for Seniors. Great place to live and many activities.
Very impressed with this facility.  24 hr nursing, ability to transport for dr. appontments.  Will definately have this facility for a follow up.
The people have been absolutely amazing. The social worker is phenomenal!

Our family had an in person tour with Belmont Village and it was a close second choice, but the price was just a little bit higher then the other communities we had toured because the medication management was not included. However they had a lot of activities which was nice and the staff were very professional on the tour and very knowledgeable.

Overall I think Brookdale Place of Albuquerque has a lot to provide their residents. It's a nice looking, clean community and the staff are all very friendly! However I think they could do a much better job getting their new residents integrated and involved in the community. They have a lot to offer but don't do a good job of showing new people around.
Property Address: 4910 Tramway Ridge Drive Northeast, Albuquerque, NM 87111

review_text: Our loved ones really like the location of The Woods - its near their old home so they are very familiar with the area which was a comfort to them as they are getting older. They also really like their apartment -it is big enough for the both of them with all their art works and furniture. The community did a great job renovating the main common area - the with the fresh paint it is very bright, cheerful, fresh and welcoming. It really is a nice environment and looks like a high end apartment complex. The staff have been wonderful and are very encouraging to families for visiting and are very welcoming
We have been here 14 months. We feel at home. We have one meal, dinner every day, all the residents are very friendly.

46 out of 50 stars. [Name removed] was very informative and spoke to Dad directly. She also volunteered the idea of independent living with à la cart assistance rather than automatic assisted-living. 80 to 90% of the facility has undergone a recent face-lift or is just finishing. The room sizes and layout configurations of both assisted living and independent living sweets are generous and well configured. laundry is included in assisted-living but not in independent. Weekly housekeeping is included in both. W/D units are available in all independent sweets, and some assisted-living, but not the layouts that Dad favored.

reviewTitle: Didn't like that there were stairs
review_text: This was beautiful, but there were a lot of steps and my dad had been on a walker, unsteadily, and he ended up breaking his arm where he was before so he was in a wheelchair. They had ramps but with the steps we were afraid of him falling. It was nice, but it wasn't right for him.
Property Address: 1450 Marlton Pike East, Cherry Hill, NJ 08034

review_text: It was clean, friendly, warm, not too big, had a nice vibe and really attentive, thoughtful staff. I would recommend to others.

Dayspring was a very nice facility. The place eas clean and the people there were very friendly. It had a positive homelike feel, but it was much more expensive than other communities that we were looking into.

reviewTitle: my dad is blossoming and ejoying meals
review_text: My dad is a friendly, cordial 86 year old.  We were afraid that senior housing would snuff the spark from him.  We were wrong....he has gained some much needed weight and is relieved to have healthcare providers in case he needs them.

It's been somewhat of a mixed experience so far. It's a nice enough looking place, and the staff seem friendly, but my loved one has had a few complaints. She says they're very strict about meal times, and that if she arrives even a few minutes early they make her get up and leave the dining room until they are ready. She also has had a problem with ants in her room, which it has taken them a while to resolve.

reviewTitle: Truly special place...a w hotel for seniors
review_text: I thought I was going to hate looking for senior living facilities for mom...and I did dread this process very much... that is until I met [name removed] and visited Turners Rock.  Game changer.  First of all the property is beautiful...like a w hotel for seniors.  Artistic, well designed.  No nursing home decor.  Rooms are beautiful, and amenities are all on point but the people...the people elevate it even further.  You can feel the energy.  Not only Christine but we had the opportunity to say hello to the GM, and the activities director [name removed]...(who immediately stated his mission is not just activities...but to build a community).  It touched me greatly and felt so heartfelt.  We had soup in the restaurant and [name removed] our server could not have been sweeter or more professional.  I watched mom's eyes light up and the wheels start turning that this could actually be a nice new chapter instead of something to dread.  My heart exploded at the relief.  Mom is on the waitlist to move in and I'm thrilled.  Amazing.
Property Address: 3911 E State Hwy D, Springfield, MO 65809

review_text:
Elmcroft personnel are very friendly and engaging with the resident.
They are very attentive to the patient’s needs.

Our tour of the facility was very nice. Great property, nice people, and our guide [name removed] was very knowledgeable of the building and the elder care in general. [name removed] , the director, even spoke to us at length, which we really appreciated. None of the other facilities we have looked at did the director take the time to meet us, we really appreciated that! 10/10 would recommend

Ditmas Park rehab, or as people here say “Ditmas”, is a great facility. My family member was here over the last few months and we were all very happy. Rehab: The rehab downstairs is unbelievable. The therapists are patient and understanding. The progress my loved one made was honestly not in air slightest dreams. Medications were administrated on time and the food was actually quite decent, good actually. There is a lot of construction going on now because they are expanding with new services. Don’t let that turn you away. We are very happy and highly recommend.

reviewTitle: My Tour Experience at Brookdale Northwest Greensboro
review_text: The community had an odor and the doors were dirty when we arrived for the tour.  We didn't feel comfortable here and wouldn't want to place our loved one here either.
Property Address: 5809 Old Oak Ridge Road, Greensboro, NC 27410

review_text: Assurety Senior Care has the sweetest staff and really took care of my cousin while she was residing there, what an amazing place.. They are so caring to their patients, thank you for the care you've provided all the way thru hospice
My review is based on my patients who live in this community
Property Address: 3145 West Mt Hope Avenue, Lansing, MI 48911

reviewTitle: I would not recommend the facility.
review_text:
My Father passed away in the facility. He was there less than a month. I was told he would be evaluated before he would be able to move in with his wife. I have my doubts that he qualified. Several issues. Will be happy to provided  specific details.
Care givers
Medicine distribution
Providing assistance when requested
Resident - good experience

reviewTitle: Review of Franklin Park at Sonterra
review_text: Assisted living is a wonderful place to me. Staff is so nice and the Activity Director is absolutely for us her caring and compassion, show in everything she does.

The staff is very helpful in meeting my request and needs for my love one.  The Home Aid providers that I have  meet my Love One needs and they are very knowledgeable and understanding in the care and surrounding.

reviewTitle: Our Grandmother is a new resident at ...
review_text: Our Grandmother is a new resident at Carriage House, but so far we have been very pleased. Magnolia, the Evening Receptionist, is very caring and concerned about all the well being of the residents (and their families), and has made the transition for us much less stressful!!

reviewTitle: Westminster Village is a great ace to visit and to live!!
review_text: There is a very warm feeling that you feel as soon as you walk in the door of Westminster Village. As you walk through the hall you see smiling residents who greet you and seem genuinely happy to live there. Employees as well seem to all have a friendly smile and a helpful attitude toward everyone, residents and guests alike.. Westminster.Village is a beautiful building with very lush landscaping and very nicely appointed apartments but the best thing about it is the family feeling one gets when visiting g there and the food is pretty awesome too. They are very creative and up to date in making fun videos and activities featuring residents who want to participate.
Property Name: Oakbridge Terrace Assisted Living Residence At Westminster Village
Property Address: 500 Spanish Fort Blvd, Spanish Fort, AL 36527

review_text: I've been very pleased with how things have been going  at Emeritus! My loved one has had trouble settling in and adjusting to the new community, but they have been very accommodating and are trying their best. It's a nice, clean community, and the staff have all been very friendly. They're great when it comes to communication, always easy to get ahold of and quick to fix any issues that I bring up. They could do a bit better when it comes to their dining service. The food is fine, but they're not very flexible when it comes to what they offer.
This was a good community however, they were a bit on the higher end.

Decent, but Not too impressed; (nicely) tiled floors seemed cold; carpet in apt. halls seemed dirty, dingy; but nice apt with the best flr-ceiling windows; nice kitchen; closets decent; young community; seemed nice people, happy; very catholic; dinner seating at 2 specific times.
Property Address: 4239 N Oak Park Ave, Chicago, IL 60634

review_text: The care was excellent! The staff was attentive and responded quickly. From the beginning to end, the communication was great! If I could give more than 5 stars, I would.

reviewTitle: Review of The Legacy Of St. Anthony
review_text: My dad passed recently and all of the staff were amazing and truly cored about our family. Nursing is now helping us move our mother in this amazing place

I will give you a 5 on  ALL. Categories.  I really do not have any negative comments. Preston Pointe is a nice place to downsize when the time is right and the person is ready to  accept  that they should   Make the adjustment.

reviewTitle: Great place to live for seniors.
review_text: We have been very happy with our decision to move into the Willows at Victoria Falls. Great resident services. The building and the grounds are beautifully kept. Great staff.

As happy as I am to have my mother settled in assisted living, I feel like I am losing family members by not being able to see [name removed]and [name removed]who cared so lovingly for my mom. [name removed], the owner, I commend you for having recruited such an amazing team of care givers to represent your company.  Words cannot express how much I appreciate your character, integrity and how much you helped me at a very crucial time while caring for mom.  I called and you came to my home the same day, assessed Mom and the home and provided me with excellent help the next day.  My God continue to bless the work of your hands as you help so many going through the challengers of caring for their aging family members.

My Mother moved here almost three years ago. She was happy then, but things seem to have changed. She still has her friends and so doesn't want to move even though there has been a steady decline in many areas of this complex.  She likes meeting with friends for supper, but often complains to me that the food is not warm when served. She was not happy recently when there was a "Harry Potter" day. The activities need to be more directed towards their generation. She said the employees seemed to have a great time taking photos of themselves, but the residents weren't really sure about the "wizards and witches" references. I told her to talk with the activities employees and hopefully they can come up with more age appropriate events. How about a 1940"s dress up day or something similar?

Unity Home has done an excellent job looking after my loved one. He is well taken care of, and really seems to have settled in nicely. I like that it is a smaller more intimate family type setting. They all eat meals together, and there is lots of individual attention for each resident. He took very well to it, and seems to be happy here!
I enjoy my neighbor here. I would like to do more on my own – sometimes I feel helpless. Friendly and helpful staff.
Property Address: 5100 New Forest Drive, San Antonio, TX 78229

reviewTitle: Review of Urbandale Health Care Center
review_text: The nurses and staff done well. The food is okay. Sometimes it's cold, but my loved one told me they'll heat it for him.

There were many factors that played into where to move my brother too, and budget was one of those factors. This community rate were a little to high for his budget. I knew it wouldn't had been a good fit for him. It is a bigger community, and we wanted something more smaller and mellow.
Property Name: Lighthouse Senior Living at Martin’s Wood LLC for Hopkins Creek

review_text: I will be checking further; sounds interesting.

Most of staff are very nice and eager to help.  If something is broken takes a while to get fixed.  Overall nice place.
I would recommend them only if your loved one is able to get around it themselves.  My Dad  is needing a little more care and it is rough.  I spend a lot of nights there.

My aunt is doing very well here at this community. It is a very nice place, and I'am comfortable with her move to this community. Everyone has been very nice, and friendly. The community looks nice, they do a good job with keeping everything neat, and tidy. They are taking very good care of her and her needs. She is safe, and in good hands at this community, and I would recommend it.

reviewTitle: The Lodge, the new face of assisted living.
review_text: This is by far the best place we visited.  From the moment we walked in the door, we were greeted by a wonderful staff.  We were shown through the entire facility and eventually taken to the rooms that are parents will call HOME.  Everything was above expectation.  The facility feels like you are walking into an elegant resort and the amenities are very well thought out and age appropriate.  We could not be happier to say that our parents are living at The Lodge.

reviewTitle: Review of Majestic Gardens at Memphis
review_text: The staff are okay. Some things we've asked for were not done. We don't like the way the rehab is set up. The therapists need to force them to do rehab to get better and my mom refuses and they let it go. The nurses are doing what they can. She has to have an air mattress and does not have one. There is a little odor in some parts. They did not contact me when they needed to. No one knew what hospital they sent her to and could not find her.

reviewTitle: They could check up on thier caregivers more
review_text:
We had a problem with the one caregiver. They ended up firing her. Once I did call and told them about the problem, they were very willing to try and fix it. They fired her pretty much on the spot for the things that she was doing. It was one person that we had issues with and they took care of the situation as soon as they could. We were going to try somebody else, but unfortunately my father passed away over the weekend so we didn't try another caregiver.

I think they could maybe spend a little more time checking up on the caregiver with maybe a surprise visit to make sure they're doing what they're supposed to be doing. They would call me to see how it's going, but I'm not there - it was my dad who was getting the care. After they set up a caregiver, that was the last contact we had with the people in charge.

My Aunt was ready to move to assisted living life. This was the first place we saw. After seeing multiple other places , this is where she decided to move! It was bright, clean and very cheerful. All the residents seemed very happy there and they are so friendly. You cant walk down the hall with out saying many hellos to everyone you pass! The staff as well are so friendly and cheerful. My Aunt has only been there a little over a week and is so happy with her choice.
It was very good there. My loved one seems to enjoy it. He said the rehab therapists are really good there.
Property Address: 1500 W Warm Springs Rd, Henderson, NV 89014

reviewTitle: Sunrise Buckhead - Great Place for Mom!
review_text: Excellent staff, wonderful residents, and beautiful building and grounds.
Property Address: 1000 Lenox Park Boulevard Northeast, Atlanta, GA 30319

reviewTitle: Review of Novi Lakes Health Campus
review_text: I think the residents need more attention to their personal hygiene. I think the therapy dept. does a wonderful job. The office does a great job too.

reviewTitle: Review of Atria Chandler Villas Chandler, AZ
review_text: Comfort and security, companionship, health monitoring and entertainment.

This is a smaller community with low staffing.  They are very caring, and I would trust them again with my loved one.  

The communication tends to be mediocre; however, they are good about calling if there is an incident with my loved one.  I do wish there was more communication about medical needs of my loved one and what the medical team says about my loved one.

reviewTitle: Review of Pacifica Senior Living Peoria
review_text: [Name removed] in Cottage 4 is doing a good job taking care of my mom. She is nice, and friendly and caring.
I love it here. The people are great. The staff does an excellent job.

They are very clean, staff is very personable.
From what have seen in the activities, they are very geared towards the residents abilities.
They seem to have adequate staffing.
Definitely do your homework and research before deciding on the location in which your loved one's would be staying at.
I live at the Regency House and I love the community. The staff, residents, activities, and food is amazing. I have lived here for 10 years and would not move any where else.

I do feel comfortable with my fathers move to this community. They are taking good care of him, and his needs. The staff have been good to work with. He is in the memory care portion of the community. I know he is being provided with good care, and is safe. It is a pretty mellow scene whenever I visit. He is doing well since his move to this community, and I would recommend it.
Property Name: Lafreniere Assisted Living and Memory Care

review_text: Quite impressed with [Removed], the Administrator  She continuously reached out to me to see how I was doing..not whether my mom was going to come to Magnolia Springs to live.  But she was concerned about how I was doing.  I truly appreciated that.

It is absolutely a very comfortable place and my loved one is happy there. It is one of the only places that is really rehabilitative. I like the fact they have a flexible schedule and I am satisfied with the therapy. The nurses are doing a good job. They take care of her wounds and bandages and give her baths. They are 100% so on top of their communication! It would be nice to have an outside area where they can see trees and birds and things rather than just cement and asphalt.

I think it's an excellent community and would recommend it to others considering taking a loved one there.  We're very satisfied with them.  When we visit, everything seems great.  It's very clean.  Our loved one says the food is okay.  She likes her neighbors and has already made friends there.  Everything is working out well so far.  The care is excellent.   They do a lot with activities.  They have had a few Covid cases, but that's on par with what's happening everywhere right now.  The cost seems high, but it's still cheaper than other places we looked at.

They're real good. It's expensive but I don't have too much to compare it to. I like the activities. They have everything posted - they play card games, bingo, and memory games. They have exercise classes and they try to make it real fun. My brother is not able to join in so he watches. We're still hoping he will improve.

I like a lot about Ashbury Gardens. I'm glad my brother is there. They're making sure he gets down to his meals and they're giving him his meds and making sure he takes a shower. They're watching over him real good. I'm really happy with the care.

There are a couple of things that need fixing. His screen door and a piece of the cabinet are broken and we've asked them twice about that. They haven't gotten back to us yet but that's something minor.
Our family had an in person tour and we really did like it but it seemed like their prices would vary and we wanted more of a set consistent pricing.

Everybody was very friendly at The Waterford at Miracle Hills.  They made it a very easy process.  

I do think that the place is more designed for assisted living, not as much for respite care which is what we used them for.  That being the case it was not entirely what we expected, but that is not their fault.  They were all very nice and seem to be very good at what they are designed to do.

reviewTitle: Review for Chestnut Hill Senior Living
review_text: I loved the atmosphere,and meeting the staff especially [name removed]. Fabulous!! I would totally recommend Chestnut Hill as well.

I was very impressed initially with this company.  Their services seemed to exceed expectations.  That said, I unexpectedly lost my job before services began.  I had to cancel and was still charged an early termination fee.  I would have thought they would have been more understanding under the circumstances.
Property Name: HomeWell Care Services of Worthington, OH
Property Address: 6649 North High Street, Ste 200, Columbus, OH 43085

review_text: This looked like a nice clean community when I visited. This community seems to offer some nice amenities and activities.  The people I met were friendly. The community we chose just seemed to fit my loved one better.

We put our mother in this facility thinking that they really cared for her and us. 
However, we didn't realize that after they got us to sign the paperwork and got her moved in that they would reevaluate her care level and increased our price by over 60% overnight!!! (And they don't let you see the point scale they use. All smoke and mirrors!)
This place has been in a perpetual state of change in their personnel and we never know who is leaving next. 

A Very unstable and untrustworthy place. Don't make the same mistake we did! Keep looking or it could end up costing you dearly.
My mother n law was only there 2 weeks and she passed but it was a beautiful place all the way.
Moms only complaint was breakfast was not much. Toast was just warm white bread. Only one piece of bacon. Are theycutting corners?

reviewTitle: Based On The Tines We Used Their Help
review_text: We had Right at Home of Wake County a few times for the care over my dad.  The caregiver was on time on and ready to help. They assisted her with what she needed and followed the instructions very well. the caregiver's personality matched with my dad's personality. All went well for this times that we used them.
Property Name: Right at Home - Wake County - Raleigh, NC -
Property Address: 2500 Blue Ridge Rd., Suite 312, Raleigh, NC 27607

reviewTitle: has been really good for mom
review_text: It has been really good for mom at White Pine Senior Living. Everybody has been good about answering questions really fast. Some type of schedule would be nice. Like a kind of checks and balances to keep track of what services that have been accomplished with mom that I could look at in her room. The hospice area has been doing that and I like that. If they are around they are very quick to answer any questions that I have but it would be nice in case they aren't around to just look on a sheet and see what has been done. Other than that suggestion everything has been really good here.
Property Name: White Pine Advanced Assisted Living of Blaine

reviewTitle: Did not care for this commu...
review_text: Did not care for this community. It was depressing and in need of an update.

We do know there is a lot of pressure the communities are facing now with covid, and unfortunately we are not able see what is exactly is going on and develop those relationships with the staff members. We do know they are very caring and they look out for their customers, but the communication is lacking a little bit.
Property Name: Arden Courts A ProMedica Memory Care Community in Silver Spring

review_text: My parent has lived at The Palazzo for a few years in independent living and it has definitely been the right place for him. The staff is attentive and truly cares about the residents. Both staff and residents smile often and seem happy on a regular basis. The activity program is extensive and the happy hours at the bar are not to be missed.  We also enjoy the music concerts held every Tuesday afternoon. The rates are better than most other places nearby and we have been very happy at the community.

reviewTitle: Above and Beyond other senior livinig communities!
review_text:
I have been involved in senior living over 20 years and have never felt so warm and welcomed like at Clarendale. 
From the moment you step in there is an energy and feeling of warmth and welcoming.  I love visiting this place!

Very nice facility, tons of amenities.  Costs appear in line until you start breaking everything down and then you find hidden costs that quickly skyrocket if you need any assistance at all.   If your 100% healthy then this is the place to be.

reviewTitle: Review for Sun City West Assisted Living & Memory Care
review_text: The staff (as in the workers) are great. The management is horrible. Communication is horrible. I can't figure out how a facility that is this poorly run can stay in business. They certainly have no problem lying to you about what they have done or will do. Classic case of over-promise under-deliver.
Property Name: Sun City West Assisted Living and Memory Care
Property Address: 13810 W Sandridge Dr, Sun City West, AZ 85375

review_text:
Grandma Joan's provided me with a very easy to use platform to find and employ a live-in caregiver for my 104-year-old dad. All the administrative details which would have been very hard for me to find out and deal with were included in the step-by-step guidance provided. On one hand the service is pricey but on the other, not easy to find a comprehensive package that would have resulted in such a trustworthy arrangement, which was the overarching criterion. California has stricter rules about payment to caregivers than other states so cost is simply higher but given that as an unavoidable feature, this was still a more viable set up than I could otherwise find.
All in all, I am very glad that I was referred to David and his service which has so far had a good outcome.
Property Name: Grandma Joan's Live-In Care Consulting and Recruiting

reviewTitle: She really took to the staff, and we were both impressed with the staff.
review_text: We were very pleased with Whispering Woods. She chose them because of how pleased she was with the person who introduced her to the area. She really took to the staff, and we were both impressed with the staff. We were also very impressed that they will look at alternatives and work with you if you run out of money.
Property Name: Commonwealth Senior Living at East Paris

review_text: The most beautiful place inside and out. Patty [removed] gave a great tour.  Unfortunately a little too pricey.
We were not the biggest fans of Myrtle Beach Manor. It is an older facility and needs some updates/TLC.

reviewTitle: Very nice, and people were very frien...
review_text: Very nice, and people were very friendly.

I am a resident of Atria West 86th and have been residing in the community for five years now.  The staff is very pleasant and helpful, which makes my living situation at ease, safe and comfortable.  There are plenty of activities of anyone's preferences and I truly enjoy participating in-house.  The community is very welcoming when it comes to pets.  I do have a dog that lives with me and my dog Carla also loves Atria and enjoy taking the elevator.  

During the Covid lockdown, the facility did an excellent job caring for the residents and keeping us safe.  They went above and beyond and kept us informed and reassured.  

Overall, my experience thus far is great!

My husband lived in this community for a few months. Everything was going very well, until they changed ownership. From there everything went down hill. They started providing poor care, and I had to move my husband to another community.
Property Name: The Courtyards at The Ambassador Memory Care Assisted Living

review_text:
Way to many problems.  
$1000 fee just to get in the apt.  Ala cart services with rates that started high and just got higher.  Some friendly, skilled and caring staff.  But... mistakes on meds, poor housekeeping and no real follow through by supervisors has made this home a real test of our trust and confidence.
Property Address: 119 East Hayden Lake Road, Champlin, MN 55316

review_text: Don't put your parent there. They barely make rounds and I always found my mother with a wet diaper and clothes that I had to change.  They appear understaffed. The nurses appear to last only a couple of months and then you never see them again. My mother was hospitalized 3 times in a couple of months and went in with no health problems except mild dementia. The last two times were for dehydration according to her lab values. She eventually died. Right now I'm still waiting on the money she had left in her patient fund account. It's been just under 4 months and I still haven't gotten her excess money. I signed paperwork indicating she had excess, but they don't seem to get around to send it to me.
