I could go on and on about no activities, never putting her on oxygen even when it was ordered, Horrible place.
Property Address: 9105 Oxford Place Dr, Baton Rouge, LA 70809

review_text: The staff wasn't bathing my loved one like they should have.  My loved one and myself have had to take trash out because of the community being short staffed.  The community is to bringing meals to my loved one, and they aren't always making them up to my loved one's room in a timely manner.
Property Address: 601 South Park Road, Spokane Valley, WA 99212

review_text: They are wonderful. They stay on top of things and pay attention. They communicate effectively with the family and residents. She has her own studio. Our family is very happy with the community.

reviewTitle: Our Pets' Joyful Life at Town Village
review_text: The pet-friendly amenities at Town Village, including grooming and walking services, ensure our pets are as happy and well-cared for as we are. It's heartwarming to be in a community that values our furry family members.
Property Address: 13000 N May Ave, Oklahoma City, OK 73120

review_text: I was just disappointed in not being told about the 1 month non refundable fee that is applied to the beginning of the stay.  Which I would have paid and did. It seemed a bit sneaky to me.  Otherwise it's a lovely facility and everyone is great.  If the location works for you it's lovely.  The l9cation ultimately didn't work for us and their manhattan location was not in our budget

reviewTitle: Review of Majestic Gardens at Memphis
review_text: They're friendly, nice, and everything. It seems like they need more staff though.
What I like the most about the Brookdale Overland Park community is the friendliness of the staff, the meals and all the activities.

The main area is clean, but sometimes my loved one’s bathroom isn’t clean.  They have a variety of activities that are appropriate for memory care patients. The only issue is that in relation to all memory care units, there are some residents that wander into other people’s rooms.  It’s an excellent location, very well taken care of. All of your needs taken care of when they’re brought to management.

Very safe and pleasant home-like environment. The apartments are very spacious. The community is small enough for the staff to get to know the residents. Pet friendly too! The residents seem really happy.  The activities are interesting and help the residents get to know one another.
Single floor, nice staff & activities, good size rooms

My mother was a resident at the Bristal for almost two years.  She unfortunately passed away in December, 2015 of heart failure.  She was almost 93.  My mother loved the Bristal.  She was so happy there.  She loved the people, her room, the food, the activities, the entertainment, the services and the beauty and cleanliness of the entire place.  She used to say..."I'm trying to find something about the place I don't like...but I can't find anything...I feel like I died and went to heaven."
    I want to thank the Bristal staff for making the last two years of my mother's life so happy, peaceful and safe.   My brothers and I were so relieved that we did not have to worry about her and knew she was in safe hands and enjoying her life so much.  I also want to thank the other residents who were so friendly and caring.  My mother made many friends and felt so loved.  I highly recommend The Bristal...and if I am still aroud in 15-20 years, I hope to be a resident there myself.
Property Address: 99 South Service Road, North Hills, NY 11040
3025 Maple Dr NE Ste 3, Atlanta, GA 30342

review_text: We love this place.  The staff is awesome and super helpful.  My loved one really likes it here.  My loved one comes for there day program and really enjoys it.  My loved one says that the food is good and enough variety.  The community is always clean and tidy.  I would recommend them to my family and friends.

reviewTitle: Cottages of Perry Hall Generally a Decent Assisted Living Facility
review_text: My 92 year old mother was a resident at the Cottages of Pery Hall for 3 months after suffering a hemorrhagic stroke, which left her paralyzed on her right side and impaired speech.  She was confined to a wheel chair and was not able to use the bathroom.  Her cottage was clean and the food was prepared in the cottage for 16 residents.  She liked the food and the staff was kind and fairly conscientious. Overall, we were happy with her care, but we visited every day, twice a day to monitor her care. My biggest concern was that they were often understaffed, which put a burden on the rest of the staff, who were trying to do the best they could do.  I expressed this concern more than once and suggested they have a floater, who could fill in when one of the 4 cottages had a no-show, but that did not happen.

The staff and the management has made everything real easy, especially with moving in. They make it all really simple and treat my loved one like a human being. Awbrey place is just a real nice facility.

reviewTitle: Carriage Court Will Add to Your Loved One's Legacy
review_text: The key to this community is it truly lives up to the word community.  The leadership is strong.  The director and assistant director are accessible, available, and responsive.  The staff are very accommodating which brings the families comfort.  They have such great strategies to protect the residents and keep that safe.  The community is well managed which is a key component to a great place which then  translates to great staff.
GREAT LOOKING PLACE... NICE PEOPLE. QUESTION WHETHER "OVER NIGHT" CARE IS ROBUST ENOUGH
It offers more selections with larger apartments, garage's and covered parking. Very friendly community with many activities on and off site.
Property Name: Legacy Oaks of Azle Senior Living

review_text: This seemed like a nice community when I visited.  I had a short visit with the marketing person and they seemed to be concerned about the residents. This community did not seem appropriate for my friend as they were not ready for memory care. I know someone who has a loved one here and they seem to like it.

The staff members at the community are very friendly. We spoke with other individuals living there and they had no complaints, they really have a good track record. They have done a tremendous job during this time with COVID and the few cases they have had, have been completely resolved. We have been very pleased. Before COVID they had a lot of activities, and the event coordinator really did a lot of with the residents. They would take them out to restaurants for lunch on Tuesday's, they also have arts and crafts. They would bring in live entertainment and provide religious services.
What has really stuck out to me about Sunrise of Newton is definitely the quality of care that they provide.
I would recommend if the person did not need additional assistance.
Service is average.  I've learned not to recommend anyone for services.
Property Address: 8833 Perimeter Park Blvd Suite #602, Jacksonville, FL 32216

reviewTitle: Small size makes it so personable
review_text: My mother moved in to Gardens of Daphne 7 weeks ago and we have been so pleased.  Everyone there is so kind and VERY helpful.  Mom's back causes her to not be very mobile and the wonderful ladies there never hesitate to help her in any way they can.  There are only 16 residents, so they can easily give one on one attention to their residents.  The food is very good and they are flexible with the menu if the resident is not in the mood for a "complete meal" making a sandwich, bowl of soup or a salad for them.  They have activities but not so much that it can be overwhelming.  I also love that they do not "nickel and dime" you for everything they do for the residents and their monthly rent is extremely competitive.  I would recommend Gardens of Daphne to anyone.

reviewTitle: my review of Fieldstone Memory Care Puyallup
review_text:
The front office was very attentive and they went above and beyond.  

I would rec
same owner - 2 locations.
Property Address: 3890 N Buffalo Dr, Las Vegas, NV 89129

review_text: The employees of this location are very friendly and welcoming. I feel very safe here.

reviewTitle: Review for Stonefield Assisted Living and Memory Care
review_text: The residents were very upbeat. They didn't look like they were waiting to transition like the other places. Also, the environment was clean and had no foul smells. Also liked the way the staff referred to Stonefield as the residents home and that the staff works for the residents and not vise a versa.
Property Name: Stonefield Assisted Living and Memory Care

reviewTitle: Review for  Portside at Grande Dunes
review_text: We picked them because it was  newer and more modern. I would not recommend it to anyone. The marketers on quoted a price and when I got there she charged me [amount removed]more. It was too late to make other arrangements. I was very unimpressed with her throughout the stay.

reviewTitle: My Parents Are In A Wonderful Place
review_text: My parents have been getting the care they need in this community. I appreciate the staff, they are good quality people who are doing a wonderful job for my parents. They can be challenging at times and they are getting use to it. I like the layout of the community, it is open and cozy with lots of light. My parents enjoy the meals 70% of the time, no specifics but they have their good days. My mom liked how she got her hair done from the onsite hair salon.
Property Address: 1713 W Chester Pike, West Chester, PA 19382

review_text: They're onsite at Edgewood Downs and it's absolutely excellent. They're different people, one lady comes Monday, Wednesday, Friday and she's in school full time and wants to get into home health care as a profession. Another lady works Tuesday, Thursday and Saturday and then the manager/director for the on-site buzzes in and out all the time and when she comes through the dining room she gives hugs out to all of the clients and everything.

At first I thought the rehab was a warming place but as time passed I realized that they don’t genuinely care for the patients.  They drop the food in the rooms during breakfast lunch and dinner and honestly don’t even monitor a patient is eating or not.  They drop off the medication the the patients room place it in the table and walk out leaving it up to a patient to take the medication or not.  I witness a patient ask to be place back in her room from the Dayroom because she had a headache an hour passed and this lady was still asking to go to her room.  My family member went in there weighing a sold weight she was healthy she started dropping pounds she wasn’t eating and and the conversation the nutritiononist had with her while I was in the room was “you are over weight so lossing a few pounds won’t harm you”. Is that a correct thing to say? I hate to write this but I just want to suggest that when you admit a family member you continue to monitor them and don’t leave that person unattended if you truely love them.

This is an amazing community!! You can tell that the staff enjoy their jobs and really care for the residents. The residents look happy, cared for and loved on. It's such a warm feeling when you arrive.

reviewTitle: Very comfortable, great food, and a wonderful staff.
review_text: The food is great and the staff could not be friendlier and  more helpful if they tried.  We only moved here because our family insisted and now we are very glad we did.  They have done an outstanding job of protecting all of us from the corona virus.  Now that things are opening up somewhat, we are finding out about all of the activities and entertainment that they normally have,  Our apartment is very comfortable and nicely laid out.  We have also found all of the residents to be very friendly.  There is a very happy group of people here, probably because they are treated well.  They are very responsive to our needs.  They are very pet friendly and because of that there are a lot of pets here.  If our little dog could talk, I am sure he would give a 5 star rating.  Their name is very appropriate, Resort Style Communities.  It is not cheap but a great value for what you get living here. I would give it an unconditional recommendation to anyone.

reviewTitle: Rate increase 40 days after moving in
review_text: Got a rate increase within 40 days. Medication management went from $100 to $200 per month. 100% increase, that's a big deal.

reviewTitle: A very desirable home away from home.
review_text: They're a very friendly group of people.  I visit often, and I feel like they know me.  I think they really try their best.  Some of the help is better than others.  With Covid, I'm only allowed in my loved one's room.  Visitors can't be in the common areas or join loved ones in the dining room.  The food's nothing fancy, but it's not bad.  Activities are limited, but I feel like they do what they can.  It's tough in memory care where everyone is at different stages and capabilities.   This type of care is expensive, but I understand that it requires a lot of personal attention.  They can be slow to do things - answer the door bell, answer the emergency call buttons.  The HVAC system isn't the best, and I think the laundry could be a little better.   But overall, I don't have any big complaints, and I wouldn't take my loved one anywhere else.
Not much to add. The staff are good and helpful with any questions or issues that you may have. I would recommend Park at Johns Creek.

The medical care at this community is [Removed].  My mother was at HC resort of Leawood for rehab care and had a completely unresponsive doctor ([Removed]) that did not return phone calls and never once walked into her room during a 20+ day stay.  She deteriorated under his care and the care of his incompetent nurse practitioner ([Removed]) and ended up in the hospital for 5 nights.  The nurses (a few who are nice) do not have a competent Director to help them problem solve and get ahead of issues.  Even after all of this, we never received one call from HC resort asking how my mother was doing.  When we arrived at the hospital, we finally felt safe and were so grateful that we never had to return.  It saddens me that a place like this is responsible for the care of our loved ones.  They need a major overhaul.

As a family member I am beyond disappointed with Clark Retirement from the executive management to poor care and services. This community lacks the empathy, insight and simple honesty that would make this an awesome place.  The staff turnover is incredibly high, numerous high level leadership people have left due to dishonesty, poor communication and lack of organization of the community. The food services has been an ongoing issue since 2016, and remains an issue today. The billing and finance staff are some of the rudest individuals.  Despite the fact that myself and many family members have filed numerous complaints with the Executive Director, VP of Operations and President, Clark continues on a downward spiral.
Property Address: 1551 Franklin St SE, Grand Rapids, MI 49506

review_text: The residents are very friendly and most of the staff are very helpful and seem to enjoy their work with seniors.  The food in the dining room is average but sadly, at times the food is quite poor.  We have experienced the food in other senior living buildings so we do have something to compare it to.  Honestly, at times when I visit, I have found some of the meal almost inedible.  It's a shame. But, more important than the food is the accessibility of care when the resident's needs change.  Highview states they are unable to begin assisted living services of any level for an independent living resident without plenty of advanced notice.  In our case, it took 4 days notice before assisted living help could be arranged.  That's a real problem if the resident has no family living in the area that can help during those 4 days.  One would think that a facility that specializes in the care of seniors would be able to begin services almost immediately for those living independently there.  As your looking for a place for your loved one, I would strongly suggest you ask the question- "How quickly can assisted living services begin if the needs of my mother/father change?"  And, taste the food more than once!!  Good luck!

After what my dad was in for 5.5 years at another facility, this place just blows it out of the water. The food is excellent, it is less expensive, and there have just been no complaints from his end. He has a full apartment with a full sized kitchen and it is very spacious. I would absolutely recommend them to other looking. The location is amazing, it is walking distance to restaurants, stores, parks, etc. so he does not feel trapped.
Property Name: Five Star Premier Residences of Teaneck

review_text: Food needs work, a lot of work!

The sense of family here is amazing. My mother has lived here for the past year and as would be expected a move can be difficult. However the Elmcroft team helped make this move as easy for her as they could, and she quickly grew to love it here. They have stayed on top of communication and during this pandemic have gone above and beyond to make sure my mom and I are both 100% comfortable! There is no place else I could ever see her being and being this happy! Great Job Elmcroft team!

Really lousy experience for my mother in law.  She pays nearly $60k a year and gets lousy help.  The call button for restroom help is ignored frequently.  It’s really humiliating to soil yourself because the staff ignores a call button for thirty minutes to an hour.  Bad staff and worse management
Very nice and friendly

reviewTitle: Doing Well Since My Move To This Community
review_text: I'am doing well since my move to this community. It is a nice facility with kind people. When I need some help the staff is always right there. They are very kind. The community is well-kept, and they do a good job with the cleanliness around the community. The have a nice shaded area outside, and you can go out there whenever you like. My experience in this community is going well, and I would recommend it to my family, and friends.

My mom is not interested in the activities that are offered. Staff was friendly and polite but not always quick to respond. Communication is not the best, it takes a few days to get a response. This was our first experience and we did not know all the right questions to ask. They offered activities but not what my mom needed or was interested. Maybe a bigger community would have  a wider range of activities and interests. Property was beautiful, the rooms were great and it was a good location. My mom liked the food.

The communication has been excellent.  I receive weekly email updates or a phone call regarding my wife's status, which I really appreciate.  The caregivers are excellent.  They know my wife's habits , idiosyncrasies,  and they understand her    I chose this community because after I did a thorough evaluation and looked at 7 communities in all , I came away with the  belief  that this was the highest quality community and I have not been disappointed.

Staff is friendly and helpful.  Staffing ratio good most of the time.  There is no true housekeeping service/s.  Staff sweep and or mop the floor/s as needed. The house is new, August 2013, and does not seem to smell bad.  No nurse call buttons in the bathrooms and or bedrooms.  Bathroom is often without toilet paper and or paper towels.  Personal laundry was not been done the first week.  Roommate also has dementia and continually moves my husband's clothes to his closet.  Roommate can become defensive so clothing has to be check daily.  Meals are fair - hot foods are often cold.  I have not seen a menu but seems to repeat weekly.
Property Name: Seasons Alzheimers Care and Assisted Living

review_text: We love that Helena Place is a small community with just over 30 residents. Our 94 year old aunt is very comfortable there. The staff is caring and friendly.

reviewTitle: the decor and ambiance of this facility is just really  nice
review_text: My parents have been very happy with Garden of Palms so far. The staff is really friendly and supportive. They are booked so don't try to get anyone in there too soon. They are a smaller facility so the people get to know each other a little better. The staff is very responsive. There is always room for improvement in the service industry. But I looked at some other places and this was far above any of them. The decor and ambiance of this facility is just really  nice.
Property Address: 1025 North Fairfax Avenue, Los Angeles, CA 90046

reviewTitle: Best value, most secure and most activities!
review_text: This was not our first choice.  When we toured others, this property ended up having the best value, most secure and most activities!
Property Address: 7575 Willow Chase Blvd Hwy 249 near 1960, Houston, TX 77070

review_text:
DEAR PREFERRED CARE AT HOME:
I WANT TO THANK YOU AND ALL OF YOUR STAFF FOR THE GREAT HELP YOU HAVE PROVIDED US AND WONDERFUL CARE FOR MY MOTHER.   
YOU HAVE DONE SO MUCH OF THE HOUSEWORK . THAT IT HAS  RELIEVED US OF  THAT BURDEN .
MY MOTHER CAN BE STUBBORN AND DIFFICULT TO WORK WITH.  YOUR STAFF MAKES MY MOTHER FEEL SO COMFORTABLE THAT SHE BECOMES MUCH MORE AGREEABLE.  YOU STAFF HAS HAD CONVERSATIONS WITH MY MOTHER AND HER LIFE.  MY MOTHER TALKS ABOUT HER LIFE THAT SHE HAS LIVED VERY FONDLY. SHE WILL RECALLS THINGS THAT HAVE HAPPENED TO HER AND SHE WILL BEGIN TO LAUGH . IT IS VERY HEART WARMING FOR ME, TO HEAR MY MOTHER LAUGH.
BEST REGARDS,
[Name removed]
Property Name: Preferred Care at Home of Fort Collins, Loveland, and Windsor

review_text: Excellent place to live.
We use home care services for my loved one through QCC Home Health Care. I would recommend them to others.
Property Address: 20413 Highland Hall drive, Montgomery Village, MD 20886

reviewTitle: My parents are doing very well here
review_text: This is a brand new community and both my parents and I are so pleased with the care they are getting here.  They have started to make friends and they are enjoying all the great amenities like the happy hour, the ice cream socials and going to the movies in the theater there.  All the staff interacts with the residents they know them by name and they always talk with them or just say hi when they see them.  It is wonderful here.

reviewTitle: Located in a business district. One r...
review_text: Located in a business district. One resident said he enjoyed staying there he was physically fully functional. Very neat and tidy. Board games, cards,TV and movies for activities. Residents accompany owner when going to store. Residents may sit out back in fenced yard.
Property Name: Vincent's Village Personal Care Home LLC

reviewTitle: Finally all settled in and I really like it here!
review_text: I moved into Chateau Ridgeland a little over a month ago and I am finally all settled in. The staff have been very nice, helpful and kind in every way. I like playing bingo with some of the other residents and I really enjoy the entertainment. The food here is delicious and I am very happy over all!
Property Address: 745 South Pear Orchard Road, Ridgeland, MS 39157

review_text: We're pretty happy with Affinity.  We definitely tell people they have a lot to offer.  It's like a little mini resort, with lots of activities.  Everybody is friendly and seems to be really helpful and supportive.  It's a very family-oriented community.  We're happy with the apartments and pretty much everything!

My mom and I recently toured Scottsdale Village Square with [name removed]. She was so welcoming, friendly and helpful, answering all our questions.  She gave us a tour of the grounds which has a beautiful pool, jacuzzi, lots of mature trees and well maintained landscaping with paved walkways. The dining room where they provide 3 meals a day, is nicely decorated and the staff was very helpful and accommodating. Although we showed up well past lunchtime, they kindly provided us with homemade soup and sandwiches. We liked that they have lots of activities going on every day with different rooms and gathering places.  
[name removed] also showed us a couple of the rooms  currently available - a studio and a semi-private room. Unfortunately, the 1 bedroom is out of our price range and my mom didn't like the idea of a semi-private so she didn't choose to live here.  If money wasn't an issue, my mom really liked the place and ideally would have liked a 1 bedroom.  
I recommend checking it out.
Property Name: Scottsdale Village Square, A Pacifica Senior Living Community

review_text: At this community there is certainly a big lack of communication between the staff and families.

The place is nice and the staff and people who live there are very nice. However upon death or relocation you are obligated to pay three months fees, (around 2000/ month). You basically are giving the 90% of the cost to Sedgebrook until they sell your unit.The issue here is they are in no hurry to sell and do not communicate with you regarding the progress of the sale. They only offer excuses when your call to why it has not moved. Very nice to be able to hold onto others money. We have had a place available for seven months and their no movement. The communication is horrible. I advise you to ask many questions about this before you sign on the dotted line.

This is a very nice community, but unfortunately not what my loved one is needing. His level of care is higher than what they are able to provide, but the services they do provide are very good for that level of care. All of the employees are lovely people. Although it isn't right for us, I would recommend it to anyone who might be looking for this level of assisted living care.

reviewTitle: Great choice for elderly parent that enjoys being on their own, but thrives on socializing
review_text: My mom really appreciates and likes the staff.  Housekeeping was a hit or miss at the beginning due to staff illness and ice storm, but now is consistent.  The move in process was better than we could have expected . Food is good, but depends on my mom's preference. The breakfast meal time is too early for her so she tends to skip breakfast. I would definitely recommend this facility.

The Atria at Canyon Creek is a must see for anyone looking to move a loved one into independent living! The staff and residents are helpful and very friendly. The apartments are finished out nicely with touches like crown molding and granite countertops. My grandmother has settled in nicely… And especially enjoys the offered activities and the excellent food service. We could not be more pleased!

I love living at Magnolias - I have many nice  neighbor's and  very good friends. Have been here a year and a half. The management & staff are great - until about 3 months ago. Our chef in the dining room was [name removed] and the meals were well prepared & good. A new man has taken over & the food has changed - especially meat - tough to cut - dried out - even ham. Chicken - burnt and blackened.
staff has been accommodating and helpful with my fathers move. Very homey and comfortable. Residents are welcoming

My mom lived at the Atria Carrollton for 7 years.  She was first in Assisted Living where she received lots of attention and had wonderful friends.  As her memory failed, we moved her to Life Guidance.  The staff was so caring and had many years of experience.  The care she received was top notch.  When she was in her last days, the entire Atria staff visited her with their good byes.  I know she felt loved and her family appreciated all the attention she received.  Atria Carrollton was the right place for my mother.

Having had experience with competing facilities, I can say without a doubt – Morningside is the best in the area! 
Their staff’s level of care commitment is extraordinary and cannot be matched. 
From reception to administration to the amazingly talented care team members – I am truly impressed.

This community is not highly recommended.  The food is does not seem appealing to my mom. They do not offer her activities to keep active. The community is clean, but she is not happy here at this time.

They have been accommodating and easy to get to as far as scheduling and all of that. If you want something particular, what I have done is just write down a list of things to get accomplished during the day and they have all seemed to work well with that. I would recommend to others.
Property Name: HomeWell Care Services of Montgomery County, MD

review_text: Park Place has a warm family atmosphere. The staff is amazing and there is little staff turnover which is unusual in care facilities so everyone feels close and comfortable. I am so glad I chose it and know if the day comes when I have to move up to assisted living I will feel at home.
Property Address: 4411 Park Place Drive, Fort Wayne, IN 46845

review_text:
Loved it!  Variety of activities and so many amenities.  A little farther drive.  It is over by Academy on 183.
Nice apartment but smaller than what Mom has.

My mom was previously a resident at Traditions of Smyrna and I blame them for letting my mom get in bad shape. They didn't let anyone know the nurse left a month before we had to move her. I told her to get the Dr to check for a UI. I didn't know she was leaving. They never checked, and that's what mom died from. They said they could no longer care for my mom, and gave me only 3 weeks to find a new home.

reviewTitle: Review of The Carrington At Lincolnwood
review_text: After 2 weeks my mother is more active than she has been in years! People and staff are welcoming and eager to please. Facility is bright and cherry. She was hesitant to change but has adapted beautifully. She said she has no time to even read her newspaper - a good thing indeed.

We love it here. The staff is fantastic. They communicate when things are going on and call when they need to if my grandma falls or is acting more out of sorts than normal. You can tell they care. The Executive Director  [name removed] is amazing. I cannot say enough good things about this place. My grandma is safe and well cared for.
Ratings answered above

reviewTitle: Review of The Orchards of Cascadia
review_text: The staff is excellent and he is receiving good care. The nurses are excellent, very caring, and busy. The CNAs are great too. Everyone is very approachable, excellent. The staff is very committed to the patients. When I speak to the nurses they are very thorough when they talk to me. It is older and the toilet clogs and things but they do the best they can. I had to ask them to clean the room one day.

We went to this property also. They are doing an entire remodel of the property. Really nice if you like underground parking with security. The staff was very nice. [name removed] was awesome.  Again a little over our price but lots of availability when needed. The are also close to [name removed].

reviewTitle: Review of Spanish Hills Wellness Suites
review_text: The staff was good but it took a long to get help. When the nurses were there they were good. All the people who updated me were good at updating while I was there. They have not called. My loved one needed something she had to wait 20 minutes to respond to her buzzer. That is dangerous.

In general I'm very pleased with how things are going here. They keep the place very clean and well kept, for the most part, and the staff are all exceptionally friendly. They've also got a good variety of games and activities to keep everyone entertained, and they do various outings to stores, as well as sightseeing trips.
Greencastle is a wonderful place to live my mom was there from beginning. The staff and administrator is very pleasant. Strongly recommend them to anyone.
Property Address: 28062 E. Greenmeadow Circle, Farmington Hills, MI 48334

review_text: I am happy with the care that is given from this community. The staff is very nice and caring. The community is clean and a wonderful environment is wonderful. The menu is top notch of home cooking. They do have activities that are offered to the residents who want to participate. The dining area has a piano to enjoy at meal times. We like knowing that she is in a great place for care and would recommend this sweet community for good helpful care.

My tour was wonderful. Paul Spring Community was twice the size of the other facility I looked at and I just found it to be too big. I did not get a warm and cozy feeling. One of the advantages they did have was the automatic handicap button for the entrance and exits.

The transition from independence to assistance is never easy but Appletree Court Assisted Living made this passage as comfortable as possible for my mother and the whole family.  They were concerned about allowing her to keep as much independence as possible while being there for all the areas where she needed some help.  The staff and caregivers are patient, warm, friendly, and loving.  The facility and apartments are well designed and maintained.  They provide a variety of social activities to keep their residents engaged and entertained.  I couldn't be more pleased with the care and attention that my mother is receiving.  Thank you, Appletree Court!
Property Name: Appletree Court, A Vitality Living Community

review_text: Arden Courts has very educational and dedicated employees.  It is an exceptional place to have your loved ones in.  They strive for excellent care and are responsive to the needs of everyone in facility.  They are very compassionate and professional.
Property Name: Arden Courts A ProMedica Memory Care Community in San Antonio

reviewTitle: Review of Blueberry Hill Rehabilitation & Healthcare Center
review_text: My loved one seems to be doing well with the therapy. The cleanliness is alright. The communication needs to improve because there is not any unless I initiate it.
Property Name: Blueberry Hill Rehabilitation and Healthcare Center

review_text: A place that my mom would be comfortable. Apartment is roomy compared to most with a smaller than average fridge, microwave and room for a little table. The living room and bedroom are of good size. Closet adequate. The public spaces look lived in and nice not just for show. Staff was caring towards the seniors and many had been there for years. Beautiful outside courtyard! Most expensive community fee of any I have seen.
Property Address: 3185 E. Flamingo Rd, Las Vegas, NV 89121

review_text: Overall I like it. Assisted living is extremely expensive, and I couldn’t afford anything else. Having said that, my major complaint is that is a royal pain to talk to someone directly. If you want the nurse, or director, you always have to go through the front desk. Trying to find anyone email, is another problem., is super hard. Also, if you go before or after hrs, you wait forever before anyone comes to the door, even though there should be someone available to attend this. Would love if they had LPN instead of nurses assistants. My mother is not crazy about the food. It seems that’s a major complaint from the residents. Either tasteless or sometimes they can’t repeat, because there is no more.

My mother was not receiving good care and she is in the hospital now. They did not follow up on the lab work. It took four days for them to respond. The staff attempt to be nice. It is clean. Communication was okay. I like one of the aides. I like the social worker who attempted to be helpful.

reviewTitle: Everyone was nice but my parents aren't happy here.
review_text: Everyone was nice and friendly. I made my judgement to move my parents in too fast. They're not happy there. I was hoping this facility would make them happy. They don't like the food. It's just hard to please them. That's my biggest thing. The facility itself is very clean. It's not bad. I just don't like how expensive it is. I didn't think my mother would need that high of level of care. They charge depending on care level.

reviewTitle: Just What We Were Looking For
review_text: We really like it here.  The biggest standout to me is the community adapts well to what the needs are of the family and residents are.  No matter what stage of health your loved one is in, they have a plan and a wide range of services to help provide care for your loved one.
Property Address: 5740 Lake Murray Boulevard, La Mesa, CA 91942

review_text: It is amazing they got her back on her feet! When my loved one got there, she was very weak. She has not been there very long and she is back on her feet! The nursing care and communication were good! The social worker kept me informed! When I call there, they are very helpful and even my brother got updates. The only thing she complains about is the food.
Property Name: Crest Pointe Rehabilitation and Healthcare Center

review_text: I can not really speak to anything that they can improve on over at the Atria St. Matthews. All of the staff members were really friendly and accommodating to my loved one while he was staying there though.

reviewTitle: Review for Tribute at Melford by Cogir
review_text: The facility is very nice, the staff is very attentive and most importantly my Dad is happy. I picked this community because it was the closest proximity to me.

The lady who showed us around during our tour was very friendly. We liked the size of the rooms because my husband has a lot of equipment and needs accessibility. The community was very clean and paid attention to detail. The reasons we didn't choose this community is because they didn't have a dedicated space for each activity and the gym served as an "all purpose" room and was rather small. They also didn't offer a view of the lake that was as nice other communities in the area.
I'am doing well with my move to this facility. Everyone has been very kind, and helpful. The community looks great, and very well-kept. I'am happy with all they have done for me.

The management and staff at Amberleigh have created a true community. The residents are treated with care and respect. The services are exceptional and ensure that the safety and quality of life for all residents is primary importance. The facility and it’s staff have been a great experience for my mother.

We have been very happy with this community so far. It is very clean, and the staff is very helpful. They have been great with accommodating our needs and making things much easier on us. For example, they transferred medical records for us and we have had to do none of the dirty work. They really took a lot of pressure off of us. Some floors seem to be nicer than others, and they are divided by the different care needs (memory care, assisted living, etc.). Overall, I have been happy with it so far.

reviewTitle: Nice place, with a few issues
review_text: In general I think Brookdale Paramus is a nice place. The facility is clean and well kept, and for the most part the staff is friendly and professional. The management staff are good about follow-up, and the daytime aide staff are very good. However, we have had some issues. I think during the touring and sign-up process they could have done a much better job explaining the level of care they provide, there are a few care needs that they do not cover that have become an issue for our loved one. I've also had issues dealing with the nighttime care staff. Overall it is a nice place, and I would definitely recommend it, but be sure the level of care they provide matches what your loved one needs.
We have an amazing staff, every single person greets you every time they see you. The common areas are very clean. Overall opinion is very good.

reviewTitle: Parent home search-a surprise and happy ending
review_text: What our family likes the most about the King's Bridge Retirement community is the staff team. The staff members there are outstanding. Based on the experience we have had so far, we would recommend this community to other families.

Our loved one is not ready for "strangers" to come and go out of the house, but the lady we have continued to speak with has been so lovely and wonderful we absolutely love her. She knows we are not ready for home care yet, but still continues to reach out and check in with our families on a regular basis.

The employees and head boss do not do anything, the residents do NOT get basic care, they do NOT get their hair brushed, teeth brushed, showers maybe once a week! Employees say they refused, so they don’t have to do the extra work.
The head boss will walk into the building ([name removed]) and she will sit in her office while she watches employees sink. They are understaffed and this is why residents do not get basic care.
Their restrooms NEVER get cleaned, toilets have BM
Caked on them, Urine soaked into the carpet, ever sense Covid the families have not been inside, and the residents are being neglected.
Meds do not get given, just dumped (they think it’s easier) and claim the resident refused.
If you put your loved one here, know they willl NOTA RECEIVE any personal care, no activities, no good meals, they will have to sit in their own urine.. and they will be shut in their bedroom all day so they stay out of the way.

Residents are always without any clean laundry because they do not have a regular housekeeper.
Residents are given Ativan as soon as they “act up”.

Watch out for story point in grand ledge!
I would NEVER let my loved one step foot in here!

[name removed] the director and [name removed the activities are both just awesome people. [name removed] has really gone above and beyond her role as a director for our family and we really appreciate her. We chose this facility over the many others that we looked at because of her personal involvement. I would absolutely recommend Holiday Lane Estates to others.
Property Address: 6155 Holiday Ln, North Richland Hills, TX 76180

reviewTitle: A great place for our mom!
review_text:
First let me say Crescent Park Senior living is a beautiful and well appointed facility. My mother was there only 6 months before she passed away suddenly and without warning. She loved being there in a wonderful apartment with a lovely view. 
The staff was most accommodating to her needs and to family visits as well. The staff treated her like family but without being intrusive.  She enjoyed the comaraderie of her friends and new friends in a lovely dining room. She often told us about the evening movies, the bus jaunts and the special events. She didn’t have time to be bored. Crescent Park is so much more than any preconceived ideas the public may have about Senior Living. 

Jill and her staff are wonderful, caring and compassionate people. They constantly check on the well being of their senior tenants. We can’t thank them enough for the life style they offered and shared with our mother.

The care needs for my mother had changed and unfortunately the community could no longer assist in the proper care she needed. They did always try their best the staff were nice. Her room was always cleaned and the meals were great. I felt she was in a protected place which was very important.

the building is beautiful but the staff is horrid. [name removed]  had my mom scared. simply just not kind to their residents and not gentle and loving as you would want for a loved one. don’t waste your time or money on this place.

My grandmother is a resident at Encore. She has been there throughout the pandemic and we could not be happier with how they have handled everything. They have kept her safe, healthy and happy over the last year. The staff is caring and attentive and responsive any time I have a question. We are very thankful that our loved one is there!

They're terrific, they really intereact with the people. They really try to do stuff with them. I had a list of five places, two of them were just too far away and out of the other three I liked park balboa the best and its actually a reasonable enough distance so I can go visit. 
She's doing well there, she has dementia so she's confused but we're happy with hte care she's getting and the people there.

Home Care Assistance of Carmel has met our every need. They have provided great caregivers for my mother who has said great things about each person. (We have had 4 different ones since the time we started using this facility.)
I'm not using them to take my mother to doctor appointments, just to be a companion in her home while I'm not here. They have found people for the multiple different times I've required. The caregivers are compassionate, and make her feel valuable. I feel secure in leaving my mother in good hands.
Property Address: 12525 Old Meridian St Suite 130, Carmel, IN 46032

review_text: Bixby Towers used to be a great place to live.  We have had family members reside there over the last 15 years.  I have witnessed the dramatic decline in amenities and lack of customer service regarding repairs since Pacifica has purchased the property.  The environment is unhealthy at times with regard to temperature regulation.  There is no air when it's hot or heat when it's cold.  The building is old and has been under construction for the last two years.  This has been a nuisance to the tenants, it would be nice to be compensated for the inconvenience of it all.  The elevators are unreliable as well as ground transportation.  It is sad to me to have to deal with all of the above.

reviewTitle: Very nice looking place, but expensive
review_text: I toured this community when we were looking into care options for a loved one. I was very impressed by what I saw here! It was a very nice looking facility, and they  looked like they wouldn't have any trouble providing for my loved one. Unfortunately the price was fairly high, and outside of the range we were looking in.

reviewTitle: Go as often as you can no matter how hard it can be!
review_text:
As in any nursing home my advise is to come when they do not think your coming. And go as much as you can. My advice would also have them daily print out a medication list for you.By law they are to inform you of any medication
changes My Mom was put on two that I was never told about. The only way I found out was I could tell she was not acting like herself, so I asked to see what medications she was on and one of them was something she had tried before and had a bad reaction. And I was not called . She was also put on a medication that a Neurologist should diagnose. When I found out I said I wanted her off of it and the physician told the nurses that  she was on it when she came there. I  got her records and that was a lie. They put her on it, I know because I have a copy.So the first time you sense something is wrong just get them out ASAP! I am this persons daughter and I loved the nurses but the management were always in meetings and leave them short staffed quite often. Everywhere you go you will probably run into some aids that are not what they appear to be. And the sad thing is if your loved one has any type of dementia they will take their word over your loved one. So if your gut is telling you that something is not right do not let them talk you into keeping them there, trust me you will regret it!

I liked this community but went with the another one just because of geographic reasons, The community we went with  is in the middle for our family and works well for us. This place was nice just too far.
Property Address: 3145 West Mt Hope Avenue, Lansing, MI 48911

review_text: There really aren't enough superlatives to describe our memory care experience at Capitol Hill.  I was there at all different hours of the day, unannounced, and every time I was there, the staff was happy and kind.  I would see them holding hands with the residents, joking with them, sitting and talking with them, and always treating them with such dignity and kindness.  I felt like I hit the lottery regarding my husband's care.  Not only did they take care of him, but they also took care of me.
Property Address: 76 S 500 E, Salt Lake City, UT 84102

review_text:
"A Place for Mom" introduced me to WBP. They gave me 12 references. I picked WBP because it was yet to open.
After meeting Beirgit Moran, Jay Johnson, and Cody , I assested them as being TOPS.
Then I saw the facility...it was tops.
I canceled all other inspection tours.
Since, my wife has entered the community, and I was able to meet most of the staff...and, they are tops, as a was told.
Linda, the head nurse, is terrific.
My wife was in another facility and, kicked out, because the staff was young , untrained and unable to handle her.
At WBP, the staff is trained for Alzheimer's, and knows how to handle the disease.
God Bless them.

reviewTitle: My Dad has been living there for a mo...
review_text: My Dad has been living there for a month. We are both very satisfied with the community and the services. Would not hesitate to reccommend it to anyone.

reviewTitle: Review of Colonial Oaks Living Center
review_text: Everything is going well. He is very happy here. They contacted me one time about his appointment.

There have been a few initial challenges with Laurelwood Senior Living .  There were some things that were supposed to be set up that were not on time.  The food is also very bland.  It has been kind of hard on my father making the adjustment.

The staff there are all just wonderful and they really go out of their way to help in any way they can.  The place is also very immaculately clean, which was one of the first things that caught my attention.  For a grumpy old 98 year old man, they are doing a good job taking care of him and though there have been a couple of bumps in the road everything has gone very well.

We removed my mom due to lack of care, medicine mismanagement, after pointing out lack of care the staff would not speak to us.  They continue to order medicine from their pharmacy without using what we provide . Her room was constantly hot with no air movement and caused foul smells . Evening staff is so short they are unable to give care to all of the residents in the building. Residents wander into other rooms ,when I questioned staff about this, they said they know and they cant stop her. Staff is not  required to make rounds due to the assisted living status , so many times we had to go get mom something to drink or snack on . The facility smelled bad and furniture was old and dirty needing replacement.  The carpet is stained and stinks as well. The price we pay per  month the company should correct these issues. Finally when we  removed her a staff member said she was happy for us that we found a better place that our mom deserved to be cared for.

We were having a tough time finding a place for our mother who has dementia with some behavioral issues. No one would take her. I then called "A place for mom" and they suggested Clare Bridge. The people at Clare Bridge worked with us and were so nice. they moved my mom in there within 2 weeks and it has been a lifesaver. The staff is so wonderful and friendly and the place takes very good care of mom. they keep us very informed and mom is much happier there. she is past having the behavioral issues now and Clare Bridge is working with us and hospice to provide excellent care for mom. I recommend them highly.

Great tour, the facility is beautiful. They did a very thorough intake. The facility was a smaller tighter layout, more like a smaller hotel. The apartment sizes were great and they do loan you furniture as well.

Moved ,with great trepidation, our Mother into the Memory Care here. Staff courteous and friendly and easily accessible to family at all times. Most impressed with the Activities.
My Mother used to sleep  between meals and now participates in most of the activities including ;
 gardening, games, some cooking, ball throwing and even remote control cars.
Staff asks residents to perform tasks they are used to from past such as napkin folding and cleaning tables- some useful
feeling. And residents seem to "snap" into things that they
are used to from their past lives. Thus far pleased.

They just absolutely love Brookdale. I think they would get a five. We been so impressed with the level of care. We chose them for the attentiveness they showed, they made it really easy and smooth to get set up.

reviewTitle: Not safe for your loved one
review_text: This place looks good from the outside, but they are understaffed for the size. My dad fell six times in three weeks, three of which required ambulance transport to the hospital. One fractured arm and a head injury later, we moved him, This place is lucky to have two people on site at any given time that is just not enough. Go somewhere else.
The food here is just magnificent. I like everything about living here. I picked out a room on the first floor and look out on the garden court from my patio and it is just beautiful.

I toured this community while looking into care options for a loved one, and I was really impressed! The facility was well kept and clean, and all of the staff I met seemed friendly and professional. We ended up selecting another community, but this is somewhere I would definitely have considered as an option for my loved one!

reviewTitle: We like this one very much.
review_text: We like this one very much.
Very nice.
Property Name: Paramount Senior Living at Middleburg Heights

reviewTitle: Review of Pacifica Senior Living Calaroga Terrace
review_text: I put in a few work orders less than an hour later [name removed] was at my door, fixed two problems, and made arrangements to take care of the third. I am speechless, no other maintenance director has been as kind and courteous.

I was there 48 hrs after a hip replacement.  it took 2 hrs for anyone to show up.  Then the first night I got NOOO medications and ended up in severe pain which took 24 hours to recover from. The food is white bread and lots of carbohydrates.  For the first 2 days they did not have a record of me so did not bring me food unless I called and asked for it then said that they had no food orders for me.  It was all a terrible mess.  I wonder how older people who are not able to advocate for themselves survive there.  I would not recommend this place for anyone.  N
Second choice at this point, just not sure we can make it work financially. Good location, very nice facility, friendly staff.

[Name removed] did a wonderful job representing the heart of Woodview and their employees. Excellent activities and residents' involvement. Nice room with the best closets that we saw that day. We choose the other facility because of closeness to where family is located.
Property Address: 3320 E. State Blvd, Fort Wayne, IN 46805

review_text: This community is quite clean, they do a good job keeping everything clean. I have been here for awhile and i do some things on own. Due to COVID there are not many activities at the moment, but in the past they had fair ones.
The people were friendly- the remodeling went really well and it is a beautiful looking building. A house-keeper came 1 time a week.

My wife and I love calling the Wellington our home. From the great food, to the great friends we h

Have made, to the great staff and activities, we are glad to be here.
Property Name: The Wellington at North Richland Hills
Property Address: 6150 Glenview Drive, North Richland Hills, TX 76180

review_text: I love living here. The staff is always friendly and good at their job. We enjoy living here. I do wish that they would remodel and bring everything up to date.

When searching for a place for my husband, BrookDale was the first place I visited.  I fell in love with it immediately and prayed and dreamed that that would happen.  However, it was not available at the time and I had to keep searching and trust that somehow things would work out.

Then, one Friday morning I received a phone call from BrookDale saying they had an opening and would like to 
consider my husband.  My heart jumped for joy.  The staff got right to work helping me with all the details and before long my dream came true.

I am so pleased with my husband's care and we both love being in such a beautiful and caring facility.  God is Good.
Property Address: 275 South Peace Haven Road, Winston-Salem, NC 27104

reviewTitle: Nice place overall, limited scope of care
review_text: Although Camellia at Deerwood is only able to provide a very limited scope of care they do an excellent job with what they DO provide. The facility itself is well kept and clean, and the staff are friendly, and the assistance they provide to the residents is good. However they are not equipped to handle any sort of high level care, and they cannot provide medication on an as-needed basis (they provide daily medications or nothing at all).

My mom is very happy and fitting in well. She says the staff are very helpful. There are plenty of options for the meals. They send a menu out every week. They repeat basic entrees and they make a special meal every day if you want something different. You can eat as little or as much a you want. They get dessert on top of that and she likes having one daily. They keep the meal simple and you know what your getting. She is really close to me and the ultimate reason why we picked the community
Property Address: 4463 San Felipe Road, San Jose, CA 95135

review_text:
Very friendly, best facility in Charlotte. I was just somewhat disappointed about the raise in price, although I do understand inflation .

I would absolutely recommend Brookdale Carriage Club Providence.

My mother is currently living here.  She loves it.  She has made many friends and they have bingo and pokeno.  Overall it has been an excellent place for her.  The only negative that we have experienced is the nursing staff.  They have a high turnover and my mother requires medication management.  She has ended up in the hospital twice due to her not getting her medication as prescribed.  If your loved one has a medical condition that requires strict medical management this is an area that needs significant improvement.  You have to continually call the nursing station to make sure the medication is being filled by their pharmacy and that it is being given as prescribed.

reviewTitle: Trustwell Living at Fairfield Place review
review_text: What our family likes the most about the Trustwell Living at Fairfield Place is the staff, their staff team is great. We would recommend this community to other families based on the experience we have had so far.
[Name removed] goes out of her way to make the residents feel included and loved
Property Address: 19638 Stone Oak Pkwy, San Antonio, TX 78258

review_text: The take good care of us and have kept COVID out of the building. The building is clean and well cared for. There are no odors like in other facilities.
This seemed like a nice place for what they offered. The have some nice grounds with some large trees and sitting areas. They offer different levels of care. They seem to offer some nice amenities.

Not discussing care for their clients, my family has had a very difficult time with the administrative side of our estate following the death of my grandmother. In the contract her estate was supposed to receive back 80% of the purchase price after the sale of the unit. My Grandmother passed away almost four years ago and they continue to say that the unit has not sold. According to the contract they give themselves no timetable to sell the unit within. This not only holds a substantial amount of money for the estate hostage, but it makes it so we are unable to finalize and close out the estate. We were told there was a wait list to get in when my grandmother purchased the apartment and now there hasn't been a single offer in the four years since her death. Very shady business practice. I recommend you find another place that is honest in their intentions when you choose to place your loved one in a retirement community.
Property Name: Oakbridge Terrace Assisted Living Residence At Westminster Village
Property Address: 500 Spanish Fort Blvd, Spanish Fort, AL 36527

review_text: I have lived at Rose Pointe for seven years and 10 months. I love it here, Rose Pointe has so many wonderful residents. The staff is wonderful. Hope I can spend the rest of my life right here. You get a lot for your money!
My father doesn't like it but he wouldn't like any place. He's being well taken care of but there are not a whole lot of activites.

TLC did an outstanding job with my client that had dementia.  They were compassionate and very patient in handling the difficult situations that dementia can cause.  Every member of their staff is well trained and qualified to handle even the most difficult of patients.  Highly recommend to anyone who has a loved one needing in home care.

This is an old facility and frankly it looks and smells it.  I was uncomfortable during my tour because it just didn't seem well staffed or very clean overall.  The layout is also difficult to navigate.  There are two assisted living areas.  The south section is on the second floor and even though the assisted folks have access to all areas they must navigate through the memory care area if they want to venture out.  Just didn't feel right and would definitely not be a place my mom would be comfortable.
The tour was great, but my loved one needed a more active, energetic facility. There was not much going on here since it is strictly assisted living.

The community is very clean and the staff members are great. The meals could be a little bit better in regards to the quality and sometimes they are not served as hot as they should be. The activities are good, they do have a nice variety and they are currently working hard on different things to get the families engaged with the residents. We also like the larger courtyard they have here.
Property Address: 185 Pine Haven Shore Road, Shelburne, VT 05482

reviewTitle: My mother is very happy here..
review_text: My mother has lived at Beechwood Assisted Living for the past 18 months and she really likes it there.  Her room is nice and we decorated it with her furniture and accessories.  My mother is fairly particular about food, but she seems to like what is on the rotating menu. They have various activities throughout the month, and she especially loves the lady that comes in to sing the old songs.  Somehow she remembers all the words.  The staff is always friendly and helpful, and the owner is very accessible.  The neighborhood location is very nice and the grounds are nice to walk around when I visit.  I would recommend Beechwood to anyone looking for a Catonsville assisted living facility.

Our family had an in person tour and this was a top alternative for us. We were very impressed with the facility itself and they seem to have an active activities program and the activities director seem very energetic

Call from [name removed] [removed]

Info from [name removed]:  music therapy; 1 Bedroom $4,995
Property Name: Farmington Station, A Senior Living Residence

reviewTitle: The establishment is very nice - but ...
review_text: The establishment is very nice - but the rooms are quite small.

reviewTitle: Assisted care maybe, memory care is bare minimum care.
review_text:
Majority time was in memory care which is (partly due to Covid) akin to having the residents in a jail dorm.  Not impressed with day to day interaction with staff for our parents. Would NOT recommend to anyone based on our experience. 


Hygiene materials were not resupplied as needed including toothpaste, shampoo, and towels. We were asked to supply these ourselves which, based on monthly costs seemed unreasonable tonus.

The assisted care section is very nice with library and rec rooms and barbeque patios. But still would never recommend
Property Name: Powell Valley Assisted Living and Memory Care

review_text: The team is friendly and eager to help.

reviewTitle: Worst Adult Family Home I have ever seen.
review_text: This place was an absolute mess. Dirty carpet, dirty dishes pilled in the sink and counters, along with an empty bottle of wine in between them. Which would explain why the owner/caregiver seemed to be intoxicated. He was rude and didn't seem to have any people skills, nor did he seem to know what he was talking about in regards to resident care. Lastly the medication cabinet was open with the lock for it sitting on top. This place is not where our parent, nor any parent should ever stay.
Property Address: 3116 S Bowdish Rd, Spokane Valley, WA 99206

review_text: Very pleased and meet very sweet people all the time. Food is good , desert and vegetables very good! I can eat my veggies every day.

I would recommend this Grand Villa as a place to consider for a loved one. They offer several activities daily including bingo, crafts, games, live entertainment etc that provide good opportunities for socialization and fun within the community in addition to transportation to local stores & restaurants which is convenient. This villa also has an in-house therapy clinic with various equipment and therapists which is a plus! Overall, great place when comparing to others!

reviewTitle: Broken bones & Legacy Refuses to call 911 for MD attention!!
review_text:
Mom laid in bed for a week, after falling & breaking bones in her room at Legacy. She had no ability to move w/o pain. Legacy CNAs helped her up when she fell and put her back in bed. Unbelievably, NO Ambulance was called!! X-rays taken days later at Legacy showed mom had broken bones. Yet Legacy still would not call 911!! The US is not a third world country! 

Mom had no access to an MD’s evaluation for over a week. Assisted living is No hospital! No rehab. No nursing home! It’s NO place to lay in bed w/ broken bones for over a week w/ few pain meds & no hospital or MD’s medical attention!
Property Name: Legacy House Assisted Living of South Jordan
Property Address: 1517 W. Temple Lane, South Jordan, UT 84095

review_text: It's a fabulous place, they have taken really great care of my mom. She has adjusted well. She has made the comment that the food is good. I haven't had any concerns, they have worked really well with her. They are very sensitive about preserving their dignity, while still providing assistance.
Property Name: The Oxford Grand at New Market Assisted Living and Memory Care

reviewTitle: If my dad could not be at home I am glad he was at Sunrise.
review_text: It is of high quality and better people than other options. The staff is very caring and friendly. The food was good. The rooms were well-sized, we had a single. The layout of the community was good. They have an outdoor patio space for residents to use, this space was secured. I highly recommend it.
Property Address: 180 West Half Day Road, Buffalo Grove, IL 60089

reviewTitle: Review of Hyde Park Health Center
review_text: Employees don't wear a mask properly. That is dangerous to the residents!
Property Name: Hyde Park Health Center - Assisted Living and Memory Care

reviewTitle: Review of Colonial Oaks Living Center
review_text: My loved one liked the nurses. I think they need to hire some more nursing assistants. They need more variety of meals.

Appletree Courts was one of four facilities we visited in the Richardson, TX area after it became apparent that my 91 year old mother could no longer live in her own home safely. She had always been very self-sufficient and hated the idea of giving up her privacy and independence. 

Once we started down the path of transitioning, her priorities were a location near her church, the cleanliness, trustworthiness and friendliness of the staff and environment, and the other amenities and activities that would be available. A friend of ours had highly recommended Appletree after his mother's experience there, as well as his own extensive reasearch into the available options in the area. 

After about a month living in Appletree, my mother loves it. The residents are welcoming and we can't say enough about the staff. Mother is very pleased with the food as well and doesn't skip any meals. Best of all, she's thriving, both physically and in community with the residents.

We heartily recommend Appletree and are grateful for the blessing it is to mom and us!
Property Name: Appletree Court, A Vitality Living Community

review_text: Very luxurious. Tons of amenities and very well designed. The place seems like it was designed around independent living and that assisted living was a bolted on and less well done part of their housing offers.

My grandparent is living at this facility.  I personally witnessed a 20 minute delay between the time a call for assistance was placed and the arrival of a staff member. The majority of the staff display a nice attitude.  The surroundings are nice.  If one enjoys a variety of bingo and shopping the activities are cleaver.

Not receiving the care that was promised. Getting my father out as soon as I can before wasting more money. No nursing help, medicines missed, they don't know where residents are and skip medicines,  faabs broken, nurses with attitudes. No help with patient portal, computers always down, etc etc.  Don't be fooled.
Property Address: 845 First Colonial Rd., Virginia Beach, VA 23451

review_text: The care friends were great but I was told they have no training with Dementia residents. The only thing management was worried about was making money. Not extra safety for the residents. The nurses there did a good job ordering prescriptions but when the doctor would visit he would have a nurse from a homecare firm come in for a follow up not the nurses on staff. Think twice about putting your loved one here in the memory care side.

reviewTitle: My wife has been well cared for.   I can now be her husband, not caregiver
review_text: In [date removed], my wife became a resident at The Pearl.  Her medical needs and level of care required became greater than I could accomplish at home.  Over the last 7 months, I have found that she has been exercising much more than at home and she has formed relationships with the other residents, none of which happened at home, even before her Parkinson's had progressed to the level it was when she became a resident.
I like this one alot.

reviewTitle: My review of Prosper at Monastery Height
review_text: I would highly recommend this community. They have activities like baking, art projects, they take them out to lunches, when the weather is nicer they go outside and also musical entertainment to keep the residents busy in the community. The staff I am very comfortable with taking care of my loved one.

My father-in-law lived at Lincoln Court.  We toured the community with Matthew Johnson before moving in.  He was very considerate and friendly to us.  He made Dad feel right at home from our first visit.  Once Dad decided to go ahead and make the move Matthew came to our home with some gifts for Dad to welcome him.  They were so well fitted to Dad's likes and needs.  We were all very impressed with that.  The community was clean and friendly.  The staff and the residents all made Dad feel welcome and at home.  He truly enjoyed living there.  They made his final days happy and secure.  We appreciate so much all they did for us and Dad.

Separate buildings for different levels, 1:5 ratio (good for area) - 10 in a unit. No bathing in room - shower or tub for whole unit. No closets, they provide bed and cradenza. Sm. studio has angle corner with window, lg. has bay type window (can have roommate). No kitchens. Large bathroom sink areas, can have open area under sink. Big on memory care, staff for nursing, activities and memory. Able to do heavier care longer (keep people with lift/2 person care).

reviewTitle: This is a very nice, and lovely community.
review_text: This is a very nice, and lovely community. The one thing that I didn't like was that they don't have a nursing staff. As the residents health declines, they would have to be sent elsewhere. There is no aging in place, and moving is a lot for a person. I wouldn't want to have to move them again.
Property Address: 1367 Locust Street North, Twin Falls, ID 83301

reviewTitle: Review of Roo Lan Healthcare Center
review_text: My husband has been there before we are very pleased with the facility. Very pleased! Especially the two girls that are always working with him in therapy - I cannot remember their names right now. But let me tell you, they have worked miracles! They got him coming back so much faster than I expected. Especially considering his condition when he came in - they actually have him up and walking! They go above and beyond. The CNAs are wonderful too.

This is a excellent community senior living. The food has gotten better since I first got there. The staff is excellent and caring. They are working on improving the grounds each day. The rooms are cleaned nicely. I would recommend this location to others, but the elevators seem to be too far since my room is a little distance away.

[name removed] was very special in Returning our phone call and getting us in for a next day tour. We are leaving with a Full Packet of information - AND have asked to be on a Waiting list for a 2 Bedroom Apt - We were very Impressed.
Great place.  Very expensive.  Didn't care for administrative staff very much.  Matt was good and do were the care providers.  Found it hard to communicate with [Name removed]and any Dr.
The best of the best. Good food, great staff. Wouldn't want to be anywhere else

I am very pleased with the staff. My mother in law feels like they care about her. She is well taken care of and that means a lot. They are very caring and helpful. They have been wonderful. The staff is very friendly. The residents are friendly as well. We have had a positive experience at the Clare Bridge of Hampton Cove. The facility is always clean and tidy. I can't rate the activities because she did not partake in them.

Our experiences with this community have been mixed.  They appear to be  providing our parent with good care. It is a nice looking community, but they are less than diligent about  cleanliness of the actual apartment. It is still a work in progress. The process of Negotiation of the residency contract was very frustrating - a sleazy experience.

Porter Place is a great place for a loved one. It has courtyards to enjoy outdoor space and the staff always communicates with family of any issue that is occuring with your loved one. The activities indoors and outdoors make a happy fun time for the residents! Visit to the Fire Dept. was a fun event for my brother!  He enjoyed going to the Resale shop to pick out some cool clothes !! It is always clean and much sunlight coming in all over ! The new massage room will be  very good for some residents to feel comfort.
Property Address: 17833 S Harlem Ave, Tinley Park, IL 60477

review_text: The staff is great. Great food. I feel safe here.

We had a great tour experience with Overture Ridgmar. The facility is beautiful, apartments are beautiful and the staff were all extremely friendly. This is a 55+ community so there are no meals served. My loved one is 96 and was not going to be cooking every day and did not need to be ordering out. It was a great place, but just did not fit our needs.
It's very nice living, because everyone is so caring and so sweet.  I feel at home here at Traditions.

It's a great place. They have worked with us so well even when we were under duress. My dad has passed buy my mom is still there. They help me deal with her issues and are supportive of me as well as her. Not everything is just perfect but is anything perfect? No. And when you throw a bunch of folks who have memory and mobility issues  who have been displaced from their homes, there is bound to be a little friction.

Overall this has been a great experience.  The staff communication with the family is fantastic, and they keep us updated on our loved one's care.

It would be nice to see more options for activities for the residents.  Currently, I see a lot of dominos and coloring books for entertainment.

The food is all home cooked in the community's kitchen, and they are willing to work with dietary restrictions for the resident.

My Grandmother has been a Resident of Hudson Manor for 3 years. The staff is wonderful, always very loving and the building is beautiful and clean. Initially my Grandmother was reluctant to move out of her condo, however, this was the best decision my family ever made. My Grandmother is like a new person, she is so happy and has become more social than she ever was before.  Max, the Activity Director, is amazing and keeps Grandmom and the other Residents active and full of life. I highly recommend Hudson Manor to anyone looking for Assisted Living for their loved one. My children and I come visit a few times a week and the staff not only treats my Grandmother like family, but they treat our family like family too !!!

My mom has been a resident at Morada Quintessence for about a year now. She cannot be more happier. Since we moved her in she has been thriving and gets great care. She loves all the care staff. I’m so happy we moved her to this place.

It was fine there for my mom and we didn't really have any problems with them.  The caregivers were mediocre.  For us, it comes down to the lack of skilled nursing care, and no registered nurses 24 hours a day.  It seemed like there was always a high staff turnover and that  seemed especially hard for my mom.  The food started out really good and then the chef changed and if was hard for her to eat with her strict diet.  They offered daily specials and the desserts were really good.

reviewTitle: Morada knows how to take care of its residents
review_text: Our mother is enjoying all the meals and dining service and is really enjoying the aerobics classes and different exercise classes they have going on.

reviewTitle: My Review of Highgrove at Tates Creek
review_text: Wonderful community, just not the right fit for my loved one.

Community is older but very well maintained, therefore darker. However, we were told they were getting ready to start some renovations, first in the public areas. Great location, waiting list, friendly staff. Apartments have not been updated, as they'd indicated they have very little turnover causing an inopportunity to update appliances etc. Approximately 13-15 years.

I went to 6 senior living center and checked them out. I went to the Charleston first because I have never heard a bad word about them. [Name removed] offered a trial run in their furnished display studio. I rented it for 30 days and fell in love with the FOOD, the RESIDENTS, the ACTIVITIES, the CHURCH activities and I fell in love with all the EMPLOYEES as well. I live here now!!!!!!!

reviewTitle: The Director was friendly and informa...
review_text: The Director was friendly and informative; directed lots of questions directly at mom; common areas on first floor and a rec area on separate floor but we didn't see it.  older bldg so not as spacious as MG but mom saw spacious as "Big".
