reviewTitle: Staff friendly.  Smaller than what i ...
review_text: Staff friendly.  Smaller than what i was looking for.
I think everyone is so helpful and friendly.  That what I like.

We are constantly taking her food. She doesn't eat breakfast or lunch with the others. I have heard some good things about dinner though. There are a lot of activities constantly going on and they are clearly posted in the elevators. When it comes to the value for cost I have nothing to compare it to. It is expensive, but it is[name removed] money that she had hoarded over the years so it is going to her.  I'd move there in a minute! Laundry gets done, apartment cleaned, meals prepared....what's not to love about that? Plus we know [name removed]  is safe and taken care of. You can use any of those words. [name removed]  and [name removed]  have been especially helpful!!

We placed our aunt here two years ago, at the start of the pandemic, when her previous placement shut down. Staff are extremely warm and welcoming to the seniors and their family members.   They have lots of activities, encourage visits, and create a caring, family-like environment. Our aunt has thrived here.

reviewTitle: Review of Franklin Park Alamo Heights
review_text: Feb. 2020 we will have been here 3 years. The improvement in our daily life has been great. We have many on site options and attend events using the Franklin transportation. We have many wonderful new friends to dine, celebrate, and enjoy party and holiday special events with. Our families are always welcomed, in lovely guest rooms. There are options to book some for family celebrations, including food service. This is a wonderful way to age.
Property Address: 230 W Sunset Rd, San Antonio, TX 78209

review_text: We loved Allerton House. It is a lovely facility and I would have felt comfortable having my parents here. We chose the other Allerton House facility only due to the fact that it was closer to us, both were equally just as great!

reviewTitle: Review for Care Advantage of Fredericksburg, VA
review_text: It was recommended by United Health.They billed my loved one after telling her that Medicaid would pay for her services .CBA refused to clean my loved ones apartment or shampoo her hair.

The staff is great.  They are very caring and responsive to my mother.  Activities and short daily trips are also a plus. 
 Communication is an important aspect of making sure my mother gets her necessary care. Management and staff have impressed me on this front as well.
The monthly events are also appreciated and being a sense of community to Sunrise.
We had a great tour with Danberry.  We really liked the facility, but another place had offered a discount so we decided to go with them.

I had the opportunity to tour at Sheldon Park recently. The atmosphere was so welcoming and friendly, it felt like walking into a friends home. Everyone was so friendly, it was very clean and nicely decorated. All the Residents that we came across were happy to talk to us and raved about the activity program. They have activities 7 days a week and a large variety in order to cater to as many Residents as possible. The staff were very good with the Residents and I enjoyed the tour very much.

My experiences with Accuaid Home Care have always been amazing. The caregivers are the real superstars in my eyes. They are always so friendly and helpful. They truly surpass any expectations I have and couldn’t be more thankful for their hard work. The manager, [name removed], is always so kind to help with any conflicts I may have. They really do go out of their way to help with any conflict I may have from time changes to new tasks I need. I couldn’t recommend a better company with a team like accuaid homecare. If you have any loved one who needs extra help, this is who I would recommend.

reviewTitle: Residential Care.  All workers are CN...
review_text: Residential Care.  All workers are CNAs  State Licensed  Specialize in Memory issues  12 max   Described as not fancy but clean

There is nothing we have to complain about. They have accommodated us and bent over backwards to get my loved one into a nice facility. If she needs to call on them for anything they are just right there.

reviewTitle: Worth a second look.  Security may be...
review_text: Worth a second look.  Security may be an issue for Mom.  Liked the feel.

reviewTitle: For me they were lifesavers in the midst of a search for mom's Alzheimer's home.
review_text: Based on the experience we have had so far with Avalon Memory Care we can say they were exceptional. Especially the friendliness of the staff. [name removed] is amazing. They got to know my mother quickly and were so accommodating and kind when she passed. We would absolutely recommend this community to other families who are looking for a place for their loved ones.

reviewTitle: Angels at the heart of Memory Care of Naples
review_text:
Angels work here!  Starting with Ana [Removed].  She was so gracious, caring, professional, and friendly from the first time we met in our search for help for our very ill aunt up to the time she passed.  We searched all over the Naples area for the best care we could find and found it without the crystal chandeliers and the marble tiles, but with each and every person involved with her care.  The Nurse Manager, [Removed], and the director, [Removed], worked tirelessly with us to provide the best possible situation to provide a beautiful, huge, furnished room for her in an area that would keep her close to the area she could be monitored the best.  They were frequently at the facility long after they should have gone home for the day to make sure everything went as smoothly and efficiently as possible.  The room itself was always very clean and comfortable, and when we stayed with her we witnessed the best in kind and gentle care.  The staff were always quick to respond when help was needed, and always happy to do so.  She enjoyed her meals and we accompanied her at times in the private dining room that is also provided.  When she was too ill to come to eat, the staff worked with her to ensure that her nutritional needs were being met.  She was unable to participate in the activities offered due to her illness, but others seemed to be enjoying themselves greatly.   She was prone to skin tears due to her restless legs and the nurses and doctor were diligent in keeping them well maintained and dressed.  I was amazed at how often she was checked up on during each shift.  She was very happy to be there and it eased our hearts to see that she was so well cared for.  That wasn't the case in the places she was that did have the chandeliers and marble tile.

I encourage anyone who needs the best care for their loved ones to check out Memory Care of Naples.  They are going to be hard to beat.  From the first time you step into the door until you leave,  you will be greeted with a smiling face and the determination to be the very best.
The office staff assist you with getting the most out of your stay with service, program, and activities with a smile. Also all amenities are included.

well my experience i had plymouth is when i called i spoke to [name removed] he claims he`s the manager, he`s not, i told him of my situation, & my medical problems (i`m very sick), at first he sounded sympathetic by telling me was going to help me, by sending me a application, & he told me that there will be a vacancy in a few months, that was 2-3 months ago, i never heard from him or the plymouth, it`s a shame how corruption is every where, all he had to say was, no there`s vacancy, & that will be that !!!!!

reviewTitle: Liked this one best - visited recently
review_text: Liked this one best - visited recently
Property Address: 6500 North Cosby Avenue, Kansas City, MO 64151

review_text: Wonderfull, loving staff and administrator that treats their residents like family! I would highly recommend!
Property Address: 3615 Drexler Dr W, University Place, WA 98466

review_text: Great place for mom. Love the staff! They are incredibly kind to their residents!???? The food is quite good. They have loads of wonderful activities for the residents to participate in if they like. And most importantly, the nurses keep you informed on EVERYTHING that's going on w your loved one.:)

We really like the smaller size of Avalon - can only have 25 residents max. The community is extremely clean and there are no fowl odors anywhere. Avalon really has that homey and peaceful atmosphere to it. They have gone above and beyond our expectations. They have plenty of different activities going on and our loved one specifically enjoyed going to the hair solon. The patients rooms are not referred to as "the patients rooms," but they are referred to as suites - so it is far above the normal cut. They have taken such great care of our loved one it is meeting all of our wildest expectations. We have recommend Avalon Memory Care to other families and we will absolutely continue to do so.

We are just starting to research options for our mother's care.  My first call was with [name removed].  [name removed] was exceptionally professional and understanding.  She readily provided a myriad of information  - facilities, varied care available, family considerations during transition, costs, etc - and then a detailed virtual tour following our conversation.  Her expertise was very reassuring as she provided information on things I had not even considered.  This was definitely not a sales pitch but a genuine discussion of my mother's future health care.  We are still researching options, but I could not have started at a better place.

My loved one is currently a resident at Bella Vista Senior Living and most everything has been very good for her at this facility so far. The cleanliness and friendliness are great. The staff, care services, meals, activities and value for cost are all great. We have no complaints about this facility. I would absolutely recommend Bella Vista Senior Living to family and friends.

reviewTitle: Sunrise at Lafayette Hill feels like family
review_text: We picked partly for location. I would highly recommend this place to anyone. The staff is courteous and knows me and my family.It's a lovely place and she is well cared for.

I wish the residents rooms were cleaned a little more often. It seems as though the floors are not always clean. Recently my family member was hospitalized and when he was discharged, we expected his facility to pick him up. We were informed that they no longer provide transportation service outside of activities. That was not previously communicated. The only option they suggested was transporting him via ambulance, which is costly. For the amount that we pay for his care, this should have been arranged by the facility/community.

reviewTitle: Good Place Overall But Dining Needs Improvement
review_text: The care is good at The Gardens, and the rooms are nice.  But the dining is disappointing.  The food is terrible, and the dining experience is lonely.

I would absolutely recommend the facility. There have been so many friendly, helpful staff members so far. I would like to mention the admissions director, my father's doctor, and the therapists. They even have a very helpful kitchen staff. Honestly, we have had other facility experiences, and this has been so different. The staff has been absolutely great. They have been so accommodating to feed my father. They have done such a close job to telling me everything. They answer all of my questions.
Property Name: Fundamental - Bell Tower Health and Rehab

review_text: Our tour at The Glenmary at Evergreen felt rushed.  The residents seemed extremely independent, which wasn't a fit for our mom who needs more assistance.  And people were walking around maskless.  It was just not the right environment for our mom.

The atmosphere of the facility is so warm and staff is kind.  Love the activities for the patients.  Great place overall, although they have raised our rate 3 times in the last year when the tier of services has not changed.

The two head of nursing and community relations director are always acommodating, and available. Most of the aides are caring, friendly, and pleasant. I can't speak highly enough, about the director of community relations.
Very disappointed. Worked with them for weeks, and suddenly no return calls after countless attempts. Unacceptable behavior in any business.
Property Name: Great American Assisted Living at Tampa

review_text: Great small facility with nice staff. It really has a homey personalized touch!

My mother selected Brookdale over several other places because she said during the initial visit that she "felt comfortable".  As she was being uprooted from her home of 25+ years this was an important factor to consider.  She has now been a resident for about a month -- anecdotally, her experience to-date has been largely positive.  She seems to be adjusting well and is participating in social activities. She finds the staff warm and accommodating and likes the interaction with her fellow seniors.  But she also likes that she has her own space to retire to.
A few items of note - While not having to prepare her own meals is a big plus, she's still adjusting to more institutionalized food and set meal times.  To be fair, there's nothing wrong with it - but she's an excellent cook, accustomed to eating a more Mediterranean diet. She isn't crazy over the cable channels available -- but I think it's because she's missing her local favorites. 

On the whole though, so far so good. 

Bottom-line - I have no idea if your loved one's experience would be the same as my mom's --  we are very involved in her life and care.  My sister went in to the visit armed with questions. We also spent a lot of time getting her apartment set-up so it felt like home.  All of this - combined with the efforts of the courteous and receptive staff at Brookdale played a part in making her move from a large single family home to a much smaller apartment and the receptive Brookdale community a success.

reviewTitle: Probably Just as Good as Any Other Facility
review_text:
Please remember when 'shopping' for a memory care facility - or any assisted living facility - that the facility's main goal is to get you and your loved ones to choose and move into their property.  In short, they want your money.  Clare Bridge verbally promised services and care that weren't in the written contract and, therefore, were not provided.  For instance, they told us light housekeeping was performed on a daily basis, but that service wasn't in the contract, nor was it provided.
Once your loved one has moved in to a facility, please make sure you stay involved as much as possible with their care.  My mother was at Clare Bridge for 10 weeks before she fell and broke her hip.  During that time, members of our family visited with Mom at least 4 times a week.  Every time we arrived, there was something missing from her care - her room smelled like a dirty diaper or her oxygen set-up was not done properly, for instance.   The staff was always friendly and accommodating when matters were brought to their attention, but we actually worried more about Mom than when she had been in her own home.

I wasn't apprehensive about coming here because seven years ago my husband stayed here and he was treated very well. So right off the bat, I knew what to expect. 
The cleanliness is immaculate. They're always sweeping and vacuuming, even when it looks fine. My room is always tidy. The nursing staff are very attentive, and the personalized attention I received from the therapy staff was first rate. The activities people are on top of things, they have something for everyone.
Property Address: 1615 East Boot Road, West Chester, PA 19380

review_text: For what our family is paying our loved one is not receiving the adequate meals and we fill we should be receiving more. We were told they would have regular scheduled activities and those are not happening at all. Our loved one feels that they are not able to have a voice in the community.

reviewTitle: Not what it claims in this website.
review_text: This place is under new ownership and there are no activities on site or off. When asked about it a nurse said the residents aren't interested.  Well most need to be prodded at that age. When asked about off site stuff we were told they have no van to take them anywhere. If you can find another place I suggest you do so. It is clean and homey.

Staff is very friendly, several have been there for years. Clean environment. 
Had a few problems with AC, toilets running.. Maintenance fixed right away..
Residents have been friendly and welcoming.

Atria Inn at Lakewood is a great community. They are on top of things all the time. My Dad is in assisted living at Atria and is very comfortable there. He did transfer from an Atria community in California and the staff and residents here seem to be much more friendly. The food is good quality and there is a variety of items to choose from. The staff to resident ratio is great. Dad never waits for assistance if needed. His meds are always administered on time. He does wear a bracelet for safety and there is an alarm in the bathroom. I cannot say enough about this community.  There are no billing issues and they seem very well organized.

reviewTitle: So far they have been great. Working ...
review_text:
So far they have been great. Working with us to arange the move in. 
Staff very helpful. ( Nancy ) notice Dad needed different kind of socks, even told me what store had them. (diabetic)
Property Name: Angels Senior Living at South Tampa

review_text: I thought Sarabella was amazing.  The place was spotless.  It was newer, bigger, more modern - all of which I loved.  But those things weren't to my loved one's personal preference.  She was looking for a more comfortable (to her) environment.

Super nice place and Alfred was just incredible giving the tour. It really came down to cost vs what you’re getting and I felt we could get the same level of care at just as nice of a facility elsewhere

What has made The Waterford at Fort Worth community such a wonderful experience so far is the friendliness of the residents and all the staff members working there. Based on the experience I have had so far, I would recommend this community to other families.

Cancer medication valued at $50.000 was stolen.  Mattress on bed was infested with bed bugs.  No activities.  Staff not certified to administer medications.  Food not edible.  Medications were not given as prescribed by doctor.  I CHECKED OUT AFTER 9 DAYS.  I STRONGLY SUGGEST DON'T GO THERE..

reviewTitle: Cogir of Edmonds has been such a blessing for my Aunt and Uncle
review_text: We were so thankful to find Cogir Of Edmonds for my Aunt and Uncle. My Aunt was in the memory care and received wonderful care and my Uncle is in assisted living and always comments about how kind and friendly the staff is and raves about the meals. We couldn't be happier with the care they have received.

reviewTitle: It's a nightmare! Don't ever send anyone there.
review_text: It's a nightmare! Don't ever send anyone there. They told me she would never get better and that she would be in a nursing home for the rest of her life. It was like they didn't even want to try to make her better. It was horrible, we moved her and she is now about a week from going back to independent living. It really seemed like they were just trying fill beds, instead of being there to rehabilitate people.

The community was beautiful and looked as if it was recently updated. The bedrooms and bathrooms where kept clean and they offered great amenities. I would absolutely recommend this facility to anyone in need of a Senior Living Home.

Both of my parents have relocated to Rigden Farm this year.  My dad is "bananas" over this place, and my mom is having the time of her life.  Great staff, great community, great activities, and great food!  I feel so blessed to have found such an amazing place for my folks in their retirement years.  As a family member, I also feel supported by their staff.  Check them out, you won't regret it!

As a performer, I get to see retirement communities from a different perspective.  I love a place that has residents energized and ready to get involved in activities and be active!  That is what keeps them young!!   I am so impressed with the many resources The Shores has, in their beautiful community, to help stimulate the mind and help their folks stay connected, enjoying their facility and  new neighbors/family! My in-laws are 85 and 90.  I would feel extremely blessed to know they were being cared for by the staff at this residence.  There is a spirit of anticipation in the air...wondering what is coming next!!  I love that!!

reviewTitle: Caring place that is hard to find
review_text: Sutton Gardens has been a God sent for my family. My aunt is well taken care of in a real caring environment. They have activities all day even a concert once a week. It's a true home for these seniors. The staff and admin is extremely devoted and care about these seniors. Gd Bless. I recommend sutton gardens for people that need constant and care and watch.

Caring staff, great management, in house therapy. Great facility! The building is clean, no odors, and feels like a family environment.  The food is great and has a variety of menu options for all three meals

Would not recommend anyone to this facility, when it was Anthology it was GREAT!!!! Once American senior communities came in it was nothing but headache!!! Moved parents out!!!!! Communication is a major issue.

reviewTitle: Review of Village Gate Of Farmington
review_text: Village Gate has been doing an amazing job keeping everyone in the building safe and taken every precaution to prevent the spread of covid-19.

We had a problem with one of the caregivers. She left my wife and my dad at the doctor's office and said she had to go run an errand and never came back. My wife barely got my dad, who is not ambulatory, back to the car. They were very on top of it and took her off and got us another caregiver, but that should not have happened. I was fine with the other caregivers.

They cost about the same as everyone else, $17/$18 bucks and hour. The were extremely prompt. They got right on it. It all happened pretty quick and they were one of the few places that called me back. They were prompt, courteous and professional.
Property Address: 923 First Colonial Road, Suite 1815, Virginia Beach, VA 23454

review_text: Mom is always saying that the food is so good. There are a few special staff members that are dear to her and give a little extra attention. Communication with family is very good. The only suggestion I could make is to strongly encourage her to participate in the activities. I would recommend this facility to others.

[Removed], owner of Home Well is very good.  I appreciate he is in constant communication and is available anytime I need to talk to him.   The caretakers have been very kind and helpful and my husband (stroke patient) seems to be happy and looks forward to their visits.  First primary goal of hiring Home Well was to get Mark wanting to exercise and we met that in the first couple of weeks of care.  Looking forward to seeing what other areas we can improve Mark's quality of life with the assistance and guidance of [Removed] and his employees.
Property Name: HomeWell Care Services of Mesa, AZ
Property Address: 3707 E Southern Ave Ste 1019, Mesa, AZ 85206

review_text: Only been there a week. Like it. Food is good. People are very friendly. They are very helpful, with occasional reminders to the staff, they get everything done for you. Rooms are nice sized. Bathrooms very roomy. Easy enough to get around the place with a wheelchair.
Property Address: 30350 West 12 Mile Road, Farmington Hills, MI 48334

reviewTitle: Review for Five Star Residences of Dayton Place
review_text: I picked this community, because of the value, moving expense covered, offered one bedroom vs studio apartment.Friendly, plenty of activities, close to shopping, and they have caring staff.
Property Name: Five Star Residences of Dayton Place

review_text:
I can give them a 5 for cleanliness and friendliness without a second thought! I am cheap so I would always like things to be free so for the value, I'm going to say they did a great evaluation and they're great, but I'm cheap.

My aunt just got there. She is somewhat paralyzed so she really can't enjoy the activities as much as I wish she could. I chose the community because it offered all ranges of care. The place is extremely clean and well designed. The food is very good with many, many choices at each sitting.

The director was very nice. They do the medical evaluation very quickly - just the physical evaluation needed a little bit more. We want a wheelchair saddle so my aunt doesn't slip out of her chair and a floor mat in case she slips out of bed. She only arrived last Tuesday night so to be honest, they are doing very, very good.

reviewTitle: Review of Horizon Health and Rehab Center
review_text: I wouldn't choose to come back to this place. If I could pick another rehab center, I would. It's clean, but it's disgusting.
Property Address: 660 S Martin Luther King Blvd, Las Vegas, NV 89106

reviewTitle: Great place for the right patient
review_text: We took my mom to Glenwood a month after I had toured and we were happy with her room and the staff. Our problem was that my Mom started to go downhill rapidly and so she needed a higher level of care. I would definitely recommend putting Glenwood on your list to look at especially if your family member just needs some assistance and cannot make it at home anymore but if you see that your Family member is declining Fast then Glenwood might not be the best fit. Everyone’s situation is different and so I’m not sure how much help my review is but the staff are really friendly and Amy who runs the Facility is great and easy to talk to and is always there to help. Unfortunately our Moms dementia came on so rapidly that once she was in it was within a month we knew we needed to take her to a much more intensive facility. Glenwood had no part in her decline and did all they could it’s just sometimes things don’t work out.

My grandfather requires 24 hour care, I guess you get kinda experienced after changing several homes. Its really kind of hard when you have roommates and youre on medicaid. its hard when youre a person and your used to certain things and your put into a home and have a roommate, then they change the roommate or the room changes after a couple of months. its not easy moving people because you never really know what your going to get. The villa is older so its not as nice as some other ones out there but the aids are friendly, the nurses are helpful and friendly and hes doing so much better here. I'm going to see if I can change his room because hes having roommate problems but the care is great.

The property is nice. They are very understaffed. The nurse that they have is terrible. We are currently having issues regarding my mom’s care. I don't think they do enough care.  I like that the community is close to my home. The quarantine is really hard on my mom being alone in her room with no family contact except by phone.

Not going to lie, I was skeptical. When looking for a nursing home, all places preach of their benefits, but you have to pick someplace. Brookdale has grown in our estimation. It's tough to let go of responsibilities you've assumed caring for your elderly parent. Whether it's Vaccination access, meds administration, Medicare recs, Brookdale the Heights has demonstrated they have the resident's and their family's interest at heart. What is most important however is how much staff truly cares for residents. My Mom was hospitalized and returned and has been moved to the memory care unit as she's in hospice care now. But almost all staff at her old building have come by to say hello, one member asking me if I wanted pictures he has of her (she's a regular at bingo now). That kind of affection is priceless. The management has been flexible and worked with us as we managed the transition from assisted to hospice. It's been a great support. I wish I could give 6 stars for staff friendliness.
Lovely campus and friendly residents.

reviewTitle: Westland Village is the best!!! Five star facility.
review_text: The staff have been marvelous. It starts at the moment we enter with the pleasant receptionist,  maintenance is very prompt, housekeeping is superb, and the dietary staff are friendly and provide delicious meals.  The apartment meets dad's expectations and he and his cat get a lot of pleasure on the enclosed patio. We would highly recommend W

Our loved one is currently a resident at TerraBella Myrtle Beach. If we could afford more, we would But on a budget, it's good. The cleaning is on you. The food is okay/good. However, they are struggling to keep workers so I'm not sure why.  I would recommend TerraBella Myrtle Beach if the person needs a nice apartment and doesn't need much assistance.
Property Address: 3736 Robert M Grissom Pkwy, Myrtle Beach, SC 29577

review_text: The value is really good. There is a base price and an additional charge for care and the care has been pretty good. I haven't had any issues. I don't think dad's done a lot of the activities because he spends most of his time going to dialysis. They've got all the activities posted on the board but most of them are during his dialysis days and then he need rest in between. It's been pretty good. The only issue was trying to get him to the dialysis appointments. They said they could take him there in the interview but then they said it became too much time, especially on the days when they take the other residents to Walmart.

It's the ideal place to live! Love the staff. Great activities to choose from. It's a beautiful community! [name removed] helped me come take a tour to see the amazing facility. Here everyone is so friendly and I am treated well.  The size of my apartment is perfect for me and the color scheme is great!

My loved one was in The Cottage (memory care). While the majority of the staff was good, [name removed] who provided activities was awesome! However, the upper admin/management do not know how to run the facility. They need to train the staff on how to take care of residents with dementia. They need to make sure all the cameras are in working order. They do not make it easy on the family members. There should be a no cell phone policy while working. I got tired of seeing staff on facebook. Glad we found a much better place that has experience with dementia and work with the residents, instead of against. Also, they talk about chef prepared meals. There were many "chefs" that quit while our loved one was there. Not to mention eating on styrofoam. We understand with COVID, but this was ongoing.  Getting things in order start with the management. It shouldn't be that difficult. People are in positions that know nothing about memory care or how to handle staff.

My mother loved being at Heatherwood. She often said it was her "home." Hard adjustment at first having to leave her house which she lived in over 40 years, but she was no longer able to care for herself. She often said how well they took care of her and she loved the staff, especially [name removed], who was her angel.
Property Name: HeatherWood Assisted Living and Memory Care

review_text:
I was hugely impressed with [name removed] and his wife plus they were highly recommended to me. 

They clearly care about their home and residents and put their heart and energy all in. 

They have years of experience and were well-versed on meds and care. I absolutely recommend you visit them and include them in your considerations when choosing a home for your loved one. 

I ultimately chose another home but that was in no way a reflection on Zoe’s, it was a logistical decision. 

It was a pleasure to meet [name removed] and his wife, I liked and trusted them instantly. I realize a ‘gut’ feeling isn’t always the way to make a decision but I really do recommend you go meet them and view Zoe’s assisted living home.

Although it took us 12 mins. to find parking for our mid-size SUV, we're so impressed with the beauty of Ida Culver House Broadview -- inside, outside, many quality choices & entertaining spaces for residents, its cleanliness, att'n to maintenance, & the security. We didn't partake in meals, but both our family members love the food & menu choices, & my sis loves all the little library locations within. Staff were very welcoming & helpful to us during this, our 1st visit. We're impressed by the artworks adorning the quiet & comfortable-to-walk hallways. Two public restrooms had state-of-the-art plumbing & hand dryers. The 1-bdrm apt my 2 relatives live in is quiet, flawless, w/ a lovely view & easy-to-manage conveniences.  While we visited, a nice female staff member came to escort them to lunch & when they declined to go because of us, she showed a menu from which they chose lunch, which she promptly brought up to their room.  We're so relieved & happy they now get to live here!!

The care services and the food needs to improve. The food is very bland and poor quality, and my loved one refuses to eat the food. The care services is not very caring. it's very dissapointing. We are not happy with this community. I would not reccomend to anyone.
I was not going to move in after seeing that they were not in a convenient location to my family. This would suit another person.
interest in the residents is paramount
Horrible experience do not put a family member here also still billing my mom when she moved out in March.... [Name removed] the director does not respond to emails either.

I am very pleased with the tour I had received at this community for my father. The staff where all very friendly and made sure to give my loved one and I a great look of there facility. They had a lot of great amenities that they offered to all of there residents and a great food menu as well. It was just not the right fit for my dad in the end decision.

My mom is doing fine in this community and I am pretty happy with all the staff. Overall I am happy with the care and services they provide. She enjoys the activities and meals that is made and provided for her. They do a fine job keeping the community clean as well as maintaining her room.

reviewTitle: DO NOT TRUST THESE EVIL PEOPLE
review_text: DO NOT TRUST THESE PEOPLE!! I trusted them with my uncle who had dementia and they turned him against me to get my Power of Attorney revoked. Now that he died, I find out that they are now in his Will. They are evil, evil people and they lied. They abused my uncle and stole him from me. I am now suing them!

Our tour at Atria Southpoint Walk was very good, and we enjoyed it.  Unfortunately our loved one was denied admission because they felt she required too much care.  They couldn't handle incontinence or mobility issues, so it seemed their version of assisted living was simply an apartment for an elderly person at a very high rate.
Very happy
Toured this facility for my father — pleasant surroundings, healthy breakfast being served. Clean, light atmosphere no odors. Father had to go into hospice otherwise we would place him here.
Magnolia has taken great care of my mom. The caregivers are great and dependable.
Property Address: 409 E Montgomery X Rd Suite 7a, Savannah, GA 31405

review_text:
Experiencing dementia with a loved one is very challenging and often sad. Placing our mom at Monarch Cottage has helped tremendously. We expected the move to be a difficult transition for her. It wasn’t. This is due to Monarch’s whole environment, especially the love and care provided by their phenomenal team. Monarch’s strengths-based approach makes it a true stand-out. The environment is at once social, stimulating, and loving. Our mom absolutely loves being part of Monarch’s community. It’s almost like she is getting to return to her favorite days of college dorm life. The setting is also beautiful. An added bonus is the outstanding food – this is delightful since our mom continues to heartily enjoy this aspect of her life. At Monarch, our mom is the customer, and it shows.

Monarch Cottage has made a huge difference in our lives. Seeing our mom happy at this stage has brought us joy at a time that we weren’t sure was still possible. I only wish she could have moved there sooner!
I was very impressed with Acadia.[Removed] was very informative and seemed to understand our needs.I didn't observe anything I was concerned about.

reviewTitle: Homey, small, friendly, aesthetically pleasant surroundings, great staff.
review_text:
Promenade at Blue Hill has a small, wonderful environment inside as well as beautiful grounds. My mom is so very happy here - unlike [facility name removed] where she was at previously. '

She has a nice large corner room. There are smaller ones but as she sometimes uses a wheelchair I thought having more space to move around would cut down on falls or accidents.

 It's a little pricey compared to the former facility she was in, but it's worth it.
Property Address: 582 Veterans Memorial Dr, Pearl River, NY 10965

review_text: We liked the staff a lot, and the facility itself too. They did their pricing a la carte, this was going to add up to be a lot for us. They also didn't have the availability we needed at the time. It was a really nice place though. We really liked it.

Morada Rogers is pretty good!
We had a few issues getting things hooked up; and we had to occasionally go to the office to work things out. It can be kind of hectic sometimes getting things done. It's a good community and what my loved one liked. She picked the second one we looked at and she seems to be happy there. It's a pretty a good package all together.

We chose Somerford House and Place Hagerstown because of the location of the facility, we liked their memory care unit, and the price of the facility compared to others that we looked at.

I would recommend this facility to others.

reviewTitle: Active Parents-The Staff Constantly Interacts With Residents And Keeps Them Busy (Mind and Body)
review_text: I transferred my wife from another facility due to what I considered poor care.  After arriving at Wyncote, within 12 hours  They determined she had a UTI and was dehydrated.  They sent her to the hospital.  When she returned to Wyncote her health was dramatically better.  The care at Wyncote is exceptional.  The doctors, nurses, aides, and administration are exceptional.  I now feel like my wife is getting excellent care both mentally and physically.  Could not ask for more.

Very satisfied working with the staff. All patients are very well taken care of and house are friendly/attractive, neat and safe. The staff is very friendly , professional and always offer fresh pastries from the scratch made by the provider. 100% highly recommend this place for your loved ones.

Our mom has been living at this small assisted living home for 2 years.  We have been very pleased with the care she has received.

The owners and caregivers are friendly and very involved in her care.  The house is clean and has a warm home
atmosphere.  The meals are of good nutrition.  They do activities and crafts and exercises with the residents.  Family and friends can stop by any time to visit.  Holidays are celebrated with the residents and family and friends are welcomed to attend.

It is comforting to know our mom is being treated with dignity and respect.

I have lived here in the Village for a little over 4 years and consider it my home.  I have checked it out previously as a possible place for my sister in law to live and also had friends from my church living here!  When my sister in law was not physically able to come here I dismissed it as a choice for her.  I feel that i was "led" here when I needed a retirement place!  The individual interest of staff members from managers, housekeeping, crafts, entertainment, dining room and kitchen employees, plus the general "upkeep" of the property has impressed me and I've spread the word about Independence Village.

reviewTitle: Seemed like a very nice place!
review_text: I visited this community when I was looking into care options for a loved one. I thought this was a very nice looking place! My loved one was not quite ready for this level of memory care, but Silverado Oak Village will be at the top of my list should her needs progress to that level. The facility itself was clean and well kept, and the staff all seemed very friendly and professional.
Property Address: W128 N6900 Northfield Dr, Menomonee Falls, WI 53051

reviewTitle: Review for Oakmont of the Lakes
review_text: We picked them because of the fact that they would take her. They were one of just a couple who do the Hoyer Lift. And the location
Property Address: 3250 S Fort Apache Rd, Las Vegas, NV 89117

review_text: The community is not prepared to deal with dementia patients.  They are not properly trained on how to deal with escalated situations. I have gone and found trash that is over a week old sitting on my loved ones counter.  The staff are friendly and Shiela has been a great resource. The staff could do a better job of communicating issues that arise with the family. The activities offered don't seem appropriate for seniors. They had a baseball game at 10:00 am when its over 90 degrees outside. I'm required to use their pharmacy and it is eight times more expensive than our prior pharmacy.

reviewTitle: Review of Pacifica Senior Living Portland Portland, OR
review_text: Great people, very friendly

reviewTitle: SYNERGY HomeCare chose the best caregiver for us!
review_text:
My experience with SYNERGY has been very good. 
We have one person who comes and she does great. The care provided is for my loved one, and they picked the right person for us. They did well, as I feel comfortable with that person coming into my home. We currently use their service for 1 hour a day. In regards to the office staff -  I've called and asked about some charges and they couldn't connect me to the right person or find the right number. I had to send an email and they finally got ahold of me; so they weren't too organized in that area. However, I can say that communication is good, now that I've got in contact with the right person. 
Overall I would recommend SYNERGY's service to others, but of course it depends on who the caregiver is. The caregiver we have works well for our family, while others may not be a good fit.
Property Name: SYNERGY HomeCare of Oklahoma City and Edmond - Edmond, OK

review_text: The lady I was suppose to meet with was not there when I arrived.  A kind gentleman who was their maintenance guy conducted the tour so he could not answer some of the questions we had.  The facility was clean and the residents were well dressed and seemed happy.  The maintenance guy said he did not know about pricing, but that they currently have no beds.

reviewTitle: Affordable Family Care goes above and beyond
review_text: Affordable Family Care has been caring for my father, who has late stage dementia, for the last several years.  I feel they have gone above and beyond by not only providing physical care for him, but also companionship and supporting his emotional well-being.  The caregivers I have met have all been very kind and caring people.  It gives me peace of mind knowing they are there with him, especially since I live out of town and am not able to see my father as often as I would like to.  I would highly recommend AFC to anyone in need of care for a family member with dementia or other special needs.
Property Name: Affordable Family Care Services, Inc - Raleigh, NC

review_text: Our first impression right away was with the friendliness of the staff members and the residents, everyone just came up to speak with us on our tour which made us feel very welcoming. The meals are good and the residents are kept very busy with all the activities. The value for cost is great.

Brighton Gardens has been a great place for our family. The caregivers are friendly and polite. The entire team was amazingly flexible with our needs. My dad enjoys it enough that he chose to stay at Brighton even after my mom passed away.
Very nice place, one of the nicest places I've seen. A little on the expensive side, not everyone can afford it. The fact that is is new makes it even nicer.

reviewTitle: Review of Legacy at Falcon Point
review_text: A caring, loving facility that makes aging in a professional environment ideal. Kudos to gracious, kind, hardworking staff.

reviewTitle: I would absolutely recommend the community
review_text: The overall layout of the community and the rooms they provide the residents there would be a five out of five.

I took a tour of Waltonwood Cary during my search for an Independent Living facility for myself. This facility and my tour were both great! The atmosphere was nice. The facility was very clean.  Everyone was very friendly.

reviewTitle: Review of The Grand Rehabilitation and Nursing at Queens
review_text: It is very clean! They are on top of the cleanliness. The engineers keep things running there, like the air conditioner and kitchen. They adjust your meals according to your condition. I barely see a nurse and the doctors need to communicate better. Overall, they are doing very well but my loved one is having problems getting a specific walker.
Property Name: The Grand Rehabilitation and Nursing at Queens

review_text: This is a beautiful home. I worked as a hospice CNA and would visit a patient in this home to help with bathing and basic hospice necessities. [name removed], the owner, is a great person and very compassionate. She truly enjoys her work and treats everyone who enters this home with respect. The staff is also very pleasant. The caregivers are very attentative and caring. This home is definitely one of the better homes if not the best home that I have had a pleasure to work with. Go NRALH.
The community went way out of their way to help us out. They were very friendly, and very accommodating. They did a great job. They really worked with us to get things going.

We have somebody coming on Fridays for 3 hours. The first time I met the caregiver she came to my Mom's with her supervisor. That was a  nice introduction to the caregiver for my Mom. She has helped mom cook soup, calico beans and they have lunch together. She is always on time within 10 min or so due to her prior job. She has done laundry, washed dishes and actually washed my Mom's walls. I would recommend this agency.
Arbor Terrace Senior Living is just too expensive for us. They need to hire more help, if possible.

reviewTitle: I wish I liked this one better. Not a...
review_text: I wish I liked this one better. Not as clean as the others. Residents seemed a little out of it. Not bad but..... Phones ringing and going unanswered......no chairs in the "library".....

Moved my mom in a few months back the care compassion are 100000% if you are worried about care like I was this is the place to go! Mom is doing so much better here she’s eating and joining in on activities always clean and happy the building is so nice clean and don’t have that smell most of them do!
Just a great service. My parents were very happy with their caregivers who always showed up on time. Highly recommended.
Lady was very nice, place needs lots of TLC, was clean but super messy. Inconvenient visiting hours.

We liked this one. Impressed in several aspects. 
Still checking other facilities.
Property Address: 4547 Palisades Park View, Colorado Springs, CO 80906

review_text: The short time dad was there we was treated with respect  and love. Grateful for the employees that helped daily.

reviewTitle: Sales staff very personable, knowledgeable and helpful
review_text:
My husband and I toured the building with my dad and his wife with the intent to find an assisted living community where they can comfortably reside and progress as they age.
The staff that toured us were knowledgeable, understanding of aging adults needs, helpful and we did not feel pressured but rather encouraged through this process. We were shown several different apartments  and all the amenities available to my dad and his wife as well as for our family.
We chose Cadence Marietta because of the price and it seemed like it would be a good fit. It has been a great experience so far and I would highly recommend.

My parents are happy to be apart of a good community. We have no complaints with the care or experience. The 
staff get my parents involved with activities and take them on scenic drives or shopping with the residents. The apartment my parent have is spacious with a nice view from their window. I liked that all the Brookdale's work together to find a good fit within their Brookdale properties.
Property Address: 10 West Monument Street, Colorado Springs, CO 80903

review_text: My mothers first week was very rocky! No staff member came to tell her anything about the timing of the laundry service, the linen schdule, the apartment cleaning or how to get help. In fact, yesterday (Tuesday) she needed help and finally got the courage to pull the help cord and nobody came. If she had fallen or had some other emergency, she would still be waiting. The gal at the front desk, Crystal, has been the only one that has given her any help or answered any questions. Better not lose her!
Everyone is always very friendly and very caring. I appreciate everything, everyone does for my grandma. I know everyone works so hard and it does not go unnoticed. Thank you!

[names removed] were great. Very homey and clean. You can tell they are very caring and effecient.  However my Dad is not ready to move or it could have been a good fit. I know they would take care of him like I would.

reviewTitle: I would give them a ten!
review_text: It was the best thing that ever happened to me. I have never felt more secure that, for the illness she has, she has the care she needs. She has a wonderful room, and I love that they all care and that they aren't corporate. It's more affordable than where she was before. It has just brought me so much peace, and comfort. I would give them a ten!
Property Address: 12016 E Cataldo Ave, Spokane Valley, WA 99206

review_text: When we first moved our parent into GG, we had high hopes for a pleasant experience.  From the beginning, though, there were disappointments & frustrations. That was over 2 years ago.  The buildings are old and in need of maintenance/repair ie chips/cracks in the walkways that could cause trips or falls, stinky elevators, cheap blinds in the rooms, drawers that are low and hard to pull out, making it hard for the unstable on their feet, dirty carpets in residents' rooms, etc.  There wasn't an orientation for new residents to give them a good start in their new community (ie how laundry service works, when housekeeping will pay them a visit, how to ring for the nurse, how to operate the heater and AC, description of activities and encouragement to participate, how much guests' meals cost, etc.)  A buddy system would have been really helpful the first week.  Then the unreturned calls when we needed various information. The nursing staff was especially friendly & helpful though.  Others in the community often answered questions vaguely.  When the elderly are feeling insecure & overwhelmed about losing their independence & their children are hoping mom or dad is comfortable, content & secure, clear, concise communication & direction provides much-needed support to the family, which we really needed.  That was lacking at GG and at times, we felt very much alone.  And we still do, so we wouldn't recommend GG to others.  Look elsewhere to find a place that runs efficiently, smoothly by a cohesive team that is organized, helpful and friendly.
I am happy here, all my needs are met. Food is good, residents are friendly, staff are great, management is good.

The overall experience is sometimes it's a 4 but with 3 turnover in manager & nursing personnel there, one can't really get a read on how well things are being taken care of.  There is a new director [name removed] which I've heard good things about. The front entrance always looks well kept but the dinning room, halls, and residents rooms need better care when cleaning. [name removed] the activity director is wonderful and does her best to make life at Ridgeland Place a good experience.  Nurses are fine, there are some who work in the dinning room and aides that are very kind but others sometimes rude. Nurse & physical therapist are good. They try hard to listen and be helpful. The food has been good as of late.  I would say the cost of what you're getting is ok.  We do struggle with the fact that everyone seems to have a different rate and every time you turn around there's another rent increase. 

I would like to say that I fine it unexceptionable to have that tiny elevator when it seem there are a lot more folks in wheelchair or with walker.

reviewTitle: Visited on Sat., Sept., 17.  Nice atm...
review_text: Visited on Sat., Sept., 17.  Nice atmosphere.  Seems as though a decent rate can be negotiated.   I'm impressed by the director's professionalism and  enthusiasm of the facility.
Property Name: Lighthouse Senior Living at Rose Manor LLC for Ellicott City
Property Address: 3100 N Ridge Rd, Ellicott City, MD 21043

reviewTitle: Reminded Me of A College Dorm
review_text: I toured Brookdale, and did not like it. It reminded me of a college dorm. Rooms were small and furniture was minimal. There was also a lot of walking outside to get to the dining area, and I didn’t like the thought of my parents being too exposed to the elements. The facility is also older and seemed less clean than other communities I had visited.

This place was super until purchased by a corporation evidently and food budget was cut and other things causing a decline in food offerings maybe cooks could be more closily watched as well. Otherwise it is a nice friendly environment a pleasurable place.

I had a great tour with Cambridge Village. I know a couple people who are here/have their loved ones here. The director is very nice and they have tremendous staff. They do offer higher levels of care. We would have gone here if the location was a little closer to us, but are still considering it if things don't work out where our loved one is now.
If quality and professionalism is something you want, then you should consider another option.
Property Name: Home Helpers Home Care of Carmel, IN
Property Address: 301 E Carmel Dr. Ste G-100, Carmel, IN 46032

review_text: Paul Spring does not only offer great amenities but also has the best staff. Every time I walk into this community you feel the warmth of the caring staff. If you have not visited this community, I highly recommend it!

Our family member enjoyed living there but moved in February of this year to South Carolina just a couple miles from our house. I would recommend this community to other families.  It was smaller than where she lives now and we actually prefer the new place and its grounds.  However, when we were looking, it far surpassed other local facilities we visited who had immediate availability.  It was very clean, no foul smells, bright and well decorated.  Meals were OK if not outstanding and employees were responsive to her needs.

we chose Wickshire because they had more to offer than the other communities we viewed. they have a doctor and nurse(s) that come in twice a week to attend to the residents. although my dad has only spent a short amount of time here, he did have an enjoyable experience.
Property Address: 3501 Hancock Bridge Pkwy, Fort Myers, FL 33903

review_text: My loved one was briefly a resident at The Rose Garden Elderly Care and everything was great for him at this facility. [Name removed] was wonderful to my loved one and dealt with his challenges with grace.
Property Address: 2993 Knights Bridge Rd, San Jose, CA 95132

reviewTitle: The director listened to me and asked...
review_text: The director listened to me and asked questions concerning my aunt. She seemed knowledgeable in all aspects of the residence. The residence was clean and fresh looking.

On the corporate side, communication is non existent. I would repeatedly email and call and would not get any response. They told me that they were getting Title 19 and every time I asked they would not be able to give me any answers. It got down to the wire and my loved one was running out of funding so we decided to move her out.
Property Address: 100 W. River Woods Parkway, Glendale, WI 53212

review_text: We toured this community and we liked the staff that was helpful to answer the questions. The community is clean and maintained. We liked the list of activities that would have been offered for her to be active. We needed something closer. We would recommend this community for the care for a loved one.

My father in law was in the Memory Care unit for a little over a year. The care he received was very good. The staff was kind and caring. There were issues here and there, but I don't think they were anything different than one would run into anywhere. 

The Memory Care Director especially, Cyndi, was exceptionally professional, caring and responsive. I can't say enough good things about her.
Property Address: 7460 Lake Breeze Drive, Fort Myers, FL 33907

review_text: In memory care the head of it is very interactive with the people and loves them. The aids are so nice and kind and willing to help! It is more expensive than I hoped but all in all it has been a good experience.

My wife [name removed] has been under your care at this location for about 4 1/2 years,  In that time her condition has gone up and down.  Each change has been addressed by the care staff clearly and appropriately in a timely manager.  [Name removed] has been respected at each point in her care by all staff members.  I thank each person involved in [name removed] care from the officer to the maintenance staff and especially the caregivers directly involved on an hourly basis.

Wonderful place to call home.  Villa de San Antonio is a warm and comfortable community.  The residents are all so friendly, and the staff goes above and beyond to help out.  Food is amazing, plus there is always something fun to do.  The apartments are nice a spacious.

I recently helped my father move into an assisted living facility and I am happy with the overall experience. The process was smooth and fairly stress-free, thanks to the helpful staff and their attention to detail. From the initial tour and many many follow-up tours to the move-in day, everything was handled with care and professionalism.

My father is also pleased with the facility. The staff is always available to answer any questions or concerns he may have, and they go above and beyond to ensure his comfort and well-being.

What’s more, the facility is cost-competitive compared to other assisted living options in the area. This was a big factor in our decision-making process.

Overall, I recommend this assisted living facility to anyone looking for a welcoming and supportive environment for their loved ones.

Very few interesting activities and there are no activities after dinner. Very few staff members to interact with residents after dinner. Food is not high quality and meal times are very inflexible   Management is not responsive to criticism
The staff at Madrona house has the kindest staff and the best food. If you have a loved one who needs care, Madrona House is a great option.
The tour we got from Colonial Oaks was great. The memory care portion of the facility seemed really small. Also, it was all women at the time so we did not think that my dad would feel comfortable.

Staff appears to be pleasant and engaged. Music plays in common areas. Big wide hallways. Adequate studio apartments, bright light from windows with pleasant views. Invited to an open house later in month, I'll attend it and get a "virtual" tour of a day at Woodholme, should be interesting; it apparently gives the sensations of seeing the world through a patients eyes.

It is always expensive, but the care meets our requirements. They took us shopping, walking. The staff members are personally likable and responsive to the various idiosyncrasies of their clients and patients.
Property Address: 1 Greenleaf Woods Dr UNIT 301, Portsmouth, NH 03801

review_text:
The staff here have always been helpful, friendly and always willing to listen.

I really like the activities, but my loved one will not check them out. They are probably fine and I am sure it is just him. Maybe they could find something that a grump, 98 year old man would have interest in.

I would definitely recommend The Wellshire Morton Grove.
Property Address: 8415 North Waukegan Road, Morton Grove, IL 60053

reviewTitle: Parsons House Preston Hollow is home!
review_text:
Parsons House Preston Hollow on Northwest Highway in Dallas is a small Assisted Living and Memory Care facility, with about 60 apartments, and as of 2014 has approximately 45 residents.  The House is small enough to feel like "home."  Numerous common areas:  dining room, living areas, game room/library, room for chair exercises and lectures, beauty salon.  Because this is a smaller facility, there are not as many amenities; however, the residents get more personal attention from the staff than provided in large facilities.

All employees are friendly and professional.  They seem to love the residents!  

The food is served as a set menu, but the chef makes substitutions for resident preferences.  The meals I have eaten there as a guest are delicious.

Apartments range from 300 to 500+ square feet.  The nursing staff monitors the resident's abilities and adjusts the care levels as necessary.

Your loved one will not get lost in the crowd at Parsons House.

I don't have experience with a whole lot of others but maybe I should say 5 for the value because being a non profit, they do seem to have lower prices than the other ones we saw. They have on-site doctors who have regular hours in the place so that's convenient if you need to see someone. 

They do have a pool, however, they don't want you swimming alone. They do have water exercises but for someone who wants to swim laps, it's not that useful.

They give you two meals a day and you choose which ones. If you want a third one you pay for that. What's also nice is that if you need more care they can go up to Alzheimer's care at additional cost.

reviewTitle: I would use them again if neeeded
review_text: Although we are no longer using their services it was good while it lasted. The caregivers were very helpful although they didn't have to do much. If we needed to utilize home care again we will definitely be using them again.

reviewTitle: do your homework and concerder home health care
review_text: The community was inconsistent with their visit during covid and I was unable to visit during her final days during the restrictions.  one of the nurses had a different opinion on my loved one's condition vs hospice.  I recommend looking into home during covid, that could be the best option.

reviewTitle: Serenity Manor offers excellant care for your loved one
review_text: I cannot say enough good things about Serenity Manor. [Removed], the owner is a wonderful person. She is absolutely meticulous about a clean, safe environment and her attention to detail is very good.  She has a background in senior care and decided to develop her own foster care facility. She designed the new  home herself specifically for the purpose.  She has put so much thought and effort into meeting to the needs of the people she is helping. She's very dedicated, knowledgeable and invested in making her residents comfortable. The food is good and healthy, and [Removed] they are very interested in accommodating the residents' individual needs. She also has several  activity programs put together to keep the residents stimulated. I would highly recommend Serenity Manor.

I'm really impressed with Scarlet Oaks. We did a lot of research and this was definitely the best value. My parents are in independent living so they don't get a lot of care besides the meals. As far as I know those are good. I'm not sure about the housekeeping - I know my mom does her own laundry. They have plenty of activities. We just went to a Halloween spook-tacular event last Friday. I can't think of anything I would ask them improve on. I'm really impressed with the place.

This assisted living home is an utter chaos and the people living there are suffering. The executive Director is a monster. She ran off the old executive Director and propped herself up for the position. She ran off the chef who really cared about the people. The next chef left after working two days because she is such a monster. The food is in chaos and the people hate it.  She ran off the medical Director who was working hard and doing a good job. She over works people and then yells and screams at them. I would not go there for anything.

My husband stayed at Atria Stamford for a month and could not stop talking about how wonderful it was and how nice the staff was, in particular the Community Sales Director who was our initial contact and who made it all happen.  The facilities are  outstanding - more like a hotel than a retirement home, and the daily activities have something for everybody.  My husband is looking forward already to the next time that he can stay there!  It gave me great comfort to know that he was taken care of so well while I traveled and visited family.

The staff at Sweetbriar Villa is very caring and loving. The facility is a good size, 30-40 residents, so everyone knows each other. It is located in a quiet, pretty neighborhood. The cost is comparable to other facilities in Eugene/Springfield.

Comment on activities: is like so many other facilities that have a high level of attrition with activities director. We do like the director is a good, Christian man. They also do have several biblical activities. One last good information for this is they are the only facility (assisted living) in Washington county.
Vitalia Rockside is a beautiful facility. If it was up to me, I would have had my mom come here but she just thought it was too big.
Offers 3 levels of care allowing 'aging in place'. Has memory loss care too. All inclusive - housekeeping, laundry, 3 meals, transportation, etc.

I needed to find an assisted living facility for my 99 year old mom, as I could no longer care for her in my home. Mary [Removed] was magnificent in helping me to get Mom placed. Maristone has truly fit the bill, and I feel it is the right place for her. I like it because it is small, and all of the staff gets to know the residents quickly. When the receptionist, office staff, housekeepers, and even the plant supervisor all know the residents, one can be sure this is a staff who truly cares! There are many activities to participate in, and Judy does a great job of trying to get the residents involved. My mom has only been there a short time but is adapting quite well. The therapy that is in house is wonderful, and with her advanced age, Mom is making great progress. The goal of the entire staff is to keep the residents as independent as possible and let them have dignity. It is wonderful to not have to worry about Mom getting good care and to have the stress removed of having to care for her in my home. I love that there are actual nurses on staff, and they definitely know what is going on with their residents. I love that there is a NP who visits the facility weekly and is in communication with the staff about the residents' health care needs. I truly could not have found a better facility to place Mom, and thanks also go to Liz [Removed] at a Place for Mom, who was able to help me start the search for placement!

I like it better than the last center, it's a bright and cheerier atmosphere here. The building itself I like, everything else isn't good. My loved one says she hates the food. She doesn't feel like she's getting much attention for therapy. They weren't rude, but they weren't friendly. They all seemed very busy and overworked. I haven't heard a thing from anyone, nor has any of her family. There has been no proactive communication.

reviewTitle: I think they do everything near perfect.
review_text: The food is an absolute 5+, it is fabulous, they have a great chef and they are always catering to her taste. I eat there whenever I can. They do offer activities but she doesn't participate in them much. They were extremely open in presenting themselves when we first visited. They insisted we have lunch with them, so we knew the food was good right away. The salespeople were lovely and straightforward and easy to deal with. They are extremely thorough and caring. I think they do everything near perfect. They've really got their act together.

Belmont has quite the cuisine but they don't have the care that we needed. Their response time was horrible as far as responding to when we would pull the little pull chains to call a caregiver. We waited as long as 35 minutes one time and other times we waited 20 minutes when my father would be laying on the floor. So that response time was pretty bad and I think it had mostly to do with the lack of caregivers. They were understaffed.
Property Address: 1039 East El Camino Real, Sunnyvale, CA 94087

review_text: I am so impressed with this community.  They treat residents as if they were their own family members.  I have recommended a couple of my best friends relatives who have raving reviews and have had nothing but positive things to say about Fairfield Place.  Keep up the good work!

I think it's a great place. Let's just say everyone smiles, everyone is polite, and everybody treats everybody very nicely. I think the nursing care is great here. I think they have a good crew overall is the best way to put it. I think they do a fairly good job of keeping it clean. There is always someone cleaning.
Property Address: 1134 Cheney Dr W, Twin Falls, ID 83301

review_text: They’ve been very good.  I think it’s a good value. They’ve been very accommodating.  The food could be better. They respond very quickly and help keep problems small. They offer a lot of activities. They send me a calendar every month. The staff is very friendly, very inviting, very homey.
Property Address: 8720 W Flamingo Road, Las Vegas, NV 89147

review_text: We do not have anything to compare it to. She has only been at [facility removed]. But hearing other stories of other places they all seem to have the same issues.

They took good care of my loved one.  They accommodate the resident and the family.  They were allowing virtual visits; there was one time we weren't able to visit due to lack of technology experience.  The communications has been pretty good.  They kept me informed of any changes.  [name removed] was very nice and she was very responsive.
I love living @ Overture!
Property Address: 1490 Ernest W Barrett Pkwy NW, Kennesaw, GA 30152

reviewTitle: Review for Harmony at Reynolds Mountain
review_text: People are friendly and helpful and welcoming.  Mom has no hesitation in getting out to activities. I looked for a good place that was close.  Harmony has a lot of activities, which is what I wanted for mom

The community is clean.  The staff are awesome to work with, and are very friendly.  The communication is immediate and they are willing to talk to the family anytime we have questions or concerns that come up.

My loved one has not had to go to the hospital since moving into the community, unlike a prior community they were in.

My room cleanliness could be a little better. The food is good but the service is sometimes haphazard. The staff in the dining room is excellent. The staff at the front desk is also over the top helpful.  All in all I would be comfortable recommending Town Village.
Property Address: 13000 N May Ave, Oklahoma City, OK 73120

review_text:
This has been a good place for my loved one.  The community is smaller and it is a  quieter community.  The staff is good when you can find them.  It seems they are understaffed.  

Medication management, dressing, and bathing assistance is some of the care provided by the community.

The apartment, all the meals, housekeeping, laundry, utilities, and changing of the linens are included in the monthly fee.
Property Address: 3620 Happy Woods Ct, Myrtle Beach, SC 29588

review_text: Looks like a nice facility. Assisted living tour not real informative. Independent living tour very good.

I moved here about 2 months ago.  I enjoy living someplace where there is lots to do and very nice people.  The staff is great,  the food is real good and there was a always someone around to talk to.  This I enjoy since I am a widow.  I highly recommend checking out Revel of Lacey

This community is very warm and welcoming. The people are kind. The food is good and filling. They are very well staffed. There are lots of activities they can enjoy when they are ready to. I would recommend this community.

Sunabella at Savannah were great for their hospitality and over quality of service.  However, where they could improve is consistent quality of care even when the family is not visiting our loved one.  The quality differs noticeably when we announce we'll be visiting versus when we're not announcing our visit.

The Maple Brook Terrace community is very friendly, all inclusive and conveniently located. They have different activities like religious services, games, movies and physical activities. Based on my overall experience so far I would recommend this community to other families.

I was there almost every day and never witnessed anything but loving care. He was always clean and satisfied with the staff and his care.
They have something going on almost every day for the residents. Everyone has a positive attitude. I would highly recommend this facility.
 I can't say enough about how wonderful my husband's last days were with their loving care.
He never complained, ever! That in itself says everything.

Move in process was well organized and they were helpful. Meals are of good quality, they always have a turf and surf option. ALFs aren't cheap, but they offer a lot for the dollar and are competitive in price. Overall, it's been a great experience.
We are super satisfied with Sunrise. They did a good job, and we are happy with them.

Michelle was great and you can tell the residents are fond of her.  You can also tell people are happy at this facility.  I saw a lot of smiles and companionship among the residents. My rating reflects what I saw as a community.  I don't have any information about services. My Mom is still deciding if Senior Living is right for her, and if so whether the Claremont is the right place.
Storypoint is an incredible place! The residents seem happy, the facility is top notch and the staff is extremely helpful and approachable.
We picked this community, because I liked the looks of the facility and I liked the sales person. They are doing everything very well.

reviewTitle: Highly recommended for Assisted Living/Memory Care
review_text:
Our father had been living in an Independent Living facility in Woodinville.  Very nice place, but as Dad's memory increasingly faded, we found the need for a more secure and assistive situation.  Dad became a resident in the Memory Unit in what was then Cascade Plaza.  The entire unit had been recently remodeled and had no trace of "Old Folks Home" feel and/or smell.  The staff was courteous, respectful and caring.

The Ensign Group purchased Cascade Plaza in 2013, and have done nothing but improve on an already good product:  infrastructure improvements, continued staff training, etc.  We found our experience with the new management group to be exceptional; we were wary at first, but the staff showed their true loving colors and we were very pleased with the transition from Cascade Plaza to Redmond Heights.

We would recommend Redmond Heights to anyone, bar none.  While we did not experience the Assisted Living area of the facility, we had access to it and found it to be similarly well-staffed and cared-for.  

We thank Redmond Heights and all of its wonderful staff for providing Dad an extraordinary end-of-life experience.

Our loved one seems to be really enjoying the meals and dining service. The activities are still pretty limited, they have bingo, a few other small games and some stretching classes. Given the circumstances they are trying their best, but right now it is a little disappointing just because our loved one is so active still.

After researching and visiting assisted living facilities that include memory care, I decided that the Woodmark at Uptown in Albuquerque best suited my dear wife's needs. It's quite expensive and that required me to examine by finances closely, but all things considered it has been a good choice.

The care givers are conscientous and attentive to the needs of residents, each with unique problems. My only concern is the night time limited number of care givers in the memory unit. I believe they need at least another staff member on duty
at night.

The top management has been very responsive to my inquiries and seems to be genuinely concerned for resident safety, comfort and needs.

I believe we made the right choice with Woodmark.
Large facility but sounded like there was plenty of help to assist more needy residents as my mom. Plenty of activities set up. Large rooms very nice. Need to bring mom there to see.

reviewTitle: Luxury living at an affordable price.
review_text: We had an amazing Tour/Visit at Deer Valley Senior Living [date removed]. Delightful staff, beautiful & comprehensive facility. And the food was 5star restaurant quality and presentation. A newly renovated building with lovely outside areas to enjoy...pool, fireplace, dogpark and lots of visiting space.
Clean.  Friendly staff.
Property Name: Terraza of Cheviot Hills Assisted Living

review_text: I think they do a great job overall at Brookdale Plaza Memorial City! It's a nice looking, well run community. Joanne, the woman who helps new residents get settled in, does a great job getting people introduced to the community and familiar with all of the amenities they provide! I've had a chance to have a few meals here, and I've been impressed by the food as well!

The manager here is very knowledgeable and that’s a vital part in things running smoothly in the day to day operations. But more importantly she is kind and caring!  You are your loved ones best advocate. But you can feel secure in knowing they have an additional advocate in the manager.
